Reviews.Title: “excellent property, great facilities, wonderful week”
Reviews.Author: laydlois
Reviews.Content: we own a timeshare in Orlando and switched for Tahiti Village in Las Vegas. It was without a doubt one of the most spacious timeshares and lockouts we have experienced over alot of years. The facility is beautiful and meticulously maintained. We were on the fifth floor of tower five, overlooking the lazy river, which was a great view. The airport nearby was a non factor for us. We were particularly impressed with the maintenance throughout our building and we loved the fact that we got a complete housekeeping service without additional charge at midweek. In fact, we discovered if we left our towels outside of the door and notified housekeeping, they would replace them daily at no charge. The lazy river and the swimming pool make this facility into a wonderful resort. We must have been there during spring break for many families, as there were loads of children of all ages at the resort. If you didn't know you were in Vegas, you would have thought you were in the Caribbean, Hawaii or any other tropical island. There is a barbecue center adjacent to Tower 5, with five or six immaculately maintained , built in stainless grills, two built in sinks, and numerous tables and benches that were well used by the guests. I must comment on the staff at the resort, because my husband contracted an acute intestinal virus while we were there, which required him to go by ambulance to one of the hospitals. The staff was so helpful and did not leave our suite, from the time we notified them of the situation, until the ambulance departed. Anything at all that we needed was taken care of at once. My only criticism of our unit was that the lighting was somewhat low, especially in the master bathroom, and the furniture probably needs to be replaced at some point soon. Some of it appeared to be a little worn, but it did not prevent us from being extraordinarily pleased with our entire vacation at Tahiti Village. Also, it is no more than ten or fifteen minutes from the strip, to which we drove often. We did use the shuttle service to the strip once, but preferred to have our own car. There is ample on site parking and a large parking garage, which is probably a necessity in the summer. We look forward to returning to this time share and would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti Village”
Reviews.Author: jriceyork
Reviews.Content: We stay at Tahiti Village, Las Vegas at least every other year. It is absolutely beautiful inside and out. The grounds are beautiful, you forget you are in Las Vegas it feel like your at some type tropical island. We always rent a car to get around, but they do have free shuttle to main strip. The rooms are spacious, and gorgeous. Opt for balancy nothing like it looking at the pool that surrounded by Palms tree (which is a must in vegas in the summer month). We love it

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, Great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Riyad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights recently with another couple while some other friends stayed at the Wynn (the other side of the strip); had a great weekend and the location of Tahiti Village, while off the strip, is so easy to get to, it made our excursions to the strip easy. Tahiti Village is directly off of the 15 on one end of the strip near the airport. That means you can either get in your car and drive straight down the strip to all the action OR skip around it completely by hopping out onto the 15, then coming back in at whichever exit gets you the closest to your destination. If you don't have a car with you, staying at Tahiti Village and cab'ing it in to the strip every day could get frustrating enough that it might just be easier to stay at a hotel that is serviced by the light rail line. As a quick example, cab'ing it from TV to the Wynn which is on the far other side of the strip was $25. That is about as expensive as it will get for you, even on a Saturday night. Ok enough about the location... Tahiti Village is not a classic hotel with small rooms and bathrooms, it is a time-share property but you can still rent the rooms and stay there like a classic hotel (TIP: if you have friends that own a timeshare there, they can get you an awesome rate if they book it without using up their time share points). The rooms show some wear and tear but for the most part are on the bigger side and comfortable. If you like a good value, TV will feel like a solid place to stay; if you prefer the pristine fancy feel of a place like the Wynn, Tahiti Village might feel lacking to you. We stayed in the Bora Bora suite while we were there; it was a comfortable size, the steam-shower was a very nice treat and the kitchen came in handy when we ordered some late night pizza and had it for breakfast the next morning. As I mentioned the rooms do *feel* a bit older; the pullout couch in the living room looked older than I thought it should have and we still had an old-fashion CRT TV in the TV cubby in the living room (while our friends had flat screens entirely in their room). Like I said, very minor things if you are just looking for a comfortable place to stay for a good deal, but if you have a good coupon for a nicer place on the strip OR prefer a cleaner/fancier place that has all the blind of Vegas with it, you will want to stay elsewhere. Tahiti Village does have two restaurants on-site and an awesome pool (very big and a sand beach section of it), but it was a cold weekend so we never gave the pool a chance. The restaurants are walking distance as well as a Denny's which is right next to it which is great for some cheap/tasty breakfast. Overall a solid visit; we would easily go back again with our friends and use it as a hub for our activities in Vegas. If I was taking my wife back for a romantic "movie-esque" Vegas experience with all the glitz of the silver screen, I would blow our retirement and stay somewhere else; just depends on what you want. TIP: Parking can be a pain because the parking right up against the hotel is limited to a 100 spaces or so which can overflow during the weekend so you need to park at the parking garage a block away. Not that bad, but if that type of thing annoys you, just be aware of that possibility. TIP: There are some pretty nice discounts available from the concierge for popular shows in Vegas that we missed until the last day; so if you are thinking about a show, check with them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: leftyg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week for a girls birthday getaway. The facilities were very nice. We enjoyed lunch at the restaurant and used BOGO drink coupons we found online. There is a slot machine in the restaurant for those that can't wait,lol. They offer shuttle service to the nearby grocery store, but be sure to get there early, it fills up quickly. People show up at the last minute and are turned away. We did take the bus trip to Red Rock which was very inexpensive and a nice contrast to the strip. I wouldn't likely stay here again unless it was with the family,because there were a lot of kids there.

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti Village”
Reviews.Author: 3trvlrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this resort in March 2012 and loved it! We had a 1 bedroom (1 adult, 2 teenagers) and there was plenty of room. The room was very clean and the bathroom was large. The king bed was incredibly comfortable, the kitchen was well equipped for a 1 bedroom, and the pool and lazy river were awesome. WiFi was only available in certain areas and the parking was a bit of a walk, but overall no complaints and we would definitely stay here again. They have a complimentary shuttle to/from the strip but we had a rental car and did not use it. Although this is a timeshare, I was only asked about purchasing once and that was on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool complex”
Reviews.Author: AlanaG4
Reviews.Content: Located south of the Strip, the Tahiti Village offered an oasis of calm, unless it was shattered by jets flying out of McCarran airport. The suites were commodious and well stocked. The resort provided shuttles every half hour to the strip, a tour of the Red Rock Canyon and a trip to the Fremont Street experience. Although this is a time-share property, after the initial contact there was no persistent sales pitch as there is with some properties. The staff were unfailing polite. The pool complex would be perfect for families with young children

Reviews.Title: “Some hits and some misses”
Reviews.Author: Maureen F
Reviews.Content: We stayed March 17-21, 2012 in a one bedroom suite. Check-in - grade F Similar to other reviews the check in process set a terrible introduction and tone to our trip. There were 3 people at the desk milling around and nothing seemed to be happening. Two agents were helping one family and the other two were trying to get security down to let people in their rooms as the card programmers weren't working. When we did helped the woman didn't listen to me, just processed items and managed to make us a key. At least the bell desk was doing a great job which kept us hopeful. Bell desk A+ They grabbed our luggage which included a car seat and a few bags. They also had received groceries and a package on our behalf earlier in the day. Our bellman took us to our room where our key didn't work. He tried his and it opened the room. Both televisions were on patio door was wide open. Otherwise looked unoccupied but very suspicious. We had 3 security guards come to the room to investigate. We insisted on another room (not 100% confident that the front desk gave us the right room to begin with) - and this room was empty and clean. Service other than the front desk proved to be solid through the remainder of the trip. Accommodations - B Layout was excellent but rooms were worn. Very quiet, my husband who is very noise sensitive was impressed he didn't hear anyone beside or above and didn't hear the planes. Location - B Loved being partially off-strip and close to outlet malls for additional food options. Also was a quick walk to pick up our rental car. Pool - A Great pool set-up which was part of our choice for this stay - however we had terrible weather and only got to use it one day. Food options - B+ Convenient to have Denny's handy for breakfast; Tried Tahiti Joes but only stayed for cocktails as we found service poor and food overpriced. All in all - reasonable stay; not sure if we'll return. Based on the reviews, I seriously suggest management look into the front desk issues as they are a consistent problem in these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Another vacation at Tahit”
Reviews.Author: MOC_Jamz
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here for the 5th time in May of 2011. My friend is an owner at a sister property so he did an exchange to stay at Tahiti Village...something he's done the last few times we've traveled to Las Vegas. Take note, this is NOT a hotel...it's a timeshare condo community. However, due to the economy, timeshare sales are way, way down, and the facility has just as many people booking rooms for a hotel type of stay, if not more, than it does from as it does from people exchanging their time or owners enjoying their purchased 1 week or 2 weeks or more. Time and time again, I am very impressed with the outdoor grounds and landscaping. They are always maintained to absolute beauty and have been every time we have stayed on the property. The Lazy River is truly the eye piece the property. It's relaxing but also very fun, and it's heated. However, if you travel during peak times (like June through August) or any major holiday weekend, the place will be packed and getting lounge chairs and just space will be difficult. This is true of ANY hotel or resort in Vegas during this time, though. Over the years, we have been disappointed in seeing such dramatic increases in the exhange rates, and the difficult of booking a room. Given we pretty much always vacation in early May knowing full well there is nothing major going on in May (kids are in school, summer is not evern close to starting, and there are no holidays for anyone), we are getting frustrated in the diffculty in securing accommodations during the off season time. Right now, as of March 2012, we still can't book a 2 week stay for May 2012, due to the supposed limitations of exchanges available. This is so sad. Meanwhile, the daily rates to stay here as a non-owner (for example, anyone wanting accommodations as a hotel stay off the street) are so high, it's not even worth consisdering. Shockingly, these accommodations are immediately avilable!!! But not for exchanges??? Ridiculous, really. We are dissappointed that what used to be so easy to book via exchange is now very, very difficult. And the exchange fee has really increased so much. It's alsmot as if Tahiti is trying to discourage owners and exchanges in favor of being able to charge anywhere from $140 and night and up to "hotel" guests. I understand the property struggled (and still struggle) in this economy, but come one. The whole point of timeshare ownership is being able to exchange and stay in so many places via Interval International around the world. We keep hoping we can book here, but if not, we will just stay elsewhere...oh well.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Waste of Money”
Reviews.Author: Christopher L
Reviews.Content: We chose Tahiti Village based on a combination of location, price, and room types available. We chose a two bedroom suite for three nights and booked under retail (vs. timeshare). What we received was a complete lack of customer service and accomodation that was average at best. We arrived at 730pm only to find one person available to check in a line full of people. After waiting 35 minutes, we were finally checked in to our room (the front desk representative did not appear to know her job very well and the manager who came out several times (and then returned to her desk) didn't seem to care. We were promised a free two-day in-room connection to the internet (wireless is available for free, but only in the lobby) because of our wait in line, but the staff did not honor this at checkout, instead replying with "we made a mistake." For a newer property, our room was very, very used. Broken cabinet door handles, dirty footboards, and cracking grout in the tile in the master bathroom. But the worst offense of all was the complete lack of customer service. The main desk concierge is nothing more than a sales rep for local shows, and the "personal concierge" located in each tower is nothing more than a sales rep to get you interested in purchasing time shares (by handing out a free gift of reading material). Finally, upon checking out early in the morning, there was no "express checkout." There also happened to be a fight during the night and there were remnants of the fight strewn about the building and main lobbies. I was responible for booking this property for several families and I was completely embarassed about my choice and our experience. My family and I are completely dissatisfied and will never book here or another RCI timeshare resort/retail again.

Reviews.Title: “A lot for your money”
Reviews.Author: castro_boom
Reviews.Content: I have been here 3 times and you definitely get a lot for your money. we always get the biggest room which has 2 full bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a kitchen and kitchenet, 2 pullout couches so you can sleep 8 people comfortably + whoever wants to sleep on the floor. there is only 1 restaurant so that is a downside. there is a lazy river and a huge pool with a bar so there is a couple of options to chill under the sun. *one of the best things is the shuttle service it is super helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Best of what Vegas has to offer”
Reviews.Author: mmtropic1
Reviews.Content: A friend, I, and her daughter.stayed here for a week March 10-17 and we were pleasantly surprised. We booked through retail, not timeshare. Sorry this a long review but hopefully helpful. PLUSES Check-in was fairly easy. We were in tower 5 on the 7th floor, non-pool side. The floor was fairly quiet but got busier toward the weekend. We had no issues with loud neighbors. Room - We stayed in the Moorea (smallest room) and it was just fine for the 3 of us. Water pressure in shower was great and hot water was not a problem. Flat screen tv's were nice and we even watched a movie on the dvd player one of the nights. Shuttle - Shuttle ran like clockwork every half hour and the drivers were awesome! I wish I had noted their names to acknowledge their hard work. Grocery shuttle runs Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 8 am. It was a nice convenience and driver even dropped us at tower 5, which was far from the entrance. We also took the shuttle to Fremont Street (need to book this but no charge), which ran 3 times (5, 7 9 pm) on Tuesday and Wednesday. Housekeeping/Maintenance - we had to call three times for different reasons and were very happy with both housekeeping and maintenance. On the first night we arrived, the fridge was making this whining noise in the middle of the night. We called and they arrived in less than 20 minutes and fixed the problem. We had the same experience with housekeeping, ordered towels and more tp and you would have thought they were waiting in the hall. The items arrived in record time! Pool and Lazy river - wonderful relaxing time no matter your age. Pool was a little too cold but lazy river was the perfect temp. The sand beach at the pool had quite a few kids and they seemed to be enjoying themselves. Chairs were not an issue. MINUSES To be fair, I do have to note the minuses, not many but important to note Concierge aka Timeshare Reps - we had to book our Fremont shuttle here and was immediately given the timeshare sales pitch, which we were trying to avoid. My friend already had a timeshare elsewhere so really wasn't interested and I also wasn't interested. The rep asked if we wanted to attend a show in exchange for the presentation and we told her we only wanted to book the shuttle. She asked my name and continued her sales pitch. When we got her to end her presentation, I asked again it she had my name down for the Fremont shuttle for 3 people. She said "yes". When we showed up for the shuttle 2 nights later, they did not have our name. I should have known she did not write my name down. it's 12 letters long and she didn't even ask me to spell it! Shame on you, Denise!!!! Thanks to the other reps on duty Tuesday night, we were able to resolve the issue and did get on the bus. Other guests - this is not so much a reflection on the hotel but more of a beware to other guests. We experienced many rude guests especially on the shuttle. We usually arrived 15 minutes before shuttle was to leave and other guests pushed and shoved to get on first. Some were loud and obnoxious to other passengers and also the driver when he told them no alcohol on the bus. The hot tub is also open 24 hours and is occupied every one of those hours, mostly with guests drinking and having a good time. This did not bother us as our room was far away from the area but might bother others. All in all, great family resort. We would definitely stay there again. The best part was being able to go to the strip but come back and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Kirk B
Reviews.Content: We had a horribly long wait in line to check in; and the front desk person gave us the wrong room and key so we walked in on another family staying at the resort. After much confusion and more waiting we figured out that the front desk person had made an error. No real error, or upgrade of any sort. No wireless in the rooms, or maid service was a dismantlement also. I should have paid attention to the previous reviews. On our last night there, there was a fight. The police came and arrested people. Needless to say, I never felt welcome, safe and was dissatisfied. I will never book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the 5star resort I paid for...”
Reviews.Author: Denise L
Reviews.Content: Requested tower5, 8th fl. not even considered, put in tower2 room 2503 should not be given out until repaired, dirty carpet, dusty broken lamp over kitchen sink, no hot water in kit, no bed spread just a bottom piece, couch cushions so deteriorated when you sit you hit the frame, hot water only 1 sink in bathroom, charged for internet we didn't use, birds nest over outside balcony. They requested $40 charge for an owner update meeting, SERIOUSLY! Stephanie on check-in unacceptable, Girlie on check-out unacceptable, only 2 sports channels at Tahiti Joe's, NBA & ESPN A customer should not have to call "NXTV" to have a charge removed from their bill because of an inexperienced manager. Accidentally clicking "TV INTERNET" will auto charge the room for internet access. Delayed 30 mins. at check-out because of this. Overall Rating: UNACCEPTABLE :(

Reviews.Title: “Ok Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: Amy256
Reviews.Content: A friend and I traveled to Las Vegas for her 50th birthday and decided to stay at Tahiti Village for the lazy river. Her sister decided to join us at the last minute and as we had the two bedroom suite it wasn't a problem. We stayed from March 5 - 12 in suites 2511 and 2511A at a cost of $600 booked thru one of the owners. The design of the two bedroom suites is odd having two kitchens and living rooms. The suites are ok but the pull out couch in the main living room was horribly uncomfortable to sit on and there was only a hard back chair as the other option. The patio window opens but no other windows with the shutters it was very dark all the time in both living rooms. We had breakfast in and the odd lunch and found the kitchen well stock for this type of cooking. Beds were very comfortable. The lazy river and pool area were very well tended, clean and welcoming. Access to the strip and airport were fabulous. Overall the Tahiti Village was just OK, we've stayed at much better for the same cost or less.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It !!”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law had access to a two bedroom condo here at a very good rate. Check-in was quick. There was no "time-sales" pressure. The location is quite good for shopping, casino visits and the car rental and airport facilities. We had an 8th. floor unit and a decent view of the area south of the Strip. The grounds are nicely maintained. Although we were there in Feb. the Lazy River is heated and was comfortable. The main pool however was chilly. The hot-tub was "hot". We found that staying in a condo was a great way to better manage visits to the Casinos, save a bit on food and relax a bit more. I would stay here again in a heartbeat if I could get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “A fun family Vegas vacation.”
Reviews.Author: owen007
Reviews.Content: We had a mini family reunion here last summer and had a fantastic time! We BBQed at the pits most nights and they were clean and well maintained. The pools are fun and have lifeguards! The only issue we had was our fridge made a loud whinning noise and they never responded to our maintenance requests, but it wasn't enough to ruin our trip, the fridge worked, it was just loud. The shuttle the strip is handy, but fills up quick in evenings. Over all the rooms and resort is great and we'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stefdiego
Reviews.Content: We did an exchange for our time share and stayed in a two bedroom for 5 out of the 7 days(could not take the extra time off) and loved it . The room was very large and 6 of us stayed there very comfortably.It was cool but comfortable out by the pool and the lazy river was heated. The other pool was to cool.And the hot tub was pretty small for that large of a property could have used a second one.Had lunch twice at the restaurant on the grounds it was pretty good.We got two pizzas and two salads for 5 of us and had to take a full pizza back. Which was great that night for snacks.My only complaint is the walls were thin and when you have rude loud neighbors coming in at 3:00 and yelling and still partying you really notice.We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not take RCI Tour....Very Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: B M
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Villlage is a nice place to stay with nice aaccomodations and friendly staff. We took the RCI tour in exchange for comedy show tickets and restuarant gift card...BIG mistake! They try and keep you beyond the committed 90 minutes. Our tour guide, Bob, was rude, unprofessional and confrontational. His boss was intrusive.The presentation was not informative on the property they were trying to sell. It was condescending and very repetitive. STAY AWAY from RCI.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay - off the strip”
Reviews.Author: RonCharr
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this location, first time with my car. This time the location was a problem because it was way south of the strip. They do provide a shuttle service; drivers are professional and entertaining at the same time. The hot tub was under repair during our entire stay which was extremely disappointing. The bags of coffee in the room for self-service were of poor quality made the worse with the "lightener" in the packets. Bring your own coffee and extras if you enjoy good coffee. Wi-Fi is available at $$$.. and TV selection was very limited. Facilities are very clean and welcoming. Had to call the desk for replacement of TV at 11:00 pm; they came right up and replaced it, kudo's. They also have a small store, stocked with all your basics and a personable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Girls weekend in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole G
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a long weekend in Vegas with 8 women. We stayed at the Tahiti Village and it was great! We got to the hotel on Thursday around 2:30 and they checked us in early. Since there were so many of us we stayed in the Royal Tahitian room and it was perfect. There was plenty of room for everything. As you can imagine, travelling with 8 women brings A LOT of stuff and we never felt cramped! I loved everything about this resort. We were apprehensive about staying at a resort we weren't familiar with, but there was no need to worry. This place was really nice, and clean, which made us very happy. We had to use both pull out beds and they were both comfortable. The hotel staff was very helpful as well. The concierge helped us arrange travel to Fremont street. The spa was also amazing! The manager sat with me and helped me plan out an entire day of treatments for all of us. She even gave us a free foot scrub! I had the best massage and facial, and all of us were very pleased with our treatments. This really was an excellent choice for our trip. The only negative thing for us was that there was no free wifi, but if you can let go of being connected, you'll have no problems. And the only other tip I can give is plan to take a lot of taxis, or do a lot of walking for the shuttle. They drop you off in two places, but for us, walking around in heels and the weather being chilly, we wound up spending alot of money on taxis and limos. I definitely loved this place and would absolutely return!

Reviews.Title: “It Took A Paid Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: MarilynBB
Reviews.Content: We exchanged into Tahiti Village smaller lock out unit but paid on arrival to upgrade to the larger unit with balcony and are so glad we did. This beautiful property is an oasis of calm (except for the planes flying low overhead which we enjoyed watching.) Our unit, by choice, was high overlooking the lazy river and the skyline of Las Vegas strip. The changes from sunrise on the distant mountains to full sun on the tropical gardens, the shimmer of the sunset reflecting on the surface of hotels and the dramatic night lights delighted us. Friendly helpful staff and the best of any timeshare stocked on site shop for gifts, food and wine helped make our stay enjoyable. Free shuttle to the strip and grocery store, good onsite restaurants, close walk and drive to excellent shopping and a spacious well appointed suite were much appreciated. The worst - no in suite wifi. A trip to the owners lounge or main lobby were needed for that. Unfortunatly, the sales people frequently, and often loudly, came through the lounge with their repetitive sales pitches.

Reviews.Title: “4 But very close to a 5”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan V
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for Super Bowl weekend. Very nice place, service was good, very friendly staff. Above evrything this place was very clean!!!!!! Our only issue was that be booked it for 3 days and on the second they called us and said our reservation was only for two day. and i needed to go to the front desk and bring my paper work. I was very upset but once i got down to the lobby and showed them the email confermation. They got it taken care very quick. I cant blame them 100% because I Booked it thru Expedia. Either way the plass was nice and i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super, the place to stay for families.”
Reviews.Author: Martin F
Reviews.Content: We are thrilled to have found this place! We stayed in the Tahiti Village for a week and were a family of 5. The grounds are beautifully landscaped, the swimming pools surrounded with tropical plants was a delight to swim in and the rooms are just something incredible! Super modern, clean, spacious accomodations! We frequently purchased food for the grill in nearby supermarket had our own BBQ in the free outdoor BBQ grills set up for guests. The staff was friendly also. I do not see how I could not give this establishment anything but the highest rating. Until the next time Tahiti Village!

Reviews.Title: “The best time ever.”
Reviews.Author: Yovie G
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Tahiti Village from Jan 31-Feb 7,2012 an had a wonderful time. The staff was so kind I loved Mikey he was the best. He was so helpful with the sights and plays to see.I would recommend this resort to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: 220pinkflamingo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tahiti Village on more than one occasion and it's the property that I recommend to my friends when travelling to LV. The tropical ambiance just can't be beat. Tahiti Village is actually a timeshare, but they rent out as well. Rooms begin as a smaller two room suite but can be expanded by openning adjoining rooms to accomodate a large family. Even the suite is very comfortable but if you go that little bit extra and get a full one bedroom it's glorious. Spacious, luxurious and like your own apartment. Pool area is very beachy with palm trees throughout. What an oasis in the middle of the desert! Always clean - I understand they actually shampoo the carpet after each guest - and reasonably priced considering what you get. This is not a casino property and although located on the LVB, are a ways down from "the strip". But a quick shuttle ride gets you right to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable family escape”
Reviews.Author: tpharkman
Reviews.Content: My family loved the pool area and especially the lazy river. Rooms were very comfortable and well furnished. Long walks from parking but hey, that is everywhere in Vegas. I stayed here on a business trip with my family which kept them shielded from the adult-nature of the strip and allowed them to tag along for fun and frivolity. Great family resort in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money and stay somewhere else on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: kelly p
Reviews.Content: We've been here for one day so far and I have had to call the Front Desk about 15 times so far.. and counting. Here are some of my major issues with this resort. 1. They spray a coconut flavored spray into the rooms after they're cleaned. This scent gave me a major headache and made me sick to my stomach. I had to check out three different rooms before I found one that was tolerable. In other words, I finally found a room that's likely been sitting vacant for the past week to let the spray dissipate. Even the bellman agreed with me that some of the rooms smell really strong. To make things worse, the windows in the "kitchenette" rooms don't open so no option to air it out. I was told by the front desk that I should call ahead next time to ask them not to put the spray in my room. Why do they put this toxic stuff in the rooms anyway - I've never experienced this in any hotel I've ever stayed in before. 2. The bed did not have a bedspread. When I asked at the front desk she said "oh yeah, we run out of them sometimes". What??? I called housekeeping on her recommendation and they said they would bring one up to me. That was 6pm last night - still waiting for it. We slept with two sheets between a pilled blanket last night. 3. There is no wireless connection in the rooms. They will rent you an ethernet cable for $5 and $10/day in your room. Haven't looked for where the connection is, but I'm guessing it's in the bedroom which isn't very convenient - ethernet cable, I don't even remember what those look like! Supposedly there is free wireless in the lobby, maybe I should hang out there with my 2 year old to check my messages. Sounds like fun! 4. They have tiny old-school televisions squeezed into cabinets in both bedrooms and then still charge $12 for a non new-release movie. 5. There is no cleaning service if your stay is less than 5 days. Yeah, I'm on vacation and picking crumbs off of the floor so that this place doesn't look like a tornado hit it! 6. The mini-fridge does not have a freezer. What's more, I was under the impression when we booked that we had a full kitchen. Probably not their fault, but we've been eating microwaved dinners on a coffee table. The only "dining area" is a bar with tall bar stools - not very kid friendly unless you like falls from tall objects. This "kitchenette" has a mini-fridge with no freezer and a tiny microwave. Nothing else that a normal hotel room wouldn't already have. 7. The bathroom leaves much to be desired. The bath-tub was shockingly small and I had a hard time getting the plug in the bottom. While my daughter thought it was a fun game before her bath last night I was less than impressed. 8. The view out of our room was a huge neon sign advertising the neighboring hotel - it flashed... all night... I have to say though that the staff have been very nice when I've talked with them. Even though most things haven't been resolved to my satisfaction at least they're nice telling me "no". The bed was comfortable, but we didn't sleep well. Maybe because the A/C unit blows directly onto it. Since you can't open the windows you need the A/C because the temp is in the room is 75+ degrees otherwise. Also, I like that I don't have to walk through a casino to get to our room. In future we will choose a suite in one of the nicer hotels on the strip (for $150/night in the middle of January we pretty much can have our pick!) and brave the casino for a room with more ammenities (daily maid service, a jacuzzi tub, better t.v., etc.). This is a TIMESHARE by RCI, so be aware of that before you book. I had stayed at RCI timeshares in the past and was very impressed so assumed this would have similar ammenities. Clearly they put their money into the lobby (which is pretty nice) and their pool area (going to check out the pool... it's supposed to be heated... we'll see), but their rooms are very pedestrian and not up to par with their competitors on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kumar389
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the royal tahiti room with my family and my friends family on 26/12/11 ror 3 nights. Booked through their web site.Getting the rooms were very fast. The rooms are very good and comfortable.Hotel is very near the las vegas premium outlets. Very good location just 10 min drive from the strip.The staffs are ok, The only problem is not much of room service and the cleaning of the room was not done daily .The swimming pool was cold even it was heated . Other than that the stay was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suites, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Wordfiend
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Vegas. First two times we stayed either on the strip or very, very close to it. We traveled as a couple, without children. Pros: - very nice suite with full kitchen - pool, hot tub and lazy river looked great (but it was a little too chilly for us to take a dip) - laundry in suite - gave us a suite overlooking the pool (at our request), very nice view - very nice shopping centre nearby (about an $8 cab ride) with movie theatre and restaurants - would be very nice for a small family Cons: - I was first told that wifi was not available in the rooms, but then learned that in order to get wifi, you have to rent a modem and install software on your laptop. Cost ($7/day) isn't bad, but the pain-in-the-patootie factor is very, very high. Can only get the modem between 9:30 and 4:30 daily from the "Gifting" office upstairs. - so far from the Strip that you need to take taxis (approx. $25-$30 each way) or take the (free) shuttle, which leaves only twice an hour and only stops at two hotels on the strip - combination washer/dryer is loud as a wild drummer - ventilation system was quite loud - Tahiti Joe's restaurant was great when we went there for lunch, but not very good for dinner. (Served the absolute worst Tiramisu I have ever tasted.)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: PawPawNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We were there for four nights the second week of January 2012. Everything were perfect. The staff cann't do enough to help you. We asked for our room to face north toward airport and The Strip. Perfect room was assigned to us. I highly recommend this locations. I will return this Lodging on my next trip. SLP/North Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: AZMamaDee
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend. My daughter was married her November 2011 and family and friends all had rooms together on the 10th floor. They have everything you could ask for, including internet (you just have to ask for the password!). The shuttles get you back and forth to the strip without worrying about hailing a cab. You are just far enough away to relax if you want, gamble or catch a game in the sports bar or enjoy ameal in the on site restaurant. I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.....again...”
Reviews.Author: P O
Reviews.Content: We're in Vegas at least once a year and we've stayed here the past two years. We will be back. We enjoy the location (just a short ride to the heart of the strip) and the spacious rooms. No wi-fi in the room and lack of parking (the walk from the parking garage is kinda far) are the biggest drawbacks. If you want a quiet escape from the strip, this place works. Also, we found the restaurant, Tahiti Joe's, to be a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but seriously needs INTERNET access”
Reviews.Author: Hadassh28
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suites, easy to access off the strip, reasonably priced, but don't expect Wi-Fi access. Holy smokes, you would think a property of this size, situated in Vegas, would have the Internet thing down to a fine science. Very annoying. Off, on, off, on...and expensive, made moreso by the time drag when trying to connect. The property offers shuttle service, so this place is more for those with cars. With a car, you are laughing. Great access to everything. Drive straight up the strip for daytime or nighttime views. Return your rental car in only a few minutes. Easy access to the outlet malls, and buy your groceries a minute away at Whole Foods, one of the best grocery stores on the planet. Issues? The Internet!!!! Or rather lack thereof. Also, junior suites are really striped down...no stove, no dishwasher (only one measly dishtowel), a constantly dripping tap in the bathroom, and a very weird thermostat. And the tiny bar fridge did not close properly, so it will defrost overnight. Good things? Clean, neat rooms with comfortable beds and pillows. Large screen flat TVs with great reception. Nice layout. Lots of amenities like a spa and pretty outside pool if you require. Parking is tight later at night, but not bad. All in all, we would stay here again...but only when we find a deal online. Got this one through Priceline...and was happy with the fee. Hated? The automatic $10/night resort fees for things we don't use! Should have complained and demanded they return the fee, but didn't notice till we were at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE BUT THEY NEED INTERNET”
Reviews.Author: JFEARN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time in 2 years and they have a nice place. i particularilly like it because i attend a trade show at mandalay bay and it is a nice short ride. The 2 bedroom units in bld #5 are great. The only draw back of this resort is thier internet system. They are using a air card system similar to what you would buy for you cell phone. The system is slower than usual and if like me you have several people in your room with lap tops you have to configure your laptop to broadcast the signal so others in the unit can use the internet. It is really not that expensive to set up a wireless system in all the room I have no idea why they do not spring for it. Should the hotel do this i would be curious to hear.

Reviews.Title: “great stay...”
Reviews.Author: SandraPlymouth_MI
Reviews.Content: Close to all the action & the airport.... but far enough away that you could take a quick rest... good friendly service.... nice suite & price for a couple

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Vegas - a little of the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: DVMDV8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week around New Year's Eve 2011 and found the condos to be very spacious, comfortable and well equipped. The front desk staff was very nice and we had no problems at all. We needed bedding for a guest and it was delivered very promptly. We had no hot water or parking issues (as some others have mentioned) and found the location to be very convenient - about a 5 minute cab ride to the south strip. It is also about a 4 minute walk from an outlet mall if you want to do a little shopping. The only downside was that the bed could have been more comfortable - we stayed one night at the 4 Seasons and were spoiled by that one! The service and food at Tahiti Joe's was good (bar food). The kitchen was well equipped with the basics, plus a few nice little extras like coffee. We used the food delivery service that they list on their website and were extremely pleased with that as well - it really made a difference in keeping costs down, and we would really recommend it. It was also great having laundry in the unit and the machines were new and worked well. Overall we really enjoyed the unit and would absolutely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Rented Timeshare @ Tahiti Village w/ Aziz Amlani”
Reviews.Author: Janasha
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent time New Years Weekend! The place was clean, spacious, very comfortable and jus as he said it would be. I will definitely book with him in the future. Thank You, Janasha Hampton

Reviews.Title: “Not great; not awful.”
Reviews.Author: Towleway
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff gave us the key to a room that was already occupied. Not a great start walking into a room with a half naked guy in it. They didn't seem too concerned with their mistake either. The property itself is nice. Great pool and the floating river is very cool. The rooms are ok; not great, but ok. If the front desk staff would have pretended to care, I would probably have given this place a thumbs up, but they just made the experience pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “The bad and the good”
Reviews.Author: Mary T
Reviews.Content: The biggest problem was lack of hot water!! At times it was medium, but never hot and often cold. In 2 different rooms the TV's were broken. (They did come and fix them.) The drawn on the bathtub didn't work properly. Parking at night was a nightmare. The food in Tahiti Joe's was excellent and the shuttle was on time and without any hassle and gave quick access to the strip. They responded to our problems quickly and were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - without being on the strip”
Reviews.Author: CheeseburgerBob
Reviews.Content: Good for families, older and all. Not in the middle of the strip, but their free shuttle can get you there quickly (pay shuttle to airport), and they have a free (but limited time) one to downtown Vegas, too. We didn't rent a car the entire time. Great pool and lazy river / tropical area oasis. Large rooms and typical timeshare activities and space. Dennys right there on property and local bar/restaurant (good food). The staff in all areas were pleasant and helpful. Concierge desk can help arrange outings and were useful, too.

Reviews.Title: “Quality rooms; obvious management issues”
Reviews.Author: Wobblyore
Reviews.Content: The location, rooms, and resort amenities were almost ideal. Unfortunately the employees from the front desk to the concierge staff were obstinate, unprofessional, and downright rude. This property has some obvious management and training issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ngozi23
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Tahiti Village. The rooms were clean, spacious and very accommodating for our group. The kitchen can in very handy and the washer/dryer was a life saver during our stay. Check-in was very easy and quick along with securing our parking pass. We rented a car which was the best option after reviewing other reviews. All the casino have free self parking. Whole Foods in in the neighborhood along with the Premium outlets ... having a car made it easy to get around. Overall, enjoyed my stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Quiet to get over your jet lag in December”
Reviews.Author: Lynnep_Willerby
Reviews.Content: Great place, quiet in December so checking in and out was a breeze. View was nice if the palm tree hadn't have been in the way, we overlooked the pool. Lazy River and pool looked great but it was way to cold to try them out which was a real shame. Apartment was very good although noticed there was a wine glass missing off the inventory so pointed this out to check out to ensure I didn't get charged. Used the gym just once and it was good, cold water on tap and towels and showers. One morning we were up so early we walked down to the strip which took us about 40 mins but it was so cold we didn't do it again. Shuttle bus was very useful and we took full advantage. We ate one night at the on-site restaurant and that was good. I would probably stay here again but in warmer weather so we have full use of all the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been so much more.”
Reviews.Author: Jonketchem
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at a vacation ownership resort. It was a highs and lows experience from the beginning. Having arrived an hour early for check in, I expected to have to wait for a room. What I didn't expect was to be turned into a pinball. I was bounced from reception to concierge and back, only to be told to leave cell phone number and I would be called when a room was available. My family and I had just cleared the parking lot when we were called back, in less than 2 minutes. Back to pinball action, as very member of check in tried to get my wife and I to agree to attend a timeshare presentation. Telling people that we were owners elsewhere with no desire to change meant nothing. Finally, we we were given 4 keys and told that our fifth party would have to share a key(supposedly policy). When we booked we were told that there were no 2 bedroom units available, but we would receive a 1 bedroom with kitchen. What we received was a sink, microwave and mini fridge. No stove, no oven, and no laundry machines. The tv did not have a remote in the living room and the bedroom remote would not work on the living room set. The bathroom door to the living room would open in, but would not let you back out. All week, access to the bathroom was through my wife and my bedroom. We called for exa linen, towels and a remedy for these issues. Four and a half hours, six calls to site magement and finally calling our own resort company got everything resolved but the bathroom door. The suite was a possible 4 star stay except for little details like these and minor details, like the scent from the carpet shampoo that took all night to dissipate, only to resume the next afternoon, and the high end fixtures that had not been properly tightened and were beginning to show signs of wearing out prematurely. The amenities were exceptional, but why on earth would a resort in the desert close the pool and lazy river at 430 daily? The individual staff were friendly and willing to help, but the management seemed intertwined with the timeshare sale staff and would only give satisfaction if we would go to a sales presentation. The shuttle service was friendly, but stopped way too early and would only let those with a key card on board. We had to pretend to lose a card to get 5th card for our son in law. This place could be a 5 star resort if it changed management teams and philosophy. Also, the beds were very hard, but the pillows were great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend recently because I purchased it as a deal on Groupon. We both had a wonderful time! Upon first arrival, I thought the place was beautiful. The front staff seemed slow and disinterested but I figured it was midnight and they might have just been tired. I visited the concierge desk the next day and they were all very friendly. I asked for tower 5 since other reviewers said this but I wanted a smoking room and to see the pool so I was in Tower 1. I'm actually happy about this because it was closer to the shuttle. The suite was fairly large, quiet, and nice but had no power in the bedroom. I called the front desk and someone came up and fixed it within 5-10 minutes. I stayed in the Morea suite and was excited to see a mini fridge, coffee maker, and toaster. The fridge was turned up too high and my milk and fresh veggies froze but I did get use out of the coffee maker. The whole time I was there, the weather stayed about 60 degrees but I still had a great time in the hot tub as well as the lazy river- which was equipped with plenty of inner tubes, lifeguards on all sides, and complimentary towels. The shuttle service was a main reason I ended up booking this hotel. I was thrilled to find out it picks up every 30 minutes, despite being the off season, and stops first at the NY NY casino and then at The Mirage. This really worked out great for me (especially when I forgot my camera and had to go back to the hotel to get it). I was disappointed, however, that the last shuttle leaving the Strip is at midnight and the only way back after that is an expensive taxi. The restaurant service was slow but the lobster bisque was amazing. When I wanted to take my leftover soup, the waitress offered to fill the to-go container with fresh soup, and she waited til the end of the meal so it would be fresh. That was very nice! Finally, I must speak about the Internet service. DO NOT RELY ON DENNY'S, next door. I brought my computer to Denny's during breakfast. I could not get anything. All websites gave a server error and when I finally got on one site it died the moment I clicked on anything. In the hotel, the Internet is $10 for your whole stay if you use your laptop in the main lobby only. If you want to connect in your room it is $10 per day. Since I believe this is a bit of a rip off and I only stayed 3 nights, I chose not to use the Internet. Despite some of the small issues this is a very nice hotel and I had a great time and experience. This was my first time in Vegas and I plan to visit again. If I choose not to stay on the Strip next time, I will highly consider coming back to Tahiti Village.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to be Time Share Owner”
Reviews.Author: MariMac
Reviews.Content: We are proud owners of a 2-Bedroom Unit at Tahiti Village, and remain been happy we are. The staff has ALWAYS been friendly and helpful, and there are many wonderful amenities as other reviewers have mentioned. We've heard complaints about Time Share Ownership in general, but you would never hear that from us. We look forward to our visits which have always been easy to book whenever we've planned for. It's also simple to obtain additional rooms when desired for added guests meeting us in Vegas. There's no gambling at the Village, (except a handful of slots at Tahiti Joe's restaurant onsite) but there are definate advantages to not having to walk through rows and rows of machines to reach your rm. I could go on about the wonderful kitchen in the main units (limited in the suites), the great pool and Lazy River, etc, but it's already been said. Any complaints I have are minor, and I highly recommend this site.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Tahiti Village”
Reviews.Author: Anamika M
Reviews.Content: We arrived there in a scorching summer afternoon with a temp. of 112 degrees F. The check-in was quick ...no lines for us. We had a bora bora unit. When we walked in it felt like we were the first people ever to stay in there. The suite was impeccable. I own timeshare in Atlantic City and I have stayed in many resorts, but here the rooms are way better than any place I've visited. The bathroom was the room needed first after the very long flight from DC to Vegas. We were happy to see the humongous bathroom with double sinks, jaccuzi tub, shower and even a dressing stool. And all this wasn't crammed together. Believe me the baths are spacious, for a one bedroom accommodation. We needed and extra blanket and were brought a set of two within minutes of asking. We had read a lot about the washer dryers not working, but we found everything to be fine. There's just a mode where it uses seven wash and rinse cycles, you don't want that to be on. So check the settings. The dryer works fine. The king size bed was super comfortable. We slept like babies each and every night of our stay. The bedroom had a nice big hdtv and the living room had the old box type set. The decor was in keeping with Tahitian style both inside the bedroom and in the lobby , hallways everywhere. The pool area was overcrowded but still neat. The lazy river is awesome. We arrived on afternoons and never had to pay for the floating tubes. They provide towels there.We wre on a higher floor so it wasn't noisy at all. There was no sound from the a/c unit either. I used to cook full meals on some days but the exhaust was so great that when we would come back from the strip at night there would be no smell of food. Always get an extra room key because one of ours stopped working on day 2 and you don't want to waste your precious hard -earned vacation time standing in a line at the reception for a key. We had three, so were fine with 2 working ones. It was always a pleasure to come home to Tahiti village after a long days outing at the strip or Death Valley or Hoover Dam or even Grand Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but bad experience”
Reviews.Author: enakpil
Reviews.Content: Property is located on Las Vegas Blvd but a mile or so south of the main strip which still makes it a nice location. LOTS of shopping close by with the Premium Outlets to the south and Town Square to the north. The resort is nicely equipped and the suites are spacious. However there were a few issues encountered during our trip that I feel must be accounted for. My in-laws gave us a week here as part of their time share exchange and we could only book the smallest one bedroom mini suite as it was Veteran's Day weekend and there was a big fight scheduled at MGM. So the cost would be the same regardless of what size room/suite we booked, but no big deal, we just needed a place to call home for a few days. Check in was fast but upon arrival into the room, I immediately found on a towel in the bathroom, a 2 inch FAKE FINGERNAIL that had broken off someones finger. Gross factor: medium. Okay, fine, I can get over that. I took a shower later that night and found myself in ankle deep water because after removing the stopper, I found the drain to be 98% full of hair and other nasties. So not only am I wallowing in my own washed off dirt, I get to splash around with backed up hair/soap/boogers/etc. Gross factor: high. I called the front desk to report this and was told that maintenance would take care of it. Okay, no problem, we'll go out to the Strip and come back and the problem should be fixed. Got back a few hours later and tried the drain: YAY! It drains fast now! Gross factor: back to medium. My wife goes to use the toilet, peeks in the trash can, and sees hair/soap/boogers/etc which came out of the previously clogged drain. Okay, it's a trash can, so Gross factor: medium-high. But wait, what's that next to the drain garbage? It looks like two or three of our green plastic knives that we had brought with us and had stored in the kitchen with our food and other items. Funny, I don't remember eating anything in the bathroom...wait a minute, did the maintenance man unclog the drain with our knives? Wait, a minute...that means he went to the kitchen to find something to unplug the drain, went through our foodstuffs on the counter and decided that our green plastic knives were the proper tool for the job? Gross factor: EXTREMELY HIGH! Needless to say, this was the last straw and we didn't want to stay in that room anymore. SO the on duty manager offered us a credit to the restaurant for our troubles, and initially did not even offer us to change rooms. It wasn't until we threatened to pack up and leave did she offer to move us and reluctantly offered to upgrade our room to the bigger one bedroom suite (which I thought was unavailable in the first place). So we took the room change (which technically wasn't an upgrade because it would have cost us the same anyway) and moved down the hall. The new suite was nice, almost 900 square feet, and had a jacuzzi tub, with a steam shower. The bathroom had two sinks and the kitchen was nice a spacious too. The living room had lots of room too so my daughter and two nephews had plenty of room to run around in. There was also a balcony to go out onto and view the Strip from which was nice at night. We stayed the weekend of 11-11-11 and we counted at least 23 weddings here at Tahiti Village, and the pool looked very nice too! Too bad they closed the pool at 4pm though. Parking is a little inadequate with the overflow parking a little distance away, but not too far. Subtract the grossness of the first room and I would give this place at least four stars out of five. The larger suite was absolutely fabulous and we wish we could have stayed there our entire trip. Alas, the ick and gross factor DID happen to us there, and I think management was a little slow to do the right thing, although they eventually did. The housekeeping manager came up to the room and retrieved the fake fingernail to investigate whose it was but I never heard anything back. The maintenance manager called me to apologize for using our personal items which was unsatisfying, but at least the effort was made. I would like to say that I would stay here again, but I just need a little time to get over the first room experience. I will say that the disparity between the small one bedroom suite and the large one bedroom suite is very large and you would be very wise to do your research before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JohnP13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this "resort" for a week and ran the Las Vegas Marathon. It was far enough away from "the strip" to be quiet and the courtyard was very nice. The staff were great and the size of the rooms was good. We had a couple of rooms and our family enjoyed it very much. I would rent out a cheap car next time, since I spent a fortune on taxi cabs this time around. But now I know better. A rental vehicle is best way to get around and there is plenty of free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - just fire the front desk and start over and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Honeysue55
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in October - beautiful, spacious rooms with great balcony and living area - even the lock out unit ( second bedroom ) was great. Gift shop nice - great coffee- pool rocked - clean and well kept , large - lazy river was super nice - didn't like paying for the tubes to ride there though. Wi fi only at pool and lobby area and you actually have to pay for that. Biggest down side was the front desk - not helpful at all - borderline rude. We spoke with several employees there who offered no info at all - upon check in we were given keys -no info on area or how to get wi fi or where to park the rental car. Finally we asked enough questions to get some idea of what to do. Yes , would go back in a New York minute but would hope that before I got there the owners would have an inservice on how to treat paying guests. After all with out us they have no job! By the way, we are in out 50's - other couple ( fam) in their 30's. Enjoyed Vegas - glad we weren't in the middle of the strip- another plus for Tahiti Viallage.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: frederiquecariou
Reviews.Content: It was the 3rd and 4th time we had to travel to Las Vegas with 3 kids of 4, 8 and 17 years old and with grand parents. This hotel has nice apartments with all what you need : kitchen, the rooms were a good size, the biggest rooms they washing machine and dryer inside. The room are very clean when you arrive, at it is appartment they do not come everyday after, It could be great when you stay 1 week to offer another cleaning passage, if you need to use the kitchen, one week is a little bit long to manage. The hotel is very convenient to airport. To go to the strip you need to take the taxi for a very short distance and it was fine for us as we like being off the strip. Theres no game machine in the lobby, not eveynone smocking, like in most of hotel on the strip, what is better when you travel with families ! We also loved being convenient to the outdoor Town Square, it is a super shopping area with great open playground for children with lots of water fun to cool the children down. The hotel has 2 fun pool, one a river for the biggest ones and one with sand beach. It is the very great for young kids and teenagers. The hotel could be perfect if they had a better restaurant to offer, the hawaian one is not so good. Theres a fee for the wireless accessin the rooms. The personnal in the lobby is not so helpfull but they seems to have a lot to do, a lot of people to serve ! For us it's the best hotel to recommended if you stay more than one day in Las Vegas with a family. Stayed April 2010, Octobre 2010, january 2011 traveled with family

Reviews.Title: “Worse service and way below expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Emadmakar
Reviews.Content: It is amazingly terrible service in every way possible. The stafe is unwilling TI help with any little request. No room service what so ever. Website is decieving. When I request early checkout due to my continuous unpleasant surprise, the manager forced me to stay by threatening to charge the entire stay even if I departed early. Big disappointment to my and the entire family. DO NOT EVER GO THERE.

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service in a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aspi123
Reviews.Content: the staff need to go on a crash course in customer service. nice place, good pool/spa/lazy river. but if u need anything from housekeeping, be prepared to wait......not much help on phone also. kitchen well equiped, but no hot plate or stove!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: CPawloski
Reviews.Content: We just spent 7 days, as part of our timeshare time, and just wanted to share some of our experiences. The room was good, with the bed being extremely comfortable, allowing a good rest every night. The Denny's is great for a bite to eat in the morning. The outlet mall is right there, so shopping is convenient. Now the downside. We stayed here in May, as well, and find that the pool areas do not get very much sunshine. The lazy river was all shaded this time, so with the temperatures being low, and the wind breezy, we didn't really spend much time at the pool. In the heat of the summer, the shade would probably be welcomed, but we came for sun. And because you're right next to the airport, you're not going to nod off suntanning, as a plane flies over every 5 minutes. Next, because there are so many rooms, trying to catch a shuttle, especially Friday or Saturday night, good luck. We had a rental car, so we had that option, but if not, look at using a taxi on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids”
Reviews.Author: Andrea S
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Tahiti Village. We loved it last year and couldn't wait to go back this year. Wow, how things change in one years time. Although this is a time share resort you do not have the pressure of having to purchase one unless you want discounted tickets to shows/dinners. Better off saving your time and buying them at the discounted ticket booths on the strip. We came with our two small children and stayed in the smallest suite (Moorea) because at the time of booking our reservation they didn't have any other rooms available but a month later at check in they apparently had plenty, but wanted us to spend an extra $40 a night to upgrade to the larger room (we opted out). The sofa sleeper for the kids was horrible. I just about fell right through it when I went to sit on it after making it for them the first night. You could hear and feel every spring in the bed. There is no way an adult could have slept on that bed. The bathroom was showing obvious wear & tear (we were in the newest section) and wasn't very clean, the carpet was FILTHY. Do not wear white socks or they will be black in a matter of minutes. The sink was missing a drain plug, and there was no dishwasher like they told us when we booked it. No washer/dryer either and the laundry facilities on site just happened to be getting remodeled and were not available during our stay. The shuttle service is nice, and was very prompt. Don't be a minute late or it will leave without you. It does run every half hour. They have added extra shuttle stops (Fremont St. and I believe Hoover Dam) you have to sign up for them, they are first come, first serve. The pool area is very nice, but the kids who are lifeguards can be "Nazi's" at times. They don't really like to work and when they have to go watch people in the pool they act as though it is such a daunting task. Most of the time they are in there little Tiki Hut playing cards. The rooms seem to be pretty well sound proofed, we rarely heard anybody around us unless they were running down the hall. The McCarren airport is practically next door, airplanes take off every 2 minutes can be annoying and loud at times, but you get used to it. Parking on site sucks. They tell you to try and park "in the curve", but half of the curve spots are for unloading/loading only or handicapped. Which only left about a half dozen to park in. Your only other option is the parking garage which is as far away as possible. The parking is free. However, there is NO elevator near the parking structure so your left carrying all your luggage/groceries, etc about a half mile to your room. You can get a dolly/cart, but then have to utilize a bell boy which costs you more money. I'm sure we will stay here again sometime (if we bring the kids), as like every hotel/resort your likely to run into some problems here or there. If we go alone, we will more then likely pick a hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: nag14
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village is a nice place to take kids when visiting the Las Vegas area. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful (came immediately when we asked for new batteries for the tv remote). It is a great location, convenient to the airport, interstate and the strip. Our only complaint was that the pool was definitely not heated to the 80 degrees they advertise. A number of the lifeguards commented that the heater was broken or malfunctioning. This was a bummer since we were all looking forward to enjoying the beautiful pool and lazy river even if we were visiting at the start of the off season. Otherwise, it was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: stillbackpacking
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 kids) stayed here for 4 nights in a 1 bedroom suite. Getting the bad bit over with - kids slept on the fold out lounge in the dining room which had several springs missing and took us over an hour of complaining to the front desk to supply the bedding even though we had stated in the booking we would need the fold out. Had to pay for the tube floats($5) in the pool. OK that was the bad bits and quite minor stuff. Now for the parts we liked - the two pools were brilliant and constantly manned by lifeguards. Having a Denny's next to the hotel was brilliant and we used the free WIFI there and ate several times. The shuttle bus in to the strip (about 10 mins drive) was good but sometimes crowded so that people missed out on the ride. The hotel is across the road from several factory outlets which if you dont mind being off the main action of the strip is great. There is a small shop in the hotel supplying beer, snacks etc - very handy. There are laundry facilities which we used and aside from issue with change machine not working were cheap and all in good order. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Get Away”
Reviews.Author: msroot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tahiti Village the frist week of November for seven days. It was the most relaxaling vacation we've had in a while. We stayed in the Royal Tahitian which is very cozy but still spacious and comfortable; the room is equipped with a full kitchen, washer and drier, and jet tub. We were able to witness a few weddings held on Friday; it was very nice to stand on the balcony and watch the beach front weddings by the water fall behind the pool and lazy river. Its only 15 mintues from the Strip and transportation is provided to and from the Strip all day. I would recommend Tahiti Village as a great place to stay while in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds and room, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: HBKreis
Reviews.Content: While the price was good for the room (through a third party website) and the room itself very nice, the poor customer service at the front desk assures that I probably won't return. The woman at the front, while checking me in, also helped other people who just walked up and demanded to be helped -- it didn't matter that I was standing there. And when she discovered that the third-party didn't charge my card as they were supposed to, the hotel wouldn't use the card that I offered and I had to put down a cash deposit. All this time, she was speaking to her manager in Tagalog, and from what I know of the language she was speaking about me in a demeaning way and gossiping while I waited. It's really a shame, because the grounds, room, and location are pretty darn good. But if I'm going to be treated like a second-class citizen, I'll gladly pay the extra $100-$150 a night at Wynn or Encore and be treated with respect.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical”
Reviews.Author: costarica08
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Tahiti Village for 4 days and 3 nights in October. We had two joining rooms, one with a full kitchen and the other with a kitchenette. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The pools are great! They have a great lazy river which the kids as well as adults loved. The main pool is very nice as well. They even have a sandy area which runs right into the pool which the younger kids get to play in. The hotel staff is great! We asked for a kitchen appliance and it was delivered within minutes. Being that you're staying in a time sharing resort, the rooms are not cleaned during your stay, but the room is spotless when you arrive. They even have a BBQ area where you can grill your own food. This place has thought of everything :) We absolutely loved Tahiti Village! My boyfriend and I are seriously considering getting married there next October. Either way, we will definitely be returning. If you decide to stay at Tahiti Village, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: breezy25
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at Tahiti Village in October for three nights. We choose one of the large 1 bedroom units and were not disappointed. It was very spacious and had everything you could wish for. We had a ground floor room by the pool which was handy. We spent a lot of time in the pool and lazy river. There were plenty of beach chairs and it was so relaxing. The shuttle into the strip offers a great services and it was very quick. We were unsure if it would be best to stay right on the strip, however with children we felt Tahiti Village was perfect for us. The planes do come over very close so when at the pool they are quite noisy but it never bothered us, it was quite an experience ! Did not hear any noise at night. We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites”
Reviews.Author: mauisnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the larger 1-bedroom suites (Bora Bora) at Tahiti Village for a couple of nights and were very impressed with the unit and the property. There was a full kitchen, washer/ dryer, huge steam shower and jetted tub. The pool area is great, too, with a lazy river and a larger pool with a "beach" entry. There is also a full service spa, though I did not use it. The resort is further away from the strip and has limited dining options - but is right across the street from the Outlet Shopping Center. But, if you don't mind being a little away from the action, it's a really nice place for a great value. Our only complaint is that there is limited parking near the buildings, so you may have to park in the structure some distance from your unit.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: veterantripster
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay for a week at the Tahiti Village. We find the place relaxing, and very accommodating. Service was great. It's a wonderful break from the busy strip yet you can get there quickly via courtesy van. We especially enjoyed being able to go to Fremont street one night via courtesy van. This was an added courtesy since last year when we had to use public transportation. As before the trip to the grocery store was very manageable, and allowed us to dine in our condo for a few times. We appreciate the amenities including the pool. Very nice resort. We would not hesitate to go back at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Low key Vegas resort”
Reviews.Author: Nicholls1316
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Bora Bora suite while in Vegas for business. The resort is very low key and relaxing for a Vegas hotel. It is located on Las Vegas Boulevard, but it is on the other side of the airport from the strip. If you want to walk everywhere, then this isn't the place for you. They do have a complimentary shuttle, but we never used it. If you drive to Vegas or have a rental car it is great place if you want to leave the craziness of the strip behind at night. The rooms are very nice and have a full kitchen with all of the appliances, dinner ware and silverware that you need. We never cooked anything, but it definitely has everything that you need if you want to cook. The room had two flat-screens, a stereo, and a DVD player in the room. The pool is a large free form pool with a sandy beach in one section. There is also a lazy river and a hot tub. There is a Denny's and another restaurant onsite if you don't want to venture out to eat. There are also two malls close by with lots of restaurants if you don't want to go all the way into town. I would recommend it for family, extended stay, or business travel. If you are there to party you probably would want something closer to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room”
Reviews.Author: Barblikestotravel
Reviews.Content: My room on the ground floor of the Moorea Bldg was just beautiful and comfortable. It had everything I needed and more, full size fridge / full size coffeemaker / in room laundry unit / steam shower / flat screen tv in bedroom / lush view off the patio, all for $90 a night. You view the steady arrival of aircraft without the noise. The gift shop has a great selection of food, necessities and outerwear. The shuttle is handy for going to the Strip or downtown but they will not go to the airport. Tahiti Joe's resturant onsite has a decent menu selection.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected surprise after a last minute booking”
Reviews.Author: YepBeenThere
Reviews.Content: I was originally supposed to be at a different hotel during my recent Vegas trip but ended up here on a last minute booking on Kayak due to a poor experience at the Candlewood Suites. This is a time share property that sells off the extra rooms when not being used by the “owners”. The rate was competitive if you’re looking for a place to stay WITHOUT gambling. The rooms are structured to be 2 bedroom units with a lockoff door separating the room like you would see in a typical hotel with adjoining rooms. I stayed in the “A” side which is the studio side which is a 1 bedroom 1 bath unit with limited kitchen, micro/fidge combo and large countertops. The room was clean and well decorated in a Tahiti theme. It had solid surface countertops and an upscale look. The furniture was in decent shape. The bed was good and the pillows were cheap and lumpy. The grounds looked lovely although I arrived at 10 pm and left for the airport at 9:00 so I didn’t use the pool which has a zero entry, sand bottom. It has a Dennys attached to the property, though most people will make their own meals in the kitchens. I would have rated this property better BUT: • They charge for internet services (tacky) • There is no work area if you are trying to stay here on business • The bathroom is poorly laid out with a VERY small countertop only large enough to fit the sink. My wife would have a fit here trying to put on makeup. It didn’t affect me one way or the other • Slow staff response • Common areas/hallways could be cleaner. All in all I would stay here again, only would be better prepared next time. I give it an 85/100 overall and a 90/100 for value.

Reviews.Title: “Grea Trip”
Reviews.Author: dotman60
Reviews.Content: Great services like free shuttle to town. Close to airport but noise very low. Great pool and spa, towels at pool. Rooms good size and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than staying at a Casino”
Reviews.Content: It is very close to the airport, no noise, and about 13 min from the strip, always use I-15 to avoid the traffic from Las Vegas blvd. Hotel is quiet, friendly staff and best of all no cigarette smell because it is not a Casino. Hotel is well maintained, every morning I could see the crew cleaning up the BBQ area, pools etc. Our apartment (51030), last floor was quiet, nice and big. It has a full kitchen (stove, oven, microwave oven, dish washer, coffee maker, refrigerator, glasses, silverware, can opener, soaps, well pretty much anything we wanted), it also has good washing and drying machines.
