Our apartment overlooked an empty block, not pretty, but not bad at all. Four of us slept in there, two in the main suite with a big TV and two in the convertible sofa bed in the main room, which has another big TV. The convertible sofa bed was NOT comfortable, it is too thin and we could feel the springs on our backs. We asked for a mattress PAD, but we got several blankets to put over the mattress to work as a PAD, this helped, but it was not satisfactory. I can't review the shuttle or the wireless Internet because we did not use them. It is a very good place to stay, the only problem was with the sofa bed. BTW we bought the stay from www.skyauction.com, I can't tell how low was our rate...

Reviews.Title: “Groupon Special”
Reviews.Author: Orphie27
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and they let us check in anyway. We requested a room in building 5 overlooking the pool as previous reviewers suggested and they were happy to give us what we wanted. The only hiccup was the tv in the living/kitchen area was broken. They offered to give us another room, but we had already unpacked. They offered to replace the tv if they had one, but we had a repairman in the room long enough and were ready to check out the pool. Unfortunately, you can't order movies from the tv in the bedroom and my wife was wanting to rent "The Help" which would have been available. Pool and hot tub area are nice. The gym was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: 19Crazy_Willy69
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on several occasions and the resort is very nice with a Tahitian theme. I do enjoy my time while staying at the resort. I agree with some of the other comments on here that some of the employees tend not to want to wait on customers- no issues with checking in process. I will say its not all the staff members but only a few. There are staff members who are very cognicent of you standing in line and are prompt in helping with great customer service. Its hit or miss if you are there outside the normal check in times especially in the late evening. The concierge has always provided us great and friendly customer service. Two issues that I have is 1) they charge for internet in the rooms and 2) each of the last two times that I visited there were mechanical issues with the rooms. In one case the door would stick trying to enter the room and you have to forcefully push your way into the room and also the cover panel to the microwave lost its adhesiveness and began to hang outward. Ok, if you are staying here without a vehicle then you will need to consider taking taxi cabs. Especially, if you plan on staying out after the last shuttle returns for the night or going to an area where the shuttles dont. I took a cab from New York New York back to the resort and it ran me approximately $13. Rates were .20 per 1/13th of a mile beyond the base fee ~$3.50- $4. Available shuttles run on a schedule and there is no guarantee that you will be able to get on. We seen in two cases where the shuttles were full and the drivers called for an additional shuttle for the remaining passengers. Pool side- VERY NICE FEATURE TO THE RESORT. Drinks are somewhat expensive for the large refillable souvenier cups($16) but the REFILLS are only $10. Mixed drinks in a large cup size (estimated size is 30 ounces). Lazy river- they charge for the innner tubes unless you are an owner.

Reviews.Title: “It was good.”
Reviews.Author: Jullisa
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare there. We had a one bedroom. The space was good. The furnishings were good. We had a view of the car rental parking lot, thus not so nice. Also not enough natural light came in. Partly due to the wooden blinds chosen. We had a rental car, so the location was good in relation to the airport and the strip. A discount mall is in walking distance and the area has various restaurants. So overall it was a good experience, but nothing out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Allright”
Reviews.Author: Pepper1978
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night, we choised this hotel as it's located near the airport and we needed to catch an early flight. We took te most simple room and it turned out to be enormous! The view wasn't great (parking lot) but for just one night okay. When staying longer I recommend something a bit more expensice including a terrace or balcony. Further we found the room very cold and the airco a bit noisy. The reception desk - man was very polite and full of jokes and the parking-man was in a good spirit too. When walking through the hotel you need a map, it's so big. It has large pool which were closed during our stay due to lightning. There's a small shop where you can buy some food and there's a restaurant too. We ate there during lunch time and the food was allright, so was the service. The hotel offers wifi but we found it quite expensive so we didn't used it. The strip isn't at walking distance so you'll need a car or shuttle for a short drive. Not far from the hotel there's a shopping center (Premium Outlet), which is nice but we prefer the other one.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: slowsuby
Reviews.Content: The first thing that I realized when we got there was that the reviews regarding the staff were correct. It seems like they only hire people who hate dealing with customers. The front desk staff was rude and seemed like the only thing they wanted was for us to go away. All we wanted to do was check in too, its not like we were being finicky or snobby. That was the first thing that I noticed. The rooms were great. Very clean, nice, and we had a great view of the strip. Other rooms didn't have this. The view of the lazy river/strip was replaced with empty dirt lots. I can see how this would affect your stay, but it isn't that big of a deal. The shuttle service was great. On time and friendly drivers that made the experience great. There were a few times when we got to the shuttle only to find it was completely full. We just sat on the bench only to be told that they were scrambling another shuttle to take the overflow right behind the regularly scheduled shuttle! This happened twice and both times I was pleasantly surprised. The only down side is that the last shuttle pick up on the weekends is around 1:45AM at the Mirage. It seems like the shuttles should run later since it is, after all, Las Vegas. Which brings me to my next point. The freaking pool closes at 8PM. 8PM? Its VEGAS. Not South Bend, IN. Things should stay open super late. People like to party. The pool was very well lighted and would have been amazing to be able to stay in it later than 8PM. The Gym was awesome. I expected to have to pay to use it seeing as how they nickle and dime you for internet and computer access. But it was free. Luckily our room was right around the corner from it. So it was an easy thing to do in the morning. Great for exercising out the previous night's overindulgence in both food and drink. The location is kind of bad. You can see the strip, but its far away. Being an objective reviewer, I would say that if you want to be off the strip, its great, but for us, we will be staying closer next time. Its perfect if you want a quiet getaway after spending some hard hours on the strip. Its also super far away from Freemont St. We really wanted to go to Freemont, but never had the time/money to take the shuttle, plus another cab. A shuttle that just dropped off at Freemont would have been awesome. I also noticed that they had nice HD TV's, but the cable was SD. It made the picture look really weird. It was annoying. It made me appreciate my HD TV at home though. We had a few bets in on sports games and were following them while getting ready and stuff, and it was tough having to watch it on the weird distorted picture. Call me snobby, but I'm used to a sort of luxury. lol. Overall, I probably wouldn't stay here again, but you have to keep in mind, I'm a 24 year old guy. If I had a family and wanted a quiet retreat, then this is exactly what I would do. Also, the staff's hatred towards customers will really get you ready for what Vegas is all about. People working in customer service positions that really hate dealing with customers. That is, unless they are digging you hard for a tip. Get ready for that too.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: LINDY6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio apt. for two nights. The room was clean and comfortable. Nothing over the top. We had an issue with shower drain and it was fixed quickly. The staff were wonderful. Helpful and friendly. We took the shuttle one night and it took some time to get on a empty bus. But a shuttle driver of a full bus counted us and let us know another bus was on the way. We loved the grounds. The pool areas were so clean. Water was perfect temp. Life guards were everywhere. They had a nice grill area also. Plenty of security. Really a nice surprise. I just wish we had a couple more days just to hang out by the pool. There was a nice mix of people from families, singles, couples and elderly. A really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Place is for people over 40, families and kids ... Don't expect a Vegas party”
Reviews.Author: johnlearned
Reviews.Content: Really nice place with excellent pool. Great atmosphere with friendly staff. No complaints at all about the hotel. It's just not a place with any Vegas party atmosphere. The pool was very nice with palm trees everywhere and reclining chairs. No music! Not a fun Vegas party pool. Its for Old people and kids. Don't stay here is your under forty with no kids. Too quiet and boring. I forgot how much I miss LMFAO blasting by the pool with a beer in each hand.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: YokelCletus
Reviews.Content: This resort is a about a mile or two south of the strip. I thought this may be inconvenient but it was not. The shuttle ran every 30 minutes to the Mirage and New York New York. There are plenty of decent restaurants within walking distance and a huge outlet mall right beside the resort. The grocery store is about a 20 minute walk. Our suite had everything but a stove. It was pleny big and very clean. The view was OK. The bed was huge and very comfy. The only real downside to this resort is that it is located right beside the airport runway and the noise can be somewhat annoying. If you can get past that you'll be pleased with everything else. The concierge, maid service, pool service, check-in counter, bus driver was all excellent. The concierge had some nice deals on the shows in town. The pool, hottub and lazy river were all great. They have free parking for your rental car. I can't comment on the pricing because we had free accommodations. We bought a time share last April with Diamond and this was a free week that came with the purchase. I would definitely go back to this resort

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for families.”
Reviews.Author: drumz
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village Resort is located south of the airport and is on the strip, but not near the "action" so to speak. It is a great place for families as it has no gaming and the pools are kid friendly. The issues are internet access and flight noise. We found the flight noise a bit annoying as every flight seems to depart over the property. The internet issue was the result of employees not knowing which suites offer access and we spent an 1+ 1/2 hours back and forth between the front desk and our room dealing with their issues regarding access: they should just offer WIFI throughout the property. If you're looking for luxury and the "glam" of Vegas, then this isn't the spot, but for a warm family getaway it's totally fine. Both the pool and lazy river are great! Plus do it yourself barbeque! A rental vehicle is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “full points from our family of four -- loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kmaxwell154943
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas this past weekend for a 3-night, 4 day stay to attend a wedding. I searched for a place to stay with the best pool for families, and this was it, hands down. full points all around. We are really appreciative of the off-strip location; the shuttles and taxis worked great for us and the pool and peacefulness we found at tahiti village made it totally the right choice for us. the facility is lovely, and the illusion of a tropical location i actually really convincing. if we had been able to smell salty sea air and/or flowers, we would have believed it totally. our checkin was quick and friendly, took approx 2 mins and all our requests had been met. the room was even ready early, which I was not expecting. Nobody spoke to us about timeshare ownership, which was great.the information was available if wanted, but we did not have to deflect any sales advances. thank you. went straight up to our room, which was immaculately clean and in order. we stayed in a moorea 1-bdrm jr suite, 580 square feet. plenty of room and comfort for the four of us. kitchen has cups, glasses, bowls, toaster, fridge, microwave -- enough to prepare snacks, cereal, light breakfast. the bed was large and very comfortable. the sofa bed in the living room was quite adequate; of course the grownups preferred the big comfy bed in the bedroom, but I slept a full night in the sofabed at one point, and was perfectly comfortable. we did not need more blankets that we had, but it wouldn't hurt to have an extra few in the room. another thing that could be added to the room is a small broom, since we were unfortunately tracking in a bit of sand. we appreciated the safe, iron, hair dryer, corkscrew. a kettle would be good, and some more coffee for the coffee machine would be nice. straight down to the pool! the lazy river was warm, not crowded, and wonderful. We were in it every day from 5-6pm, when it closed. My kids would have run down to be there if it opened earlier in the morning, but it opens at 10 am for what I think are sensible reasons: quite a number of lifeguards are needed to watch the pool, and before 10 am, the swimmers are mostly families with quite small children, not yet ready for the lazy river. the floatation rings are $5 each rental fee per day, but we were not charged at the end of the day, depending on how close it was to closing time. towels are warm and fluffy and plentiful at both pools. the main pool is large, warm, and has several shallow areas, great for kids, and a sandy beach. we spent every morning in it from 8:30-10. lovely. the hot tub, also appreciated. there was a movie being set up on the friday night; we were too tired to stay and watch, but it seemed like a fun idea. I don't think the movie planned was age-appropriate for our kids (6 and 9), but this was not an issue for us since they were done for the day anyway. we watched only a bit of TV, the kids appreciated cartoon network, teletoon, and pbs. the convenience store had all the bases covered; enough to get some fruit, coffee, snacks, beer, wine, souvenirs. the staff was very nice. we find it really appropriate that housekeeping comes in only on request or if you are there a week or longer. we had plenty of towels and everything we needed to manage ourselves without having the room made up daily, which I frankly find wasteful and unnecessary in most places. the only thing I would have asked housekeeping for is some more (and possibly stronger?) coffee, and/or coffee filters. the shuttle worked perfectly for us. we rode it to the strip 3 times to different locations, and found the drivers to be very nice. on the one occasion that there was an overload, the driver called right away for a backup, which came just as promised within 5 minutes. They might consider a system to manage the wait for the shuttle; it is hard for people to know who was there first, which could potentially get stressful for some guests, since the boarding of the shuttle kind of happens willy-nilly. We took cabs back from the strip because our children were tired (and/or dying to get into the pool). they were easy to find at all strip hotels, efficient, and cost approx $15-20 for the trip. fair enough. same cost as the trip to/from the airport. the concierge arranged a car rental for us with budget for our last day; we swam, packed, checked out, and were picked up at 10 with all our bags by a budget van driver, who took us to the budget location, where they set us up. We were underway by 10:45, which I think was quite reasonable, with all our bags in the car. We drove west to red rock canyon, which is amazing and an easy 30 min drive out of town, then came back to town and parked in the self-park at the mirage to visit the tigers and dolphins. When it was time, we dropped the car off at the airport car return, then onto the shuttle and zoop! to the airport. easy. btw we did notice planes flying over tahiti village, but it was not excessively loud or problematic. I think anywhere in vegas you can hear planes flying over at some time of the day. we were at tahiti joe's twice and denny's 3 times. the pizza and nachos at tahiti joe's were very good and generously sized, as well as reasonably priced. the burgers and grilled cheese also got good reviews. the beer and wine were very reasonable, and the margaritas we had we delicious. we did receive separate checks for the bar items vs the food, but this was not a problem for us; the food server simply relayed our orders to the bartender, who brought the drinks and checked on us. Really good value in the pizza/nacho/burger end of the menu. Denny's was staffed with really nice people, and the food and value were good, especially if we targeted the pico de gallo on the menu. The kids loved the pancakes, eggs, and bacon. Quick, efficient, and very, very nice staff. thank you. overall for us: the location off strip was a plus. the pools were amazing. the room was clean, comfortable, large, and well appointed. the service we received was quick and friendly. we had a fantastic experience at tahiti village and will definitely recommend it to friends and family. thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: plgross
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. There was nothing hat really stood out to us. Room were a bit outdated but clean and they included a DVD player, which made it nice for our 4 and 2 yr olds. Pool was great; however, inner tubes for the lazy river are not free and cost $5 a day. We did the Timeshare presentation, which is where the value really comes in too play. We got a free night's stay, free dinner at Tahiti Joes, and a $100 coupon for dinner at Pampas Brazillian Grille. There's no daily housing keeping and you have to take out your own trash. Overall, a good stay but probably wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DNC143
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tahiti Village when it was first built and thought it was amazing. I decided to stay again after wanting to try something different after staying at the Hilton Las Vegas on The Strip many times already. I'm sadly disappointed in Tahiti Village and won't stay there again. Where to start? We wanted somewhere that had the "suite" feel - kitchen, living room, bedroom because we had our young daughter with us. We got the standard Moorea room. The bathroom: One sink/vanity cabinet - where are you supposed to put all the traveling toiletries? The shower head let out a stinging strong spray that my daughter couldn't even stand under, the pressure was so strong. I can imagine the plumbing maintenance! Every time the next door occupants flushed toilet or ran their shower/sink - you could hear it loud and clear. The room itself: Carpet was filthy, dishes were only rinsed, lamps burnt out. The TV channels sucked. Not even Disney channel - who doesn't have Disney Channel? Hotel: You pay for everything! If you're in the Moorea room, you don't get a washer/dryer. The laundromat is on the 9th floor of Tower 5. If you are in Tower 2, you're out of luck. Fridge is a mini fridge (its a mini kitchen). Internet access - if you are an Owner you can get the USB internet port for $25 a week, if not its $40 a week. The Business Center in the main lobby wants a $25 hold on your credit card even if you use their computer for 2 minutes. Basically if you are not an owner, you pay 5x more then an owner. Cookie making activities cost $5 per kid for 3 Safeway cookies, duncan hines frosting, and some toppings. Lots of old/handicap people stay here. The place reeked of handicap type smell. Nothing against them, but the disinfectant or cleaning solutions they use smells up everything including the activity room and fitness center. The staff was not friendly. Answer your question, and just move on because they have no time. The parking was horrible. Just to get to our room on the 2nd floor but parked in Tower 5 we went down two long hallways. Stairways not accessible. I am going back to the Hilton. Staff nicer, their deli/Starbucks, activity center, fitness center are better. They close pool and mini mart later (hello, cause this is VEGAS!), the rooms are HUGE with a separate shower/jacuzzi, full size kitchen, Disney Channel, clean clean clean! Ohh and for all your timeshare owners - I don't about buying Tahiti Village. The RCI and other places especially in Hawaii hotels are run down under the Tahiti Village ownership. Pictures are deceiving. I know because I live in Hawaii and visit the neighboring islands frequently. They do not looks as awesome as the pictures. Hilton brand much more professional and facilities are first class. I think if Tahiti Village want to compete with Marriott, Hilton, and Disney....they need to step up.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money if you rent a car”
Reviews.Author: Feb58
Reviews.Content: If you rent a car, then this location is perfect for the money, it was fairly quite, with everything included, but the only thing we thought was included is the wireless internet, but when we arrived we were told it is an extra $10 more a day. So we carried our laptop to use it for online searches but we couldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Strip and far enuff :)”
Reviews.Author: copejenney
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great place to stay off of the strip the Tahiti Village is a great choice. Reserve the full kitchen suite and bring your own food to cook either indoors or on BBQs by the pool. Very large facility so request a first floor room close to an entrance to avoid long hauls to and from your car. Great bathrooms with shower and separate whirlpool tubs. Very family friendly, a bit crowded at times in the pool area. There is a free shuttle to and from the strip. Hotels.com offers great discounts periodically during the year.

Reviews.Title: “October 1st - 8th Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NanaLC54
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Tower 2 overlooking the hot tub and the pool. Beautiful 2 bedroom lockout. Plenty of privacy and close to everything in the resort. The staff was very friendly (kudos to Krystal for making our room choice the best ever. She went above and beyond to see that we were in the best possible location. Thanks Krystal.) Used the shuttle to the strip. Also took the tour of Red Rock Canyon and used the shuttle for the Freemont Street experience. Loved every minute of this vacation. Would come back and stay at Tahiti Village again. Every thing was great. The BBQ area was awesome and clean. Absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical vacation spot in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ESHORVAT
Reviews.Content: We not only own a 2 bdrm, but also a 1 bdrm here and we love it! Very spacious and the kids enjoy the lazy river & pool (even in December). When we can't make it to Maui (SOK) this is our next go to location since it's not very far from home! Great place for family fun and it's close to the airport yet far enough away from the Vegas strip. If you’re in need for some casino/strip action there's a complimentary shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this resort and really loved it. The room was clean and well appointed. The grounds were well maintained and beautiful. It was nice being in Las Vegas and not staying at one of the casino hotels. Felt like we were on a tropical vacation, but when we wanted the casino action, caught the shuttle which was always prompt. The on site resturant was also excellent. This would be my #1 place to stay the next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: CUVAhikers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the sister hotel--plain Tahiti on Tropicana and it was very nice. We slept great and it was larger than the two of us needed but very nice. pool 24/7, stove ,microwave, and refrigerator. 2 tv's and the front desk was pretty helpful to find where we needed to go. The only down was you needed a parking pass for your car and they didn't give us one on our return trip and if we had gotten towed would have been a disaster, but thankfully only a warning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find in Vegas!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: creekertraveller
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort in September. We used a special offer to secure a suite for 3 nights. There was some confusion over the reservation but was resolved by David in the promotions department and we appreciated his effort! We stayed in the Moorea suites section which was easy to reach from the parking area and the lobby area and pool. The suite was a good size with bedroom area, large bathroom and a living room, kitchenette area. The kitchenette does not have a stove but was well equipped with microwave, small fridge, sink and all the china, cutlery needed. We did not plan to cook so we were happy with the arrangement. The staff were very friendly and helpful. This is a time share facility but there was no pressure to take a tour - just an offer and when we said no that was the end of it. We really appreciated the lack of pressure. This is a great get-away from the strip but easy to get there as they have a shuttle bus that ran from early AM to late PM to two locations on the strip. It was soooo nice to hop on and off and not worry about dealing with traffic and parking fees. The facility was very clean, the pool area was large with one area being sand beach which was especially great for children. The hot tub area was separate and open later than the pool area. There is an additional pool which is a lazy river of moving water enjoyed by using tubes to relax on the water. It was a special treat especially in the evening when less bathers were using it.. So would we go back????? Absolutely!!!!! Away from the busy strip you can escape to Tahiti and relax. There are two onsite eateries...Denny's which we did not visit - and Tahiti Joe's which we visited 3 times. Two lunches and one dinner....We were very satisfied and recommend it for lunch and dinner....priced resonably and food quality very good.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: rosiesnv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in September and really hated to leave! We stayed in a Moorea suite and it suited us fine as we only ate breakfast in the room and the small fridge and microwave were perfect for us. These rooms have no stove, dishwasher or washer/dryers. I did do some laundry on the 9th floor of Tower 5 and the facilities were excellent. Several washing machines ($1.50) and dryers ($1.25) and vending machine for detergent and also a coin machine if you need to get change. Laundry room was very clean as were the machines. You can also ask the housekeepers for laundry detergent and they will give it to you. We went to the pool every morning when it opened and it is very clean. Lots of loungers and you can have as many towels as you want. My ONLY complaint about the hotel was at the pool and that was people letting the gates slam! I know, not the fault of the hotel, but it would have been nice to see a sign on the gate reminding people not to let it slam. After 50 or more times it gets really old! End of rant. We never used the BBQ area but every morning there were staff working very hard to clean the grills. The staff at this hotel seemed to always be hard at work. It is very well kept. We actually saw a housekeeper pull the stove away from the wall in one room and clean behind it! The hotel itself is quite large and it took us awhile to get our bearings--we often used the wrong door to get to the pool or parking lot! Even though each tower is fairly large the elevators always came promptly. There is an on-site shop for anything that you need. The local papers sell out quickly but there is a paper box outside tower 2. The shuttle to the strip was fantastic. It takes you to New York, New York or the Mirage. The shuttles run every half hour. It is about a half mile to Town Square where there is a Whole Foods Market. Lots of restaurants there, too. Nice mall. There is a roof top patio on Tower 5 which has a great view of the strip at night. We took our wine up and watch a lightning storm one night. The Las Vegas Premium Outlet Center is right across the street from Tahiti Village. Lots of shops and 2 food fairs. Also MacDonalds and IHOP. The room we had was spacious enough for 2 people. The bedroom was separate from the living area with a well-proportioned bathroom in between. The A/C unit was in the bedroom and blew right onto the bed but it wasn't too loud and we never shut it off. It didn't keep us awake. We have never stayed in the same place twice in Las Vegas but I think we would consider trying this one again! Great stay. Thank you, Tahiti Village!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Relax in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Sshull
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week at the Tahiti Village in Las Vegas. I found nothing wrong with this hotel/vacation club, in fact, it was nicer than I had anticipated! The pools were great, plenty of chase lounges, fresh towels when ever you want them, warm water and a handy pool bar at both the pool and the lazy river! Don't be fooled by people saying they had to rent the tubes... just take your own. The pool staff even offered to blow them up for us. (There was signs stating no outside rafts allowed, but we ask if we could use ours and they said sure!) The room was very comfortable and well appointed with about anything you might need. We even found out that there was an shuttle provided 3 times a week for a grocery run at no cost to us! No need for walking to the nearby store as others complained about in their reviews. Actually, the shuttles are understated! They not only go the strip every half hour, but if you ask the front desk, they have grocery runs, but also trip to places like Freemont Street, Red Rock, and I think maybe even Sam's Town. Be sure to ask because these have limited seating and you must sign up for them before they fill up! The only thing that could use improving is the BBQ area. We found that they were pretty dirty by dinner time, and a few of them were almost impossible to light. We had to wait for someone to finish there cooking to do ours because we could not get the open grill to light. Not a problem, just an inconvenience. There is also an Outlet Mall right next the the Tahiti Village property, along with a nice selection of restaurants and even convenience stores like 7-11. The worst part of staying here was having to leave! I would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly and Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: timmyf16
Reviews.Content: Discovered by accident during web search for family-oriented lodging. Double bonus was the on-line booking discount. Arrived late Thursday evening with a tired family. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and well-maintained. Location was also ideally suited for other family and friends arriving via commercial air, as it's just minutes south of McCarren Int'l Airport. The large pool, with its own beach area, as well as the "Lazy River", were huge hits with kids both young and old. On Sunday, for members of our group with late-departing flights, the hotel accommodated them by providing free storage for their luggage as well as use of the hotel facilities for the entire day. This allowed them to wait for their flight by the pool, rather than at the airport. We've already booked our next stay at the Tahiti Village Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to get away”
Reviews.Author: tchase_11
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village has the most beautiful grounds. A fantastic pool with beach entry and beautiful lazy river! Great for adults and kids. The suite is very nice. Spacious, well stocked and updated kitchen. I am a bit of a clean freak and thought the rooms could have been dusted better but overall it they are in nice shape. Tahiti Village is not in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Vegas the strip but it is easily accessible and they offer shuttle service to the heart of the strip. It is very nice to be able to get away from it all at the end of the day. I think anyone who stays here will enjoy a wonderful, peaceful stay. The service was very good. All of the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy611c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 week in a 1 bedroom condo. We absolutely loved the resort. Took advantage of the shuttle to the grocery store and many times to the strip. Loved not having to rent a car!! The pool area was so relaxing, we just loved it. Will definitely stay here again the next time we visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Treesah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tahiti Village Labor day weekend. The rooms are very nice, everything is clean, operational, the staff was very friendly, the pool area is nice. The shuttle was very convenient since we don't care about driving on the strip. They had an excursion to the Red Rock Canyon which was excellent and a bargain at $5.00! We had a great experience and would return. Nobody tried to sell us a timeshare. The only reason I'm not rating it excellent is because we had the dreaded parking lot view.

Reviews.Title: “Good to Very Good for Non Owner”
Reviews.Author: RxDive
Reviews.Content: The pool is the obvious outstanding feature for this resort. 1.5 miles south on the strip next to the outlet mall and a non gambling hotel. The cheapest room was just average in repair / condition. Marks on the wall and stains on the carpet. We toured the time share and noted a considerable improvement in room condition! Overall - not bad for $80 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal off-Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trud19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tahiti for a week from the 12th sept. for our honeymoon. We wanted a more relaxing hotel rather than a busy, noisy hotel like you get on the strip. We booked this through an English travel agent, not a timeshare. Our one bedroom apartment was ideal, good size rooms etc. location was perfect, amenities close by, but we did have a car for the week, which I would recommend doing, although the shuttle bus was reliable, We did drive to the strip a few times, where you can park in some hotel car parks, We used MGM. On site Denny's was handy and a short walk down the road to Mc.Donald's to use their free wi-fi was ideal, rather than pay extra at the hotel for wi-fi! For grocery shopping, there is a Food 4 Less store further south which I think is where the hotel do an early morning trip to.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home...”
Reviews.Author: lpcruiser
Reviews.Content: with a 'wow' pool area plus a lazy river ride out the back - I did check the place along with possibly all the strip hotels and we weren't disapointed a bit! Shuttle bus for when you want the strip etc but so relaxing around the hotel, massive 1 bed with kitchen appartment...view not bad from balcony facing the strip (better at night as waste land between the hotel & strip). Good looking BBQ area which we didn't use as only 3 days but glad Denny's next door! Excellent value for money......when can we go back! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Bad for owners (like us), good deal for those outsiders”
Reviews.Author: coaznroth
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband are Royal Tahitian owners for this resort since 2008.We do come 2 or 3 times a year here to spend our weeks. We are satisfied how clean it is, 24hr spa, shuttle bus to the strip, etc, etc,.We do come back and stay so many times and we talk to people that stayed here and most of them said that they are "not owners" and they do get the very NICE VIEW room which is the pool or lazy river views and for us that are owners NEVER had a chance to have those room views but facing either the garage or the shuttle buses parking and the staff called it the mountain view area. The mountain actually is too far to see and there's nothing there but bare mountain..duhhh! what a bummer!! I guess it is better to just rent a room and treat it like a hotel than being an owner. I even asked whenever I booked to give us the view we want if that possible coz we are tired of looking at the back parking view..but whenever we checked-in they always say fully booked..so I guess we have to suffer staying in this bad views for our entire ownership...wonder if we do get attention from the management

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, fun pool...we loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: lu_164ever
Reviews.Content: I booked the most basic room, Moorea, for our family of four (husband, 2 kids and myself) because we were only staying one night and I figured I may as well not spend the extra $ on the bigger suite. Once we got to our room I realized that we had been upgraded to the Bora Bora suite, which was a very pleasant surprise. The room was HUGE and beautiful, very clean and comfortable. The kitchen is very nice with top of the line appliances and it was also extremely clean. The kids loved the awesome beach entry to the pool, as well as the lazy river. There were plenty of lounge chairs around for us to enjoy, though we were staying on a Sunday which I imagine is a slow day for them. All in all I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The huge beautiful rooms and amenities that you get for the price can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti Village is a nice place”
Reviews.Author: CraftyFellow
Reviews.Content: Nice place! Clean and well maintained.Half the rooms face the pool and half the parking lot... No pool sides were available, but there was not much noise on the parking lot side. We had a one bedroom. Problems were a lack of close parking. There is a big back lot, but it is a hike. Internet in the business center was $.50 a minute! You can rent a Clear modem for about $70 a week.... While this place has a strip address (Las Vegas Blvd), it is 2 mile south of the strip next to the outlet malls. There is a free shuttle. My only other complaint was $14 for a mojito drink at the pool bar???

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: redneck51
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my husband and myself. Clean, quiet, perfect sized suite with bedroom, bathroom and kitchen/living room. There were utensils for 4, a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. We stayed 6 nights so there was no change of bed linens or towels. I don't change my bed linens or towels everyday at home so this didn't bother me. Its things like this that drive hotel rates up. If it could be considered a problem-parking! There is limited parking by the shady main building/pool area and if you want to park there you have to be really lucky or cruise the lot patiently. There is another parkade area for this property but it's a bit of a walk. All in all a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: vancouverfuntraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tahiti Village from August 13 to 17, 2011 We traveled with my Mother in Law and our son 9 years old. We had a great time at this resort, away from all the hustle bustle of the strip no smoking and gambling. This resort is very suited to families. If you would like to enjoy some day/night life on the strip you can, this resort makes it very convenient as they have a shuttle that is very punctual and the drivers are very nice and curteous. We stayed in the Bora Bora suite, which has two bedrooms, in fact it actually looks like two adjoining appartments, the suites are very spacious and very clean. Loved the pools and our son loved the sand beach. We would definately recommend this resort and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great relaxing contrast to the busy city!”
Reviews.Author: vanash
Reviews.Content: No complaints whatsoever from me! this was my first trip to vegas, and while I was totally expecting the party like a rockstar experience, the hotel was so relaxing and comfortable that I honestly chose floating around the lazy river and drinking margaritas over partying on the strip. located really close to shops, we were able to keep our food costs low, both for groceries and liquor, as well as a pretty decent food court at the outlet mall. we walked down to pick up anything we needed, and when we wanted to go up to the strip we just hopped on the hotel shuttle. (except the one time we had too much champagne and tried to walk. dont attempt this. it is a terrible idea, especially in heels) the hotel advertised that it was on the strip, however it might technically be on the blvd, but is so far down that I would hardly consider it to be part of the strip. front desk staff were a bit unfriendly unfortunately, always took care of any questions or requests we had, but definitely could smile more, and make a better effort to sound like they like their job. pool staff, bartenders were great. beds were comfy, rooms were really clean, and the decor was well done. its more of a tropical resort layout, so it is a long walk from one end of the hotel to the other, but it is really scenic, and I thought it was great. the attached tahiti joe's grill needs improvement, food was good, but service was really slow and drinks were overpriced. shuttle drivers were really friendly and we appreciated their enthusiasm and advice. would definitely stay there again if i was to visit Las Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One of our Best Vacations - Ever!”
Reviews.Author: wisnuke
Reviews.Content: We had not visited Las Vegas in many years and wanted to see and experience all of the changes. We decided to stay at a timeshare resort so that we could alternate between the excitement of the Strip and the relaxation at the place we were staying. The Tahiti Village did this almost to perfection. We stayed in a large, one bedroom unit with a full kitchen. It was outstanding. Lots of space, well layed out and nicely furnished. The view from the balcony was not the best, but we weren't there to sit in the room anyway. As nice as the unit was, it was outdone by the pool area and lazy river. The pool was the largest and most beautiful I have ever seen, with tropical landscaping throughout. There was also a hot tub in a separate area, and one end of the pool was a walk-in sand beach. The lazy river was a nice change of pace from the quiet of the pool area. I must qualify my idyllic description a little bit due to the conditions at the end of our ten-day stay. Some kind of competition was scheduled in Las Vegas during the last three days of our stay. At this point, the number of people at the resort increased by about 50%, and the number of children and teenagers must have doubled. This made the pool and lazy river areas much more crowded and noisy. We would have preferred the calm of the first week of our stay, but even the more hectic period was enjoyable. The resort had an extremely nice grill area that was well maintained by the staff and heavily used by the guests. Free parking was available on site, but most guests were satisfied to use the shuttles that left for the Strip every 30 minutes. There was also a short morning trip in a shuttle to purchase groceries, although that was one of the least relaxing things we did all week. The resort staff was very attentive and friendly, and the common areas were always being cleaned and maintained. The only negative during our visit was the absence of a reliable (and free) Internet service. Hopefully, this will be added in the future. We went to the strip nearly every night, eating at a lot of good restaurants and seeing many great shows. We can understand how circumstances can cause people to not enjoy their stay at any resort, but it seemed to us that most of the guests were having a great time. We recommend that people who are considering this resort pay a lot more attention to the positive experiences that are being described. We would love to be able to repeat this trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will return”
Reviews.Author: CharChar69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tahiti Village, Las Vegas NV from August 20-25/11. Check in was smooth, and the front desk staff were pleasant and helpful We rented a 2 bdrm lock-off unit, which had 2 master bedrooms, and 2 queen size pull out sofas. There was a large kitchen, and a small kitchenette, and a large balcony. The location was excellent, as it was next door to the Premium shopping outlet mall, and many restaurants were within walking distance. There is a gas station that is very close, where we bought beer and liquor daily and a few supplies, such as coffee, sugar and milk. On site there was a 24 hr Deny's and a small pub that also had a restaurant., called Tahiti Joes, this is where we went for happy hour every night for $2.00 drinks. The hotel provides a shuttle service to New York, New York, and the Mirage which runs every half hour. We never had to wait, it was like having free transportation at your service. The pool was terrific, and we used the tubes for the lazy river every day free of charge. We just walked up and took one, and noone ever said anything to us. We were able to take a cooler of beer to the pool, which was much cheaper than buying them at the pool bar. The grounds were very well maintained. It was really nice staying at a place that was spacious and off strip-yet so close We all really felt more like we were on a vacation rather than being in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the strip. We all agreed that we would stay there again. We rented from the tahiti village website, and were able to get accommodations in the Royal Tahitian unit for $1000 Canadian dollars for 5 nights. Highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “mix thoughts”
Reviews.Author: Lesley K
Reviews.Content: Checked into handicap room. Took shower and bathroom flooded. They changed our room. It had ants so we had to leave while they exterminated. Housekeepers and most staff were super nice. Pool and spa lovely. However, lots of left over garbage around by morning. Barbeque did not work. Tried 3 different ones before using stove in room. Internet that was suppose to connect you on our computer did not for 4 out of 8 days, annoying. Very close and convenient to air port and no noise from planes. Good but definetly not a four or five star place!

Reviews.Title: “No other place in Vegas to stay, Best investment I ever made”
Reviews.Author: Doug M
Reviews.Content: Sorry to read all the negative things about Tahitti Village. We have been Owners of the Royal Tahittian for several years and come down with our family and friends every year. We have been to Vegas many times and stayed everywhere from Green Valley, several Station casinos to the Bellagio etc. We Bought into Tahitti Village and Love it. The Staff Remembers us when we come down and even inquire as to why on this trip we don't have the grandkids..How personal is that! if something in not right they send a repairman right away. Last year we came down with two other couples and they loved it so much they invited themselves back this year. Guess we will see you in September. Again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SurfandSailFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Suite for 12 nights with a full kitchen and were very happy with nearly everything in the hotel. Our 11 year old son thought it was great too. Good points were; 1. BBQs and eating area which made eating in more fun. It was a good way of having chats with other families too. 2. The Shuttle to the Strip ran every hour. 3. The pool (open till 10pm daily) and lazy river were great, although only a max of 4 foot deep. 4. Facilities in kitchen. 5. Size of rooms. 6. Steam Shower and jacuzzi bath in room. 7. Balcony. 8. Location (10 mins drive to Casinos on Strip) Negative points were; 1. We had to ring House Keeping to get room cleaned and bedding changed. 2 Sofa bed wasn't very comfortable. 3. Had to wait for 2 hours for room to be ready. 4. Suspect many guests came from LA at weekends. Hotel got very busy and noisy. Seems to attract different kind of guests at weekends. No other Brits at hotel when we stayed, Maybe of interest info: We used this hotel as a base and spent time in Death Valley, the Grand Canyon (staying in Kenab), Bryce Canyon and Zion (stayed in Springdale). We don't really gamble (we both lost 20 dollars each in NewYork NewYork). Our son thought all the rides in the Casinos were great. Circus circus had the best rides along with the Stratosphere.Best deal on the Strip for us was the buffet in the Wynn. Absolutely fantastic!! We also hired a speedboat on Lake Mead, cooked an egg in Death Valley (126 degrees) and visited Calico (waste of time as a tourist trap). In summary Tahiti Village is a very good hotel and good value for money in August,

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Coopsiscool_10
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in the Royal Tahitian 2 bedroom suite which was huge. We would have managed with just the larger room on it's own as the sofa converted into a bed and you could hire an additional roll-away bed. All home comforts available and a very well equipped kitchen. Pool area and lazy river were a great place to relax. The shuttle bus was always on time and this service was a great saving on taxi fares. Check-in was friendly and efficient as were both Denny's and Tahiti Joe's restaurants. My hubby had been to Vegas before and stayed at the Bellagio so we knew the Tahiti Village was up against high expectations. For us the place ticked all the boxes and we would definately recommend to other travellers. Check out the Outback Steakhouse opposite New York for a top quality, reasonably priced steak. Also The Cheesecake Factory in Ceasors for excellent value family meals. Freemont Street a must see aswell. Eat at The Grotto Italian at the Golden Nugget. Mac King Comedy Show at Harrahs is a great show for all the family. Our 16 & 14 years old's thought is was "class".

Reviews.Title: “great great great great resort”
Reviews.Author: gigi097
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village is a great great resort to spend one week in Vegas. They have a Lazy River as well as a main pool but we spent the entire week in the Lazy River. The employees are very accommodating and personable and the Concierge desk especially Mickey are very, very nice. We have been there for the past three years now and never get tired of going there. Highly recommend Tahiti Village to anyone who is looking for a great, relaxing and accommodating resort. Hate leaving everytime we go.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to do it again”
Reviews.Author: J0nes_22
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom suite worked perfectly for us 4 couples we all had our private area with closing doors. we each shared 2 bathrooms and had our own tv. The pool area was great. I have no complaints, welllll one small one, check out is toooo early. Other than that I can't wait to do it again. Maybe next time we will all take our kids because it seems kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool area...”
Reviews.Author: shakespearenut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in August 2011. We had one of the smaller rooms, but it was enough for the two of us. The resort is fairly new, clean, and comfortable; it is also a good value for your dollar. We stayed here in the small one bedroom unit for $350.00 for the entire week. The best part about the resort, though, is the pool. If all you are interested in is sun-bathing, you can bring your lounge chair right into the shallow areas of the pool. This makes things much cooler, particularly if you are there during the summer. This is also a very large pool, lots of room for fun in the sun, and there is also a lazy river. On the other hand, since the resort caters to a wide variety of guests, the pool area is not necessarily family friendly. If you will be traveling with young children, you should note that you will likely encounter a good number of young adults who have imbibed too much and whose language is definitely no suitable for young listeners -- particuarly at the pool area. Also, I definitely suggest you spring for the larger one-bedroom over the smaller of the two, especially if you are planning on cooking your own meals. The smaller room does not even have a bowl in which to warm something in the microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms... Lousy service!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal B
Reviews.Content: First off, Upon arrival the rooms we had called and confirmed 3x weren't the ones we were given. Check in time is 4:00pm we arrived a little early and thought maybe they might have a room available. They told us it would be about and hour and they would call. Almost 2 hours later we went back to ask if they were good about calling the guests when the rooms ready, of course they insured us they are and it wouldn't be to much longer. 45 mins past check in time we received a call. Once getting back to the hotel to check in it took 40 mins in line before we got called up to the Front Desk. The Champagne that was a paid for gift by a family member turned out to be Chocolate cover Strawberries.Also the customer service was horrible. They offer Valet and Bell hop service but there no where to be found. The pool closed at 4pm the next day.They state they have gaming at Tahiti Joe's which turned out to be 2 slot machines. You can tell this hotel makes there money off the timeshares and they don't care about the guests or there needs. Although would have to say besides the horrible time at this resort the room decor was outstanding and clean. :)) I

Reviews.Title: “We stayed one night in August, not long enough to enjoy this excellent resort.”
Reviews.Author: AileenMolly
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 3) stayed one night in August, which was not long enough to enjoy this lovely resort. We had a one bedroom Bora Bora room. Huge and so well set out. The kitchen had all essentials needed. The bathroom was also very big, full bath, walk in shower, double wash basins. We didnt have time to use the lazy river or the pool but both looked amazing. Car parking (very busy) and the lack of internet was inconvenient but didnt spoil our overall stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of staying in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “For Families in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jjc666
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas was the last stop on our trip. Started in San Francisco, stopped on coast, visted LA and drove to Vegas. I booked a week at Tahiti through an exchange with II. Our stay ran from Tues to Tues, however, we were only staying 3nights (Wed to Sat). Check in was quick, we were given a two bedroom unit on the 8th floor of building 5. This is in the back of the complex. Unit was clean, big, and quiet. Very easy to get an elevator, and parking close by. Bathrooms were big and clean. Full Kitchen too. Fitness center was small, some equipment was not in service. Kid's center was small and on the fourth floor. Hotel activities were not really advertized, saw a sign in the elevator. Lazy river was nice, costs 5.00 for a tube per day. The main pool was very large and nice. The grounds were very well kept. I liked the little convenience store on site, as well as the Denny's and Tahiti Joe's restaurant. I like to eat out on vacation, but many people here were using the BBQ facilities, it was always crowded. The shuttle service to the strip was nice. It drops you off at NY, NY, and there is also a stop at the Mirage. If there was a big crowd, an additional bus would be used. As a place to bring a family in Vegas, I would say "yes" to this timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Resort was great and We will go again”
Reviews.Author: TikiTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 5 nights this month and had a great experience. First of all this resort is great for families. We stayed in a one bedroom unit with patial kitchenette. It was great for making our son breakfast in the morning and quick lunches. We were in building 12 with a small view of the pool from the bedroom unit. The resort and unit was very clean. The benefits of this resort are the spacious rooms, lazy river, huge pool and bbq pits for grilling. The pool is open until 10pm with lifeguards which was great for relaxing after our day trips. We ate the restaurant. Food was good and drinks were great. Order their pizza as they will deliver to your room or to the pool in the day. Another plus was that you can take your coolers into the pool. The hotel shuttles were very convenient. They ran until 1:15am on the weekend and 12:15pm on the weekdays. They come every thirty minutes. Beautiful property, great staff and easy to access the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Always a perfect place to stay! We love it here!”
Reviews.Author: shmeebee
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village is a perfect alternative to staying in the craziness of the Las Vegas Strip. We have stayed here 3 times and will continue to book here when traveling to Vegas. The rooms are amazingly spacious and clean, with a separate bedroom, living room, kitchen, and bathroom with jacuzzi tub & steam shower! The lazy river and pool are very clean and relaxing! They provide a shuttle service every half hour to 2 different locations on the strip, so you never have to take a cab! Also, we took advantage of the shuttle that goes to the grocery store on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays to stock up on essentials for our room. There is a barbecue area that has 5 or 6 huge grills for your use and it is be a fun place to be every evening. We chose to grill on our last night and were very happy we did. There are 2 fitness centers on the complex, which we used, and were pleased with the cleanliness of each one. I highly recommend staying here, as you get to be at a resort by day, and party in the strip by night! It's the best of both worlds!

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: soliddzign
Reviews.Content: We needed a getaway with a nice pool and not on the strip, as I wasn't all that excited about having fliers flicked at my kids with pictures of human topics I was not yet ready to cover with my two young boys. Plus, we needed space to spread out a bit so that mom and dad could actually enjoy some sort of rest during the couple day vacation. The bummer was that it is August and anything in Nevada is going to resemble a base camp placed directly on the surface of the sun. It was HOT. 105+ every day. So, I was super excited when I came across the Tahiti Village. Read lots of reviews, nothing terrible except if you were a time share owner. Plus, the rooms were huge and it had a separate room for the wife and I. So the plus side was that we had a pretty nice location on the bottom of the strip but a relatively quiet area compared to the rest of the strip. We had a fairly new room with a small kitchenette and a hotel with 2 pools. The down side is that this place will certainly not kill you with customer service. Not that I'm the sort that likes getting hounded but a little something every once in a while would have been nice. I didn't even get a,"How was you stay?" at the end. The pool was fun. You're close to a ton of things. And the kids had a blast, so I guess mission accomplished. Just don't go expecting super high-end amenities or service.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: nmbsquared
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, we only spent one night here on our way to catch our return plane from Vegas. This place was pretty awful. Customer service was non-existent. We could not get a bellman to help with our bags or locate a cart to push our own luggage in. We had questions about computer access and no one ever came to assist us -- with a cost of $10 and no wireless, that was probably for the best. There was a charge for absolutely everything including $1/page for printing. We did not try the food but heard from others who went to the restaurant that it was terrible and we were wise to order pizza from elsewhere. The only thing good about the place was the pool and floating river (although it appeared that they wanted you to pay $5 to rent a raft for the river). I would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PLACE TO STAY FOR FAMILY OR NO FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: rodney n
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June of 2010, I took my wife , my Son and daughter which both are grown, I also took three of my grandchildren and my Mom and of course my wife. I have to say that the place was so nice and so awesome that me and my wife bought a timeshare there and then sold the one we owned in Branson. I do understand that some things can happen when you're away from home but I also know that some people are VERY HARD to please, and those people are the ones that give this place anything but a GREAT review, You have to be nuts to think this place is not awesome!!! we have been to a lot of timeshares since we became owners in Branson and believe me this is one that is right at the top of the list. Plus the daily events are awesome to. The pool is HUGE and the lazy river is so much fun, they also have a HUGE BBQ area so you can grill out. They offer free shuttle to the grocery store two times a week and free shuttle to the strip in two places, This resort is a class act believe me. I have stayed in many and even in several that were suppose to be hoottsy tootsy places and this beats them all. I sugest staying here anytime and we are heading there again tomorrow. Can't wait. we are owners here now and this will be the first time we have stayed as owners, I will give feedback on this trip when we return. I think you should give this place a try and especially if you have kids they would love it but If you do have a problem then go to the Manager and let know and I know they will help you get it taken care of. Will check back when we get back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it so much we bought a share!”
Reviews.Author: JN403
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun staying here. The pool was awesome and the foliage around it made me forget we were in Vegas because it feels like somewhere much more tropical. The shuttle service up the strip is great and we found the schedule worked well for us. We own a timeshare here, but would totally stay here as a hotel if we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Once Again”
Reviews.Author: ciceroCalgary
Reviews.Content: Our first two week stay at TV. We were a little concerned that two weeks was too long as all our other stays here were a one week duration. Well, we worried for nothing, we travelled as 6, the children being 17, 8, 6, and 4. My wife drove down from Alberta with the kids as I was working and flew down to join them later. I have to say, the rooms are as beautiful as ever, the property is being maintained excellently. Of course there are signs of wear and tear here and there but that is to be expected as things break they get fixed, no big deal. We were in building two on he fifth floor and had requested a pool view, the view we got was amazing, best yet. Not only could we see the pool we could see part of the strip, awesome. My two oldest children made new vacation friends, an all of them were happy running back and forth between the lazy river and the pool alll day. Exhausting for us but worth every bit of spent energy to see the joy in their faces. On my last review I stated that we were going to use more of the amenities this time but while I was there I realized the great thing about TV, it's in Vegas, and Vegas is the Amenity. If you get bored in Vegas you are trying too hard, we are not gamblers and couldn't anyway with little kids but we were able to fill up two weeks without a problem. The staff as usual were all pleasant, and tried their best to be helpfull. We had maintenance up three times for a plugged toilet, they always arrived within 15 minutes. A beer at the pool bar was $5.00 for a big can of Red Stripe. Not outlandish as far as I'm concerned, and we quite often brought our own from our room without hassle. One of the BBQ's wasn't working but when informed the hotel said they'd fix it immediately. There were days we did not leave the resort and never felt lacking. I had to head back to work but my wife and kids attended the Saturday lua, she said the kids enjoyed it, the entertainment was ok but they should have moved some of the pool loungers out of the way because the view from her table was not great. When asked if she'd do it again she said yes, so that's a good thing, and the food was simple but well cooked with enough variety as to not be boring. The shuttles were once again great and now all you need is to flash your room key so it's easier than ever. We are now happier than ever that we bought here. Next year two weeks in our timeshare in Mexico then back here for two in 2013. It's Vegas Baby.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: dkmorales
Reviews.Content: Took the family for a short trip before school started. We had two 14 year olds and two 24 year olds. Booked the two bedroom suite and we all loved it! Tons of room with a full kitchen and everything you need. Loved the lazy river and the pool was great, it stayed open until 10pm and you are able to take your own ice chests down with your own beverages and alcohol and food. Although the cocktails they serve are very strong and delish. (Watermelon Mojito = Yummy!) Everyone wants to stay here from now on vs. any hotel on the strip. Didn't even feel like we were in Vegas until @ night when we took the shuttle for dinners and a show which was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: david760
Reviews.Content: My pool team made it to the nationals in the APA and I booked three rooms through Interval International. I booked two at Tahiti Village and one at Tahiti for members of my team all checking in a day apart. When I took my teamate over to Tahiti to check in they heard us mention that the rest of the team was at Tahiti Village and immediately offered to move my teamate there too, for no extra charge. The service was outstanding and friendly. At Tahiti Village, the resort was absolutely beautiful, the rooms were very up to date and comfortable. They went out of their way to put all of us right next to each other in the resort. The pool areas (two of them) were very much fun. One of the pools is a lazy river and it was very relaxing to just lay on a tube and float round the pool. Everyone on my team, including myself, really enjoyed the resort. We would definitely go back if we make the tournament again. If you like to shop, the outlet stores are right across the street. And the location was just fine although not on the strip, it is just right down the road from it on the same street. You will not be unhappy if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Time share exchange...staff very unbending”
Reviews.Author: Rihsurf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort over the 4th of July. The place was very busy, staff requests were unbending, sometimes rude. Probably because they were overworked and understaffed. Lifeguards were really busy at the main pool, lots of kids splashing about. Watched one lifeguard pull out a struggling kid. Very quick response by the LG. Front desk staff at check in was less than helpful...we thought we were in a grocery store check out line.

Reviews.Title: “Large Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: cowboys
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 2 nights and just loved the size of our 2 bedroom condo. This was a welcome relief after spending the previous 9 nights in regular sized hotel rooms. Our kids loved the extra beds as well as the extra bathroom. This hotel has a nice pool area as well as a separate river ride which is a short walk away. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed being away from the strip and being able to park very close to our room. i would highly recommend this hotel if you do not want to stay on the strip. Also if you get a chance go see Terry Fator at the Mirage (great entertainment and very funny).

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: chris6333
Reviews.Content: Back in the day when my wife and I had no children, we loved staying in the action packed hotels such as Hard R**k and the V***tian. Now that we are older with four children we began looking for a more family friendly place that is not as run down and dirty as the place with the huge clown in the parking lot. Tahiti Village is the perfect place. They offer restaurants on site and a ample lobby with friendly service. The beach pool and the lazy river were heated and the whole family can enjoy it. The lifeguards even played pool games with the kids. The best part of all, you do not need to drag your luggage and your children through a smoke filled lobby just to check in or to get to a restaurant. It is just 1.5 miles south of the strip which makes it feel safer since it is away from the "action." The only down side is the small parking spots which were free. The rates were very reasonable and the room has a full kitchen, smaller rooms have a minimum of a sink, fridge and microwave with all of the eating supplies you need. We were here in April 2011 and will return soon. UPDATE: We returned in July 2011. Where to go Take your kids to the family friendly parts of the strip such as M&M, Mandalay Shark Reef, and the Mirage Zoo ONLY during the day and preferably on a weekday. Best to drive your own car.

Reviews.Title: “Don't buy here”
Reviews.Author: chafraho
Reviews.Content: We bought timeshares in 09, because our first stay and impression was very favorable. As a family vacation spot, this is a very friendly, luxurious and well maintained property. After our first visit as shareholders, we were unable to book another reservation. Paid fees, and all, but their service would not or could not keep their records straight. We were repeatedly told we had not kept up our obligations. We were unable to have any human being talk to us with specific information, other than 'our records indicate'.... Shortly thereafter, the company went into bankruptcy, and we have had nothing but chaos since. We cannot locate anyone responsible enough to respond to us. They stopped accepting our payments for almost one year, then attempted to take us to court for default. There was a reported settlement approx one year ago, yet we have had no information forwarded to us about this settlement. I guess if you get a good deal for a weekend stay, it's probably worth your while to visit. But basically say no to everything, get out of there as fast as you can, and enjoy your vacation and comps. These are a bunch of hucksters and shysters, and if you do business with them, shame on you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a family”
Reviews.Author: janet11120
Reviews.Content: This place is alitte far from the main strip, but if you are taking your kids to Las Vegas cant go wrong with this place. The pool and the lazy river is great for family fun. My sister has a time share here and I stayed with her. Really enjoyed staying here, but a little to far for me from the Gambling. If your looking for a place to stay for your whole family and kids cant go wrong here, your kids will love the it here. They do offer a shuttle to the strip, but sometimes it is late, but over all great place to stay for just relazing and soaking up the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: chem311
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you are NOT looking for the "can't remember Vegas" kind of trip. It is very family friendly. Four of us stayed in the largest option room they have (which is just both smaller rooms connected by a door) and it was great, there is a food 4 less close by that we stocked up on some food for the weekend which was perfect. There is a shuttle that is very easy, although it doesn't run as late as you may want to stay out. To get a taxi back from the strip you will pay about $20.00. The pools at the hotel are very nice. There are a lot of kids, and the pool is kinda luke warm hmmmmm. Overall its a great place, your not on the strip, its mostly familys. Also the jacuzzi is 24 hours but unfortunately the pool is not.

Reviews.Title: “Room for Improvement.......”
Reviews.Author: pghcop6
Reviews.Content: We are time Share owners at this resort. We bought back in 2006 before the resort was even built and this was our first visit. My wife and I are firm believers that we go on vacation and travel for the sites, not to stay in a room. However, as owners, we believe we have an obligation to be objective. First the good. Overall, the resort was nice. Great location, off the strip but close enough to get a taste. Great shopping and restaurants within 5 minutes and a large outlet mall within walking distance. The shuttle service was great also and made travelling to the strip very convienent. At one point, we did rent a car and there was never an issue parking at the resort. The airport was very close and we walked to the rental car place. Very Convienent!! The room itself was clean, spacious and comfortable. The pool area was nice and the lazy river even better. Now the not so good. We rely heavily on sites such as Trip Advisor for reviews of resorts we want to visit and after reading hundreds of them, know that everyone has different views, tastes and experiences. When we read reviews, we look for things that are consistently there. With that said, the issues we had at Tahiti Village may not have happened had we been there a week earlier or later. With that said, here goes. We got in to the resort later in the evening. As we walked through the courtyard to the lobby, we came upon the smell of fresh marijuana. We observed two individuals walking a short distance in front of us who were the obvious source. NOT the resorts fault, but set a bad tone and first impression as a family friendly destination. Warning, there is no maid service if you stay less than seven nights unless you are willing to pay for it ($35.00 a day for a one bed room I think) We stayed seven nights and had room service once, half way through. If you want or need anything such as coffee packs, towels or toilet paper, you have to call. Internet service. If you are an owner, you get internet in certain sections of the resort, but not in the room. It was very inconvienent when it worked, which it rarely did. You can however, purchase a router and have the internet anywhere in the city. This was great and worked perfectly, but cost $40.00 for the week. NOTE if you are an owner, tell them and you get it for $25. Again, overall, despite the issues, I would recommend this resort. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Time share was terrible”
Reviews.Author: Ninn4
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying at Tahiti village a couple years ago so we thought we'd look into buying a unit. We went for the presentation where the "salesman" was verbally abusive, threatening, derogatory, mean and insulting. Never ever have I been treated as a potential buyer like that. It was surreal. I said to the boss "what the heck is going on here, this is what he's saying to us" and he spoke to him. When the "salesman" came back he said why'd you tell my boss, I've been nice to you and then continued with his insults, bullying and ridiculous behavior. I called him on his behavior and disposition and he acted like he didn't know what I was talking about. My Husband was fuming but kept it inside so as to not make a scene. Eventually we left, on the way out the guy was bargaining with us, just keep it between us, please don't say anything else to my boss etc. It was totally nuts! Not only will I not buy Tahiti Village I won't be staying there ever again based on this crazy event. The sales tactic was just down right pathetic and ridiculous. It was crazy, crazy!!! I am sure there are some lovely sales people with common sense but this wasn't one of the, Tahiti you've lost our business I won't be back no matter how much I like the property. The property was really nice though, new and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: LauraMvegas
Reviews.Content: I wanted to make my daughter's 10th birthday a memorable one--and Tahiti Village was the perfect choice. We stayed in the Bora Bora room, which was large enough for me to be confined (MY free time) to the master suite, while the girls did their own thing . We were on the 5th floor overlooking the lazy river, and had a great view of the city at night. The kitchen was fully stocked with supplies, which was great as I was able to make the kids a healthy dinner. The master bath had a steam shower and a large jacuzzi tub that I think all of the girls fit in wearing their swimsuits. The best part, of course was the amazing pool with beach entry, and the lazy river. We were fortunate enough to have an early check in, and as soon as we placed our luggage in the room, we headed for the pool. The girls stayed in the lazy river until 10pm when it closed, and the lifeguards and pool staff were all very friendly and professional. My daughter said this was the best birthday retreat ever, and we plan to return next year to celebrate. We will definitely stay for more than one day next time. Even though we are locals, it is a nice getaway, and I don't have to worry about the kids. It is very family friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and value”
Reviews.Author: Traveller32Sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, which was very well appointed. Terrific in-room service (for instance, requesting some kitchen items from housekeeping which arrived within 5 minutes). Good swimming pool for children. No noise from the airport whatsoever. Only downside - which is not unusual for Las Vegas - is that our room was next to a group of quite loud partiers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Neek913
Reviews.Content: We are owners of Tahiti Village timeshares. This is my second trip to this resort and it never fails to satisfy us. Our check in was quick, and the room was great. Everything was clean and neat. The pool area was great and the lazy river was a hit with the kids. A great investment for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families and kids”
Reviews.Author: WandaJ77
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas with our very young children 6 weeks and 16 months. The resort is great for families because there are a lot of other families at the resort. You don't have to worry about the crazy Vegas partygoers as much. The pool has a sand entrance which is great for the little kids. The rooms have full kitchens or kitchenettes so its great for heating up food and bottles. There are plenty of restaurants next to the resort so there is always something different to eat. It was a great vacation to take the kids on and not too far from home.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR KIDS”
Reviews.Author: sharonm03
Reviews.Content: This was a great trip for multi-family groups... the rooms are beyond what I expected, very nice, very clean, lots of room.
