The full kitchen came with all that you needed to make any meal... the Denny's and Tahiti Joe's was super close and enjoyed going too... The pool was fun, poolside service slow, but worth the wait, was able to bring your own cooler to the poolside for food and drink... they have a store that sells great sandwiches and lots of other items at a great price! Shuttle was a great savings... you are about 2.5 miles from Mandalay Bay and they drop you off at New York/New York and Miriage... so that helps with taxi costs.... and they are nice shuttles too! Ok.. if you bring alot of stuff, it is a little hard to get it to your room at check in and check out (not enough Bell staff to help everyone) the parking lot is free and covered, but it is a hike it you have lots of stuff to carry... many trips in the heat wasnt too fun.... Check in was the downside, all the other people in our party got a room after I checked in, you can check your bags and wait by the pool, but still no reason for such along wait, when all the others got right in... not too friendly either.. All in all I will come back and everyone in my party is planning to come back next year and stay longer too...!!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it here”
Reviews.Author: bolin3876
Reviews.Content: hi were from Brighton in England and we stayed here at the start of June 2011 and we loved it here,i have just recovered from a stroke and was not looking forward to the long flight from England,im glad we came as we love vegas. First time we have stayed here and cant wait to get back,as we love the states,so much. Unfortuneatly i have just lost my job,so dont know when.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for family fun”
Reviews.Author: my3boyz88
Reviews.Content: We took a 8th grade class trip here, great place to stay! The kids had a blast, we were able to save money by cooking in the room, and bbqing in the bbq area. Complaints, check in took WAY too long! It was almost 5pm before our rooms were ready. Then the next am we had to recheck in for the same rooms. When I made the reservations I asked if there was a security deposit I was told "no" at check in they asked for a $100 deposit per room per night, we had 3 rooms for 2 nights. When you fund raise to go on a class trip you dont keep an extra $600 for something you are told you dont have to pay. They did only charge us a $300 deposit =} all in all it is a very fun, and relaxing place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice !”
Reviews.Author: Miminifee
Reviews.Content: Excellent condo hotel just outside the strip. A shuttle brings you the the New York New York hotel or to the shopping centre on the other end of the strip. Very nice room, new. Very clean big room and big bathroom. Very nice pool with a sand beach in it for smaller children. There is also a lazy river at an extra cost. Big jacuzzi too. If you like BBQ, there are a few available to you. Shopping centre (outlets) just across the street and a grocery store 5 minutes by car. Car rental facilities a block behind the hotel. There is also a shuttle to the airport. Would go back anytime. There is one 42 flat TV screen in the room and a 32 flat TV screen in the kitchen. Parking is for free. At your arrival you get coupons for Dennis and a kit with Tylenol, tooth paste, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids!”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachFamilia
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Tahiti Village with my family and it is perfect for kids. This trip we stayed in the smaller Moorea room and last month we stayed in the large 2 bd 2 bath with my uncle and his 2 small kids. Both times we had more than enough space for the kids to run around and play. The kids love the sand beach pool and the lazy river. My kids are 2 and 4 and the Tahiti Village is by far the most family friendly resort in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures Don't Do it Justice”
Reviews.Author: andAwayIGo
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful! Initially we were just looking to save money and to stay someplace different than a strip hotel this time. Were were ever pleased. The pictures don't do it justice. It is so much better than the photos. The rooms were clean, spacious, well-decorated and modern -right down to the appliances and electronics. The property was well-maintained and quiet the staff was very friendly. It was nice to come back after the hustle and bustle of the strip and just relax away from all the bright lights. I definitely recommend this to anybody -especially large groups traveling together.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AgentBW
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what all the negative reviews are about. My three sisters and I stayed here from June 13-19 and we LOVED it!!!! I would highly recommend it for anyone who wants a quieter place that is still close to the strip but not too busy and crowded. We stayed in a one bedroom (sleeps 4 with the sofa bed) room with a kitchenette. The staff were friendly and helpful if we ever needed anything. This hotel is on the strip but further down, there is a free shuttle that leaves EVERY 30 MINUTES to take you to the strip that only takes about 5 minutes to get there. It stops at New York New York and The Mirage so you can get to all the action very easily. I am not sure why the "Pharaonik" user said it only leaves every hour because that is certainly not true. There are two shuttles that leave from each location (Starts at Tahiti Village, drives to NY NY then to The Mirage, then back to Tahiti) every 30 minutes and the pick-up/drop-off locations are at the same spot so it is very easy to find. We never had trouble with the shuttle being too full. The shuttle also runs all day until about 12am, this could be annoying for people who like to stay out late. Also, they have another shuttle that runs on Saturday and Sunday that takes you to a shopping center about a 15 minute walk away. This shopping center includes a Whole Foods Market so if you are planning on cooking you can pick up groceries easily. The drivers were friendly and even gave us recommendations of places to get discounts and transportation tips. I also liked that the hotel is across the street from one of the Shopping Outlets. There is also a McDonalds, IHOP, Outback Steakhouse, Subway, 7 Eleven and a bunch of other restaurants and food places that are an easy walking distance. The hotel also has several outdoor grills that made it great for cooking, but they can get pretty crowded so plan ahead. The hotel has a pool, hot tub and a lazy river. The tubes for the lazy river cost $5 per person but the first day you can use it for free, and the second day we used it it was so crowded they let us use it for free again! I got the feeling they weren't that strict about charging people for it as there were tubes all over the lazy river pool so you could just get in and grab one. Also the lifeguards were mostly teenagers and weren't really paying attention to who was using the tubes. The only annoying thing about the pool was that every Saturday they have a luau in the big pool area, so they closed the pool at 4pm on Saturday and you could only get in after 6pm if you were going to the luau, which you had to pay for. The hotel also has wireless internet (not free). If you want to use it in your room you have to pay $10 a day. However, if you have a laptop you can use it in the lounges for only $10 a week. We opted to pay $10 for the whole trip which worked for us. But there were a lot of people coming up to us and simply asking for the password, which made if you can find someone willing to give you the password you can use it without paying? Plus there are so many things to do in Vegas who wants to spend hours on your computer anyway? Our room also had 2 HDTVs and one included a DVD player. Since we stayed for a week we got room service which was nice. We did encounter one problem when we called about 8am to request more towels, and did not receive them until 14 hours and 5 phone-calls later. Overall however, we loved it and will definitely be staying at this hotel in the future! Here's a quick pros and cons list: Pros: Clean, Friendly staff, big pool, hot tub and lazy river, outdoor grills, free shuttle to and from the strip, wireless internet, close to shopping center, outlets, grocery store and restaurants, not too crowded and very family friendly Cons: Further from the main strip, housekeeping can be slow, pool closes early on Saturdays, wireless in your room is $10/day, internet lounge in Tower 5 didn't open until 10am (frustrating for early risers like me). Note: If you are planning to buy groceries but don't have a car and won't make it in time for the Whole Foods shuttle, there is a company where you can order what you want online and they deliver it to your hotel room. However, their minimum order amount is $85, so its not really worth it unless you are staying for a while. Look on the Tahiti Village website to find the name of the grocery company.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Mhopstetter
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many of the luxury hotels on The Strip but decided to take a Getaway through Interval International. What a find! Tahiti Village was even better than the pictures and we cannot say enough about the staff. The free shuttle takes you to two locations on the strip and picks you up hourly. There are even shuttles to a shopping area. The Concierge was always helpful and made our plans actually happen- even giving us great tips that only an insider would know. The pool was great for the entire family and the bar-b-q area has grills to use to make your own meals. It is luxury away from the craziness of the Strip. Make sure you go to Tahiti Joe's- great pizza and awesome Happy Hour specials. We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing!!”
Reviews.Author: MPACE42
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say that this was one of our best trips to Las Vegas! There was 8 of us girls and even though it wasn't on the strip it was great because of the shuttle taking us there and back if we wanted. The staff were very helpful and accommodating us in every way from extra towels, hangers, shows, best places to go and clean up! The resort was clean and the pools were great! This is more of a family resort but still we had a wonderful time! Would love to see the pool open later though! Had a great massage too in tower 5! The little grocery store there was great too the ladies were so nice and helpful We are going back July 2 - 9th that's how much we loved it! Our own little paradise!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pharaonik
Reviews.Content: Just the worst hotel ever!!!!! We booked for 1 week but we spent only 2 nights, we prefered to pay more and go in an other hotel more expensive but where they treat you as a custumer!!!! we payed 370€ for one week at Tahiti Village, when we booked after at the Hilton hotel, on the strip we payed only 352€ for 5 days!!!! The staff is very impolite at the reception and at the concierge!!!! The strip is at 6 miles away from the hotel!!! They talk to you as you are a dog!!!! They do not reflect the image of Tahiti's people who are helpful and smyling!!! You think that you are in a factory!! EVEN The bus driver (only one for all the custumer who wanted to go on the strip, not down town) is very irrespectfull, the bus leaves every HOUR with only 20 peoples so just imagine when 70 peoples are waiting!!!!!!!!!!! Moreover, for coming back you don't know where to wait for the bus to go back home, and the system is the same for the return at the difference that the shuttle stop at 01 am and if you can't get in cause there's no place, you just have to get a TAXI for 20$ for 6 miles !!!! So just pay a little bit more and go away!! Just note that the luxurious hotel on the strip may not be expensive because they have casino.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs updated”
Reviews.Author: AmyTravels720
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 day trip to Vegas. We stayed at Tahiti Village because we wanted a nice pool and a larger suite. I really liked the Lazy River but was a bit dismayed that it closed early one day due to a "bio-hazard" (not sure what that was). They do have a lot of extra fees for the inner tubes, wifi, etc. I'd rather just pay a resort fee and be done with it. The room was nice enough but is starting to show wear and tear. They need new linens and someone to paint the wood that has been marked up. The shuttle was convenient but they need to run into the wee-hours of the morning rather than stopping at midnight. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family fun”
Reviews.Author: sunrich
Reviews.Content: Traveled with 11 boy & 16 girl Wife & kids loved this place ...great pools lots of shade no problem getting a nice location anytime of the day, pool opened at 8am & closed 10pm.Great BBQ area by the rooms, Bora Bora room was perfect for 4 of us king in master,queen sleeper in living room,full kitchen,patio with table/chairs,washer & dryer "did bring an Aro bed for that extra bed". saved hundreds of dollars buying food & drinks at Food for Less down the road,you can take beverages & food to the pool area. keep in mind this a condo and most people spend a week here,if your looking to get pampered by the staff this is not the place for you...no daily housekeeping service,but who cares you have everything you need in your room. just ask the housekeepers for extra towels,soap,T paper etc. we only used the shuttle once it was slow & full most of the time and was much eaiser to drive the short 2-3 miles,rental cars are really cheap now $15-$20 per day Budget through Costco...only bummer was the pool could of been cleaner fair amount of roaches floating in the morning pools guys just walked around and really did nothing except spend an hour cleaning a fountain that was out of service at the main pool (6/15) that was the reason for the 4 star not 5, othe than that place was great and a real value for those looking to save & not have your kids exposed directly to the strip....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: prince81
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here and thought the accommodations were excellent all around. The Tahitian theme of the common areas and rooms makes it feel like you're in paradise. The front desk staff was very nice and worked quickly to get our room ready even though we showed up well before the normal check-in time. Our 1 bedroom suite (tower 5) was very spacious, clean, and adorned with many high-end fixtures. Both the swimming pool and lazy river areas were relaxing and not too crowded. There is no daily maid service however they were always prompt with our requests for fresh towels, etc. One thing to note for future guests is that all the rooms have balconies with the exception of the 1 bedrooms with kitchenettes. Overall, I was very impressed and am definitely staying here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: socalfam4
Reviews.Content: I spent quite a lot of time reading reviews of this resort, and although some seemed a little bothersome, we were completely amazed with our entire stay. Upon check-in we were given the "timeshare talk" but all we had to say was that we were not interested and that was it. We stayed in the one bedroom kichenette and needless to say it was perfect. The room was incredibly clean and stocked with whatever we would have needed. The kichenette had a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster and all the dishes and utensils you needed. Our bed was comfy and we had an overabundance of pillows. Some reviews did mention the airport noise but we didn't hear it once in the room. The pool on the other hand was noisy at times but not to the point I would even rate it as a negative feature of this resort. The pool was awesome as others have said. We did not use the regular pool at all but it looked like tons of fun for families or people of any age. We went to the lazy river pool twice during our stay and it was so relaxing. They have intertubes for rent for $5/day which most people used. The river really keeps you going at a good pace and has waterfalls and streams of water spraying out all around it. Plenty of lifeguards were on duty for those concerned about safety of their children. Tahiti Village also has a great outdoor bbq area complete with sinks for washing up that seemed to be very popular. We never ate at Dennys which is on site (too scared from reading past reviews). We did go to Tahiti Joes for some drinks (they give you a coupon book at check in with some good deals). Drinks were pretty good and the bartender was great. Very personable and friendly (wish I could remember his name). The resort offers a shuttle to New York New York or Mirage and leaves promptly every 30 minutes. I would have to say some drivers could have been a little nicer but most were tolerable. All in all, we were really sad to leave. Tahiti Village offers a great relaxing experience while still close enough to the strip to go let loose and have some fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice timeshare property, a bit out of the hustle of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LesliSLC_Utah
Reviews.Content: This timeshare property is at the very end of the strip past the airport, but not within walking distance of the happenings on the strip. They have a free shuttle which leaves on the hour that has 2 drop off points on the strip. (It would be nice if there were a 3rd drop off a little further up the strip.) On site there's a Tahiti Joes Restaurant which has increased their menu items since the last time we were there, however, we feel it is a bit expensive for what it is. There are some other restaurants (low end to mid range) within walking distance from resort. Pool area is fantastic. If you have small children you will especially like the "sandy beach entry" at one end which is not deep. The lazy river is fun and relaxing. They have limited people walking around to take food orders. There is a wonderful grilling area open for everyones use. They have large commercial sized grills as well as tables & chairs in this area. A Food for less grocery store is approx. 1 mile further down the strip or a Whole Foods about 3/4 mile towards the strip. The Whole foods is huge and has a great assortment of pre-made salads and everything else you could every need. There is a small convenience store on site with limited & expensive items if you need something quick & convenient. The exercise room could use improvement if you are a serious weight training person. No dumbbells, just a few pieces of equipment and a universal that is missing lots of attachments. Decent cardio equip., just not a lot of it so there is a lot of demand for it during prime time. Rooms are equipped very nicely. Even the small Morrea side with the mini kitchen has dishes and all your main needs. I do not like the fact that they make you pay for WiFi or the tubes for the lazy river, but overall a nice resort if you don't mind riding the shuttle to the strip or taking a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Wonderful worth every minute!”
Reviews.Author: YullieYullie
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village had top rate service. Everyone on staff was friendly, accomodating and very helpful. It was my first trip to Las Vegas - all around great facility, our timeshare room, was top notch, clean well appointed with all new appliances, large rooms, large bathroom even had a stem shower which my husband loved! The two pools were great even thoug there was a lot of kids pool was big enough for everyone-one side was a sandy walk in for real small kids. The other pool was a lazy river tube float which was excellent! I can't say enough about what a good experience we had at Tahiti Village we will go back - we even bought another timeshare there. Also, shuttle bus to Vegas strip was great! No need to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti Village is a diamond in the rough!”
Reviews.Author: MAJChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas in May 2011. We decided to stay at a time share place, Tahiti Village. This is 2.5 miles South of Mandaly Bay. After reviewing online, I would say that they lived up to our standards. Check in was quick and easy. The time share people were not pushy at all and simply said if you have any questions to see the Conceigere Desk. The rooms were very nice and clean. It is my understanding that there are only 2 size room, the smaller one and larger one. We stayed in the smaller one but the kitchen was very nice, bathroom large, bedroom set off to the side. Perfect for groups of people as there is a door seperating the living room from the bedroom and the living room has a pull out couch. Everything was key access which is nice. The pool staff didnt complain when guests brought in their own drinks. We were allowed to drink in the pool while swimming as long as it wasnt glass. The lifeguards were very kind and always asked if we needed anything. The lazy river was amazing and the pool staff had no problems with drinks while lounging through the pool. The outdoor bbq area was very nice. I never read anything about it online so hopefully Tahiti will update its page and reviews with this. I didnt take the shuttle service but i heard from other guests that it was nice and easy. Store were easily walking accessiable and while "off the strip" a great location. Right across the street from the outlet mall! The area was quite and you didnt hear planes fly by as it was close to the airport. The facility was always clean and the 24 hour outdoor hot tub was awesome! Tahiti Joe's wasnt the best. The food was fine but the prices were out of this world too high! Denny's is at the bottom and well, it was Denny's food at Denny's prices. Our only complaint was half way through our stay the water was being worked on and out throughout the night. However the next day there was no cold water so eveyrthing was scorching hot! We called down to the desk and they informed us there was nothing they could do regardless that we had plans to be somewhere and needed to shower. They didnt even give us ideas besides "please be patient". The water never got back to cold before our plans so we filled up the bathtub with hot water and threw ice in it till it became warm and bearable. Overall, great experience adn would def. stay here again. Great place for couples and/or families.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JDReeves
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent two nights at Tahiti Village prior to a Conference back in May 2011. The accommodations were very nice and the staff displayed great customer service during our short stay. We enjoyed being at the end of the Strip, within walking distance to Outlet shopping. Based off of some reviews, we were a little hesitant to eat at Tahiti Joe's. We're glad gave it a try - the service was great and the food was good. Our dining experience was so pleasant, we ate all of our meals there. The Pool is really nice; however, we picked the accommodations for the Lazy River - and it didn't disappoint. Overall, we had a wonderful time at Tahiti Village and look forward to staying there whenever we're in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to open your wallets”
Reviews.Author: Donna47096
Reviews.Content: Get ready to be charged for everything. My husband and I travel all over the world. We own three timeshares. I have never experienced this before. Every motel, hotel and sleaze bag place offers free wifi but not here. Plan on $10.00 per day. And if you refuse to pay and need to get your boarding pass printed, well ... they will charge you for that plus $1.00 per page. A drink at the pool.... Plan on paying $16.00. Most places have you put the tab on your room... Not here you have to give them $300.00. I've never expected freebies, but come on this is crazy. The grounds and rooms were clean. But the pool was pretty nasty. Parking was not good. A long way to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sydmoal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Tahiti Village 5/29-6/3; 8 yr old daughter, my husband and I were surrounded around a unique property. Used this week via my timeshare exchange through Interval. We stayed in a 1 bedroom; Completely maintained with up to date amenities. Room had granite counter tops, mahagony cabinets; small refrig, microwave, utensils, and plates, cups, etc. also provided napkins, liquid soap, everything needed for a family. Full size sofa sleeper in the living room, mattress was ok for a 8 year old; queen size bed in bedroom fairly comfortable. Room smelled musty; carpet was clean and well maintained; bathroom had a small counter with a single sink; lacked counter top space or needed storage in the bathroom for tolietries; ample towels for guest; guest service was immediate as we requested towels; maid on came 2 times while staying there, this was somewhat problematic, but we just made the beds and asked for clean towels daily. Denny's restaurant on site; tons of restaurants within a block; outback; chipolte; starbucks; casinos, etc. The lazy river was lots of fun, it is shapped like a lagoon; tubes are $5.00 per day and they charge it to the room; if you look around people disgard them after their done and so there were plenty of them around; the pool is perfect for kids; man-made beach for the kids; pool was 3-4 feet and huge; kids program activities daily for the kids; for those shoppers, there was the outlet mall directly behind the property, no car needed; no free wifi unless you went to the 10 floor; otherwise internet could be purchased for $7 per day, not good as it should be around the pool and throughout the complex; cable worked well with multiple channels; plasma tvs mounted on the bedroom wall and in the living room; airport was less then 10 mins; off the main boulevard in vegas (strip) took less than 5 mins to be in all of the action; rented a car from foxrentals, 5 days $52 incl tax; overall great property could benefit from ceiling fans in the living room and bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: yvettecarlier
Reviews.Content: This resort is great! I have stayed at many different hotels in Vegas, from the Stratosphere to the Four Seasons Hotel, I would pick this resort over any other hotel on the strip. We wanted to go and relax and do a little gambling and clubing, and not be directly in the hub of the party every day, worked out perfect for us! We were there with another couple too, and this trip was their second time at this resort! It is so easy to get to the strip, they shuttle you, and will return you right back as well. Fantastic! The rooms are very clean, and have plenty of space. Nice kitchen area and sitting room, flatscreen TV's, some rooms have a balcony. Really nice ambiance. Although I didn't experience the Spa it looked fantastic, with very reasonable pricing. The resort staff is very friendly, and very helpful in every matter. We did not have our kids with us, and the next trip to Vegas we will bring them and will stay at this resort. It is fantastic for families. The pool is sand beach bottom, great for little ones, and the lazy river is great for everyone! Easy walking distance to have breakfast if you don't want to cook, or you can also order pool side for delivery. Just a really great place.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Get Away, great for families!”
Reviews.Author: huladolz
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare property but you can rent rooms through Expediai & such. We were originally staying at South Point with friends and we could not stand South Point- huge smoke filled zoo. We tried to get out of our stay there but because we were there Memorial Day weekend, we had to stay 2 days to not lose $. On Monday, we checked out and went to Tahiti Village not knowing they had space. They did and for $105, we got a nice 1 bedroom unit/condo with kitchen. We love Hawaii and this place does remind me of Hawaii with tons of palm trees, island decor, tiki bar with drinks & ($16 for a lava flow in a keepsake tiki cup, $10 refill), rock waterfalls, 5 bbq's. The pools are great- 1 lazy river pool, rings are $5 each or free if you're an owner, big huge amoeba shaped pool with beach entry, shallow kid play areas, volleyball court and my girls favorite, the beach entry pool where lots of kids are making sand castles. There's only 1 hot tob- they need at least 3 at this resort. Since it is a timeshare, cleaning is not every day, but that's ok. Location- it's right across from the outlet mall where there's some places to eat as well, it's near the strip (take car or shuttle) and it's near the car rental drop off. It was great to just lounge on the lounge chairs & watch the kids on the sand- It was relaxing from the chaos of the strip. There's an activity room too for kids with pool table, board games, tv. I highly recommend for families and the summers we can't afford to go back to Hawaii, we'll come here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool thats the best part”
Reviews.Author: phil1007
Reviews.Content: The pool was nice, friendly lifeguards, unfortunately thats the best experience we had in this hotel. DO NOT EAT AT TAHITI JOE'S - TAKES 45 MINS TO GET A DRINK! Our rooms were not cleaned during our entire stay, staff were rude, beware of staff member who tries to convince people to take limousine to strip clubs. Shuttle bus is always full, they have a spare bus but do not use it to take care of overflow of passengers who cannot get on to first bus. The shuttle always leaves the Mirage early.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Front Desk/Defective AC System/Clogged Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Mountdata
Reviews.Content: Room 2511A had a defective AC System. When I called the Front Desk Operator to request a room change, she had an unfriendly attitude and suggested that if we wanted to move, she can give us room 5741 which was the farthest room of Tower 5. When I requested to have the keys and maybe a bell man to help us move, she said that I had to get the keys myself and that there was no available help. When we finally move to room 5741, the AC system was working. Unfortunately, when my spouse used the bathroom, it was clogged. Management should train the front desk personnel to handle these situations more delicately and professionally. Maintenance should checks these rooms on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property and close proximity to everything”
Reviews.Author: poldfield
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed are stay.Rooms are spacious and well equipped. Location is excellent. The only negative we experienced was a cockroach in the bathroom,and the wifi was too expensive and complicated for our liking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: cpeers1203
Reviews.Content: Since this was our first visit to Las Vegas we were unsure what to expect. From the moment we checked in until check out everyone was friendly and helpful from the front desk, housekeeping staff and restaurant staff, etc. The shuttle was great and ran exactly on time, the rooms were clean and well equipped and the pool was very clean. This is a great location for families with small children. If you love to be in the action of the strip this isn't the place to stay but for us it was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “FIVE STARS”
Reviews.Author: Spankems
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our week at TV. From check in to check out everything was professional for our family of three that included our daughter who was celebrating her 21st birthday. Every question we had was answered promptly. The bedroom was the size of most hotel rooms and the livingroom and kitchen were great. We loved the lazy river, the large pool, hot tub, and the convenience of supermarkets, fast food restaurants and the short drive down to the strip. We loved the quietness of the hotel at night, we heard not one sound on our foor the entire week. We had a car rental which allowed us to get to the action in a few minutes. We also liked the nearness of the highway system that allowed us quick access to roads leading to Zion National Park, Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, etc. There is a free airline boarding pass computer near the lobby and check out was a simple call to the office, though that we hated because we really did not want to leave. Everyone comes away from an experience pretty much what they bring to it so we came with a good attitud and got a great reception. All experiences differ but we came away with high praise for the staff, the guests and the resort environment. While some may think it is too far from the action, there is a shuttle that will take them there. As for us, we wanted the action at our choosing and to leave it behind late at night. As for someone complaining about bugs, we never even saw an ant though I am sure they exist. We wil go back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GC_Family30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tahiti Village a week ago when we visited Vegas for a wedding. It was my first time to LV and we chose the Tahiti Village as we wanted to use our vacation club exchange. We were very happy with our check-in - the gentleman who assisted me was very friendly and asked what sort of view we would like from our room. I chose one of the strip not thinking that we would also be looking directly over the airport! However I can honestly say we did not even notice the airplanes once during our 5 night stay! The rooms are a great size, the furniture is looking tired though. The kitchen is well equipped but as with most American hotels they don't supply a kettle or anything else to make a cup of tea! We had issues finding the coffee and sugar, it was hiding in the perculator! We loved the steam shower - great if you are like us and your sinuses suffer from the change in altitude and drier climate. I found the internet access ridiculous! When in the USA you can get free WiFi just about anywhere - except at this hotel! Not only do you have to pay $10 a day for it, it isn't wireless and you need to get a ethernet cable from the reception desk. Once all of this was sorted out, I then had the issue of trying to find the port to plug the cable into! Turns out there is a small box tucked behind the DVD player that you need to pull out. This is really awkward because you naturally want to put your laptop on a table and there is no table close to this so you have to have the cable stretched across the loungeroom! We finally got all connected up ready to skype with our kids for the first time since being away only to then discover that the connection is too slow so we had a terrible time trying to see then and could only type to speak with them :( The resort is quite spaced out which is nice except when your room key doesn''t work. We were warned on check in that the keys are very sensitive and demagnitize if put near anything like cell phones or credit cards so we were very carefull not to do this. We returned to our room one afternoon with a small window to shower and get dressed to catch the shuttle into the strip to catch a show. Neither of our keys would work in our door so I ran to reception to get this fixed, she said the key were reading fine and it could be the door battery so if the new keys she issued didn't work use the in-house phone to ring and get engineering to come and fix. Of course this was the case and so by the time we ended up accessing our room we had missed our shuttle and needed to catch a taxi into the strip. (btw this is $10-15 depending on traffic and where you are going to). Unfortunately this wasn't the only time we had key issues but the next time we found the receptionist who was on the desk at the time extremely rude and unhelpful. As far as location goes we were happy. The premium outlets are very close by (walking distance) along with restaurants. We had a hire car during our stay and were able to park close to our room each time and you are able to self-park at many of the strip hotels without a charge. My husband used the pool and gym during our stay. There were plenty of lounge chairs around the pool and pool towels are supplied. The gym was on-par with his expectations of a hotel gym. Overall we were happy with our stay and would recommend it to others if they didn't mind being off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: bonn47
Reviews.Content: We arrived late afternoon and received a warm welcome. Check in was quick and our room was ready. The unit had a full kitchen, huge bathroom and bedroom. The kitchen was well equipped and the unit was very clean. The king size bed and pillows were both very comfortable. We ate in both Tahiti Joe's and Denny's restaurants and had great service. The shuttle service was fantastic. It was always on time and a very comfortable ride to and from the strip. The Outlet Mall is just down the street and has lots of good deals. The weather was gorgeous and allowed for some time at the lazy river, pool and hot tub. All were very clean and well maintained. Overall, we had a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: eskapczynski
Reviews.Content: We had booked a "Bora Bora" room for one week. (Sat. to Sat.) The room appeared clean, and very spacious. The pool water was cloudy, and because of the sandy beach, there was sand everywhere in and around the pool area. The most disturbing thing was the COCKROACHES IN OUR ROOM!!! On Monday, my wife killed two. She called down to the front desk, and they sent a man up with a spray can, who did a very short, spoty spraying of the bathroom. Two days later, (Wed.), we killed TWO MORE!!! We called down again, and this time, we made him spray the entire room while we went out. We never left our balcony door open longer than to pass in or out. Again, two days later, (Fri.) night, she killed another one. We checked out 4 hrs. early on Sat. just to get out of there. The front desk only said, "I'm sorry."

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service with cheapened facilities!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferG117
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful but the staff is rude. None of the rooms were ready at the promised 4:00 check-in time, the kitchens were not stocked with supplies and they charge an outragous fee for Wifi. The couches are old and saggy, the tv's are old and VERY small and do not allow you to play DVD's. I called the front desk 4 times and never got an answer. The lady at the concierge desk was rude and sarcastic! It is definitely NOT 5 star! We travel a lot and this is the worst "apartment style" room we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Well managed family resort.”
Reviews.Author: famigliadi4
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this resort for one week over sping break. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Rooms were clean and spacious. The pull out couch not the most comfortable. Possibly needs to be changed.The pool and lazy river were always full of kids and adults having a great time. Always plenty of lawn chairs and shady areas. There was a BBQ area with six BBQ's cleaned daily and ready to go. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The shuttle service was more than adequate to get us to the strip and back throughout the day.Not one bad experience with the staff the whole stay. We would stay here agian without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: kytten13
Reviews.Content: The Room, Pros: Very nice size, spacious whether you get the two bedroom lock-off or just one bedroom. The bathroom consisted of two sinks, both a jacuzzi tub and a separate steam shower (my husband's favorite!). Stacking washer and dryer included. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Location: we were located on the 3rd floor of tower 5 - on the same floor as the fitness center, awesome! (BTW, if you have kids, the activity center is the 5th floor of tower 5 so that is where I would try to be located). Very clean room. Nice flat screen televisions in both the bedroom and living rooms. DVD player in the living room. The check in process is quick and they give you this little welcome pack with coupons for various Vegas attractions and places to see for free. Cons: The phones are out of date and when you call the front desk, you are put on hold for quite a long time. View was of the parking lot, but considered a small price to pay for the room Wired internet for $10 per day - sort of expensive for something that only one person in one room can use - this is my biggest complaint about this property. The Spa: One thing not mentioned in previous reviews is that this resort does have a small Spa located on the 9th floor of tower 5. They are small in that there is not a sauna or a whirl pool, but they do offer massages and facials for reasonable prices. If you ask around, you may even be able to get a $10 or $20 off coupon. I had Doreen for a deep tissue massage and she was very good. Overall, professional and good value for the money (~$100 for a 60 minute massage and $145 for a 90 minutes massage; deep tissue is $10 more). The Shuttle: Fast, on time. Need your room key to board. Only runs until ~11 pm, so you'll need to take a taxi back if you're out later than that. Cost of a taxi from the strip to Tahiti village ranged from $11 to $22 depending on the taxi cab driver, route, and traffic. Pool/Lazy River/Jacuzzi: Have to pay for the inner tubes on the Lazy river ($5/day) and they won't let you bring your own. There is an actual sand beach area for the kids to make sand castles. Water in pool/lazy river is slightly heated. Business Center: Consists of 2 computers, which you need a major credit card to even start. Printing is $1/per page, with boarding passes printed free of charge. There is a grocery store, Food 4 Less, across the street on the other side of the strip mall. Overall pretty cheap, and the alcohol selection and prices were awesome. One note - double bag everything because the bags are super thin and rip easily.

Reviews.Title: “VERY PLEASANT STAY”
Reviews.Author: NHlakelover
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort & very clean - disregard all negative reviews! Located just south of Mandalay Bay - less than a mile. We stayed in a MOOREA unit (1bdrm w/limited kitchen in Tower 5) and is perfect for a couple. Very comfortable - 2 TV's (kitchen/living room area & bedroom), king bed with lots of pillows, huge bathroom. Pool area (plenty of chairs) & lazy river is very nice. There is an area with 5 gas grills (like an outdoor kitchen)with lots of tables for families who don't want to eat out every night! Denny's on property is convenient and we wanted to try Tahiti Joe's (also on the property) but there was some issue in the kitchen and told us it would be a long wait - we didn't go back! The shuttle to the strip (about a 15 min drive) is a plus - even takes you on a "grocery run" (nice for those who want to use the grilling area!) & local mall several times a week. Only negative is that it is very close to the airport so there is constant airplane traffic. Not heard too much while in the unit but at the pool it is very distracting! Planes fly over almost every 3-4 minutes!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: juliebooBuffalo_Ny
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but were inpressed with the hotel. The pool area was big (though the water temperature was cold-you know it's cold when the lifeguards are swathed in towels to stay warm!) and had a "beach" where our son could play. The suite was beautifuL. It had a kitchenette and two TVs, pull out couch bed, and enough space that our son could run back and forth until he was tired. My only complaint was with the restaurant (Joe's) which was VERY slow. Ordering two sandwiches took almost 40 minutes and it was not busy. The food was good. Will probably stay there again in the warmer months for a few days. FYI: Children under six who ride the hotel provided shuttle to the Strip have to be in a car seat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to get away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: wingchunkuen
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a nice change of pace from the hectic scene of the strip. If you want to be a little more laid back this is the place to be. While it's not really Tahiti or Hawaii, if you were having a mai tai under the umbrella by the pool and surrounded by palm trees and warm weather, you could almost imagine you are there. Staff was nice, timeshare presentation was short and sweet with not much pressure. The shuttle to the strip was very nice and having Denny's at the location saved some money on dining out. Also the Premium outlet mall is next door so you can do some shopping without paying the ridiculous prices for the same items at the luxury hotels. Activity center was a hit for the teenage kids and the fitness room was nice for the wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: AudraC
Reviews.Content: Hotel: We liked that it was more family oriented and off the strip. Everything was clean and tidy and it was a really nice looking hotel. Room: We were in Tower 5 in the far end of the first floor in a BoraBora suite (1 bedroom, full kitchen). Close to the parking garage. We sleep with the fan on so noise wasn't an issue for us. We were pleased with the size of the suite. Plenty of room for a family of four. The kitchen was well appointed and very clean. I wish there was an option for two beds rather than a bed and a sofabed. The kids weren't impressed having to share the sofabed while we had a nice comfy king sized bed. I also wish they had free wi-fi in the rooms, but on the last day we saw a sign that said you could get a wifi stick for $7 for the week. We just went to Denny's a couple of times for brekkie and checked emails there. Housekeeping: There is no housekeeping unless you stay for more than 7 nights, but any time we needed anything I'd just pop my head out into the hall and ask a housekeeper for a couple of extra towels or toilet paper. If there's no one in the hall, there's a number you can call for housekeeping. I wanted 2 extra pillows and a blanket, they were there in 15 minutes. I actually prefer not having people in my room when I'm not there so that wasn't an issue at all. One thing I loved was that there is a stacking washer/dryer in the suite! Security: I felt very comfortable here. There was staff everywhere and we noticed several security cameras around the property as well. Pools: The pool and lazy river were great. They keep it very clean and are always tidying up wet towels and straightening out the deck chairs . Drinks at the poolside bar were a little on the expensive side ($10 for about a 10 oz Pina Colada). There's a sign on the door that says no outside food or beverages, but it seemed as though everyone there had their own drinks so they obviously don't enforce that rule. Shuttle: The shuttle was great - always on time and friendly drivers. It took about 15 minutes to get into the strip and they drop off at NYNY and The Mirage. Car rental: We wanted to go to red Rock Canyon so inquired at the concierge desk about renting a car. They said they had a 'deal' where we could get a 3 day rental of a mid sized car for $25 with unlimited mileage through Budget. Of course when I said "What's the catch" they said we just had to take a tour of the property. My husband and discussed it and the concierge promised us that it was very low pressure (of course he would!) and that they weren't the same as the ones we see in Mexico. We figured we were strong minded enough to sit through and not buy a time share so decided to do it. We set our tour up for the last day we were there so he 'pre-gifted' us the car rental (we took advantage of the gift 3 days before the presentation) and took a $200 deposit. We toured Red Rock Canyon, Boulder City and Hoover Dam. We also took the car down to Circus Circus and the Mirage - both had free parking close to the hotels. They gave us all kinds of show tickets, but most of them were for crap shows in the middle of the day so we didn't bother. We mostly wanted the car. Picking up the car was kind of a pain because they use the Budget about 20 minutes from TV, but drop off was quite convenient about 5 minutes from TV. We walked home after dropping it off - maybe a 15 minute walk. Time share spiel: We googled 'How to get through a time share presentation' to get tips on going and not being sucked in to buying a time share. (Lots of funny stuff out there!) We opted for just telling our tour guide, Michelle, straight up that we were in no way interested in buying and didn't travel all that much to make use of it. She was totally nice and said that's okay, but she has to spend a certain amount of time with us so could she use us for 'practice'. No problem as we enjoyed seeing more of the property. She actually did a great presentation and didn't once pressure us. There was a 'try before you buy' option for $5600 for 2 weeks a year for 5 years. Didn't sound unreasonable for anyone who did travel a lot, but it still wasn't for us. We were done in an hour. I think that's it! I would definitely stay here again with family.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools, close to public transportation, & able to walk to restaurants”
Reviews.Author: xmasangel
Reviews.Content: Rooms at Tahiti village have many amenities. One bedrooms have jetted tubs and steam shower. Sleep 4 - one bedroom has king and living room had a fold out queen. The bus stop is right in back of parking garage. Multiple trips in 24 hours $7. multiple day passes are available. Guests can walk to Outback, Dunkin Donuts, Chilli's, IHOP, and many other restaurants without adding a rental car or paying high cab fares. Premium outlet Mall is right next door. Bus goes everywhere else that is important - skip the car. There is a Tahiti Village courtesy shuttle to New York/New York and Mirage hotels. There are at least 2 private shuttle companies, CLS and ACL?, that will deliver you to TV $32. RT on CLS. So don't believe the TV information people when they tell you there isn't any companies that bring guests to TV. Internet available at a cost $10. day for hard wired and $7. daily for WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome....going back in september.....”
Reviews.Author: Cindy3738
Reviews.Content: Not sure why so many complaints. Everything...and all the staff are awesome. Rooms are very clean.....tired of hearing of the ONE roll of TP...the cart is always on the floor....ask for more...so simple! Tons of parking...NO BUGS (maybe shut your patio doors who ever was complaining). Shuttle runs every 30 minutes for free....great security.....VERY CLEAN!! Cindy/ Edmonton

Reviews.Title: “Yeah - it's all that.”
Reviews.Author: puffy_fluff
Reviews.Content: Look - it isn't the Bellagio or anything like that, but for the huge room, the cool pools, and amenities - it is a really good place to go with kids.

Reviews.Title: “So Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LoveProvenceToronto
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay at the resort for 3 days with my famiily over March break 2011. It was disappointment after disappointment. When we arrived, the pool and beach were closed and that was one of the reasons we wanted to stay at the resort. Then, nobody told us that you had to stay for 7 days to get your room cleaned once. We had a pile of dirty towels and they would not clean our room. When I asked the front desk, they said they would at least have the towels removed from our room but nobody came to pick them up. Totally disappointing. When I asked to speak to the Manager, the Manager never surfaced and came out in person to greet me or talk to me about my dissatisfaction. She just sent the front desk clerks back and forth with messages and they didn't even know how to answer any questions so they had to keep going back to see the Manager. From a customer service standpoint, there was no effort put in after so many mistakes were made. I was told there could be late check out at 12pm and then when I asked to check out late the day we were leaving, I was told they couldn't. Many mixed messages and signals, and very disappointing. The room also looked like it hadn't been cleaned as the carpet was very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: MN_Traveler38
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Tahiti Village (TV) 3/8/11-3/14/11. We were very pleased with pretty much all of the accommodations. Our room was a nice size and very clean--if we would've booked earlier we could've had a 2 bedroom but a 1 bedroom with pullout sofa worked fine. I have read other posters complaints about customer service but I did not find that to be a problem. In fact, we had a toilet issue the first night we were there and they responded right away and were very friendly. We stayed in Tower 5 and used the fitness room every morning--it has better equipment than most hotels we stay at and the room is very nice and spacious. At some places you feel like you are working out in a closet!!! Our kids enjoyed the activity room with free pool & air hockey. The pool area was very nice and they had towels available which I didn't know beforehand so we could've saved some packing space by leaving the beach towels at home. The shuttle service to the strip every 1/2 hour was convenient and suited our needs but we didn't stay out real late any of the nights. The only complaint we had was the WiFi limitations. We weren't able to connect in Tahiti Joe's and the staff seemed very insincere about checking into the problem. WiFi at Denny's worked fine and the staff at Denny's were all very pleasant. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Tahiti Village. It was nice to have a resort away from the strip so we could kick back and relax away from all the activity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jrowlands
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Tahiti village and I feel compelled to write this and tell you to NOT listen to the negative reviews. The stay here was fabulous. The resort grounds are beautiful. The pool area was great and used a lot as we had great weather. Each staff member we met was nothing but kind and helpful. The rooms were nice and comfortable. Tahiti Joe's has good food. The only negatives are that there is no free internet, and the shuttle(which is great and has friendly drivers) only stops at two stops. And yes the airplanes flying above can be irritating, but you get used to it.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun here, good for families and for friends”
Reviews.Author: natashadh
Reviews.Content: I went here last Memorial Day weekend, got a GREAT deal through Travelzoo for a 1 bedroom suite. It was really nice, the bed was comfy, the shower was a steam shower and jacuzzi bath, with a washer and dryer too. The pool was way cool, with the lil beach and then the lazy river was pretty cool too. The drinks at the pool bar were tasty. I would definitely stay here again. Here is a video I took of our suite: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8AepQdzHUn4

Reviews.Title: “The Customer Service Counter, was the worst part of my stay.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleS36902
Reviews.Content: Except for Vincent. I think that was his name. He multi-tasked, got the job done. He is the customer service person, people would hire. The rest of the customer service people were awful. Just the worst, Ive seen. We got married at the Tahita Village, in the gazebo, then went to the resturant next door. Tahiti Joes. Well, my 9 month old went to the hospital, because she was so sick. While the docter was in the room, I had to excuse myself, because I was sick. Then my new husband got sick and my brother in law. We were all sitting on the same side of the table and next to eachother. So Im sure that something was on the table, that got us all sick. Because we all had something different to eat. My new husband stayed in bed until it was time to go to the airport. Nice. It was a over a $50 cab ride to the hospital each way. That I guess I could get over, but the customer service desk people were awful. It was hot outside and my sister and I went to get grocerys, when we came back I asked the cust ser person to call a bell boy to get us a cart. She said oh someone will be around in a little while. She had her radio in her hand. All she had to do is call someone and find out how long he would be. Nothing. It was hot. I had my child with me. We stood on the curb with grocerys. I had to make serveral trips to the room with my child in hand, while my grocerys sat on the curb. All she need to do was pick up her radio. Too bad Vincent was not around, Im sure he would have handled it much better than she did. When I had to fill out my report reguarding all of us getting sick, I asked her to call Security so I could hand them the report, she made me stand in line for 45 minutes so I could ask her to call security. Again, all she had to do was pick up the radio. WoW. The Tahiti Village itself was nice. But the worst part was the customer service. It has taken me a long time to write this, because Ive been upset about it. I didnt want to come off too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: truth123
Reviews.Content: I have pretty high expectations when it comes to hotels, having worked in the industry for years. This place lived up to every one of them. The room was spectacular. Travelling with a group of 12, we rented two large suites ( I believe they were called the royal tahitian) With there being 4 seperate families, we each stayed in one side of the connecting suites. We were MORE than comfortable in the suites, with plenty of room for all of the kids and adults to have their own space. The rooms were super clean, as were the hallways and common areas. While we were there, it was a bit cool so none of us really frequented the pool area, but the hot tub and lazy river were used on a daily basis. The hotel even noticed that there were a lot of small children there the week we were there, so they raised the temperature of the lazy river. The concierge was always willing to help with whatever we needed and the wireless internet they helped us with was super fast and for the (kinda expensive) price and with our laptop, could be taken anywhere in the city. We will definitely be coming back to this hotel again if we come to Las vegas with our family. No question about it. -- Other bonuses, you are basically right down the street from the McCarron car rental place. -- You are also RIGHT across the street from the Outlet mall and several restaurants. -- Only negative... regardless to what the management said in that other post, the planes DO fly RIGHT over the hotel. After the first night though, we slept right through it. If you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely go back to Tahiti Village”
Reviews.Author: Nafus1
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews I had reservation about this place. First let me describe our experience. We found the CLS shuttle near Baggage claim 16 just outside the door. The round trip to and from TV cost us $16 each. They gave us two tokens with their phone number to call 24 hours before we left. We did and the return shuttle was there on time. It only took 10 minutes to and from the terminal. We arrived at 9PM and the reception person was very helpful. I had read to switch to the new tower #5 and was able to get it. She also explained about the shuttle to the strip that left every half hour and to be on time because they are firm at leaving on time. She gave us a schedule that we used and never had any problems. It took ten minutes to get to the first stop Nw York New York and another ten minutes from there to the Mirage. The shuttle saved us a lot of $$. We had a one bedroom unit with a kitchenette; It had a small frig and microwave which was fine with us. We ate at Denny's each morning next door and except for some watered down orange juice the last day everything was great. The large breakfast kept us going until Supper. Denny's had the free WIFI where we checked our emails and researched Hoover Dam info. TV was very nice and clean. There was a small store where they sold snacks, drinks and clothing. We mostly just got drinks for the frig. The room overlooked the lazy river so that was nice but our friends were across the hall and had a blah view of sand and the airport. Tower 5 was next to the parking garage so if you park there it is close. The outlet maill was across the street from the parking garage as was Outback if you want a chain restaurant. The mall was very big and had all the big names. We didn't go in the pool or lazy river but we did touch the warm water. Being in the 50s during the day it was too cold but others were brave. We didn't eat at Tahiti Joes but it looked OK and has free WIFI as well. We didn't go to any shows but there are ticket discount booths on the street so check them first before paying top dollar. Also, we quickly discovered that smoking is allowed in the casinos and none we found had non-smoking sections like Atlantic City does. So we breathed unsafe air for four days in the casinos but not the restaurants. We ate one night at the Sugar Factory Restaurant in the Paris Casino. It was a soft opening and the waiter said they might be slow but almost an hour later they finally brought us some simple crepe and turkey sliders. The manager apologized and gave us some free food. However the food was delicious so I highly recommend the place as long as they have sped up the kitchen. If you've never seen the Hoover Dam GO! Our friends from LA drove us there and it is spectacular along with the view of the new bridge. The drive is only about 20 minutes from Las Vegas. We also enjoyed Fremont Street with the nice covering and laser shows. Go at night for free entertainment and characters who walk around for picture ops. (tip expected) We had a prime rib buffet that was outstanding. I think it was at Binions. The Cosmopolitan Hotel was beautiful and should be seen. The casino was not our favorite. Probably the MGM and Paris were the favorite places because we won there. Now back to the unfavorable reviews I read before the trip. TV is located about 3 miles south of the casinos on the same road. It tells you everywhere in the literature so don't complain about it. This is a time share place where they also tell you that you don't have everyday maid service. So don't complain about it. The shuttles leave on time so don't complain when one leaves after you get there late. The beds are medium softness. Don't complain if you like them hard or very soft. The parking garage is aways from the lobby but this place is huge. If you go to Vegas be ready to walk. My wife and i lost weight and we ate very well. Some complained about noise through the walls but we didn't hear a peep. People stayed on both sides of us. We didn't have warm weather so we didn't experience crowds like there probably are in the warmer months. If you get a free room or free movie tickets expect either a sales push or pressure when you get the time share sales pitch. No one bugged us at all during our stay. Our friends have grandkids so they can't wait to bring them back for the pool and lazy river. The outside facility looks fantastic. Yes we will be back to TV.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space”
Reviews.Author: MichiganPartyof5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 1 bedroom bora bora with 3 kids and had plenty of space. The kitchen area was clean and new. The bathroom was large and looked in new condition as well. The pool area was just like the pictures...warm lazy river that really moved, a sandy beach area and hot tub. For under $200, this provided a good family spot in Vegas. We drove to the strip in 5 min., rather than using the shuttle. Note that walking in Vegas is a challange. Paris to aria takes longer than you think, but the lights are one of a kind.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation ruined by Tahiti Village and its staff”
Reviews.Author: EdH61
Reviews.Content: Very noisy as resort is located adjacent to major airport landing path. Refrigerator was VERY noisy but it covered up the jet noise. Parking is a major problem. They towed our car after telling us exactly where to park. It cost hundreds to get our car back as well as a very expensive taxi ride way out into the desert. Don't drive a car and park at this resort, that is, if you can even find a parking space. They accept no responsibility for providing wrong information. Unit was small and cramped, not what the pictures on-line promised. Located a long ways from the heart of the Las Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: danandhails
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and thought it was fantastic. The room was big with a seperate living area. Its a good alternative to the hustle and bustle of the strip, and has a free shuttle bus every half hour until around 1am which was excellent. The pool area was the best part, its very big and fun and has a lazy river. The hawaiin theme really makes you feel like your on a tropical holiday, with palm trees all round the pool. Right on the doorstep theres a dennys and tahiti joes restaurants and a shopping outlet. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Sandi56
Reviews.Content: Close to Strip. Home away from home. My unit had a full kitchen, spacious living/dining room with fireplace. Very comfortable. The bedroom was spacious and adjoining was a wonderful bathroom with really great jacuzzi tub/shower. Nice granite counters in Kitchen & Bath. My company approved whole heartedly. Security was good. Be sure to get parking pass. The only thing is there's only one elevator near the main entrance, so you have to haul everything up to the 2nd floor. Had covered parking which came in handy when it was raining. It's also very nice to have a washer & dryer. I would stay there again. You can walk to basic shopping & basic restaurants. The Orleans is close too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: artap
Reviews.Content: Traveled with husband and friends so we booked a 2 BR Suite for 7 nights. Couldn't believe how nice, clean and comfortable it was! First time we haven't been in a casino hotel on the strip because we are gamblers. It was so nice to gamble, then come home to the tranquility of Tahiti Village. Had a great balcony with views of the strip! It is near the airport however you could barely hear the planes (even outside). The shuttle was great and we usually took a cab and/or our rental car at night. Loved having the full kitchen (stocked with beer and mixers) and washer/dryer. Adjacent to Denny's for breakfast/Tahiti Joe's for wings/sandwiches. You can walk to the Outlet Mall. LOVED this place and will stay again on a long trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: hotmickey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this timeshare resort. Be aware of this future travelers to las vegas. Check in staff was friendly. Did not receive the room I requested. The room was nice and clean. Perfect for two adults. Since this was a jr suite it had a mini fridge and microwave only. Housekeeping came in on Tuesday and gave us clean towels, washed our dirty dishes and took our trash. Thank you h.k. parking is a real pain and the biggest complaint we both had. In the day there is plenty close to the entrances. At night we had to park in the unsecured and unmanned garage. Did not feel safe. Felt safer on the strip at three am. The outside pools were not heated. The drinks are overpriced. We had nonalcoholic ones at eleven dollars each. Outside areas are beautiful and well landscaped. Felt like we were on an island. Overall we will stay here if no other timeshares are available on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not very handicap accessible rooms.”
Reviews.Author: kjshine851
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom/one bath unit at Tahiti Village the first week of January. When we got into the room, I noted there were two tall bar stools at the kitchenette counter, which were too tall for me to sit in. I am 5'4", have M.S. and use a walker and scooter to get around. There were also extremely low closet rods in the bedroom and living room storage cabinet. My husband, who is able-bodied, and I have traveled quite a bit and we have never seen closet rods designed to be used by disabled people that were built so close to the floor. I think the closet rods might have been 2 feet high off the floor at best. There were no closet rods for able-bodied companions or for longer clothing, as there usually are in most hotels or timeshares. Neither one of us could hang up our clothes. There was also no handle to easily grasp to open or close the pocket door into the bathroom. There was no soap dish or holder in the shower to hold soap or shampoo. The place was clean and close to the outlet center and dining and shopping across the street, but I would not recommend it to the disabled traveler. The bed was very saggy in the middle, too, and when a workman came to the room to possibly replace the mattress, he offered to bring us a twin roll-away bed, which we delcined.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Queenie2631
Reviews.Content: My husband andI went to Vegas to celebrate my birthday and our first trip to Vegas He had bee wanting to go for many years.The timing was right so we booked thorugh INterval International. Minor issues with one front desk clerk but over all what a great place even though it was %! degrees I went in the lazy river it was heated and I was only chilled when I got out They have 7 life guard just fotr the lazy river Great free shuttle to the strip and the maiin DUECE bus line which runs akll the way to Freemont street is right around the corner at The las vegas outlet mall so convienent many rest in the immediate area . No need to rent a car however friends joined us and tehy rented a car we went to the Hoover dam that was ggreta and much cheaper than taling the bus tour to the dam then decide to travel on to the west rim of the g caynon hoever the price was quoted t 29.95 pp but the cjeapest was 150. for 2 as you must tour the indian reservation on a bus then they take you to the lookout sopt for the canyon on the bus you cannot grive to the look out spots totatally mis leading I highly reccomend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Totally awesome”
Reviews.Author: doubleexposure
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough about my stay here, the front office, everybody was so helpful, and friendly The place was immaculate, and the rooms were cleaned in the middle of the week also. The rooms were huge. Shuttles to the strip for free, and shuttle to the airport for small fee. I came alone, to get away, and have some time to myself. And i did, but also got out and saw Cher , totally awesome. Huge swimmingpool, beautiful. All i can say is i dont think u could do much better,

Reviews.Title: “I WAS PLEASANTLY SUPRISED BY TAHITI VILLAGE”
Reviews.Author: JFEARN
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at Mandalay Bay and found this place through Interval International. In the past I have always stayed at hotels close by, but thought i would use a voucher and book a condo. This place was about 2 miles from the convention center which was very convenient. A 12.00 cab ride each way. We had a 2 bedroom unit that would sleep 8 The rooms were state of the art with all the amenities although they did lack more than one frying pan and only had 6 dishes per set so you were constantly washing dishes. The washer and dryer took a long time to run their cycles which was a little bit of a pain but, we only used them once. The view in bld 5 over the lazy river was very nice and the airport noise was almost non existant. The great thing about this resort is that they pick you up at the airport on the car rental shuttle and take you to the shuttle hub ( where all agencies are) which is only about a block from this resort. They supply cellular broadband sticks which is interesting considering they have ethernet cables in the room. The drawback of these sticks is you have to buy them for each computer you are using. If you are tech savy ( we had one of those guys) you will be able to use the signal and broadcast to serveral computers. The spa and work out area were right in our building which was very nice. I would definitely stay there again because it was very convenient having all that space.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Luxurious Alternative to Casino Chaos”
Reviews.Author: DiFerraro
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at Tahiti Village and was very impressed with the resort. The rooms are lovely and spacious - we opted for the adjoining suites since we had three generations staying together. The shuttle service is a treat as you don't have to deal with taxis or driving your own car. Can't be the value for your money, either. A great way for parents to enjoy Vegas without subjecting the kids to casinos, smoking, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jhreview
Reviews.Content: After my husband booked our hotel, I read the reviews and most were not so good, but I am really glad we still have it a chance and stayed there. The service was great, the people were really nice and the hotels lay out it easy going and fun to be around. It was not warm enough for us to go into the pool, but next time we will. They had so much to do there without having a casino in it. Denny's and Tahiti Joes restaurant right there in the parking not (both with great food). We look forward to heading out there again and staying there.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst customer service!”
Reviews.Author: CCAA12
Reviews.Content: The check in took way too long 2 different agents could not locate my reservation finally someone did find it. And that agent was very unprofessional and rude. I finally got up to my room and it was a nice room very clean but the toilet kept running I tried to contact someone anyone to help but no answer at the front desk the phone rage over 30 times the 3 times I called. The resort is nice the only problem is the front desk staff get rid of them

Reviews.Title: “This place is worth going back to.”
Reviews.Author: jebt00
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to California and only got to stay one night. It was great, the service and the room. I only wish we had more time to enjoy the lazy river and pool. Maybe another time when we have more time to spend. The rates were awesome for Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Eve Stay”
Reviews.Author: JasminedogLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Our family of four exchanged a week into Tahiti Village to celebrate New Years Eve in Las Vegas. We enjoyed our stay in the two-bedroom unit that was our home away from home. Our experience during the busiest week of the year was far more positive than negative. Check in went smoothly and we were treated in a friendly and courteous manner by the front desk staff and concierge hosts. Our concierge offered a timeshare tour, we declined, and that was the gracious end to that. No hard sell whatsoever. Our unit in Tower 5 (requested and granted) was spacious, clean and everything we had expected from reviewing the floor plan and reviews. We were on the second floor overlooking the BBQ grill area and entrance into Tower 5 … so this was a bit noisier on New Year’s Eve (late night returnees) but really not a huge issue. The resort is not surrounded by much of anything except the Outlet Malls to the south; so don’t expect much of any scenic view (although many Strip hotels offer views of their parking structure or the casino rooftop unless you are willing to pay a premium). The master bedroom had a very comfortable king bed and the lock-off second bedroom had a queen bed. The master bath was huge and nicely appointed with a jet spa tub and a great walk-in steam room/shower, both of which worked well during our stay. The second bath had a regular shower/tub set up. The main living room, dining area and kitchen were nicely appointed. The lock-off bedroom had a separate sitting room/kitchenette combo. My daughter slept in the sofa bed and said it was not very comfortable (sofa beds generally aren’t that great). But both kids enjoyed 4 flat screen TV units in our two-bedroom. The swimming pools were apparently heated and open, but no one was swimming given the outside air temp was mid-40’s in the day and low-30’s in the evening. Compared to the Marriott timeshare tower next to Planet Hollywood (great location, great units, but terrible pool during the summer), the Tahiti Village pool complexes would be great during the hot summer and could truly feel like a resort. We tried out the gym on the 3rd floor of Tower 5 and found the place clean and decently appointed with 3 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 2 recumbent bikes and stacked weight and pulley stations. There were 4 flat screen TVs in the room as well. Wish they offered free weights. Our negative during the stay concerned the stacked washer and dryer unit … the washer took a long time to wash and the dryer was not that powerful. Parking around the perimeter of the main buildings is very limited and guests are encouraged to park in the multi-level parking structure that is adjacent to Tower 5. It is indeed a very long walk to your parked car in the structure if you are not staying in Tower 5 (and for some it is a long walk depending on what part of Tower 5 you are staying in). . Tahiti Village is just south of the LV Airport, adjacent to the Outlet Mall and a few minutes’ drive to the great Town Square Shopping Center (outdoor “village” shopping center with a Whole Foods Mart, many chain retail shops, about 6 popular restaurants like California Pizza Kitchen and Claim Jumpers, and a Tix4Tonight office to purchase day-of-performance discounted show and dinner tickets. Freeway access was convenient and the drive to the center of the Strip ranged from 15 minutes (no traffic) to nearly 45 minutes (New Years’ Eve traffic). A few minutes further south along Las Vegas Blvd is a Food 4 Less, Rite Aid and a number of inexpensive chain restaurants. Getting to the casinos and hotels along the famous Strip will require a car (or cab ride). We did not use the hotel shuttle. Those who like the convenience of a central LV Strip location or who enjoy the late night club/casino vacation that Vegas offers are better off paying for a hotel resort at the Strip. But Tahiti Village fits the bill for families or groups of friends who are looking for space and the convenience of a kitchen and washer/dryer. We all agreed that we would have no hesitation returning to Tahiti Village. Highly recommend reserving a two-bedroom unit to really understand why people have positive reviews about the place. If you only reserve a one-bedroom lock-off, then you are better off reserving a resort hotel on the Strip. We would not hesitate to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TrixieEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in May and loved it. The pools were warm and wonderful, the grounds beautiful and the rooms spacious. We spent most of the day at the pool, and then took the shuttle to the strip to shop and look at the resorts. We saw Le Reve at the Wynn and loved it. Sat in the front row splash zone and loved every single minute. Awesome show. Hope to return sometime and go to the Wynn buffett. It looks amazing. We went to the afternoon Paris buffet and it was okay, but i don't think it was even on the same planet compared to the Wynn buffett, but then again, the price reflects this. We really enjoyed being off the strip. We don't gamble or drink and this place felt like a "resort" on the beach instead of a City with the crowds and noise, even though it was so close. Fabulous place and excellent value for the price.
