Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfied. I will return.”
Reviews.Author: bmuel01
Reviews.Content: I have been an owner since 2008 (2-RT). It's sad the reviews show the laziness of people to not ask for assistance. Housekeeping was great: ask for additional TP or towels or anything. Never leave a hotel or anyplace without getting a final "paid" bill. This is more that a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is no-frills time share condo”
Reviews.Author: Alton C
Reviews.Content: We knew this.was a no frills time-share resort when we reserved a couple of one-bedroom condo's for the NFR. As a note to travelers: The location is off the well-traveled path. Which means that someone in your group must have a car. Don't rely on the resorts' shuttle transportation. You are out in the middle of nowhere. You will need reliable transportation. And, by reliable...I mean: Rely on you. I knew where the Tahiti Village was located before going there, so the location didn't matter to me. We knew we were going to be there for a while and wanted to be away from traffic. (Vegas traffic can wear you out after a couple of days). So, we actively sought out the Tahiti Village for its location. The one-bedroom condo works fine for a couple traveling alone. It had a fully workable kitchen, A small dining area. And, a pull-out sofa in the couch. The steam shower was awesome. Loved it. The jacuzzi tub was also nice, but since I'm not a tub person, I didn't use it. The decor wouldn't be in the pages of Home & Garden, but it wasn't Vegas Tacky, either. It was pleasant. Our view was pretty aweful. A parking lot. But, I suppose that everyone had a view of a parking lot. What else is there to see out in that area? We were there for a total of 6 nights and were not bothered once by a sales staff trying to sell us a time share. Refreshing to say the least. I don't want people reading this review to be fooled by the 3-Star rating. It isn't getting 3 stars because there was anything wrong with the property. There really wasn't. We got exactly what we paid for. And, exactly what we thought we were paying for. It wasn't dirty, noisy, and the staff was pleasant. We will go back. But, if you want a 4-star or 5-star place in Vegas...this isn't it. It's a no-frills time share condo for non-gambler. It's a nice no-frills time share condo. But still a condo, nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: seplorance
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay in Las Vegas here for the pools. I have 2 teenagers plus a1 year old and the pools were perfect for all three of them. The people, staff and guests, were amazingly nice too. It is a short drive to the busy part of the strip but Tahiti Village offers a shuttle if you don't want to drive your car. The rooms are very spacious and I love the benefits of having a small kitchen while on vacation. Tahiti Village also has a BBQ Pit so you can grill your own food. We will be staying here every chance we get.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and ripped off!”
Reviews.Author: Dragons55
Reviews.Content: went on a vacation with my pregnant wife, hotel was terrible, customer service was sub par, we were there for a week but only got one roll of TP, our fridge did not work as a fridge, carpets were stained, we saw weird bugs crawling around inside the rooms, shower worked only when it wanted to, loud parties, they charged us $100 cleaning fee after we got home, our closet doors were broken, the lazy river is just sucked, the pool was really just a big puddle, they constantly tried selling us a time share. Right beside the airport so that sucked, shuttle bus drivers were good, but if you were not one of the first 16 people in line you missed the shuttle, We were going to stay at MGM, but we saw the pics of this place and well the pictures were not accurate at all. There was a hotel next door that catered to...well you dont want to know.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT USE YOUR CREDIT CARD AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Natalia7791
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel right up until we got home and received our credit card bill to find that it had been charged after we left, for something that had nothing to do with us. Beware of this place, I had been warned and I did not listen, THIS PLACE IS DISHONEST AND DOES NOT DESERVE YOUR BUSINESS.

Reviews.Title: “Never going to Vegas again, but at least there was a Denny's next door. Front desk was mindless”
Reviews.Author: ryanlcobb
Reviews.Content: Beds were not very comfy, sore neck and back the whole trip, there was no legitimate table to sit down and write or work on a laptop, we were given a small room with a dirty coffee maker and nothing to at least boil water in. The view was of an empty construction site. The fitness center had broken machines, the ice machine on our floor did not work and was never fixed. The front desk misinformed us upon check in - they told us they would be CHARGING our credit card $100 as a security deposit, but upon checkout they insisted it was just a hold, not a charge. The on-site bar, Tahiti Joe's, charged me $19.20 instead of $8 for one drink; I went back a total of 4 times to complain to the never-present manager (issue was resolved eventually). Bath/Shower had low water pressure, when shower is on, water still spews from the tub faucet (annoying). TV remote controls very fussy and half-broken, channel selection was limited. Front desk also told us we would have to check out a luggage cart to move our luggage up to our room (hand over ID, push cart across the property, use and return)... they lied, we could have just used the bellhop service but the front desk misinformed us on that issue too. Bellhop service was (eventually) helpful and friendly. Never visited the pool, too cold and windy (not their fault obviously). Convenience store is extremely overpriced on basic goods. They also wanted to charge a lot for internet, we just chose go without any internet for a week. Again the front desk misinformed us on the internet, they told us we could use the internet computer in the lobby, when it was actually some free wifi within the lobby, I assume (I saw other people using it, and wish I had known about it sooner, but the front desk was never very knowledgeable on anything anyway)

Reviews.Title: “Was disasterous until we were upgraded after many complaints”
Reviews.Author: allanafleming
Reviews.Content: Stayed for our wedding, we asked for someone to turn the fridge down (after it kept freezing everything) and a new light bulb in one of the only 2 lamps in the room on the Wednesday morning. It still wasn't done by Saturday. We asked for an upgrade as the room was unclean, small and not what we paid for. There wasn't even a kettle! The bedroom window slid across and we were on the free way! They said they were fully booked, then they said we could pay £180 for 5 nights, then changed their minds. I asked to speak to a manager about my food being frozen and the poor service, but I kept being fobbed off. I took my frozen food down to reception an in front of a packed lobby full of new customers I demanded to see a manager and finally after 4 days, they let me speak to one. 30 minutes later we were upgraded to an amazing room, with a massive bath, twin sinks in the bathroom, large plasma televisions with a balcony. It finally felt like a honeymoon. Would stay again but only in the second room. Shuttle to the strip was extremely handy, but late buses were unreliable. Vernon on reception was a legend!! Pool was a definite bonus

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: jim72150
Reviews.Content: I am here at Tahiti Village with my three young adult sons for some father son fun. We exchanged into a two bedroom unit and it is really very nice. It is clean and spacious and we all have our privacy. The resort is very close to the airport and probably 4 miles to the main part of the strip. The resort runs a shuttle every 30 minutes to New York New York and the mirage and do a nice job of it. If i were to come back to Las Vegas with my wife only, i would stay in the heart of the strip at one of the mega resorts up there. That being said, for a group of four men, this place has been awesome.

Reviews.Title: “We made the right decision staying here, loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jintyfer
Reviews.Content: We've been to Las Vegas many times but this was the first time with our toddler as well as my husband's teenage brothers (14 & 17), so the holiday had a whole new dimension for us. We deliberated for ages over where to stay as we really didn't want to stay in a smokey strip hotel because they don't have a kettle let alone a fridge which are necessary really when you have a toddler. It was a toss up between the Trump (their rooms are condos with small kitchens and are non-smoking/gaming) and Tahiti Village. We chose Tahiti in the end and loved it. It was just perfect for our needs. Great outdoor space, HUGE rooms - we had a small one-bed suite and a large one which were connected and we couldn't believe how much room we had, it was brilliant. The kitchens were also well stocked. We had hire car and didn't mind having to drive everywhere - there isn't much in walking distance of the hotel you see. The pool area is fab - our toddler loved the beach area and the teenagers had lots of fun in the lazy river and playing pool volleyball. Ok, so it's not a 'cool' strip hotel but we visited a different one every morning for a buffet breakfast (Planet Hollywood, Aria, T.I., The Wynn, etc..) which was great so we still got the Vegas experience. Plus the teenagers babysat for us a few nights so we could go out and enjoy ourselves. All in all a great holiday and I have no complaints about the hotel. Can't comment on the restaurants as didn't use them although the reviews on here aren't too good. Oh, Tower 5 is lovely, all shiny and new. Request a room there if you're planning a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly spacious accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Susan123Derbyshire
Reviews.Content: After a week and a half of travelling and sharing a room, the whole family ws delighted to spread out in this very spacious accommodation. Our family of 2 adults and 3 children booked an aprtment style set of room, that gave us 2 seperate bedrooms, both ensuite, with 2 sitting rooms, plus a small kitchenette, and a larger one. With 4 televisions everyone was happy; we also cooked in twice. The pool area was busy, and we didn't visit it, but the kids loved the "lazy river" which we thought was pretty good value all in all, adn a bit different to the normal hotel pool setup. It all felt much more like staying in an apartment thatn a hotel which suited us fine; we had been to a supermarket and came ready to do our own breakfasts etc, which worked well. The loction wasn't perfect, and our room overlooked a parking lot and an electricity substation, but we didn't come to Las Vegas for the views from the hotel, and that apartment was so well appointed we didn't care about the view. Another big plus was the very efficient shuttle bus system (free) operated by the hotel which we made good use of.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: evans522
Reviews.Content: I stayed at T.V. Oct 6th - 10th for a family get together. We stayed in Bldg 5 on the 4th floor in a lock off unit. I usually stay at a Marriott timeshare so I was pleasantly surprised with the size off the lock off unit. This unit was basically a small 1 bedroom because you had a door dividing the living room and bedroom. The pool was nice for my kids being that it had a sand entrance with sand toys readily available. There were also 2 ledges. One was 3" deep and the other was 1' deep. We never attempted the lazy river because the water was cold and the air temperature was only in the high 70's / low 80's. I was told by a family member that the food at Tahiti Joe's was OK at the best. For parents with little ones if you head North on L.V. Blvd roughly 1 mile, on the left is Town Square. Town Square is a upscale outdoor mall and they have a nice kids play area. You can google it and see pictures. The free shuttle runs every half hour (10am? -1am?) to New York,NY and continues to the Mirage and then back to T.V. Also on the weekend they will drop you off for a couple hours at Town Square. 3 days a week they do a grocery run but it is only for 45 minutes so shop quick. For gamblers needing a quick fix, Tahiti Joe's has electronic poker at the bar and a couple of slot machines. All in all we liked T.V. as a great option to the casino hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A highly recommended stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mrstanya228
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Tahiti Village. It is truly home away from home. Although it is about a mile from the strip, the free shuttle is a great asset to utilize. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only downfall I would have to report is that the free shuttle isn't 24 hours a day, resulting in a $20 (one-way) taxi drive from the strip. The hotel's pool is awesome, and it is a great place for a family to stay, enjoy and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Family Trip in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SalChoto
Reviews.Content: Very good experiences on the two trips in which we had stayed there as family vacation trips. My kids loved the pool with beach sand around it, as well as the lazy river which was very relaxing. Tahiti Village gives us the impression that we are not in busy Las Vegas, but a relaxing paradise with the whole family. In addition, we saved a lot of money and ate healthier by cooking our meals every day as we reserved a room with a full kitchen. I couldn't even tell that we were in Vegas until the night, when we would go to the casinos after the kids were sleeping from a busy day in Tahiti Village. We did not have any problems with the staff, they were very good in our two trips. My only suggestion would be to add more days to cleaning the rooms when someone is staying on it. As right now, they only clean the room one time during someone's staying as far as I understood. HIghly recommended as a family vacation in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to go and worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: rayj501
Reviews.Content: As owners of the time share at Tahiti Village we are very pleased at the constant friendliness of the staff and the high level of service. The comp's provided by the management are great. Rooms are spacious (Bora Bora) and the steam shower and jaccuzzi are great after walking during the day. When we have a need whether it be from housekeeping or the front desk area we have it in minutes - service is better than on many cruise ships we have been on. Shuttle service saved us several hundred dollars in car rental, but does require some planning and walking to attend shows on the strip. Would like if they had more grocery shuttles (only three times per week) as had to pay for taxi when we came in on late Wednesday. Overall, a very relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “spacious clean suite, great location”
Reviews.Author: blink4321
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed our 2 nights stay. The hotel is about 2 miles from the strip. Our room is spacious and clean. The staff was friendly. We enjoyed our quiet rest without the the hussle of the main strip. Hourly shuttles brought us to the strip without any problems. Woud stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: taglf01
Reviews.Content: My FIL gave us his exchange on his timeshare for our anniversary. This was my first adult vacation that wasn't at an all-inclusive resort so that was an adjustment, but I can't take that out on the resort. Our room had everything you would need. Dishes, flatware, cutting knives, scissors, dishwasher, fidge/freezer, microwave. The pool was nice and warm the way I like it, but the lazy river was too cold for me. Hot tub was nice too. The outlet mall next door has all the souveneirs you see on the strip for 1/2 the price so do your shopping there! My husband always wanted a real cowboy hat so we went to the Boot Barn across the street and they had plenty to choose from. We took advantage of the Freemont Street shuttle. Glad we did that we had a great time there. Only complaints I have are: I do agree with some of the reviews that parking is hard to find. Had a rental car for a day and parked everytime in the parking garage. The prices at the Tiki Bar at the pool are expensive and you have to rent tubes for the lazy river. Overall we had a great stay and would go again

Reviews.Title: “A break from the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: Marnie17
Reviews.Content: The Tahiti Village is a couple of miles away from the main part of the Las Vegas strip, but the landscaping and water features make you feel like you're miles away in a lush, tropical location. The Lazy River feature was a big hit with both my 11 year old son and my 75 year old mother. The rooms were well laid-out, with a separate sleeping area, and fridge and microwave. The rooms are only cleaned once in the middle of a one-week stay. The one downside was that very few rooms have a decent view, and ours overlooked a dusty fenced-in area. There is a shuttle bus that makes two stop along the main part of the strip, and it leaves the hotel every half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant Stay”
Reviews.Author: glyma1009
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at Tahiti Village this past weekend. It was a group of 6 girls celebrating a bachlerette party. We needed a spacious unit to accomadate all six of us with plenty of space so that we can get ready before hitting the strip. We also needed a budget-friendly place to stay at so Tahiti Village was perfect. We didn't mind not staying right on the strip because it was not too far away. The pool is very nice and the jacuzzi is open for 24 hours. Also another nice thing about this hotel is that our room had a jacuzzi tub and a steam shower. It has a fully equipped kitchen with an oven, We baked a cake and cooked some food during our stay. Tahiti Village is quiet and also very good for families. We had a great time but of course if you need a big, fancy and crazy place to stay at this is not for you. For a semi-crazy kinda-mellow group. This is PERFECT. We plan to come back with our families and my 2 year old.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: ImACoutureGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort through our timeshare as a last minute trip. The resort is several blocks away from the main Strip area, but there are shuttles constantly running throughout the day and there were always Taxis out front. (Watch the drivers, we had one drive us around in a circle for a higher fare.) We liked having a quieter hotel away from everything. It was nice coming back to an uncrowded hotel at the end of the day. There was a Denny's beside the resort, in the same building as the Tahiti Joe's restaurant that was very convenient and allowed for inexpensive meals. If we go back to Las Vegas we would not hesitate to stay at Tahiti Village again!

Reviews.Title: “Best timeshare around.”
Reviews.Author: boarderbrad158
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times, and each time I am very happy with my stay. The location is right off the strip, the pools are awesome, and the rooms can't be beat. I have never payed more than $100 a night for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “would have been five stars if not for a few incidents”
Reviews.Author: katespinoz
Reviews.Content: the hotel is big and beautiful. I had a bit of a problem checking in. My mom is a timeshare owner and I'm co-owner but when I tried to check in, they told me I wasn't an authorized user. They wanted a written consent so I can check in. My mom is older and not tech savy. She has no idea how to email or fax. Anyways after like 15-20 of speaking nicely with the front desk, they finally let me check in. rooms were great! spacious, clean, We had enough plates, cups. they pots were of low quality, yes I know not to expect the good stuff but we tried to make a simple pasta with sauce and it took over an hour to make, and the pasta got stuck to the the bottom of the pot. The dishwasher not so great, but it did the job. the washer and dryer not so much. My friend used it on our last night. The wash cycle went fine. when she switched it over to the dryer it went up in flames. thank good they were all ok. just a bit of coughing and light headed, because of the smoke and intense smell of burned plastic. but what bothered us was that there was no extinguisher in the room and the one in the hallway was LOCKED!!! The staff came up to the room quickly and called the fire department and paramedics. they had to give us a new room for the night because the smell was horrible. I even think it affected the room next to us. My friends were able to get there stuff out but had to be aired out all night. The clothes that were in the dryer were taken and the the hotel staff had it washed and dryed in a few hours. overall I think they handled the situation well, not great just well. They were nice about it, but didn't even offer us a discount on our bill or a free night or anything. The incident did ruin our last night in vegas. We were celebrating a friend's 21st birthday and we had plans to go out to a club, but by the time all was solved it was well over midnight and our clothes were not ready and we were just not feeling well to go out. the incident "is under investigation" so I have to call in about two weeks to get an update. If I get offer a discount or free stay.I will gladly come back again, I will just stay away from there appliances. other things I like about the place were the shuttle service. It was mostly on time. When it was over-packed they called for a back up bus. the pool was great. It was heated and at night it felt good. the denny's next door was great. The area was quiet, so we rested well. It would have been the perfect vacation if not for the small fire. Maybe they should service their appliances more often or invest in better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Love Tahiti Village!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marlin074
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good in you cannot pay strip hotels, it has a shuttle service that take you to the strip every half hour to Mirage Hotel and New York New York (this is very convenient if you dont want to spend too much money on taxi) , the rooms are very clean and confortable....the location is perfect because is very close to the strip, less than 10 minutes, you can eat at dennys and Las vegas Outlet Center is one block away so you can walk.... Our stay was excellent!!!!! I highly recomend it...

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: Holls101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August and even though it was extremely hot, we loved the Tahiti Village. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit and just loved our room which was very clean and roomy. The grounds are well kept and the large pool is fabulous. We would stay at the Tahiti Village again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Safe, Relaxing place to be...”
Reviews.Author: Mrv617
Reviews.Content: I dont't understand how some people can have a bad review for thisplace. Check in and check out was a breeze..It was a pretty nice resort with nice pool and always clear. The lazy river was just perfect for relaxing. Never packed and we didn't have to pay for the tube although the sign says it. there are few floating around they you can just grab. The main pool was more packed than the lazy river but not at a point where you are touching each other while swimming. The hot tube is 24hr...The room was spacious, we had Moorea Room in the newer tower in the 5000's. Flat screen in the lving room and bedroom. Still had the new smell along the hallway. Elavator was quick never had to wait long for one. It was gated so really felt safe. They even have a bbq station where you can go and have your own cook out...nice.. They have a Denny's right in the resort with discount coupons...Parking is free so that's good...but hard to find. Luckily our rooms was near the parking garage and that was easy..Will come back again anytime...

Reviews.Title: “Vegas in August of 2009”
Reviews.Author: Kev1963
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas with our kids. Tahiti Village was away from the noise and things we did not want our kids to see when it got dark. Two great pools (one lazy river and one sandy beach). Large room (close to 1000 sq ft) with excellent appliances, large screen tv and large bathrooms. Shuttle ran on schedule all day to get us from the resort to the strip (about a 7 minute ride) and back with no problems. Would love to go back with the kids again.;

Reviews.Title: “Luxuery”
Reviews.Author: tmscooter101
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village is first class. It couldn't have a nicer place to stay in. The front desk people were there to greet me and they catered to my every need. I loved the pool. My room overlooked the pool. I felt like I was in paradise. It was complete luxury for me. I love the fact that they had a shuttle that took you to the strip. I do wish however that it stopped at more hotels other than just New York New York, and Mirage. But I would stay there time and time again. The cleanliness of the place was superb. I met the nicest people. The clientele of the people that stayed there at Tahiti Village seemed to be of really upper class. I really liked that too. It was one great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place and Brilliant Staff”
Reviews.Author: 2essie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we exchanged our timeshare for the Tahiti Village. What a wonderful place. The staff could not be more helpful. It was a lot quieter than staying on the strip. The hotel has a swimming pool with a sandy beach and a lazy river. The rings for the lazy river have to be paid for but I think they were about $3 for all day. It was well worth getting one and just drifting round the lazy river. Brilliant. There is transport every half hour from early in the morning until late at night and we found that they were more or less on time, which is a remarkable achievement with all the traffic going onto the strip. We were given a lovely room which overlooked the strip and the airport which was brilliant as far as we were concerned. The girl on reception went out of her way to find just the right room for us. I can honestly say that this is the very best timeshare we have been to and we have been travelling twice a year for many years. The staff really were the best. As well as the shuttle going down to the strip there was also a shopping bus three times a week. We were told to be early as it was on 'first come first served basis'. However, when the bus was full they just rang through for another bus. The lady driver on the bus helped everyone on with their shopping and nothing was too much trouble. If you want to visit the Grand Canyon, Sweetours are the ones to go with. Book it at reception. They took two of us there in a 4x4 Land Rover, we had a helecopter ride into the bottom of the canyon and the personal touch all the way round. Best day of our lives ever. As you can see I cannot rate this place highly enough. Every member of staff was the best. We couldn't choose one who was better than another. Well done Tahiti Village - Keep it up, we appreciate it. Don't worry about somewhere to eat, there is a Dennys on the premises which will put you on if you have travelled far and have no transport to get out and don't want to take the bus. Be prepared we found Vegas quite expensive $15 dollars for two cups of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pool, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: musique9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with his parents and sister for New Years 2010. We had 2 adjoining rooms and they were amazing! ROOMS: We had a "royal tahitian" 2 bedroom (which is basically 2 adjoining suites). The main room was equipped with a full kitchen and very spacious sitting room, as well as a bedroom and ensuite bathroom. The adjoining room had a kitchenette, bedroom and bath. The rooms were newly update, clean, and very spacious. We didn't do a lot of cooking but the kitchen was very well equipped (and there are BBQ facilities on site) so if you wanted to do all your meals at the resort you definitely could. POOL: The pool is beautiful and HUGE! Even though it was cool, we used the hot tub a lot and even tried out the main pool and lazy river. The pool area was kept very clean and we saw them drain the hot tub fully for cleaning as well (always a good sign). I would love to go back during the summer so I could use the pool more. SHUTTLE BUS: This service was very convenient and generally ran on time. The drivers were friendly and helpful. RESTAURANTS: Cannot comment as we did not ever eat there. STAFF: All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Overall, this was a wonderful place. We didn't spend much time at the resort but we definitely could have - the grounds are beautiful and the rooms are huge. It is very busy and there are lots of kids, so it wouldn't be my recommendation if you are looking for a quiet, peaceful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Despite many, many flaws, would go again.”
Reviews.Author: goldilocksbaby
Reviews.Content: Near the Rental Car Return and Las Vegas Outlet, with easy drive to Southpoint, "M", and Green Valley Casinos, or the strip, this resort relies on a Tahitian ambience. The rooms are large, but our unit's carpet did not seem totally fresh. There were gates that lock but the entry security doors did not always work. Our unit's door needed to be pulled in order to lock. The mechanic could not fix it, but he was successful at fixing the broken lock on the safe. Upon arrival there was no coffee pot, no extra towels, & not enough toilet paper. A requested wake-up call on the morning of departure did not happen. Despite all, the "Lazy River" and quiet, beautiful resort with a good location prevailed. Bus to strip was helpful despite rental car. The staff was pleasant. We liked our unit, and the kitchenette was enough for us. Hot spot (Denny's) accessed in small area of lobby. Great trip, but those casinos will take your money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for family, avoid their restaurants at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: canary52
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I had a girls only vacation at the Tahiti Village. The upside is we felt very safe at Tahiti Village. It is a family place - totally. So if you want a place without kids or if you're looking for a romantic getaway, this is probably not the place for you. If you want to party till all hours, you might want a place closer to the center of the strip. For convenience sake, we went to Tahiti's Joes the first night and Denny's the second. My words of warning for both: DON'T GO!!! Tahiti Joe's is terrible TERRIBLE, inedible food, highly overpriced. Table after table the waiter asked do you want to pack this, everybody said no. Word to the managers: get a good restaurant onsite!!! You're too far from center of the strip to have food this bad. Denny's smelled bad - like sulfur, unbearable. I could barely even eat the canned soup they served there. The breakfast items my daughter ordered were no great shakes either. Go to the strip for food!!! The shuttle to the supermarket is nice, except they go at 8am and give you 45 minutes, not much time to get what you need. The shuttles are great for the most part. There was one shuttle driver I complained about because she actually hit the car in front of us, barely missed the walls of the turnaround and let go of the brake so the bus moved while people were getting off. We stayed in a one bedroom upgraded. The room in general is very nice; the bed in the bedroom is fabulous; the pullout is Horrible. Plus the louvres on the windows let in light so my daughter was up at 6am every morning. Plus they need amenitites like oven mitts though they did give dish soap and paper towels, lots of extra grabage bags and toilet paper, tissues, etc. We were able to get plenty of bath towels and whatever we needed, no problem. Could be better stocked with dishes, maybe even a blender. The maintenance guys (they replaced our tv) were nice, very responsive, almost too much so because we were exhausted the first night and had no working tv or dvd in the living room and they were determined to fix it. Mike the manager is very nice, as are the other managers, as far as I can see. Some of the front desk people (Perla for example), were not so friendly. The lazy river and pool are great, crowded but great. Cold but great. Cold because of the "waterfalls" but without cold water the pool and lazy river would have been like bathtubs so once you got used to it, it was refreshing. All in all, not a bad place. It could be great for what it is (it's not the Bellagio, guys) and should be, given the location. They need to try a bit harder.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - Just a small drive to the real action.”
Reviews.Author: lisa11130
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sat. August 14 @ 6:00pm after a long flight. I was given the advice to request a room in Tower 5 so we did so and was given a great room in Tower 5. Funny thing was another couple on the side of us did the same thing and they were told that no rooms were available. We booked thru Interval International so I don't know if that made any difference or not. I was told by a friend that the other Towers are really worn down and that Tower #5 was the newest. I did not see into any of the other rooms so I cannot confirm this. Our unit was a 2 bedroom lock-off with 1550 square feet and it was pretty nice. No great view but the balcony was nice to have even though it overlooked an empty lot. The unit had 4 flat screen TV's that were pretty big. Master bath had a stream shower that was wonderful. Plenty of pillows and blankets. Unit was clean except for our nice, new white socks were dirty from the carpets. We had one call from the front desk on our answering machine asking us to take the Timeshare tour and we never called them back because we were not interested. They never bothered us beyond that. We were told that housekeeping would be in on Tues. to clean and they did not show up so I called them for more towels and they had them to us within 10 minutes. Housekeeping came back on Wed. but then only cleaned one bedroom and did not restock toilet paper or dish soap so I called Housekeeping again and they said they would come back on Thur. and they did not. Called again and they finally came on Fri. morning and only cleaned what they had missed but they did restock everything which was very nice. The AC worked wonderfully and was kicked down to 70 degrees the whole time we were there and kept our room cool. Tahiti is off the strip quite more than we had expected but the pool and lazy river was work the extra effort to get to the strip. We had a rental car and parking was terrible due to the location of our room but that did not ruin our week stay. Kids took the shuttle when we did not take them places and they did not have any problems. Denny's was ... well Denny's and was fine for a quick meal. Pool was crowded with kids but the lazy river was not so much. There were floats around everywhere and we were told that as long as we did not remove them from the area that there was no charge. They also had large tan pool towels there for everyone to use and they said you could take them back and just leave them in your room. Any questions just ask. We were scared of going to stay here for a whole week after reading some of the reviews but all in all it was a nice stay. We have stayed on the strip at the Marriott Grand Chateau before as well as the Grandview, Club de Soleil, and Westgate. I would have to say that Marriott would have been our first choice due to location but it's pool is terrible. Tahiti Village is second. not so great location but nice pool area and fun lazy river!

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare, not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTwinkie
Reviews.Content: The facilities at Tahiti Village are quite nice - the swimming pools, Tahiti Joe's (their restaurant), we did not use the fitness room nor the spa. The room we stayed in was average, mattress in main bedroom is too bouncy so any movement will disturb your partner, the pull out sofa bed was very uncomfortable. It was nice to have a microwave and refrigerator, no LCD TVs in our room just a couple of old 27" rear projection TVs, the air conditioner was a little noisy but cooled down the room very quickly. The concierge is not what the title says, they are just time share sales agents in disguise. So while they'll offer you free or reduced rates for shows be prepared for the big push to take the timeshare tour and high pressure sales pitch. If you need actual assistance without any strings attached the front desk staff are very helpful and friendly. A couple of tips: - internet access at Tahiti Village is not complimentary ($9.99 a day), you can either go to Denny's (slow service) or sit in the Tahiti Village front lobby to get Denny's wireless signal. - as noted, Denny's service can be pretty slow but if you have coupons ($5 off if you spend $20 or $10 off if you spend $40 - which can be found in any of the LV booklets) it helps with keeping food costs down - Las Vegas Outlet Mall is a 10 minute walk from Tahiti Village which can be challenging when it 40+ C but there are plenty of good shopping deals there. There are also some good restaurants in the strip mall outside of the actual mall, they are also reasonably priced. - Shuttle service is complimentary at Tahiti Village, on a bit of a side note a 'concierge' from Tahiti Village called us at our home offering us shuttle coupons so we were under the impression that we had to pay for the shuttle... The shuttle service is very good, always on time and air conditioned most of the time - it stops and picks up at New York New York and Treasure Island. The front desk can provide you with a printed schedule. - a taxi ride between the airport and Tahiti Village is about $15 without tip whereas the airport shuttle cost is $6 per person - you can do the math...

Reviews.Title: “Good location for families with kids, spacious rooms, but a crowded place”
Reviews.Author: thkohler
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for two nights for our stop in Las Vegas. The Tahiti village was a good compromise between being sufficiently close to the Strip for the adults and the possibility to go to the pool for the kids. We booked the hotel because of a special offer on hotels.com and had 2 bedrooms and a large living room for a really good value. The rooms were in a very good shape and very clean. A large parking garage gave sufficient parking space in the shade. The shuttle bus to the New York New York Casino worked well. The downside is that the common areas (pool, grill areas) were very crowded. The Tahiti with several hundred rooms is a busy place and the possibility to let smaller children roam around is not really possible. Also, there are no nice views to be had: You either look onto the rental car center of the Las Vegas Airport about 500m away or onto a side boulevard of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brozPennsburg_Pa
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village is a beautiful hotel, the pool and lazy river were great. It is away from the strip and action but that was what we were looking for. Parking was an issue as we were in Tower 1 and there were never any parking spaces nearby, we had to park in the garage which is far. I was a little concerned about the pressure from the time share people, but I told them I was not interested, they still gave us show tickets and a goodie bag and never bothered us again. WiFi was available in the lobby towards Denny's.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: PE4thisTeacher
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying here. I was there to have some surgery and it was a great place to recouperate if you can not be at home. Nicer to have the amenties of a condo than a hotel room for recovering. We got a great deal through a timeshare owner so I am not sure it would have been worth paying $198.00 per night. It is well built and we never heard any noises other than children running down the hallways now & then ( and we had to be in kitchen to hear them). The suites had granite counter tops & the full size kitchen was very nice for a timeshare. In the deluxe suite the living room was spacious as was the bedroom & the bathroom. The bathroom in the larger suite had a jacuzzi tub and seperate steam shower. Flat screen tvs in the living room and the bedrooms. DVD player in the living rooms. We had a two bedroom suite which is actually their deluxe one bedroom suite attached to the "jr" suite through an ajoining door. The "jr" suite does not have a window in the living room or a balcony as did the deluxe. The "jr" suite had a kitchenette which consists of a sink, mini fridge and microwave. Beds were comfortable enough but I have slept in better. It is at the south end of the strip and it was nice to avoid all of the strip traffic. To the south of the resort is a lot of shopping and many different type of restaurants. Grocery stores & pharmacies were close also. There were some drawbacks as no place can be perfect. The pool was not deep enough for me. The deepest spot (which was quite small) was 4'6" and most of the rest of the pool was 3'6" or less. Great if you have young children but not so great for this adult. It was one of those sandy bottom pools so you do leave with sand everywhere. They have a lazy river that is not sandy but not any deeper. You had to rent tubes for the lazy river if you did not bring your own floating devices for $3.00 per day. There is not maid service daily unless you pay extra for it. They come clean halfway through the week. Anything we needed was brought right away. The grounds were nice. Someone mentioned the parking garage next to some seedy elements but they have either bought this and torn it down or the person was mistaken. On one side of the parking structure was a very large outlet mall. The other side was a field. It was close to the airport but with a CD player that I brought I was able to mask any noise and never noticed while sleeping. There is no gambling on site or smoking inside any of the buildings. The resort has a restaurant Tahiti Joe's. I was underimpressed. It was expensive and not so great. Except the seafood bisque and garlic bread. That was tasty but bread was $4.00 extra & bisque was $11.00. There was also a Denny's on site that I did not visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...here's a couple of things you should know before you go...”
Reviews.Author: mzkris10
Reviews.Content: The property itself is nice. It is a ways off the strip, which is a nice break from the hustle and bustle. They do provide a complimentary shuttle to TI & New York New York. The shuttle service was a nice bonus. Upon checking in, we went to our room only to discover that our door would not open. The key card worked, but the door wouldn't open. So, my husband went back tot he desk and they said they would send a maintenance person up to look at it. We waited, with all of our luggage, for 20 minutes in the blazing hot hallway before someone finally showed up. The pool and lazy river hours were somewhat limited. We booked our reservation on line and in no place did it make any mention of the hotel putting a $100 hold on your credit card for a security deposit, but when we arrived, that's what they did. Also, read the fine print on the form you have to initial and sign at check in. If you leave the keys in the room, and not in the safe in the room, you will be charged $75. I just felt like we made a reservation and were caught a little off guard by all of these 'hidden" loopholes on their end. It didn't make us feel like we were "welcome" guests at the property. Very odd...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing service - loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Bob154914
Reviews.Content: Our big family group of 10 (including children) stayed here for one week and can't say enough about how wonderful it was. The rooms are spacious and beautiful, the pool and lazy river were so fun and not too crowded, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the shuttle service was excellent. This is the best place for families to stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “You think you should look over and see the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: KatKemp
Reviews.Content: I have a timeshare with Interval International and used on of the Getaways to go to Tahiti Village with my mom for a week. We've both been to Vegas before and our trip to TV exceeded our expectations. I called the week before we left and asked if they had an airport shuttle to pick you up. They don't (it's about a $20 cab ride with tip to the resort, though), but they do have something going to the airport to do drop-offs during the week for $6 pp. When we arrived our room wasn't ready. We had requested tower 5 since it was the newest. (If we hadn't requested a specific building, we would have been able to get in.) The front desk clerk gave us a key to the pool while we waited and the bell hop took our luggage from us. On I believe, Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays, they have a shuttle that will take you to the local grocery store, "Foods 4 Less" but since we had time and knew jet lag would catch up to us, we took a cab over there and got some snacks and breakfast food for the week (F4L also sells beer and wine). There are cabs outside of TV so you really don't have to wait for one. When we returned the bell hop took our groceries as well for us and we went next door to Tahiti Joe's for a drink. We were too early for happy hour, but the prices were very reasonable for the drinks. During happy hour which is from 3-6 and 10pm-2am they have half price drinks. When we left we were able to check in and went to our room in Tower 5. I had requested a full kitchen with Interval and we were not disappointed. The kitchen here was more updated than my one at home! The room had the kitchen, a big living room, a huge bedroom and a giant bathroom with jacuzzi tub. We overlooked the BBQ area and it was fun to see all the families grilling downstairs. The pool was gorgeous with a "beach" on one side for the kids. There are a ton of chairs and umbrellas and I didn't have any problems trying to get a lounge chair. Tahiti Joe's Tiki Bar is at the pool and you can order food from Tahiti Joe's which they'll deliver to you if you want, but you can bring down your own food and drinks, too. The Tiki Bar has frozen drinks served in a 20 oz souvenir cup for $13, but you can bring it back to them to refill for $9. We spent one day at the lazy river which was also a lot of fun. Both the pool and lazy river have lifeguards all over the place. If you want to rent a tube at the lazy river, it's a $3 charge to your room, but we saw people with noodles and their own floats. (You don't have to have one to get in, but in case you do) The concierge was also very friendly. We wanted to spend a night on Fremont Street and they were really helpful when we asked what would be the best way to get there. (it happened to be the bus which is really easy to navigate and was only $7 pp for a full 24 hours). Since I was there with the timeshare I figured I would have to on a timeshare tour, but because I wasn't with my husband (it was girls week) they didn't ask. Because TV isn't on the main part of the strip, they have shuttles for you that pick you up every half half (on the hour and at 30 min) and drop you off at New York, New York, and Treasure Island. The shuttle drivers were also very nice and while we were driving explained how to get from New York, New York to Excaliber and Luxor, MGM, and how to catch the tram at Monte Carlo (across the street) to the Bellagio. For the people who have had negative comments, I'm not sure what they were looking for, but TV was a great vacation and the staff was very helpful in making sure things were easy for you. I will definitely be going back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Organized / Friendly Atmosphere - Tahiti Village, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ShaneB6
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Tahiti Village! It is a time share without the casino environment and was nice to be able to go back to that after being out at the casinos all day. The staff was friendly and I especially liked their pool and hot tub setup (beach theme). The price was right and they have complimentary shuttles that run every half hour to the strip. You can purchase discount tickets for all the main attractions/shows right at the front desk as well. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Average resort, average rooms, average service...”
Reviews.Author: sixpack069
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend, her family and I stayed at Tahiti Village for just one night July 3rd. We came into vegas a day early and stayed here before going to the resort that we booked in vegas. We were a group of seven, and the room was a little small for my comfort. We were all tired from traveling so nobody was too picky about accomadtions. Check in was a breeze...took all of 5 mins. No lines so I was pretty happy. The main pool was closed when we arrived due to a hawaiian dinner. The lazy river was refreshing and served the purpose of staying cool when it was 110 degrees. The location is not the best. Its about a 30 min walk to mandalay from the resort. We did not feel like having our brains cooked so we just drove. They do have a free shuttle that runs every half hr up till 11pm from the resort to NYNY. The other thing that was annoying was our room was FARRRRRRRRRRR from the parking garage. I mean it was a serious hike across the complex to the room. The bell boys just watched us carry our own luggage and did not offer anyt help. This blew big time!! Also no free wifi in the rooms was a big turn off. All in all the resort IMO is about a 3.5 star place. There is really nothing outstanding about it, and nothing that is terribly wrong with it either. It served its purpose of lodging for one night, I am not sure if I would stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “low budget accomodations, far from the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: tr943
Reviews.Content: stayed there in June. Typical low budget accomodations, undesirable and somewhat low budget customers. Out of the way from central Vegas. The bar located on site "Tahiti Joes" was smelly, and basically a joke. Much better values in Vegas. Stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Be nice when it's finished!”
Reviews.Author: lancysue
Reviews.Content: Were not notified that there was a hotel shuttle from the airport, so we paid slightly more for one of the local shuttles. View from our room on Floor 8 of Tower 5 was disappointing, looking out over the multi storey car park and the empty ground earmarked for the next stage of development. This was a timeshare exchange and we were expecting a full kitchen, jacuzzi and balcony but were told that Interval International frequently mess up the bookings, but we'd have to pay more if we wanted to change rooms. Some reception staff seemed to have an 'attitude' - when reporting our jammed safe problem to the concierge she told us to go back to our room and call maintenance. When we did call, Maintenance was quick to respond, although we got the impression that jammed safes happen quite often! We were also expecting 2 bedrooms but there was 1 and a (comfortable) pull-out sofa bed in the kitchen area which was less air-conditioned than the bedroom and could be noisy if the fridge started running. If we wanted on-demand movies that was $11 per film, it also seemed silly to have this facility on the smaller of the two flatscreen TVs in the unit. There's an on-site Denny's and a small shop which is useful, and Tahiti Joe's bar/grill with happy hour from 10 pm. The very strange 'welcome pack' comprised a small tube of toothpaste, shampoo sachets, fibre tablets (!) and some money-off coupons. There's a nice residents' lounge on the top floor with two terraces offering great views of the Strip (if the doors are unlocked). The grounds and pools looked great, although too full of kids for us to take advantage of the facilities (can't really complain as it's a family resort).

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, quiet, fun and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: pippster88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom in Tower 2 for three nights and TV exceeded expectations. I liked that it was away from the strip- you get a true resort, refuge feeling from that. Lots of lush green planting and very clean and well maintained. The 2 pools are well staffed by plenty of lifeguards and towel/tube rental staff. The lobby is so fresh and clean and quite, like coming home. The rooms are big, clean, well appointed with everything you need to cook, snack and relax. Our room was peaceful and quite and the AC worked like a charm, I slept like a baby every night. There were no surprises or rip-offs on my bill when I checked out-- the staff was more than helpful and highly professional. The Shuttle Bus was great- arrived every half hour and wisked us down to the strip whenever we wanted to be there- nice drivers. I can't think of anything wrong with this place-- except that it is in LV and it seems that they put money into resorts and casinos, but everything around is just ugly. No street scape, billboards, litter. That's not TV fault, but those going to LV will have to ignor the seedy underbelly of illegal workers handing out cards for "Girls Girls Girls" (prostitutes) and I find it depressing to see people exploited like that and its not for families at all. But that has nothing to do with TV--- as I said, a lovely refuge.

Reviews.Title: “dont waste your time and money oh and plan on breathing smoke!!”
Reviews.Author: kgreen21
Reviews.Content: me and hubby bought a package through his work already pre-paid.. well we got the smallest room with no balcony, table or range top that it advertised. First of all..we check in and they say they have to block $100 on my credit card for room charges we might make. okay fine,,(remember the room has already been paid for in full months ago), so we think we will use that for drinks at the bar and tahiti joes , well when we go to charge it the drinks and food to our room that only had come out to like 30 bucks they say we had to upgrade to a $300 block on my credit card to do that. the $100 was only for like in room movies and internet wich we had no intention of using. Okay.. now second complaint...the smoking man next to us made us so sick the whole time.. it came into our room all day. Third complaint, the master bedroom t.v. did not have pay per view movies or a dvd player. If we wanted to even order a stupid movie since they blocked $100 for that we had to do it out in the livingroom.. siting on the couch. This place really sucked I think. We will not ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing family vacation...”
Reviews.Author: Vinobambino
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village was absolutely amazing! Everyone we encountered was very friendly (Staff & other Guest)!! The room (Moorea Suite) was huge and didn't feel like a stuffy hotel room, it felt like home. The pool and lazy river where outstanding. They offered a lot of beach toys and foam noodle floaters for little kids.Water temperature in the pool was perfect for a hot day. The river was a little chilly but refreshing. I highly recommend anyone considering a Vegas vacation with children stay here!! We will be back several times....

Reviews.Title: “Those who don't like this place are way too hard to please”
Reviews.Author: BurlesonRodkat
Reviews.Content: We just stayed on June 6 through 13... 2010 We had two one bedroom units in building 5 and let me tell you the place is awesome! We had a view of downtown from our balcony. The Lazy river was too cool, they do need to warm the water a bit for it though, but pretty cool. The pool is awesome too and huge and warmer than the lazy river with a sand beach and vollyball net. They also have a area where they have gas grilles to cookout on and this was the talk of the week of how cool that is, we cooked out three times and met lots of really cool people. we stayed 7 nights so while we were there our kids room refrigerator went out and we called and up they came with another one. We really had zero complaints, They have free shuttle to New York New York until I think midnight or so. some people that go to places and expect nothing to go wrong with anything are kidding themselves, and really I think should never leave the house, the issue would be if something goes wrong and nothing is done about it then you have a problem, but some people can't wait five minutes for anything and thats why you have so many bad reviews of places, we have been to nice places where we have read reviews from other people saying the place was a dump, Tahitti Village for my family! We had a great time and the place is on the strip but away far enough to be quiet and lots to do at the resort for kids and we just loved it. I would recomend this place to anyone, older, younger and even with kids, we had our grown kids and they had kids and couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “you'll be charged if someone tries to break in!!!”
Reviews.Author: happyutah
Reviews.Content: well we booked a two bedroom suite for 8 of us. family. pro"s clean, large, no smoke smell. con"s no rest room fans, if they were there diddnt work. Someone tried to break into our room. when we noticed it we went right down to report it. were told security would be up in 10 min. wrong 45 min. later still no security so we called, they said another 10 min. wrong 45 min. later they came up. we got the run around for 3 more days. they just diddnt care. they have no security camera"s in the hallway. so we get to pay for the door!!!!!!! thats right they charged our credit card. They dont have anyway to finding the ones who tried to break in, so they bill the victim!!!!!! nice system. we also had pictures of all kinds of vandlisim that had went on over the weekend, i wonder who they will charge for that!!!!next time i stay in vegas, i will stay at a casino room. I know they have security cameras in the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Best damn hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Waymonlhall
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the reviews I have seen on this property, I stayed there 7 days from June 12-19, 2010. I had a one bedroom suite with a jacuzzi, a shower/sauna, full kitchen, living room and bedroom with king size bed. The hotel is spectacular and I would recommend it to anyone. It is a part of my timeshare so I decided to stay here instead of Planet Hollywood. I am so glad I did. It is within close proximity of the strip and all the stores.

Reviews.Title: “quiet retreat from chaos”
Reviews.Author: JerrySouthRiver_NJ
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village is for those who want to be on the strip but away from all the hustle & bustle. The resort offered a free shuttle to New York New York the week we were there, but will offer an added stop or two, going further down the strip starting the week of 6/21/2010. Our room was a decent size. Good size bathroom but had no counter space near the sink. We were a bit upset about the view from our bedroom...the back of the resort, open lots, parking deck, and the rental car place. But it was no big deal. We weren't spending much time in the room anyway. The bed was a bit hard for my taste but the pillows were fantastic. The kitchen area was fine. We really liked the pool area. The pool was a good size and kept clean. It was open early (8am) and stayed open late (10pm) during the week. The hot tub was nice and open 24/7 !!! How great is that? The lazy river was also nice, although in a different area. Tube rentals at $3 a day. The staff were all friendly especially the shuttle drivers and the gift shop employees. A great asset was having a Dennys on site. We didn't even try Tahiti Joe's since we felt it was a bit too high priced. Every thing and every place in the resort was very clean.Some say there is too much airport noise, but this is not true. You barely realize you are very near an airport. All in all a good experience at this place.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sheashea36
Reviews.Content: Tahitti Village really made my stay rather unpleasant. I made one reservation for June 16- June 20, 2010 with Orbitz. Upon check-in, the Front Desk charged me a $200 deposit and then told me that Orbitz sent the reservation in the wrong way because I had 2 rooms. Upon standing there another guest came in with the same reservation I had (for two rooms) and they charged him $100. I asked Dan the Manager and he told me that he would look into it, needless to say I never got a response, nor was my money refunded. I asked another manager about the deposit after I asked the Front Desk clerk why she only charged him a $100 and she informed me that $100 was the correct price and she didn't know why I was charged $200. After all this, the Manager lied to me and said the other guest was charged $200 (even though I was standing right by the Guest elbow to elbow and say and heard the $100 exchange). Well, this was not all. The Resort has a 10:00am check out time and my Flight was not scheduled to leave until the following morning at 1:45 am. Orbitz offered to pay for the additional night due to a computer error and Tahitti Village refused to accept payment from Orbitz and that they wanted me to pay the additional night. Tahitti Village advised me that Orbitz's credit card was declined (mind you this is a Corporate Credit Card). Tahitti Village's Management left me at the Front Desk for 2 hours advising me that they were working on the matter (this was my vacation) and in fact they were just sitting in the back avoiding me. Orbitz continued to call Tahitti Village and Management would not come to the phone, nor return their phone calls. This went on for two days of my vacation. Well, needless to say Orbitz found me another comparable hotel and yes their credit card went through. I am leaving Tahitti Village and vow to never return. I have never been treated like this in the 37 years I have been living. I never knew businesses refused payments from someone willing to pay for an error that was made by both Businesses with no fault from the customer. My stay was not enjoyable because of the unprofessional, terrible, rude, and non customer friendly staff on Management level. PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME, MONEY, AND STATE OF MIND AT TAHITTI VILLAGE, 7200 LAS VEGAS BLVD.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: PaulV39
Reviews.Content: After reading through some of the reviews on this and other sites I was concerned that the resort service levels would minimize our travel experience. Our entire trip was very enjoyable and the service level was great. We stayed in the fifth tower and enjoyed a great view of the lazy river and the Strip in the background. This was an ideal location if you want to enjoy the “sites” Vegas has to offer without overwhelming your children with everything that “Sin City” has to offer. We took daily excursions to Lake Mead, the Hoover Dam, the Grand Canyon and Red Rock Conservation area, combined with relaxing time at the resort we and our children enjoyed our 7 day stay. We travelled with my wife’s parents so we were able to enjoy a few adult nights on the strip, while still providing our kids a great vacation. The staff was very helpful notably Mikey at the concierge table who seems to know everybody in Vegas and can get you set up wherever you want to go. The facilities were well maintained and the entire resort was kept very clean. We rented a car while we were there, but on the nights that we went out we were able to get back to the resort from the strip with a cab fare of less than $20.

Reviews.Title: “Pool was so cloudy and hot, paid for a room a another hotel”
Reviews.Author: beckiesandiego
Reviews.Content: What's really interesting is I wrote this first review on June 7th from our other hotel we paid for JUST so we could use the pool. The grounds are very pretty there but the pool was cloudy and very hot. After many conversations with management that went nowhere I was told the temp was 83. It was so hot that I couldn't swim laps plus I was grossed out putting my face in the murky water. My husband flat out refused to use it. We were there for 5 nights celebrating our 20th, so dissappointed with the pool. All we wanted was to check out early and get our money back. Expedia who we booked it through was no help as the management wasn't either. Our tv was also blurry. And a maid knocked on our door at 8:45 check out morning wanting to know if we were out yet. It was bad enough that the check-out time was 10 and yes you had to sign, you would pay double if you weren't out. Hey, we wanted out early and they wouldn't let us go. We would never stay there again, nor recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Shonus
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! While you're at the resort it doesn't don't feel like you're in Vegas (except for the heat). But it's close to the strip so you can easily get the real Vegas in no time. They have a shuttle system that runs every 30 mins to and from the strip. The one downside to the shuttle is that it stops at 1:20am. Cuts your night short. At the resort they have an amazing lazy pool with water falls. We spent hours just floating around in tubes. The happy hour at Tahiti Joe's (bar at resort) is the best deal on drinks in Vegas. $1.50 beers & $3 mixed drinks. I will be coming back to Tahiti Village over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again or recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: thtfatkid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tahiti Village from june 4th- june 7th and i had a problem with my payment. I originally booked my reservations through booking.com on May 18th gave them all my credit card info and even got my conformation number and prinrted it. With paying bills and buying stuff for the trip i never noticed that in the whole 3 weeks before my stay the payment never came out. At check in everthing was fine they took a 100 deposit and i stayed for 3 nights. Now just remember i booked my room 3 weeks prior to my stay and nobody bothered to contact me about the non payment, also nobody contacted me during my 3 night stay. Well when i went to check out they said i owed them money for my stay, mind you i'm in Las Vegas and i did lose alot of money gambling. I told the manager i never knew the payment didn't come out and that i lost money during my stay. She was very rude and very unprofessional and told me to stop trying to get away with a free room. I explained to her that i booked 3 weeks prior and why didn't somone contact me before my stay, and if payment wasn't accepted why was i allowed to check in and stay my 3 nights. She said they didn't want to bother me. So she used my credit card on file for payment and i went negative in my account and had to pay 2 overdraft fees.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: willosc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great. Perfect for families. Great Atmostphere. Loved the grilling area. Main pool is huge, and great for the kids (sand area). Lazy river also loads of fun. The rooms are large, the kitchenette comes in very handy when traveling with kids. Staff could be more polite. It is very clear they are not happy attending to your needs. We had to wait a long time for towels. If you are able to overlook this, the hotel stay is great. Both pools require room card to get in, which is great for security reasons. Hotel also provides a shuttle to and from the strip (New York, New York) unitl late at night. However, late shuttles do become crowed, and might require extra time waiting on the next shuttle. Parking could also be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Loved it...and would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Purduegolf1
Reviews.Content: Now, let me preface this review with the fact that we had toured Tahiti Village on the first day ever of timeshare presentation on a previous trip...so we already had know that the facility was beautiful. So, when i booked through II, i was pretty confident that we were going to love the place. Then i started to read some of the other reviews and was a little skeptical. But here are my thoughts. We arrived late (around 11:30pm) on Wednesday night, May 26th of Memorial Day weekend. There was no one in the check in line (of course) so no waiting. The nice lady at the counter had originally put me in a room that she called "Mountain View" but i asked if there was anything overlooking the pool. She checked again and found a room on the 6th floor #5610 in the Number 5 building...which was perfect because i read that was the new, nice one. Parking is a pain. The parking garage was the only area that we found to park, but that is a ways away from our room. But whatever. We aren't picky. And we could use the exercise. Took the elevator to the 6th floor and walked all the way to the end of the hallway and our room was on the right. Opened the door and WOW...it was beautiful. Huge full kitchen, dining room table, family room, nice size balcony overlooking the lazy river and off in the distance you could see the strip. The bedroom was large and the bathroom was even larger than i expected. The sinks, a jacuzzi tub which never got used, a shower with a steamer which i attempted to use once for about 5 seconds when i felt like i couldn't breathe anymore (apparently not for me). Then about 2 days later, i discovered we had a washer and dryer too. Not that we planned on using it though. But definitely nice for those that might. Overall the room was FANTASTIC!! We woke up the next morning and were told to go to the concierge desk for a parking pass for the week since we had only gotten a temp. pass the night before. So, we did so and he also gave us a little welcome packet with some coupons to Denny's and Tahiti Joe's, and some other shows and things to do on the strip. It was a nice touch. He mentioned that we could do an II presentation and get tickets to a show for free in return and we thought about it, but the 11:45 time just didn't work into our schedule. He mentioned that the resort was doing a luau on Saturday night and we could prepay and save money. We were planning on doing it because it sounded like fun, but got distracted in downtown Vegas and ended up not going back for the Luau...glad we didn't prepay. The concierge was very helpful and i'm glad he was located right on the first floor for convenience sake. I had read that the BBQ area gets pretty busy most nights...and it was...looked like fun. But never did get to use it. I did wake up one morning and use the workout room and a treadmill. It was pretty big...about 5 or 6 treadmills, weights and a bike. Pretty good. I did use the lazy river on Sunday...i was determined to use at least one of the amenities that drew us back to this place. DH however hates pools and things so i was solo on this adventure. Went down in the late afternoon, around 4ish and i had read that they charge for tubes, but there were lots laying around, so i just grabbed one, threw my sandals to the side and plopped in the water. Went around about 10 times...it took about 45 minutes maybe?? but the one thing which is just a complaint of mine and maybe i wouldn't care in the middle of summer when it is 120 degrees out but i wasn't really in the mood to get soaking wet, just wanted to float around in a circle and relax and there are all these waterfalls and shooting water thingys throughout the route which the kids really seemed to love, but me, not so much. But i just managed to paddle my way around them, hold onto the the wall and guide myself when needed and it was fine. Like i said, i didn't want to get soaking wet, maybe most might like to... But didn't get to use the pool...we did go take a look at it--AWESOME...if we had more time, i would have. But gambling was our main reason for our trip. The location is a bit far from the strip. But we had a rental car so didn't mind. We have learned the back roads to take if we needed to go somewhere faster. But the bonus is it is quiet...didn't even hear the airport noise. We did see the shuttle and lots of people using it, but again, we had the car and didn't need to. I-215 is 1 traffic light away, so very easy to get around. Ate at Denny's one morning. It was busy but convenient. Didn't get to Tahiti Joe's, but wish we had. Overall, the place was fantastic. I'm glad we traded our timeshare for this place. We thought we would like it and we weren't let down. It has everything. Great for families, great for people with cars. If you don't have a car, the shuttle might not work out so well all the time. But at least there is an option. Staff was friendly, grounds were very clean, room was spacious and very nice. I would definitely stay here again...100%!! Thanks Tahiti Village! You've done a great job! :)

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely LOVED Tahiti Village”
Reviews.Author: carrielle
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas May 27th-June 1st for my wedding and shared a Bora Bora suite with my 6 year old and my mother. I cannot say enough nice things about the staff and conditions of Tahiti Village Resort. We booked through a friend who had a timeshare and got a guest pass. The pool, lazy river, and hotel all were just beautiful. The pictures really don't do this hotel justice, it is GORGEOUS inside and out!! I would love to stay there again if we ever go back to Vegas. The spa jet tub and steam shower were also wonderful. That tub could easily fit 3 people it is so big. I want to go back just to take a bath there again! We also enjoyed the fitness center and the activities room. If you have children this is the place to stay. It's far enough away from the strip to keep them safe from the mishappenings of Vegas but still close enough (with free shuttle) to enjoy all that Vegas has to offer. Also it was easy to sleep as it was not your typical noisy until 4AM Vegas hotel. It was a family place first and foremost.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort with fabulous lazy river”
Reviews.Author: tennisplayerbbb
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our time share for Tahiti Village which is just past the airport. Our one bedroom Bora Bora in bldg. 2 was spacious and nicely decorated. We were less than 10 min. from the main strip area. The hotel does provide a shuttle which runs about every 30 min. and goes to New York-New York casino. This is an excellent destination resort. It has a very large salt water pool with a sand beach. The children there were having a blast! There is a hot tub which is relaxing and not far from the sand area, so when kids/adults got too cold, they could warm up before heading back into the pool. While the pool is warm, the wind on one of the days was blowing and was cold, so once anyone got out of the pool, he/she was cold. The best part is the lazy river. There is a $3 charge for tubes, and despite the sign saying that you have to rent them, they told us we could bring in our own. So we went to a nearby Dollar Tree and bought two noodles and drifted around the river. What fun! So relaxing! There are two workout rooms, one in the bldg. you check in and one in Tower 5, the newest and largest of the bldgs. There are two restaurants on site: Tahiti Joe's and Denny's, but one can just walk a little further and find lots more restaurants to eat in. The concierges were excellent with their directions and advice. Overall, it's a wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: 508river
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful, all the workers were extremely friendly and helpful. The shuttle is great. Spent a week there and enjoyed it all. Pool and lazy river are great!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Setti21
Reviews.Content: It's a good location a couple of miles from the Strip. The resort runs a shuttle every hour so it's easy to get to the casinos if you want to go there. It's far enough, however, that it is a totally calm place to be. The concierge desk was a disappointment. They are so obviously on commission from these various tour operators and restaurants. They are pushy and make you take their signed cards when you go to restaurants to make sure they get the sales credit. That is not a service, it's almost as annoying as telemarketing. Upon check-in, our room was not ready and everything took forever. The room and the pool were nice though. I would have liked free wifi, but that's not available. You can hire mobile internet dongles from the front desk for $7 a day though. Overall we had a nice week-long stay in there and I would consider going again.

Reviews.Title: “A really great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gogrammygo
Reviews.Content: We booked this 1-week stay through Interval International. We were so pleased. This resort has everything. The pools are great and there is a lazy river to float around. The place is spotlessly clean and the staff is very friendly and responsive. The elevators were always quick to come and there is plenty of parking. The only down side was the internet service setup. You have to go get a modem and install their software to access the internet. The business center charges a min. charge of $5.00 plus the timer keeps running. It took $10 just to check my e-mail. Great place though. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort - Which Happens to be in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Skinsfan76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 y/o son for 8 days and really enjoyed the resort. The overall facility is amazing and won't disappoint. We reserved through a travel website and aren't time share owners, but that didn't seem to make a difference while staying. Check-in was a breeze and was very quick. We rented a car and it was nice that this resort is litterally around the block from the rental car center. Because we had a car, you have to get a parking pass (even though I'm not sure that anyone ever checks for it since I never put my pass on the dash). This forces you to go to the concierege which is their time-share selling side. I just let them know we weren't interested and was on my way. We rented a 1 bedroom Bora-Bora room. IT WAS HUGE!!! The amount of room was impressive, even for a time-share property. We had a full kitchen with all pots/pans/ect. We did call to get some measuring spoons though. The porch is nice, but we were looking out on a cleared lot. Not the best view, but unless you have a pool view, I don't think you are going to get a nice out side look. The bed was comfortable and the tv's were both flat screens. Bathroom had a ton of space and the steamer in the shower is great. We also had a stacked washer/dryer. Small capacity and drying took forever, but nice convience. Like most long term stay places, you don't get daily maid service. You just put your trash out into the hallway and it get's picked up. We just picked up what we needed from the maids in the hallway if we ran out of something. We were staying in building 5 and were about as far from the pool as you can get here and it still wasn't bad at all. The main pool is great. We never had any problems finding chairs regardless of the time of day we went. The pool was opened from 8am-10pm the entire time we were there except one day. The sand beach is really great and our son loved it. You get your towels from the life guards and just have to show your room key. They also have some life vests for small kids.
