We didn't use it since my son has his own swimming vest. The lazy river was nice. You pay $3 to use their tubes. My only complaint is that all the waterfalls can get annoying. The lazy river was opened from 10am-8pm every day we were there except one. We ate at Denny's once and it was fine. Denny's is the same anywhere. Service isn't great, but the food was. We didn't try Tahiti Joe's, but my friend did and said it was horrible food, prices, and service. They also have a couple of slot machines there. There is a small convience store on site as well which was pretty well stocked and had decent hours. The work out rooms were okay at best. They have two of them and there were never anyone in them. The treadmill speeds aren't calibrated correctly and won't go very fast. Dpends on what you do. I brought this up, but it wasn't corrected while we were there. I know they have a spa there as well, but we didn't use it. There is a large outlet mall litterally across the street from the resort. In their parking lot there is a ton of choices for restaurants and fast food it you want as well. There are also two gas stations on the corner there. They have shuttles running to the strip all day, but we never used them since we didn't have to. Overall this was a great place and my family loved it. We would stay again. You aren't stuck going through casinos and smoke if you don't want to. They keep the facility immaculate and really did cater to anything we needed. It was a great place for our son and you can be immersed in Vegas as much or as little as want here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: brit0308
Reviews.Content: This place was great! My family and I stayed at the Tahiti Resort in May for 5 days. We stayed in the room with a kitchenette and 1 bedroom. The rooms were very clean and very big (not like average hotel room). The place had a pool and a lazy river. The lazy river was $3 per tube per day. The main pool was quite big. It had little huts around it for those who like shade and plenty of chairs. It also had a little "sand beach" at one end of the pool which was where the kids played. There wasn't free wireless in the rooms but right beside the lobby you can catch free wireless from Denny's. The location was great...about 5 minute drive from the strip but far enough to get away from the busy strip. There was a free shuttle that would come every half hour and take you to the strip. It would drop you off at one end of the strip (near the Tropicana hotel) or you could stay on the bus and it would drop you off at the other end of the strip (near Treasure Island). The shuttles were always on time so it was very convenient. The shuttles would also take people to the local grocery store every couple of days for one hour in the morning. -That was also free. There was a Denny's located right on the property -very handy -open 24hrs a day. There was also a restaurant called Tahiti Joes located on the property as well. -Didn't check it out though because it seemed a bit pricey. There are a lot of restaurants across the street (about a 5 minute walk) -restaurants like Chili's... (chain restaurants) There is also an outlet mall across the street. (Got some good deals there) Tahiti Village offers the guests free parking as well. The place is a timeshare but don't worry- they do not hassle you at all to buy any time shares... not like a lot of other places I have stayed at. Overall friendly staff and an excellent place to stay in Vegas! I would definately recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: newfie_penney
Reviews.Content: We are owners and stayed for the first time. Everything was great. We stayed in the Moorea - a little small but we didn't want to spend time in a room with a pool area like that. It was great and the kids loved the lazy river. We had a blast. Great sleep. We also had supper at Tahiti Joes - it was really really good - we enjoyed all we ordered. Pool side drinks good price for Vegas. We didn't have much dealings with the staff as we only stayed one night - but front desk seemed nice. The pool area sold us when we bought in - and it still does. It was truly great. The one great thing is that you can get away from the bells and whistles of the casinos. Also, there is a free shuttle service which goes to Tropicana and Treasure Island - I think they run every 20 min. ending about midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Las Vegas Resort A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: When going to Las Vegas you hear time and time again you can only stay there 3 to 4 nights without going crazy, Tahiti Village will change your mind, one week is perfect! We had four Bora rooms, which is a one bedroom with a full kitchen for the week. The steamer in the shower put the rooms over the top,WOW! Everyone in our group loved it. The rooms were spotless, the pools are fantastic and the staff is always there when you need anything. Not one complaint from our group of 8. When checking in, I requested the new tower and all rooms on the same floor, this was taken care of ahead of time so check in was a breeze. We used the barbecue area several times. It's cleaned daily and the people down there made it a party, enjoying drinks, visiting and everyone loved the place. Tahiti Joe's delivers to your room and has full service at the pools. We had two meals and both were great. Julie the bartender was awesome, she made it fun to hang out. Town Square across the street makes you not even care if you go down to the strip. Blue Martini is a must, best happy hour in Las Vegas 4pm-8pm! This is one of the top 5 pools in all of Las Vegas. Everyone in our group is still talking about the great week! Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel off the Strip at a great price”
Reviews.Author: YYCvacationer
Reviews.Content: My dad and I stayed here for a couple of nights in early May. I was a little skeptical of the price ($63/night), as many other reputable hotels were around $110 and up. I couldn't have been happier with the hotel. Big rooms, toaster, microwave, fridge, plates, bowls, glasses, our room had everything. You could travel to Vegas for pretty cheap if you stayed here, as you could cook a lot of your own food (BBQ outside in the common area). Pool and Lazy River were great. They were clean, and even had a little sand area for the kids to play in. Lots of life guards for everyone's safety. There is a shuttle that drives you to the Tropicana as well as Treasure Island, as well as Tahiti Village. There is also trips to the grocery store on Monday, Wednesday and Friday Would go back in a second

Reviews.Title: “Nice little gem away from the craziness”
Reviews.Author: chingmax
Reviews.Content: If you like Vegas, but don't need to be in the middle of everything and want a great place to stay, this is it! Was surprised to find there is a small day spa, so while the family went to the pool, I spent some time on myself and had a wonderful facial and something called a gold algae wrap. I felt very pampered! The pool and lazy river are wonderful! The kids just loved the sandy beach and the waterfall seemed to drown out some the noise from the airport. Stand at the pool and look around and you won't be able to tell you are in Vegas... could be a plus, could be a minus, depends on what you are looking for! Close to some outlet shopping, always a plus. And they even had activities for the kids. All in all, it had something for all of us, no matter what our idea of a relaxing vacation would be...

Reviews.Title: “The Best just beautiful and luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: visionYarrawonga
Reviews.Content: This was our favourite place we stayed in on our holiday. It was just a short taxi ride from the airport and i knew i was going to love it as soon as we pulled up. We had a king size bedroom with a pullout bed for the kids in the lounge. The rooms were just beautiful. We had a huge plasma is the bedroom with a huge ensuite as well. We had also our own washer/dryer so that was handy to catch up on the washing. The kitchen was beautiful as well. The kids got to use the pool one day and they enjoyed that i wish we had more time to use it. The complimentary bus that toook you to the strip was handy the only dissapointment was that it didn't take you all the way down the strip at night but other wise excellent. The Tahiti was also located near the Outlet shopping centre and chain restaurants as well. On the premises there is a Denny's Restaurant which i thought was wonderful untill my husband got sick on a burger there so that was a huge let down, but the other restaurant Tahiti Joe's was alot better. Overall we had a wonderful time at the Tahiti Village we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places we have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: blackhillscuster
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village is a participnt in the Interval International Resort Exchange program and has nightly rentals as well. We stayed there the last week in January, 2010 and had a wonderful time. The rooms are beautiful and the landscaping is like a Caribibean Island with a lazy river that you can float tubes in and a huge hot tub. The staff was cheerful and very helpful. The resort is not far from the strip and the airport but isn't noisy or hard to get to

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay if you have young Kids”
Reviews.Author: erdnistransky
Reviews.Content: Our overall review is FANTASTIC. We travelled with our 3 year old and do not drink or gamble. Check in at around 7 PM took 5 minutes. Staff was VERY friendly. The pool area is great and if the weather would have cooperated we would never have left it. Our only issue was that at 10 in the morning we did laundry in tower 5 and then threw the clothes in the dryer. We did not return till 10 PM and the clothes were gone. My husband did find 1 of our daughters dresses mixed in with someone elses. We assume kids were playing a prank, mixed peoples laundry up and someone did not notice they had our clothes. Naive??....oh well, it was only some kids close that will easily be replaced. Our last 2 days were quite cold and my only suggestion would be that someone in the area carry kids DVD's to rent or to buy. We did not have a car and taxis are expensive to travel around. The village was amazingly clean and very quiet at night. We stayed in tower 1. Most activities are in tower 5 so ours did not have a lot of hallway traffic. The kids activities were awesome. The candy treasure hunt and rootbeer floats for $2 each were a hit. They have lifejackets for toddlers and loads of beach toys for everyone. I can not say enough about the sand beach/pool. I have never seen one like this before. Why everyone does not do this I can't fugure out. A pool will never be the same for us and our daughter will never accept anything less. The maximum depth of the pool is 31/2 feet. The lazy river is subtanitally cooler than the pool because it is more shaded. If your vaction is primarily to have fun with your kids and enjoying wathcing them play then this is the perfect place for you. The shuttle did take us to the strip and we enjoyed walking around. First went to Circus Circus and the Mirage. Extremely disappointing. Not sure what we expected but the air quality was discussting and my eyes were burning within 5 minutes. After that we mainy stayed outside. We were only out till around 10PM but still felt safe walking around pushing a stroller. Lots of others with kids as well. We went up the Eiffel tower then headed back to the village. When I could not find a sink stopper for the kitchen I called and one was brought within 15 minutes. Whenever you passed a staff member they were always very polite and courteous. We never ONCE got asked about anything regarding a time share or tour. Our daughter got a bad cold and fever on our first night and when I enquired at the front desk about a nearby hospital they showed great concern and gave me detailed info. Although we never needed to use it, everytime we went by the desk the lady inqured about her health. It really seemed that they cared. We had a onebedroom and it was all new and very clean. I read the other reviews and can not imagine what they are talking about and how they encountered such a different experience than ours. My only complaint (and not a great one) was the food at Tahiti Joes. The place was practically empty and we ordered steak but still had to wait an hour. For the price it would have tasted better off my barbecue. But in all fairness I am used to grass fed canadian beef and should know that it would not be comparable. We ate at Dennys several times and the food was good. The staff was also very friendly. I felt as though we had stayed in a top notch resort. If you need daily maid service this is not the place for you. We ran out of toilet paper mid week and just grabbed some (with permission) from a cart in the hallway. Everything was as advertised and we knew that we would not be interupted with daily service. It was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Timeshare Resort”
Reviews.Author: kenrabs
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vegas and we stayed at Tahiti Village through an Interval International timeshare exchange. The resort is on the south end of the Vegas Strip a few minutes drive from Mandalay Bay. We rented a car through price line and the airport rental car bay is right around the corner from the Tahiti Village parking garage so once we got the car we were there in about a min. We arrived early and did a pre check in at noon and went to lunch and got a call our room was ready about 1:30 and finished checking in. After visiting the concierge and passing on the timeshare tour we were never bothered by them again. I asked for a room in tower 5 the new section and was given room 5146. It was a first floor room facing the lazy river. I was worried it would be noisy being near an exit door but we had no issues with noise during our stay. The room was a 1 bedroom suite that was spacious and clean and. The furnishings were fine and avg comfort. 2 large TVs in the living and bedroom were nice and liked the breakfast bar and stools that seperated the kitchen from living dinning room. The Kitchen ad most everything needed to cook with nice appliances. There were nice sliding doors to the patio from the living room, but could use a screen slider as well. The bathroom was spacious with a shower/sauna and large whirlpool bathtub and dual sink vanity. The bedroom had a king bed that was ok for comfort but wished they had better pillows. Like most timeshares there is a midweek housecleaning. If you need items before or after the cleaning you can ask housekeeping or call them. We don't make much of a a mess in our room so we passed on the midweek cleaning. The grounds are well groomed and clean with a tropical feel. The gas grillsarea with tables are used often and clean by staff daily. The pools are nice and clean with plenty of lifeguards on duty. My only negatives with the resort deals with the lazy river only open from 10-4:30 and the pool open from 10-8. The lazy river should be open longer and does come witha $3 fee for a tube which you can only use theirs. Also a good number of the pooloungers were damaged and need to be replaced. The hot tub is open 24hours if I do remeber. There was a workout room in building 5 and also an activity room in building 5 with a pool table, fooseball table and TV. Resort kid activities take place here also. Activities have a small fee and we didn't do any on site activities. We did eat in and take out at the Denny's on site for breakfast. It was a good easy option and was well staffed and clean. We did not go to Tahiti Joes the other on site restaurant. It does have some gaming and does have pool drink service huts. Rides from the resort to the main part of the strip range from 10-25 min depending on traffic. Parking on the strip was easy at every resort we visited. We never used the free resort shuttle during our stay. For show tickets there is a Tickets 4 tonight office by the McDonalds after you pass the Vegas sign. If you want discounted tickets for that evenings shows this is a good place to visit. We got Cher tickets for $65 plus $5 service charge. They had a good selection of shows at great rates. Go early as they open at 9 or 10 to get hard to get shows. They also have restaurant discounts. The Hoover Dam is about 45 min from the resort and parking is $7 and tours run about $30. We just walked around and passed on the tour. We had a great stay in Vegas. I found a lot of the complaints about the resort are over blown. The staff was friendly, our room was in great condition. Parking was hit or miss but parking in the garage wasn't that bad. The walk from it to the rooms is a small issue only if you have problems walking and never bothered us. The clientle of the resort was a mixed bag with lots of families especially on the weekend. Check out was quick and easy. They do a $100 deposot on your card at check in and if you need in room internet cost is $40 for the week or $7 a day and you have a $50 deposit for the modem. I would have no issue staying here again. It's a greta place for families and those not wanting to stay on the strip. There is plenty of shopping near by also.

Reviews.Title: “The worst in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Xbebe111
Reviews.Content: This place I think it will be good if they hire new people to run this place, my experience was terrible I traveled from maryland and when I got there at 11 pm I was rol I didn't have a room since they were sold out, the girl at the front desk was rude she didn't even bother to look for another room for us, they claimed that all the area was sold out and I was Paying a really cheap rate for them to look for another room. They told me come back the next day at 10 am to get my room which it will be ready, when I got there they told me check in was at 4pm so I have to wait ! .. I spoke to 3 different people at the desk and all of them keep changing their story ! I will not recomend this place at all

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, felt like a tropical vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Kat1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a small suite, which was still really large and laid out well. The room was spotless and well laid out. My kids slept on the pull out couch and my husband and I on the king bed in the bedroom. We loved everything about this hotel. We did not have housekeeping, but did call for extra towels. The pools were so much fun, one had a beach and there was a lazy river that was just so much fun for the kids. We traveled with our 6 & 8 year old. We would definitely stay here again. We were in building 5, everything was new and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “"I would not stay here again!"”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ077
Reviews.Content: We have owned a unit in Tahiti Village since before it was built. We have never stayed there before this last trip. We will never stay there again. Our room was shabby, worn furniture, open drain in closet (horrible smell), and fire alarm beeping at 6:00 am. The hall was dirty and was not swept. Our patio looked out on the Denny's parking lot. We discussed this at our owner's meeting and were told we should have made it known that we were owners when we booked the week, and then we were taken on a tour of the "nice" tower - slap in the face to us. The resort is a considerable distance from casinos and the shuttle (although it does run on time during the day) stops at 11:00 pm. When we purchased this unit everything was projected to be "beautiful", it was not. We have stayed in other time share properties that were fantastic - not this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KrissySno
Reviews.Content: I checked into Tahiti Village on April 7th. My family was staying there for 4 nights. When we first arrived we were quite early (forgot the time change), and the staff was really pleasant about providing us with a guest pass so we may enjoy the pool while we waited for our room to be ready. When I did ask about our room, the gentlemen at the front desk warned me that I may not receive a room with a washer/dryer because I booked through expedia/hotels.com. Through these sites, apparently we're only entitled to rentals, not owned suites (timeshares). I requested a room with a washer/dryer though & my request was fulfilled. Our room was ready about 2pm local, which was great since apparently check-in is 4pm. The rooms were great, we had a Bora Bora room. However I really did NOT like the bathroom. It was like our entire bathroom was a shower. There was no jacuzzi tub, but small price to pay for the washer/dryer. We received a welcome package too when we checked-in. Everything was great, loved the suite. It was convenient to the parkade & lazy river. There is gaming onsite (keno, a couple slot machines, & video poker) until 2am at Tahiti Joes. The drink specials are 1.50 from 10pm-2am! Ryan, one of the bartenders is great & will make sure you're well taken care of! The resort is located about 1.5km/1Mile away from the Callaway Golf Centre, where there's a challenging Par 3 (I know, I know) & a driving range. Allowed to Demo Callaway products there. The AceGold Bus & Deuce does not run all the way to Tahiti Village after midnight. We had to get off at the Callaway location & walk. It's not that far, but it's unlit & a tad scary. Cabs are rediculously expensive from the strip & despite asking them not to, they'll bomb over to the interstate & go the scenic route. My children loved the pool & the jacuzzi. At night it seemed there was ALWAYS someone in the jacuzzi. Oh yeah, no free Internet at this place. It's 7 bucks a day with a 50 dollar deposit. Oh well, on vacation, the farther away from the Internet & email, the better. I'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of overbooking tactics”
Reviews.Author: vacation_junkie03
Reviews.Content: We were excited to spend spring break at the resort for a 2nd year after having a wonderful experience last year when we exchanged a week via Interval Intl. This year, we booked a prepaid reservation via Expedia which had an incredible rate. When we arrived at the resort, we were told that they were overbooked and had to downgrade everyone that was checking in. We paid for a 1 bedroom with full kitchen and was downgraded to a hotel room with kitchenette! This has never happened with any hotels we've used in our many years of traveling. Needless to say, we were furious and was a terrible start of a vacation. We're in the processing of resolving this "inconvenience" with the hotel's management, Expedia, and credit card company. We suspect that this may be a common business practice with the hotel if you booked via Internet sites. So, beware that this could happen to you. Other than this operational problem, the resort itself is beautiful and an ideal resort for families. There's a major difference between a 1 bedroom with full kitchen and hotel room with kitchenette. Pay the extra and get the 1 bedroom - more space, jacuzzi tub, steamer/shower, double bathroom sink, balcony, kitchen, DR, FR, washer/dryer, ... We have a couple of little ones and so we did "off strip" family activities like chocolate factory tour at Ethel M's Chocolate, Sunset Park playground, Red Rock Canyon driving/ walk, Adventure Dome at Circus Circus.. We recommend breakfast at Bootlegger Bistro which we discovered when we refused to wait at the IHOP restaurant. The bistro is on Las Vegas Blvd next to the Outlet Center Annex. The prices are reasonable and patio dining was relaxing and pleasant. We also tried Garden Grill at Circus Circus at the recommendation of another reviewer. The all you can eat Prime Rib for $12.99 was a good deal. The meat was very tender and delicious. The kid's meal was pricey -- about $5.00 for a corndog or macNcheese that comes out of a 50 cents box. Kids beverages like milk was $3.50 and above in addition to their meals.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience - Hotel Mgmt. is not customer friendly”
Reviews.Author: kdbrad
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the Tahiti Village for me and my 3 kids for spring break vacation. We arrived at 4pm at the Tahiti village which is check in time. There was a very long line that we waited in. When we got to the check in desk we were told our room was not ready yet. I was surprised that the room had not been cleaned yet so late in the day. I seen many frustrated people in the lobby and talk to one lady that had been waiting already for 2 hours for her room. We decided to have a early dinner and then come back. Our room was ready at about approx. 5:30 pm. We were very tired after a long day of travel. When we arrived at our room we discovered we did not have a room with any type of view. One side of the room faced the strip with cars going by and the window view faced the entrance parking area. I felt so disappointed. It was my daughters first time in vegas I wanted a nicer experience then this. I went back to the front desk only to be told there were no other rooms available. I could check back in the morning but no guarantees. I was so unhappy with the room. I called hotels.com where I booked my hotel package. I said that I wanted to cancel my reservation and go to another hotel and explained the situation. They said that I needed to check out and they would then call for my refund. I checked out about 45 min after checking in and got a room at the Bellagio. I called hotels. com in the morning to see how to get a refund from Tahiti village. They called hotel management at Tahiti Village who said they refused to give me any type of refund. I asked if I could call hotel management at Tahiti Village to explain my situation. I was probably on the phone for over 1 hour being passed around from person to person explaining my story. I finally talked to Megan (Hotel Mgr.) who said that she would not give me any type of refund. I said that I understood how I might get charged for the first night but why for the full 4 nights. She said once you checked in you lost 100 percent of your refund. I told her if I had to pay for all the nights that I wanted my room back . She said that she could not guarantee me a room because it might already be check out. I said you are going to charge me for my room even though you rented it out already. How is that fair. She said it was policy and it didn't have to be fairl. They called me back hours later letting me know they could get me my room back if I wanted. They were supposed to call me right back why it took 2 hours I have no idea. I was so irratated by the situation I did not want to go back and ruin the rest of my trip. I did not receive my refund and my only recourse is to let everyone who is thinking about booking a room that hotel management is not customer sevice friendly. If something goes wrong this is not the type of company that is going to work with you. All they care about is getting there money and that is it. Make sure to read your contract carefully about cancellations, etc.... Would never book a stay there again and will let all my friends know my experience and to be very careful about dealing with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING RESORT”
Reviews.Author: FinancialCPA
Reviews.Content: Visited the resort with my daughter who was on spring break from college. I can not compliment this resort enough on their services, rooms and set-up of the resort. From the minute we walked into the resort to register we were received with smiles and offers of assistance. We were then directed to the concierge desk where we were helped with car rental and tours. Everyone was so helpful, kind and eager to accomodate us. Rooms were very upscale and we stayed in the Bora units. Very nice bathrooms and patio, needless to say the wonderul kitchen area. As a professional owner of an accounting business in New York, I would say this resort is an elite resort with a family atmosphere. The location was perfect to the strip where I entertained by daughter at night but also enjoyed the wonderul beach and pool area we were able to relax by the pool in the day time. The Tahiti theme tells the story of the outside area. There is a large hot tub that is great for the cool mornings or late in the evening. My only complaint would be to many children under 12 were int he hot tub, swimming and diving under the water, and the parents did not control the children. WE did make a complaint to the front desk. With the overall resort review I would say outstanding and I will be returning in May with my husbend, to stay at the Village instead of at a hotel on the strip where our conference will be held. Also, we are seriously looking into purchasing a timeshare with this resort, that is how wonderul my first vist was at the Tahiti Village.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas if you have young children”
Reviews.Author: sanselment
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two sons ages 5 and 3. We stayed here from 3-25-10 to 3-28-10. When doing these reviews I like to break it down alittle. We came to Vegas to attend the MONSTER JAM finals at Sam Boyd Stadium and I purposely didn't want a hotel right on the strip. Just to add also this is my fourth time to Vegas, so I do have some knowledge of the area. Tahiti Village is a great family hotel that is also an excellent value. We stayed in a Bora Bora room which has a full kitchen and king bed in the bedroom. The couch is a pullout also. The room was beautiful and clean with everything you could need. A washer and dryer is also in the room. The bathroom is huge with a tub and seperate shower with a steamer which my wife loved. We had a balcony view looking towards the mountains. A little hint to save some money is get groceries from the Food for less grocery store which is only about a mile south of the hotel. I did this and we stockpiled our kitchen for our stay. It's expensive to eat out every meal and we saved some money. We also had two flatscreen TV's which was nice. Room was great. The hotel/pool was just beautiful and well kept. Everyday I would see employees actually cleaning the concrete sidewalks which I thought was impressive. They do keep it clean. Being from MN we swam in the pool which was great. The sand beach is a nice touch. My kids enjoyed the lazy river. The temperature while we were in Vegas was sunny and around 68-75 degrees. We had some wind the first couple days but it was SUNNY. Check in and out was a breeze. Free WI FI was in the lobby and you can bring your Laptop down and relax in numerous chairs while checking up on computer stuff. You actually connect to the nearby Denny's restaurant WI FI. It worked and beat paying for it in your room. The location was excellent for us as everything is close by. The rental car center where everyone has to go in Vegas is right behind the hotel. Very easy to drop off car and pick up when it's so close. The strip is only about a 1 mile north of the hotel on LAS VEGAS BLVD and very easy to get to. I rented a car from Advantage for 85 bucks for 3.5 days. It was welll worth it and having a car in Vegas to me is a must. For my wife she also liked the location as it is next to the LAS VEGAS OUTLET mall and she spent some time and money there. Overall this was a great stay for us and with two younger boys is really fit our needs. Its relaxing and close enough to the strip if you want that. I

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families-Close Enough to the Strip but Far Enough Away”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller350
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Las Vegas so we weren't sure what to expect. We were travelling with 2 young teenagers and did not expect to spend that much time at casinos. The purpose of our trip was rather to relax, shop, sightsee and enjoy some quiet time. For our purposes, the Tahiti Village was perfect. If you're looking for casinos, action and busy nightlife, you won't like the Tahiti Village. We arrived very late at night and upon arrival, the staff were very courteous and checkin took less than 5 minutes. We stayed on the main floor in Tower 5 (the newest part of the hotel) and were a short walk away from the pool and lazy river, both of which were heated to 80 degrees everyday. The pool has a small beach walk-in area which would be perfect for toddlers or young children. The lazy river is lots of fun too -- only about 3 feet deep -- with waterfalls, but it is mandatory to use only hotel-owned tubes, which cost $3/each to rent. There is a great BBQ area with large stainless steel grills, if you're into that. We did not use the BBQ, but the area was busy with others grilling everynight of the week. The accommodations in our suite were first class. We had adjoining suites with living areas in each suite, a king-size bed in each suite, complete kitchen facilities in the main suite with bar fridge & microwave in second suite, 2 queen-size pullouts, a total of 4 flat screen TVs (three 42 inch & one 47 inch) and stackable laundry. All the comforts of home. The beds were phenomenal, there were granite counters & steam showers in the bathrooms and the kitchen had granite counertops and brand new stainless steel fullsize appliances. There was no WIFI and internet access cost $10/24 hours but that did not bother us. The hotel offers a free shuttle to & from the Strip every half hour, which was most convenient to get to the Strip when we wanted to go. The shuttle only stops at the Tropicana and Treasure Island though, so you must be prepared to do some walking. We ate on site at Tahiti Joes one night, which we should not have done. For the price, the food was nothing special, there are no windows in the restaurant and there are places close by that are better. There is a Dennys on site, but we did not eat there. Grocery stores, gas stations and all kinds of shopping (including liquor store) are across the street. In fact, the Las Vegas Outlet Mall directly across the street from the Tahiti Village would be a teenaged girl's dream-come-true. Very good shopping there. We had a rental car which came in handy staying as far off the Strip as we were, but the Tahiti Village offers free parking very conveniently located to the rooms. If you're looking for a balance between access to Vegas when you want it and for peace & quite when you want it, the Tahiti Village is a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Spot for Families!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennitravels
Reviews.Content: Vegas is never a great family spot. We travelled out last weekend for a family wedding. A friend had mentioned Tahiti Village, so I decided to look it up. Orbitz had the best weekend price, it was $15 less a night compared to expedia and hotels.com. Of course for the drive in you do have to be careful of the signage on the road. It is of course, totally inappropriate for kids. The hotel is a nice change of pace from the strip. It is on Las Vegas Blvd. NEAR the Strip just past the airport. They have a free shuttle that will take you to and from the Tropicana and Treasure Island. We made the mistake of using it with the kids, again remember Vegas is NOT meant for kids. We did enjoy the hotel. We rented the Royal Tahitian suite (1500+ square feet); which is the 2 bedroom, 2 living room suite. It was perfect for us and sleeps 8 comfortably. The main kitchen is nice to have with kids. It comes with utensils, plates, glasses, stove, microwave, full refrigerator, dishwasher, ice maker and washer / dryer (the smaller suite also had kitchenette). The room was clean and very functional. My kids enjoyed the in room jacuzzi tub, and my husband enjoyed the in room sauna and flat screen tv. The lazy river was so fun. We all had a blast floating around. There is a $3 per tube room charge if you want to rent tubes to float it. Try sharing first. We rented one for each of us, then realized we didn't each need one. We didn't try the pool or bbqs, but they looked nice. The pool has a small sand area with beach entry, and several shallow entry spots that look great for toddlers. There is good shopping a mile away; with whole foods, h&m and yogurtland. It made us feel like we were home in Orange County. I did have 4 complaints about the hotel. 1. There are not pots and pans or baking sheets in hotel. We hoped to make cookies one night and were disappointed to learn this. Be sure to bring your own. 2. There is no WIFI. You can get in room internet, but you have to be plugged into the wall. AND THERE IS A $10 CHARGE FOR EACH 24 HOURS OF INTERNET USE. 3. There is a business center with PCs that charges per minute. 4. If you have young kids, be sure to ask for a room facing the interior. There is always the potential for inappropriate billboards in view of your balcony. We ate at Tahiti Joe's Restaurant one afternoon. The service was good, and the food was great. There is also a Denny's onsite, which we didn't go to, but I am sure it is like any other Denny's, great for late night people. Overall we had a good experience. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “better place to stay than a hotel room on the strip”
Reviews.Author: sandit10
Reviews.Content: Even thou you are on the Las Vegas strip you are not within walking distance of it but the shuttle conveniently runs every 30 min. plus you can use the duece if you stay away late. The advantage is the great pool, sandy beach, lazy river area. Unfortunately it was a little too cool to spend much time in the water. The rooms are spacious and well equipped with dish detergent, dishwasher detergent and laundry soap. I would recommend the 1 br suite as it has everything and if you need the room add on the studio suite. The 1 br has a balcony or patio. The service was great, staff friendly. Do not eat at Tahiti Joe's thou the food was really, really bad. There are lots of eateries near the outlet mall which is 1 block away. They also have some buffet discount tickets available for vegas but better off to go to a big ticket discount booth for show tickets as they do not have enough selection to choose from. If I go back to Vegas this place would be my choice. Great place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: looking4sun09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Pool area is great, staff were friendly and helpful. Shuttle drivers were hit and miss...some friendly and some not so much. Received a phone call on first day to pick up a welcome package but no one bothered us after that. We asked for a room with a better view on day 3 and we were moved without hesitation to a room with a gorgeous view on the ninth floor! We were even given a better mattress for our sofa bed because the one we had was quite flat. Staff came to our room within minutes. Very impressed! Not thrilled with finding hair on the bathroom floor though. But that is my one and only complaint. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: SUNSHINE1331
Reviews.Content: What a treat Tahiti Village was. We came for the weekend while parents stayed the entire week. Everything was ready, close to the strip and made the experience wonderful. There is so much to do at the Resort let alone playing in the casinos. There was plenty of BBQ's, a large heated pool with a sandy beach and then there was the heated Lazy river to float along... along... along. Just great! We are planning on coming again with the family this time in the heat of summer.. why not? the rooms are large and there is air conditioning, pool, bar, restaurant all right there! They even have discounted rates on the shows.. The Blue Man Group is a Must!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Elaineeastsacramento
Reviews.Content: Past bad reviews may be due to the resort being under construction. Our stay in Feb. 2010 was wonderful and relaxing. The resort is the main drag, South Las Vegas Blvd., but south of the main crowded casinos. This meant we were away from all the traffic, noise and crowd. So it was perfect for us. The resort is right next to the Las Vegas Outlet shops. All you have to do is cross the street where the parking stucture is located. Town Square Shopping area is directly across the street within walkin distance. This is a must to go to. Shops, restaurants, etc. Over a million sq. feet, the largest shopping area in Vegas. Went to the strip just once. Been to Vegas before so done the strip many times. We enjoy going to the Silverton and SouthPoint Casinos. There is a Denny's right on the property so if you arrive late you can get a bite to eat w/out driving anywhere. Lots of eateries by the Outlet mall. Would come to this place all the time! Each unit has a Steam room shower and huge jacuzzi tub for two. This was the bonus...

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever”
Reviews.Author: VictorK4
Reviews.Content: We went down and stayed at Tahiti Village and its a time share resort with its own store, lazy river, hot tubs, swimming pools, and room service with massages. It gives you that exotic feeling and leaves you wanting more. The food in the restaurant is reasonably priced and is some of the best food around.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all... pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: mobycat
Reviews.Content: Staying in Las Vegas for about 2.5 weeks for work. I had to book here for a weekend because my other hotel was sold out in the middle of my stay. The good - very quiet. No smoky casino to have to walk through (which also means I didn't have to walk forever just to get through the place. Room was nice - 1 bedroom with kitchenette. The work schedule I had required me to be sleeping from about 4pm to 1am (working from 2am to 2pm). It was quiet enough that I had no problems sleeping during the day when most hotels would be pretty loud with everyone still awake. The bad - if you stay in building #2 and need to laundry - you're going to have to walk over to building #5 and go to the 9th floor. Wish I had known that before I asked for a room close to the lobby. The bathroom - the vanity was awfully small. Only a couple inches bigger than the sink - not a lot of space to place things. Shower was good, though it took a while to get hot water. Oddly enough, there was no desk in the room. I assume all the single rooms are like that. You can use the coffee table, but that gets to be a pain in the butt being at that level. They have a "convenience" store onsite. But it has less than the Rebel and Terrible's on the street corner about 100 yards away. There is also an outlet mall across the street, if that's your thing. There is also a Whole Foods nearby - you can walk it, but if you have a lot of food, you'll want to grab a cab back. There is a free shuttle that will take you to the Tropicana and back. I believe it also stops at Treasure Island.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay- wish the planet was not under construction”
Reviews.Author: StephanieB3
Reviews.Content: Not the best- room was a 5 star but the service was a 2 star!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again - Not even if they paid me”
Reviews.Author: MrRanger
Reviews.Content: We purchased a weekend at Sam's Club as an anniversary gift for a family member. We were told it was a 1 bedroom with full kitchen and bath. That was the first lie. We then booked a weekend so that we could celebrate together. THREE DAYS before our scheduled trip we were notified by email that our reservation number was no longer valid. Why? Computer glitch. Somehow another reservation was booked over ours. The level of concern from staff? Zero, Zip, Zilch. Four hours of screaming later, someone cancelled and we were provided another reservation. We checked in and discovered the first lie. We could upgrade for $50.00 a night to a full kitchen and bath which meant, our room was $303.00, the upgraded room was $375.00. But wait, it gets better. At 2:00 a.m. a female guest next door was being severely beaten. We called the front desk and after the phone rang repeatedly, it was picked up and then immediately dropped back onto the cradle. We had to call the police department directly. So it seems the night shift staff has the same level of concern as their reservation staff. After we checked out, and this is several days after we checked out, we were advised by and staff member that they had "neglected" to charge the proper rate of tax on our rooms. Unfortunately, since they had our credit card number we could only say "how nice" as they added an additional $40 to our tab.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Icheckeditout
Reviews.Content: The value of this place is phenomenal. Huge suite, full kitchen, steam shower, simply wonderful. I would have liked to use the pool but it closes at 4:30 p.m. in winter. Warning: Don't succumb to buying a timeshare. Just check in at the reception desk and be done with it - no side trip to the Concierge desk where they promise you show tickets etc. etc. Don't forget you are in Las Vegas, don't get fleeced.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: 2012done
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this timeshare property from January 19-23; we had the family suite which is very roomy. We did not utilize the pool; it rains four days and the aveage temperture was about 30-40 degrees. Blame it on El-Nino. The property is nice and quite, Albertson's supermarket is approximately 4 miles away on Eastern Avenue; do not shop at the market across the road (organic stuff/expensive). We had a rental car, so we did not use the property shuttle.If you expect top notch services like a hotel located on the strip, this is not the place. This is a time share; similar to the older version of timeshare in Orlando, Florida. **we arrived at the property way earlier than I had expected-1 PM; we still got our room within 10 minutes** The negatives----although we had a family suite, the room did not have a washer or dryer in it; we were told by the staff that since I had booked with Expedia and the fact that I am not a property owner, our room would not have the washer and dryer....Gee, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “OMG...Incredible”
Reviews.Author: sugarrockhill
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels and resorts, and this one by far was my favorite one of all. We had about 5 other couples that stayed the same week at big name hotels and all they did was complain how loud and how the room didn't even have a coffee pot...We had a couple at Treasure Island, Paris and others at Cesars...Not only did they always have to tip the Vale parking attendant, but the rooms didn't have coffee pots, mini frig, nor a microwave. Meanwhile at Tahiti Village, we had everything we needed for the perfect vacation. The other couples kept coming to our place to enjoy the pool and the grilling area. I can't wait to go again next year. We bought into it and don't regret it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti village is quite nice”
Reviews.Author: rkramadh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tahiti village during xmas 2009. I booked it through my time share exchange with interval world (no, we don't own time share at Tahiti village). Check in was around midnight, the two receptionists seemed a bit tired (it was 12/23). Once they decided which one of them will check us in, it was fairly smooth. They both could learn to smile a bit even at that wee hours. No bell boy called, we lugged our luggage to 4th floor after walking to the elevators some distance away by the pool area. The room itself was very clean, kitchen very modern and more than sufficient with full stove, fridge, dish washer, dishes, forks/knives etc etc. There was a sofa/queen bed in the living room with a smaller TV. The bed room had large queen bed with a 42" plasma TV. The jacuzzi in the the bathroom and two sinks, steam shower etc were all very nice. If only the weather was warmer (50s), we could have used the pool area which was full of palm trees. The decor in the entire place was tropical, I liked it. Maid service was only once during the week, although we were told if we dropped our used towels outside our room, they would provide us fresh ones whenever we wanted. We tried to save the planet by not using that. Fresh towels when we checked in and once when they came to clean our home in the middle of the week were sufficient for us. I didn't go in Tahiti Joe's but we picked up some food the first night as it was open 24 hours. Parking can be tricky some times. Make sure you register your car at the front desk so they give you free parking for the week at the premises. The daily shuttle to the strip was very useful and convenient. They stop at 3 diff resorts, it's much saner than driving through the strip. Last shuttle was from Tropican back to Tahiti village at 11:20 pm. Didn't buy groceries on premises as it seemed quite pricey. We bought it a grocery store near by, pretty good. Whole foods was almost walking distance from the hotel. Some nice Mexican restaurants too not far from Tahiti village, the outlet mall almost next door was pretty good. Resort is very close to the airport too which is good. Our welcome package said we could get discount tickets to one of the cirque shows for the usual time share 90 min spheel. I didn't take advantage of it (should have), ended up getting matsuri show/buffet tickets. Matsuri was good (not the Cirque of course!) but the buffet was THE WORST FOOD EVER EATEN!!! Glad we hadn't paid for it but since the show/buffet had nothing to do with our resort, no more comments on that. We drove to Valley of fire and Red rock parks, definitely well worth it. Hoover was very close by too.

Reviews.Title: “Tahitti Village doesn't care...”
Reviews.Author: lbpupi
Reviews.Content: In our first family trip to exciting and bustling Las Vegas, we were simply minding our own business walking and looking at the casinos when a very persuasive lady talked us into "just listening" to her. She lured us in by saying the shows we wanted to see while we were there she could get free tickets to and also free meals, etc. All in exchange for just 90 minutes of our time touring Tahitti Village. So we took the tour the next morning. That 90 minutes was more like 3 hours including shuttle rides, etc. When you are shuffled into the conference room, everyone seems real nice. But boy are they pushy, pushy, pushy. The place is very nice at first but my husband and I really could not afford a timeshare. But we felt we would never get out of there and enjoy the rest of Las Vegas if we didn't give in. So we did. The paperwork was rushed through and it was about 1" thick. There was no way we could have read everything before signing, as it was that part took over another hour. Turns out the contract says you can cancel within 3 days of signing. But once you finish your vacation, get home and settle back in - guess what - more than 3 days have passed. The monthly payments for the timeshare were automatically taken out of our checking account. At the time, my husband was waiting the 2 years it typically takes to get on disability and I had been laid off and unemployed for over a year. So since they were getting their money, we felt no one at Tahitti Village would listen to us or work with us. So I finally was able to cancel the automatic payments through my bank for a small fee. THEN we heard - relentlessly - from Tahitti Village. Suddenly, they are concerned. When I explained that this was a spur of the moment purchase and we really couldn't afford this, the lady said she would tell their lawyers just to let it go into foreclosure then because they were in the business of selling timeshares and not reselling them or taking them back. With the deposit and payments and maintenance fees in the short 6 months we have "owned" the timeshare, we have invested well over $3000. We were not asking for ANY of that back. We just wanted to sign the timeshare back over to them. That's all. But they won't listen. So now we have to go through getting served and letting it forclose instead . This whole operation is absolutely ridiculous in this economic situation most people find themselves in and the fact that popular Alan Thicke from the well known comedy "Growing Pains" personally recommends this timeshare is very disturbing since his reputation is one of a more wholesome and friendly gentleman. Tahitti Village is only nice to you if they think you might invest in them. Otherwise no one seems nice or willing to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place.......very rude employees!!”
Reviews.Author: Rusu530
Reviews.Content: There was a lot that I truly loved about this place! It was clean, quiet, and really beautiful!! There are two restaurants on site, a small store, and a shuttle to the strip that runs every 1/2 hour!! I had 5 teenagers with me this trip and the Royal Tahitian Suite was roomy enough for all of us. But with so many competitors in Vegas they really need to work on their customer service! There were a couple of really nice people along the way but I would say that 75% of their staff is VERY RUDE!! My second complaint....Even a $50 motel offers free internet and movie channels.....not so here! And last but not least check in time is 4pm and check out at 10AM. After partying in vegas I wasnt even up until 9AM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back to Tahiti Village again”
Reviews.Author: purogringo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay at Tahiti Village and wanted to post a review for others to see. We own a Marriott timeshare and traded thru Interval to get this place. We thought this looked like a fun place that our kids would enjoy. Plus, for us, Vegas is an easy 6 hr drive. Since we are Marriott owners, we've come to expect a certain quality level wherever we stay. We realize that when we trade we might not always get something of equal value. However, we were more than impressed with the quality of the hotel, the rooms, etc. We stayed in the big 2 bed lockoff room. There was our family which inlcudes 3 kids: 5, 4, 18 months, and my wife's parents. The room was very big, and we stayed in the lockoff portion so the kids could sleep on the sofa bed. The lockoff was very big and comfortable for our family of 5. Only draw back is that it doesn't have a full kitchen (oven). But you do have a mini fridge and micro. The pool area was GREAT! We only went swimming 1 day since it was New Year's week that we went. The main pool was cold, but would be awesome in the summer. Our kids played in the sand area and wadded in the beach and didn't mind that it was cold. Personally, I almost froze my butt off. The lazy river is heated and that was pretty nice. This would be a great pool during the summer when it's warmer. Our kids could spend all day there. The only problem we did encounter were kids pranking our room. The 1st night we got a door knock at 2am and then a phone call since we didn't answer the door. Apparently we ordered sheets. NOT! My mother in law was very upset and spoke to the hotel mgr the next morning and the mgr seemed liked she didn't care. The next day had a blender sent to our room. The 4th night had another knock at our door at midnight. You can imagine our frustration and anger at this point. The hotel had put our room on the DO NOT disturb list cuz someone was pranking us. Yet, service orders still came to our room. Once again we spoke to the hotel Mgr and this time they comp'd us a dinner at Tahiti Joe's. Came out to be about $200. It was nice, but still frustrating get all those late night wake ups, especially when you have small children and an 18 mo old that woke up crying. Over all we had a great stay. We had a lot of fun. We did some great things that were cheap and easy for our family to do: Hoover Dam, Ethel M Choco factory, Anderson Dairy Tour, Outlet Malls, Bellagio water show, Caesers Palace shows, etc. We are making plans to go back this summer when it's warmer and take advantage of the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as first visit.”
Reviews.Author: ALBERTAFAMILYOFFIVE
Reviews.Content: Check in was fine, all staff were very good .Pools very cold ,hot tub border line warm.Units show alot of were and tear from our visit a year ago.Our unit hadn't been vacumn on checking in ,kitchen floor was dirty.We had a 2 bedroom ,lots of room ,no free internet.Close to outlet shopping ,kids were bored pools too cold even for them. at our mountain resort pools are very warm through Chriistmas. Jet noise didn't bother us, we will probably try another resort in Vegas next trip.

Reviews.Title: “It would've been better, without the contact high!”
Reviews.Author: Portugal62
Reviews.Content: Some vacationers might not complain about the adjoining room guest(s) sharing their marijuana smoke (coming through the vents), but I didn't appreciate it. I complained to the on duty manager (Ericka), and I did not feel she was prepared to accommodate my complaint as a guess. This was a legitimate complaint on a guess participating in an illegal act. If I would've been searched by Las Vegas Police, they would've thought I was smoking and I would've been sent to jail. If you have a complaint go directly to the front desk, don't call the concierge they have set times, better yet, take matters into your own hands and call the police yourself...

Reviews.Title: “Not to my satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: irishguns
Reviews.Content: The check in took a long time. We were the second in line and about 15-20 minute wait. As for what was great about the hotel is that it looked nice. I liked not having all the hustle and bustle of las vegas especially with children. Well thats about it. The shuttle service was nice but did not go down to the Circus Circus which is primarily for children we would result in taking a taxi from Treasure Island or walk from there. The rooms were roomy despite our shower leaking on the third night of our stay which resulted in a pack and move to another room at 9:30pm at night. Without any complaint from us or our children we received nothing for our inconveniece. We were waiting to see if anyone from management was coming up to apologize or anyting. Nothing at all just the maintenance guy to check our tub and tell us we need to move. The rooms did not come with towel service or trash service. The single bedrooms only came with a mini fridge not a freezer compartment. The childrens activity room (by the way none of the room keys worked to the door, we had to keep going to the door to let about 3 people in) consisted of one pool table with three cues which did not have tips on them, an air hockey table with a hole on the top and a broken leg, and 5 board games, Yeah, Yeah Yeah! The lazy river was nice but you had to pay $3 per inner tube with no outside tubes allowed inside. That water could of been warmer considering our stay was in DECEMBER. The main pool was really cold, it must have been 10 degrees cooler. For our 4 day stay I maybe saw one kid in the pool jump in and right out. That should have been a clue that no one was in the main pool. The hours were ridiculous 10-4:30pm but the jaccuzzi was 24 hours. As for check-out pretty quick. When we got home though I checked our bank accounts and discovered that the deposit would take about 5 business days to return to our account. We definetely will consider other time shares in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: keithbs
Reviews.Content: All the past negative reviews must have shacken management up, as our stay was great. Each of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The grounds and buildings were spotless. We stay in the "A" side, which is the 1 bedroom. The only downside is that it only has a mini refrigerator (with no freezer compartment) and a microwave for cooking (no stove). This makes it harder to make full meals, but great for visting all the restaurants in Vegas! Our room was in Tower One, facing both the Strip and the airport. Plane noise was NOT a factor and the only time we heard them was when it was very cloudy, which contained the noise at ground level. There is a Denny's and Tahiti Joe's on the property. Tons of other restaurants with in 2-3 miles. Do not compare this with a hotel, as it is a timeshare property. Overall, we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Sarahb2sweet
Reviews.Content: We had gotten this trip through a smartcircle.com promotion we bought through Sam's Club. We really didn't know what to expect, especially after the annoying radio commericals about free trips to Tahiti Village. We were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. Check-in was fast and easy and no one tried to sell me anything or make me go on any tours. They have a counter dedicated solely to helping people with questions about shows and activites around the cities. They were very approachable and knew what they were talking about. They would even try to give you deals on shows you were looking into to try and save you a buck. The weather was cold so we did not have a chance to enjoy the pools much. The hot tub was sort of small, but nice and clean. The pool was very nice. The lazy river would have been very enjoyable had it been much warmer. The younger life guards at the lazy river did not seem pleased to get out of their warm shack and to their post so us crazy Minnesotans could take a few loops. The room was amazing. Set up very well, clean, and offered a lot of extras. Would never have guessed we'd get a microwave, dishes, and silverware. This r esort is not like a normal hotel and it seemed very quiet. That was nice, but it left us not always knowing how to do things. Do you need to wash your dishes before you check-out? Make your bed everyday? These are things that they could have briefed us on, but rather we had to ask. All in all it was an amazing time and I would reccommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wow,brilliant, fantastic”
Reviews.Author: chatterbox21362
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at the Village.there were four of us in our party & were not sure what to expect . We were not dissappointed. Effectively 2 rooms next to each other with connecting door. lovely & clean with a whirlpool bath & steam shower ( very welcome after a day walking) Not sure what the issue is overlooking the car park as it wasnt an issue to us. it was too cold at night to sit outside & on the odd occasion were were at the resort during the day we were by the pool or in th e jacuzzi( outside) The only downside is no free internet tho if you sit outside Dennys you can log on to their network, Ideal spot at the bottom of the strip with great free shuttle service. They even lay on a free service to the supermarket a couple of times a week can recommend the steak at the outback just accross the road at the las vegas outlet $14.95 for steak & lobster tails All in all had a brilliant week & cant waiti to return

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUT WITH NOTES”
Reviews.Author: cbpilot
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant place to stay overall, and we were there a week. Clean and neat. I will list the shortcomings and other than that it was all perfect. No free internet. You can attend a time share meeting and get it free, but otherwise it was $5/day for a wireless hook-up. We stayed in Tower 5 because we asked at check-in where the nicest rooms were, and since this is the new building they directed us there. We were at the end of the long hall on the 7th floor. There is limited parking close to the one elevator, but it is first come and goes fast. Unless you stay in the room all the time you will return at times and have to use their free parking garage. This parking garage is at the opposite end of Tower 5's elevator, and you will have a walk of about 150 yards each way which was a pain to deal with all week. Staff was friendly, but maintenance was invisible. Our room was missing a hair dryer, and when we asked for one (twice) we finally were told they were ordering more and we never did get one. The lazy river was nice, but in November the building blocks the sun on most of it and that made it pretty cool in the shady fall air. We had to pay for an innertube and that was disappointing as it would cost them nothing to throw this in for free. Good location on the strip, but out of the hussle, but within fast striking distance. We would stay there agin.

Reviews.Title: “2 Days Gettaway!!”
Reviews.Author: shaunhiyashi
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a short 2 days gettaway here.A nice quiet place this time of the season at the end of the south strip just past that famous welcome to las vegas sign.Room is clean "smells like raid?" but found bunch of hair underneath the bathroom sinks.Turned central a/c up few hours later the raid smells almost gone.Tile and wood floor looks clean but bit dusty by our standard mayby we dont wear shoes indoor.all of the employees in the hotel were nice and professional enough for us not have any complains.Nice looking pool,jacuzzi and lazy river but this time of year its too cold out no one is using.Parking is free and very accessible to your room location.No free internet service,this blows!! From this location to MGM Grand only 5 mins driving 25mph but do watch out for vegas local drivers bunch of "Idi0ts & [--]"!!! Anyway..this is a nice hotel for the price paid definately 4 star for tahiti village resort to other same comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emotions both good and bad”
Reviews.Author: coop036
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Las Vegas Oct 10-17 for our anniversary. We chose to stay at Tahiti village. We are timeshare owners at Westgate and wanted to stay on the strip. I called Tahiti village twice and condolidated Resorts once to request a room with either a view of the strip, a view of the pool, or a view of the lazy river ride. Although I was told that room requests are not guaranteed I was told by 2 separate employees that it should not be a problem. Upon check in, we were given a room in tower 2 on the 4th floor, view was of a parking lot, Dennys, and a motel that looked a little questionable. I asked if we could be moved and I was told that everything was sold out and to check back. Upon arrival at the condo, it looked nice. The bads: the couch was very, very uncomfortable, the telephone in the living room did not work, the light in the bathroom worked intermittently, there wasnt dish clothes or dish towels to do dishes and the kitchen was poorly stocked. After asking for 3 days, the staff was able to assist us in moving to "get a view"... We were moved to bldg 5, room 5360,,, This was the best.. everything was new and updated, the couch was comfy, the view was amazing (lazy river and the strip), kitchen was properly stocked, etc. Outside of the room, the grounds were amazing; beautiful and well maintained. For the most part, the staff was friendly and tried to be helpful, minus one or two at the front desk. The only other minor problem that we had, we were charged $9.99 for some internet thing that apparently works through the tv. Neither myself or my husband used the thing and we were charged but did not use it. I'm not quite sure what happened but my husband was playing with a keyboard and I'm guessing that had something to do with it. The staff refused to refund the charges, if it would have been more than $10.00 I probably would have fought the charge, but it wasnt worth the aggravation. In conclusion, I would definately recommend the place if you could be guaranteed a unit in phase 2, bldg 5 but WOULD NOT RECOMMEND it if you were staying in phase 1, bldg 2

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend Tahiti village to anyone visiting the Las Vegas area.”
Reviews.Author: tstrat69
Reviews.Content: -The staff was very helpful -Housekeeping when called was at our room in a matter of minutes. -Def. highlight was having a shuttle to and from strip in Vegas, saves you big money. -Gorgeous place to stay -A++++ rating overall

Reviews.Title: “Great resort! Will go back for sure!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbud9
Reviews.Content: Just got back a few days ago and had a great time. My family owns a timeshare at Tahiti Village so we got a great deal for the week. We stayed in Tower 5 on the 8th floor. Just had a single room which was very spacious for the 4 of us. We had a nice view of the lazy river from our balcony. They offer a shuttle bus to the strip that leaves every half an hour. The bus has stops at the Tropicana and Treasure Island. The only thing with the bus that we didn't enjoy was that the bus last pick up is at 12:30 AM. But it's not the worst thing in the world, if you stay out late you'll just have to take a cab. The resort is right next to the airport, but suprisingly you dont hear anything from your room. We could hear them from the pool, but not a big deal. The pool area is very nice, and they allow you to bring in food and drinks. No glass, although someone had, and ended up breaking it in the pool. So that was 3 days of no pool because they had to drain, clean and refill it. Some people like to ruin it for others. But I would go back to Tahiti Village again. Great location right next door to the outlets. Very close to Walmart and other shopping. I would recomment this hotel to anyone. Great time. The people who have bad reviews on here dont know what they are talking about. This is a timeshare so like any other timeshare your room doesnt get cleaned every day, only once a week. These are more like condos, than hotel rooms. And yes you may be asked to go to a sales pitch, dont go then. There is no suprise that they want you to buy, so there will be pressure. Oh one bad thing- when we got our room cleaned they forgot a couple of things so we had to call twice to get someone to come back and bring the missing towels, soap ect.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been any better!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie_Cat_9
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Tahiti Village. I loved it the first time & I loved it the second! Our room was lovely and spacious, beds were comfortable, it was very quiet and we slept great. The staff was helpful and very friendly. We were there 4 days, and really didn't need maid service during that time, so didn't miss it. Plenty of towels to last the two of us. We did need some soap, but just ask one of the maids one morning in the hall, and she gave us some from her housekeeping cart. The lazy river is to die for! Get your innertube and float all day. It's so relaxing. (and, yes, there is a $3.00/day charge for the innertube, but who cares?) It was great to be at such a quiet and peaceful place during the day, then go to the noisy and fun casinos at night. (By the way, the free shuttle to the strip is very convenient and the drivers are helpful.) All in all, it was a great time (again!) and I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: just2fy2
Reviews.Content: The Tahiti Village staff were gracious host and hostesses and tried to accomondate our every need for ie., extra towels, extra beds, etc., Six middle-age women out to celebrate a 50th birthday in Las Vegas, I hated to leave. The Laguna, waterfalls, and sauna are relaxing and refreshing. The location is off the strip (so you get peace and quiet to recoup from the casino noise and traffic), there is a shuttle but we ofted for a limo to take us in style. I particularily commend the housekeeping staff - for managing to keep the facilities clean despite a few unruly younger guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kristisv68
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 4 traveling to Las Vegas for a special birthday occasion. We decided to try the Tahiti Village based on the recommendation of another friend. The hotel is actually a time-share, which is the only real downfall of this place. We booked it as a hotel, and told them we weren't interested in the time-share, and they didn't push it too hard, but there were tours constantly going on, so the place was quite crowded. Our rooms, which were very nice- perfect for families- were on the same floor as the meeting center for the time-share meetings, so our hallways were always crowded. But getting past the time-share, we had a wonderful stay. The rooms are very clean, and comfortable. They are not luxurious, but have everything you would need. Our units were the one bedroom units. They had a kitchenette, living area, bathroom and bedroom. A lot of space for just the 2 of us in each room. The hotel is very easy to find on Las Vegas Blvd, just south of the strip. There is shuttle service provided by Tahiti Village, or ample parking if you have a car. The pool area is wonderful. There are two swimming areas- the beach pool which has an actual sand beach and a lazy river. Both are great fun. Overall, I would stay there again and again, with or without my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great place to enjoy your time in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ctnmt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 5 days/4 nights in Vegas with my sister and her husband at Tahiti Village. Our daughter is an owner and she made our reservations. We stayed in the Bora Bora unit which had the bedrm suite with bath and the kitchen/dining/living room combo. It has a king bed and queen sofa. The queen sofa was very nice to sleep on. The biggest thing that we all enjoyed was the jacuzzi tub, which is big enough for two and the steam shower, both were very nice. The photos that you see of this resort are exactly what you see If you choose to book a room here you should know: 1. Internet... there is no internet in the rooms, but you can connect in a small area by registration or go to Denny's which is on site 2. Parking... It is pretty hard to get a parking spot around the towers of the resort, but there is a parking garage and you can enter Tower 5 which is a short walk. They have security that checks it regularly. They called us one nite to tell us we had left our lights on the car. 3. Shuttles... they give you a shuttle schedule when you check in and it is quite flexible and the wait isn't bad 4. Staff... I read a few reviews that were critical. We found that to be untrue, everyone we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. We ask for extra towels, sheets, coffee, etc. and they were very promt to make sure we had what we needed. 5. House keeping... if you are expecting daily housekeeping you will be disappointed. This is not a hotel/motel. You're on your own, unless you spend more the 7 days and then they come in on day 3 or 4 and clean. If you place the trash out in the hall in the mornings they will pick it up and as i said up above, if you need anything...ASK 6. Noise... this is in the path of planes taking off and landing, but the only time we really heard anything was when we had the doors of the room open or we were out side and it didn't bother us at all. You are going to hear these sounds no matter where you are in Las Vegas We enjoyed the lazy river, the pool and the hot tub. The hot tub could get a little crowded, but it is open 24/7. AND you will find sand in the pool and hot tub, after all there is a sand beach which is great and it is a tahitian decor. We just went with the theme and had a great time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - poor service”
Reviews.Author: shellyrocks2
Reviews.Content: Physically this is a great place to stay. The rooms and all facilities are beautiful and well-maintained. Too bad this attitude of top quality did not extend to the staff. Upon check-in we were greated by a blank stare from the lady at the front desk. Her facial expressions varied from disinterest to total disdain over the course of our short interaction. We were prepaid, prebooked and easy to please as well as remaining friendly and cheerful regardless of the service. A credit card was requested for incidentals but the staff neglected to tell us it is Tahiti Village policy to automatically charge this card $50 and refund the balance not used within 5 - 7 working days after checkout. Every piece of literature about Tahiti Village stresses the frequent shuttles to the strip that make the location (not on strip) not a factor. This is apparently based upon the whims of hotel staff and does not adhere to any set schedule. At 6pm on Friday night we walked to the front desk and asked when the next shuttle to the strip would be arriving. The staff (once again no facial expression) informed us that it was not until after 9pm. When asked about the promises of frequent shuttles to the strip they shrugged at us and turned their backs. While there was no shuttle to be seen a line of taxis waiting for customers made me wonder about the possibility of kickbacks to the front desk staff for customers?

Reviews.Title: “overall ,a fun,great place-IGNORE the winers!”
Reviews.Author: benzboy
Reviews.Content: Had trepidations about staying here after reading some other reviews. Some of those complaints I suppose were legit, but many were very petty,especially considering all the wonderful facilities Tahiti Village offers. We stayed for 5 days. The pool and especially the river were terrific with beautiful landscaping all around. The rooms were exactly what we've come to expect from a 4+ star resort (we own 7 weeks of time share,all premier or 5 star,and travel extensively). The location is great,just south of Mandalay Bay,with easy access to the strip via the backroads or I 15(beware the construction all around the periphery of the strip). To be sure,wireless access should be free and readily available in a resort of this caliber,but a quick walk to a corner near the lobby allows access to Dennys wifi. Within walking distance: Dennys,an onsite restaurant,Dunkin Donuts,huge outlet mall,fast food,Outback--and on &on. Parking very close to the units IS limited,but they have a parking garage that is less distance than walking thru some of the casinos! We had a car,so didn't use the shuttle,but it was utilized by alot of people who apparently had no trouble reading the schedule. No problems with, or attitude from staff. We've stayed at 4-5 other premier resorts in Vegas(Hilton,Marriot,Polo)-all were very good-Tahiti Village from our experience measured up well. Enjoy the wonderful laid back atmosphere, and IGNORE the petty stuff! We will be back no question.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful tropical resort away from the strip with no casinos”
Reviews.Author: mikt
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful. A tropical paradise with a beautiful pool and lazy river. Drinks were expensive, so best to take your own. It's about 3 miles from the strip not far from a mall, places to eat and a grocery store. They provide shuttle drops and pick-ups from the resort to several places on the strip. Very good price if you are an Interval member. Much less than anyplace on the strip. If you are looking for food, the only thing on the property that is affordable is Denny's. However across from the parking garage at the mall are several eating places that we discovered the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Very Far Away From Here!”
Reviews.Author: DMenscha
Reviews.Content: We exchanged a week from our Cabo San Lucas timeshare and I had no reason to not like this place before we got here. What a difference! It cost us $380 FOR A WEEK AND WAS WORTH ABOUT HALF THAT! This was business for my wife and "leisure" for me As reported by previous reviewers, the front desk is a disaster and full of the most unhelpful people imaginable. The first bad news...Internet service is $10.00/day. (but our unfriendly (AND APPARENTLY HARD OF HEARING) front desk type told me $10/wk. Are you kidding me? Free Wifi is all over the place in $39 rooms everywhere.
