After finding out that the front desk clerk had misinformed me, I complained to the front desk manager, and she sweetly offered that if I brought my laptop down to the end of the hallway, I might be able to find a wifi hotspot. Or I could walk a block to McDonalds. (She claimed that the homeowners association was responsible for the current system.) Give me a break. Oh well, the room was very nice. Really, very nice. We go to the pool (which requires a room key to get into) Ask for a towel, towel boy says show me your room card (which is now on the far side of the pool). Dude! How do you think I got in here? He finally relents. Also there is a $3 charge to use the vinyl inner tubes required to float the "Lazy River" pool. Next day, go to the onsite convenience store. Ask to charge the $15 to my room. Clerk says, do you have a room charge card? Ummmm no, just a room key. "Well you need to go to the front desk to get a room charge card". Hmmm we had to leave a credit card on file for room charges already. Oh thanks for telling me that when I checked in front desk. Would I need one for the lazy river pool? I didn't bother to find out. Well at least they were busy at the spa, robo-calling me every day with an almost unintelligible message about the $10 off deal (but first I need to spend $100). It must suck to be an employee with a talent and have to make dialing for dollars calls. Daily throw-away ads for pizza joints and the like offsite under the door also made us feel very special. Went to the onsite restaurant/bar but turned back in the elevator by 2 parties who both were complaining about service and quality. Maid service MIA one day (the only day we really needed it). Right under the flight path at McCarran, which is no big deal to me, I like aviation and the rooms were very quiet unless you opened the door. It gets noisy at the pool. Come back after 10 one night, and there are no parking places in front of the building, but there's an acre of pavement just 250 feet away. No problem, we park there and the next morning there's a notice on the windshield from "security" that this is a CONSTRUCTION ZONE and I can't park there. Excuse me? Where the heck is all the construction going on? I've been here 5 days and there hasn't been a single shovel turned or any other evidence that I could possibly be in the way. The alternative place to park is on the other side of the 25 acre property. You've got an acre of parking within 250' of my room So give me a real place to park or leave me alone with your notices. by this point, I'm so pissed off at the management, I can barely see straight. Out of the 30 or so face to face with employees, about 6 looked us in the eye and greeted us. We're salespeople, we smile at everyone and usually say hello. I even greeted them in Spanish where it seemed appropriate. So now we come to the final straw. They have this TV in the room that also serves as an internet connection if you don't have your own laptop. (For which you had better have brought your own cable.) There is a controller for the TV that looks like a wireless keyboard and it stops functioning properly. It's the only way I have to control the TV and it's very clumsy. Grab it and go down to the front desk to exchange it. Oh No! It's the "I'm not listening to anything you say" clerk that checked us in. She keeps referring to the keyboard as "the internet" to the maintenance guy. I keep trying to tell her it's the keyboard controller to the TV set, she can't be bothered to listen to me for even 5 seconds. I look around the lobby at knowing glances from other guests. I raise my voice to see if that is going to work and she points to a camera and tells me to stop threatening her. ??????? I assume by threatening her she means expecting service from her. After her little tirade though I'm thinking about really getting in her face. The maintenance guy shows up. She takes him behind the counter in the office (I'm sure to explain to him what an evil person I am). He's great, he's fabulous! And he comes to the room and asks where the TV remote is. TV remote, you mean like an actual TV remote? He starts looking and comes up with one stuffed behind a boom-box on an upper shelf with doors on the front. Nice job hiding it housekeeping, I never would have found it there, Heck I didn't even know there was a boom-box there either. You Rock Jorge! So, if you actually pay money for this place after reading the last few reviews, it's your funeral. I will never come back here. Next time, I'll sleep in my car.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed with Tahiti Village”
Reviews.Author: purple411
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how clean the facility was. I was there the last week of August for one whole week and I will definitely return. I used my exchange to visit Tahiti Village. We had the smallest room in Tower 5, which was good enough for the 5 people in my party. The only negative that they don't tell people about the small room is that there is not a stove! Only a microwave which makes a difference if you wanted to make breakfast! I traveled with 2 children, one was three years old and the other was 11 years old. The 3 yr. old enjoyed and loved the sandy beach area of the main pool. My older daughter had a great time playing volley ball at the main pool with different people she would meet. The resort was constantly packed but not to the point that we didn't enjoy it. I really don't have any negative comments about the place other than the Laundry Room. If you are planning on washing in the Laundry Facility "Don't!" They have 4 washing machines and 4 dryers for all of the facility to use and while we were there only one of each was working which was extremely horrible! Other than that the staff is great and the cleaning crew was very attentive and hospitable to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...resort great, service horrible”
Reviews.Author: mss0ccerbunny
Reviews.Content: We were guests of owners via Consolidated Resorts. We stayed in building 5, ground floor room right near the BBQ area. I normally don't like ground floor rooms, but it made for easy access and good people watching. We had the "Royal Tahitian" room, which was basically the studio and the one bedroom units combined. Very clean, nicely decorated. We stayed in the studio unit side (aka Moorea) and kept the doors between the 2 units open. The grounds and the pools were absolutely wonderful! You did not feel like you were in Las Vegas, the greenery was so lush. The main pool can get very crowded at times and chairs can be scarce, but the mood is very relaxed and happy. Downside: 1) DO NOT LOSE YOUR SAFE KEY OR YOU WILL BE CHARGED $75!! Even though the guest book says they retumble your lock and replace your key, this is not the case. It took maintenance almost 2 hours to arrive at my room, and when they got there, all they did was give me a replacement key. For this key, I was charged $75. $75 for a key????? That's ridiculous!!! 2) Do not assume that all shuttles go back to Tahiti Village. Only one does, and that picks up at Tropicana. We had to wait 20 minutes at Treasure Island for the shuttle, then another 30 minutes on the bus to only be taken to Tropicana, where we had to wait another 20 minutes for the Tahiti shuttle home. Over an hour wait to go back to the Village is unacceptable; I’d rather take a cab and pay the money! 3) The cleaning people came the 4th day to clean our suites, and left the pile of dirty towels on the floor of the master bedroom. 4) Without the other unit having a patio, we would have felt like we were in a cave because the Moorea studio had only one window. The bathroom sink vanity area in Moorea had very little counter space also. I almost felt deprived compared to the sprawling counter space in the other unit's bathroom! 5) The main kitchen was sparsely supplied. Not saying I blame the company because I'm sure there is theft, but it made for some very frustrating food preparing with lack of supplies. We had to call the front desk and have them send more kitchen supplies to our room. Like other's mentioned below, this facility is great. The service...not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Beware...or be aware”
Reviews.Author: 21stTraveler
Reviews.Content: The really sad thing is we "purchased our stay" at Sams Club....big mistake. We did not go for the "timeshare or have a free comped trip". My wife was approached at Sams Club by a T.V. vendor for a 3 night stay for $199.00. I was very concerned because these are the guys "on the radio"....buyer beware. After she bought it, I checked Tripadvisor and there was positive and negative. We travel a lot and I told her we would be our own judge. After we arrived we were disappointed with the room and asked to pay for an upgrade, and they said "very doubtful". We were told two different prices by two different people and they never called back to follow up. They said they were booked solid, however at the spa, we were told the place is "dead this weekend". We have to probably believe the spa worker over the front desk people since the parking garage was pretty empty. I believe they save the best rooms for the "possible buyers and to sale to late arrivals at a premium". My wife was led to believe it was a "resort" with all the amenities when she purchased it. It defenantly was not....they truely cater to the people that are there for free in hopes of selling it to them. For those folks it is a win/win. There was no "maid service", because that is not what the place is about. There is no "customer service" because that is not what the place is about. Oh, don't be shocked, but everyone leaves their daily trash in the hallways for pick up, since T.V. caters to people who like to cook in thier rooms "on the cheap". If you go....go for free and NOT pay anything....there is no value in paying for a room there and you would do much better at one of the Strip Hotels. So please beware ....or be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic service, staff has little hosptility skills, not worth exchange!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoRunner2009
Reviews.Content: READ BEFORE YOU BOOK TAHITI VILLAGE THERE ARE PROS AND CONS: There were many negatives about Tahiti Village and some positives. First let me start by saying that if I was an OWNER at this TimeShare resort I would be furious! I used a week my mother-in-law exchanged and in many ways feel like using this week was a waste when speaking about many things about the staff and maintenance. Start at check in: when you first arrive not a single person at the desk had any customer service skills. Nor at any time when going to the front desk did anybody display good customer service skills. It is called “hospitality” after all, isn’t it? One time I went to the desk and there were three girls standing there, one guy on the phone. One girl says “I will be with you in a minute” and continues to talk with the other two girls. The guy on the phone helped me. Maintenance: Door to the Lazy River doesn’t open and countless people have problems. You watch this over and over again and finally an owner got mad and told the lifeguard to have the door fixed. Thjs went on for days before it was fixed! Door to work out room on 3rd Floor Tower 5, same thing!!! Countless people can’t get the door open and NO it isn’t the key it is the door! Somebody would have to get off a machine to let a person in. On my second day there at 6:10 a.m., I couldn’t get the door to open. I called the Resort Manager, Ashley, and she gave me ways to get it to open short of standing on my head!!! She sent engineering and he lightly pulled it and it opens; I asked him to post a sign with instructions how to open. NOT! I watched this go on day after day in that workout room! Lastly, there is ONE laundry room in the 5th tower for ALL TOWERS for those who don’t have a washer dryer. There are 4 washers and 4 dryers and 2 washers don’t work and 2 dryers don’t work!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Yes, maintenance/engineering had been notified!!! What is wrong with this picture? You exchange a week and this is what you get. Oh and the main/large pool, I have never seen something so dirty in my life. It was disgusting, we didn’t even put our toes in it! The lazy river was clean and very, very nice!!! Other than the door, the Lazy River was great!!! A huge plus for a family !!!! The shuttle, NOBODY, and I mean NOT A SINGLE staff member could explain the shuttle schedule to you!!!! That was pathetic!! The bus driver got it right, thankfully! (It left early from the strip, thankfully we didn’t depend on it leaving at the scheduled time!) The managers and staff don’t seem to strive for quality at this resort! The concierge, when they give you directions, they don’t give you a map, they tell you what streets to turn down. No sheets with directions. Keep in mind, the “Concierges” appear to work for Member Services, they book tours. They aren’t really a “Concierge” there to give you info about the area. Concierges generally have ample information to give you vs. short answers. I have stayed at some nice resorts and this resort doesn’t get a even one star about the above things I just talked about. Tower 5: if you are booked in Tower 5, expect a lot of walking as you will likely have to park in the underground parking area! The pros: The Lazy River is great, the shuttle is nice (I rather drive, parking is rather easy and less time consuming) and location is wonderful! The unit was nice. The staff at the Lazy River was very nice and would smile at you (hospitality), the shuttle driver was informative nice. The location is ideal, near the strip, near grocery stores, shopping, etc. I can’t say that I would go back. I don’t stay in the unit for much more than to sleep and eat breakfast so too many things stood out in the negative. NOT WORTH THE EXCHANGE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE:You won't get your rebates”
Reviews.Author: farmerdino
Reviews.Content: The high pressure sales co is bankrupt - all promised rebates are NOT BEING HONORED by Tahiti Village Resorts Co. I asked if they'll refund the $100 promised to us for air fare when we took tour. I filled out forms and sent by certified mail as requested; it was received 2 days b/4 bankruptcy declared. NOPE they won't compensate us - not even for good will. They are sending EVERY complaint to a bankruptcy lawyer. This leaves a bad image because on the tour you are led to believe the sales staff are Tahiti Village employees. NOT TRUE and when I asked about THAT they said lots of people are upset but they don't seem concerned about this manipulation. What a shame because we thought we would buy the next one being built but definitely won't now. Who's to say that won't go out of business?

Reviews.Title: “Family and kids heaven in a not so family friendly city”
Reviews.Author: DenverMommy
Reviews.Content: Although my husband and I had said this may be our last trip to Vegas since our kids are getting older and we didn't want them exposed to all the "Vegas ambiance" we have changed are mind thanks to Tahiti Village! As others have said, the pool is heaven for kids, with our little ones loving the sand beach and lazy river and the rooms are amazingly large and well appointed. We actually had a mini-family reunion, with 8 people in the 2 bedrooms and it wasn't uncomfortable. Our family members have traveled to many places and expect a lot of their vacation accomodations but since we got such an awesome Getaway rate from Interval International for the week, we all agreed this place was an exceptional value for your travel dollar. Although the actual accomodations were top-notch, don't be confused, you are not going to get the service and pampering of a Westin or Marriot high end timeshare so if you are trading into here, just know that from the beginning. I loved the location, close to the airport to pick up relatives, a quick drive to the strip if family members wanted to go, easy access to the freeways to get to other parts of the city and I didn't have to take my kids through a smokey loud casino once if I didn't want to. If you want to be right on the strip don't stay here, you will be annoyed, but If you are looking for a place where the little ones can enjoy the pool, the adults can drive to the clubs and casinos and the grandparents can take the free shuttle to the Tropicana (which my mom did) you will love Tahiti village!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, clean, luxurious, and a great getaway from reality!”
Reviews.Author: karissa70
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I had the pleasure of staying here with my husband and our friends. I would recommend this place to everyone. Our unit was a 2 bed/2 bath with a nicely sized patio. Everything is new and modern. The decor is palm tree themes with sage colors painted throughout the unit. The pool is heated, and the lazy river nice and relaxing. The Tahiti Joe's restaurant/bar has amazing food and drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort just south of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: SchoJohn
Reviews.Content: Fantastic roomy place - We can't recommend this place enough

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti Village is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingBeauty
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed here for our first trip to Vegas and I loved it! Tahiti Village was the icing on the cake! We stayed in the newest tower which I believe was tower 5. My room was NICE. I didn't even care that I had no veiw of anything great, lol. They were booked since it was Memorial Day weekend which we were told is the busiest weeked in Vegas. Everything was spotless in our room and we felt at home. We own there (thanks to my parents :) We stayed in the Bora Bora which is the perfect size for couples. The jacuzzi and shower with steam were excellent. I also loved the CD/DVD player so bring your favorite music like we did and have little pre-parties before you head to the strip. Tahiti Joes had decent food and bar drinks were delicious. I also LOVED the pool area, lots of fun. The shuttles weren't always on time because again that was likely due to the busy weekend. Sorry Nay-sayers....but We really love this place and we look forward to heading back!

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyed our trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravel4Me
Reviews.Content: We had a very late check-in, due to our flight so there wasn't anyone in line, nor was there any problem with getting keys to our villa. Our two bedroom villa was actually a split room and we had trouble getting into the second room (the larger side with the full kitchen, patio, etc.). Our call to maintenance wasn't responded to for about 30 minutes and with two hungry (and tired) children, this didn't go over well with any of us. Once we were in the room and unpacked, it was a short walk to the on-site Denny's, which had okay service. I was surprised that the resort did not have free wireless in the villas, nor in the lobby. They basically encouraged guests to use Denny's connection or pay for internet service in the business center. The discounted tickets and planning representative was a nice surprise & I was able to plan most of our family activities right on site. Being in building 5 was an extremely long walk from the lobby, especially after walking the strip for about 90 minutes and exiting the shuttle at the front of the resort. Couple of great things about being in building 5 - children's activities, gym and concierge are all in the building. With one exit, you're near the main pool and gas grills where we fixed several yummy meals. With another exit, you're near the lazy river. My sons loved the man-made beach, the basketball court, the volleyball net and swimming with their new friends. I loved how quiet the resort was and that no smoking nor gambling was at the resort - you could basically have a family trip in Vegas without the slot machines. The shuttle service was a nice touch and kept us from having to rent a car. The bad part about the shuttle is the grocery store run is only 3 days per week and it's at 8:00 am (too early for vacationers)! We ended up taking a cab because our arrival time would cause us a 4 day wait for the grocery shuttle. All of the staff was nice, the rooms were beautiful and extremely clean. We met lots of great families while cooking at the grill and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: kcape
Reviews.Content: We are consolidated resorts owners, and after hearing about the bankruptcy we were very concerned, but it was very difficult to notice anything different. The hotel grounds and rooms were spotlessly clean and beautiful. We did not hear any noise from the rooms near ours, as was reported by other guests. The parking was convenient and they have a beautiful covered parking garage in addition to parking lots, which was much appreciated in the 110 degree weather. It is a bit of a drive to the strip, but during our week stay we learned to use a couple of the secondary roads rather than Las Vegas Boulevard and could get up and down the strip easily. Just valet parked at whatever hotel we were stayin at. The lazy river was truly wonderful. The hotel charges $3 per day for tubes, but we never paid for any, as guests who were leaving offered their tubes to guests newly arriving and there were always several unclaimed tubes lying around. We had no problem finding chairs in the sun or shade at anytime during the day. Drinks at both the pool and the lazy river were expensive, but you were allowed to bring your own in a cooler. They did sell small ones in the gift shop for $5.00. We rented cars due to the sheer number of people we had with us, so I can't comment on the shuttle service, but we did see Tahiti Village shuttles on the strip when we went. The vans were large and nice looking. We received a mid-week cleaning, and had no problem having any trash picked up if left outside our door within a few minutes. The grill area was very nice and was cleaned thoroughly every morning. We would never have known the ownership was in bankruptcy during our stay and in fact the hotel was booked solid. We couldn't even pay for an upgrade as their was nothing open. We did ask for a later check out, but were refused. We found buying groceries/liquor at the Food for Less much more economical than the Whole Food market and it's just a a short five minute drive. The shopping outlet mall is walking distance (just across the street). I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Tahiti Village to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: tripper96
Reviews.Content: Since I've relied on trip advisor reviews so much in planning vacations, thought it was time to write a review myself. Just returned from Tahiti Village and thought the place was great! We were on an Interval sell-off and had a 1 bed Bora unit in bldg. 2 - ground floor. The unit was very spacious. Fully equipped kitchen with granite counters and stainless steel appliances. Huge bathroom with double sinks and large whirlpool tub. Nice toiletries included. Bedroom was a good size with comfortable king bed. Living/dining with sliders to patio. Everything was clean except I thought the upholstered furniture while not worn could have used some freshening up. The unit was exceptionally quiet. We enjoyed the lazy river & being able to take our own drinks & snacks with us to spend the day there. Didn't use the pool but it seemed that the little ones were enjoying the sand beach & making sand castles. There were lots of loungers but needed to get up earlier than we did to find a place with a 'hut' for shade. We were not approached at all for timeshare presentations. Did have some messages on the 'phone to use the spa but nothing else. Parking was a bit of a chore as all the spaces in front of our unit were always taken. We used the parking garage which meant a little walk but not a big deal. Yes, the pool & lazy river are fenced off which requires your room key to enter but we thought this was a good security feature. As well, had to show room key for towels but they would let you have as many as you wanted. My only complaint was that the washrooms near the lazy river weren't open which meant walking to the pool area & remembering to take the key to get back in! Found the staff to be very pleasant. The building and grounds are very well maintained. Lots of people used the bbq area for meals. We enjoyed being a little away from the main strip which was so busy. Didn't use the shuttle as we had a car but thought it was a great service for guests. It's a different kind of vacation being in a timeshare unit than a hotel room but one that we really enjoyed. The privacy, the space we had, having breakfast on the patio, lovely surroundings etc. made for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “AARGH!”
Reviews.Author: cygnet2
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most frustrating and disappointing trips we've ever taken....and we travel a LOT! First the hotel----we were there on a timeshare exchange. (Please keep in mind that our home timeshare is a deluxe 2 bedroom/2 bathroom premiere unit and exchanging it for another resort is supposed to get us a comparable unit) Entered the lobby and it was very attractive! Couldn't wait to see our accomodations. We requested a non-smoking room as close to the pool as possible. We were given one on the first floor---sounded great, but when we got there and opened the door, we were shocked! It was like a cave---so dark. And not near the pool at all! There was only one window (missing the screen) that opened to the lobby parking lot and had tall shrubs planted in front of it, presumably for privacy. Unfortunately, the privacy came at the price of absolutely no natural light. We had to have maintenance bring us an extra lamp----which they placed on the floor without a lamp shade! Our "kitchen" was minimal---microwave and mini-fridge only. The upholstered furniture was old looking and not especially clean. The bathroom was clean, but the tub/shower combination was tiny! Where was the big jetted tub advertised on the website? Obviously in the other (larger) part of the lockout unit we were in along with the stove, dishwasher and washer dryer! So disappointing! We were expecting something far nicer than what we got! When we asked for an upgrade, we were told they were totally booked. Next day a young couple was at the front desk complaining that they didn't want to pay for a 2 bedroom unit when there were just the 2 of them. I don't know who's booking reservations, but they're obviously not doing a great job. Then we went down to the pool and spa to relax---This place is totally locked up....fences and gates everywhere that require your key card to enter. The pool is large and at first glance, beautiful. Unfortunately there is a sand beach entry for children and the sand is not well confined to that area. It goes everywhere and is really an annoyance. There was also about an inch of sand in the bottom of the spa. When I asked if they were going to clean it out, all I got was a dirty look. And forget about bar or food service! There is a portable bar by the pool and another by the "lazy river", but no servers. Drinks are $13 for the first and $9 for refills. Available food included chips and ice cream at the bar or a hot dog or nachos at a portable cart....which was out of hot dogs when I wanted one because they're only allowed to have 6 (!!!!) in the cart at a time. And did I mention there are no restaurants in the resort itself? There is Tahiti Joe's just across the driveway and Denny's in the same building and that's it. Tahiti Joe's was horrible! The food was awful, the service was abysmal and cocktails have to go on a separate check because the bar is actually owned by a different company. Concierge service was a joke....yes, they'll book local day trips for you and make reservations, but they also want to sign you up for a sales pitch and when we declined, the concierge became VERY rude and cut off the conversation, even though we were about to ask her to make reservations for us. This place has so much potential, but is a disaster as it is now...I couldn't even get change for a dollar to use the vending machine. And parking?? Horrible! Couldn't get a parking space late one night so parked in guest registration parking and got a nasty note on the windshield and a nasty phone call at 6 am....I guess I was supposed to park on the other side of the resort between Denny's and the fleabag motel next door and walk all the way to my room late at night alone?? NOT! Had to park on a deserted side street each night after that and walk to my room. Scary.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Tahiti Village and would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: clipperusa
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying off of the strip and I can honestly say that I did not miss the craziness of it. We had a 2 bedroom lock-off unit that slept 8 and it was wonderful! The grounds were beautiful and our unit in Tower 5 was very clean and quiet. This was a girls trip with 2 moms and 6 girls ages 17 - 22. They loved it! They tanned at the pool and floated in the lazy river during the day and then we all went out at night. If you are a big gambler, then you would probably prefer to be on the strip. However, if you are not and like to stay at more of a resort atmosphere, I think you would like Tahiti Village. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: rachelsbobbob
Reviews.Content: This resort is almost new. Everything was spotless; the grounds were lovely. Ask for a view of the pool or lazy river since there are construction sites around the resort. I did not really see any construction going on while we were there, but there were construction fences and lots with construction materials. Parking can be a hassel, but do not shy away from the parking garage. Depending upon your building, you could have a ways to walk, but there were always spaces in the several level parking garage. Handicap parking was scarce. The pool was gorgeous with plenty of chaise lounge chairs. There was a sandy beach at the pool for the kids; it did cause sand in the pool in close areas, but it really was not a problem. There were plenty of steps into the pool and there were shallow areas where chairs could be placed. Towels were available for guests at the pool and lazy river at no charge. At the lazy river, there was a daily charge for each person of $3 for a big tube. This could get expensive for a family with kids. The resort charges for internet access. So, again this can be costly. We did not use the shuttle, but we saw many using it; there is a schedule. The shuttle runs frequently to a variety of places. Be sure to check with consegier the first or second day to get information packet and find out about discount tickets etc. There is an outlet mall across the street from the parking garage. Furnishings were lovely and the bed was fabulous. We had no problems during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely relaxing vacation at the Tahiti Village.”
Reviews.Author: bellasmom4
Reviews.Content: Rent a car because you'll be close to the South Point Hotel which is great for teens because they have a 16 movie theater, arcade room and bowling. Close to the rental car center and close to the airport and right down the road from the Strip! The lazy river is busy all day with kids and the main pool is big and has a volleyball net and a sandy beach which is nice for the little kids. We stayed in Tower 5, Moorea unit. No patio because unit has a limited kitchen. It was fine for the 4 of us. We were right by the parking garage and the outlet center is across the street. You can't go wrong staying here. The larger units are beautiful, we asked to see them. Denny's is right next door for breakfast. Staff was courteous and helpful. Would definitely return to the Tahiti Village! They don't have internet access in the room, but Denny's has WI FI next door. The business center charges you to use their internet service and copier. It was $10.00 to confirm and print out our airline tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: FancyFancy
Reviews.Content: Our room was wonderful. Everything was clean and spacious. The entire family enjoyed staying here. No complaints at all. We will definitely stay here again. As all other reviews state, " great place to stay with kids."

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Neek913
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Tahiti Village since I purchased a unit here in 2007. The place was awesome. The room was fabulous, Everything was new, the room was huge. The grounds were meticulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facilities, Great location, Great Family location”
Reviews.Author: fireinjunjoe
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great rooms: Had two connected 1BR, 1Bath condos.. Total of 2/2. Separated the kids from the adults. I was in Bld 5 (closest to parking garage). view was OK. Future development area. Quiet. Rooms were like new and clean Location: Near airport and rental car area. 2 miles from big casinos. Close to shopping. turn south on strip to "Food for Less" . They have shuttle there also (limited times). Rent a car if you are looking for other than LV strip activities. Facilities: Main pool was a little warm. lazy river quite cool. they rent float rings $3 ea. rooms and such excellent. Mini-market was much better and cheaper than expected. Cons: Only check in a little slow- took an hour for 12 couples/ families A warning: Las Vegas is not for kids. not a lot to do for them. Rent a car and plan away trips from area. But TV very nice if they just want to pool and crisp up like tanned bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti Village”
Reviews.Author: tapinsharon
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful tropical inspired oasis in the middle of the Nevada dessert! We had a wonderful time there. The pool area has got to be one of the best in Vegas. Meticulously maintained. Everybody was very helpful. We had a ground floor room right next to the pool, which was especially convenient. The kitchen is very well stocked, which is unusual for timeshares. I advised the first caller from Tahiti Village we would not be doing a time share presentation. And again when we met with the "concierge" told her we would not attend a time share presentation. Absolutely nobody approached us after that. The only issue was one morning we had a dying cockroach in our room. We notified maintenance who was horrified - but I saw some cockroaches out and about the strip at night as well. It's a difficult thing to manage when they are all around. It was fun being right across the street from the big outlet mall. We rented our own car, so transportation to/fro the strip was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “We will never go back!”
Reviews.Author: gabiandsofi
Reviews.Content: We traded our week, so that we could take our children to Tahti Village. My husband and I had taken a tour last year, and thought our children would really enjoy this resort now that the Lazy River had been finished. We had a list of complaints by the end of the week. First of all the main pool was very dirty. I don't know how often it is cleaned, but I did not appreciate floating clumps of hair while I was trying to relax in the pool. Secondly, there need to be more pools for the size of this resort. The pool and the lazy river are way too crowded. The Lazy River is supposed to be for floating around. It was so crowded at times, that it took forever to float around the river just once because there was actually "crowd traffic". Thirdly, I thought it was inappropriate for the resort to allow all that beer drinking in the lazy river. It got a little wild on the Fourth of July, with some semi drunk guys acting pretty foolishly while families with children were trying to enjoy themselves at the lazy river. Fourthly, not all the dryers were working in the laundry room, causing a backup. Who wants to stay up past midnight doing laundry during their vacation? Complaint #5: the concierge in building five was not helpful at all when I asked him about the local children's museum. He never made eye contact, and the only thing he could do was print out the directions for me. He was very young and inexperienced. Complaint #6: The gyms need to have age rules posted. On one of the days that I was working out, I saw parents dropping off their young children (maybe about 9-10 years of age), and leaving them there to entertain theirselves. I was there to exercise, not supervise other children who could get injured on one of the machines. Complaint #7:Security was too lax. There were lots of people going in and out of the buildings at night, and using the pool that I am positive were not members or resort guests. How could so many people not have a card key to enter the pool areas or the buildings? Complaint #8 (and final one as well) : The internet access was absolutely primitive. I had noticed several people sitting in one section of the lobby using their laptops. Since I did not want to pay to use the computer in the lobby, I was told by someone at the front desk that I was welcome to use my laptop in that section because that is where you could access the internet from the Denny's that is located accross the parking lot. In other words, the resort was not paying for internet access. Even though I knew it was an unethical procedure, I tried it anyway. The internet was extremely slow. It took me 20 minutes to "get in", and it was through Denny's home page. I went an entire week without retrieving my email. NEVER, WOULD WE RECOMMEND THIS RESORT, AND NEVER AGAIN WOULD WE STAY THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous time”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaResident
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite (Bora Bora room) along with our two kids (ages 10 and 6). The room was very spacious, more than enough for two adults and two kids. The bathroom was great with two sinks, a hot tub bath, and a standing shower stall. The room had a full kitchen (including pots and pans), dining table, sofa bed, and balcony. There were two TVs (one in the living room and one in the bedroom). We had no problems with any sales people regarding the timeshare tour. We had one message on the phone to pick up the welcome package and that was it. I heard that if you did not want to be bother about the timeshare tour, don't pick up the welcome packet. So we did not pick it up and had not problems. The staff were very responsive to our needs and very helpful. We are a little hesitant about Tahiti Village because of some of the negative feedback left but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and had none of the problems that peopled have complained about in the previous reviews. The kids loved the pool and we never had problems finding a shady place to sit. The fitness center was OK, small room with old equipment but it was better than nothing. We did not use the shuttle as we drove. We did not have parking problems but we were usually back by 9:00pm. The kids enjoyed M&M World, Paris hotel, Caesar's Palce, and the water show at the Belagio. If you like Nachos go to Margarita Ville (near Flamingo Hotel) and order the volcano nachoes (this thing iis huge and should be shared).

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: Rhodes32
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village was a great place for us. It had a (limited) kitchen allowing us to have breakfast and lunch in our room (great if you are on a budget). The room was very clean. They have daily scheduled activities. They have a huge pool with part sand, which my daughter loved! They also have a Lazy River pool, which was great. A shuttle is provided to major hotels and casinos. The best part about Tahiti Village was they don't have slot machines and such meaning no smoking inside.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware”
Reviews.Author: AirForceTraveler
Reviews.Content: The entire week we were there we heard constant comments of "bankruptcy". Be alert to the sales dept - the free tickets are being refused at the shows, vouchers are being denied. Every company we came into contact with stated that the resort was going bankrupt. Business center was down entire time and they charge ridiculous fees. Everything is a fee. Only good part was the spa on 9th floor of tower 5 but they were contracted - not a part of the resort. Spa is excellent - ONLY HIGHLIGHT Parking was poor, cleaning was fair, no laundry facilities in most rooms, was not booked in the part we were promised by Interval International. Laundry room on 9th floor had 5 washers 2 worked, 5 dryers 3 worked. Staff is not helpful nor friendly. Staff was never able to answer questions or provide information. DON'T GO ON THE TOUR - YOU ARE WASTING YOUR TIME - TICKETS WILL BE REFUSED AND THE SALES STAFF WILL LIE MORE THAN USUAL. IF YOU WANT A GREAT SHOW THEN THE SALES STAFF CAN PUT ON THE BEST CON-SHOW I HAVE EVER SEEN!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service- Don't Waste Your Time”
Reviews.Author: penguina1987
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a romantic couple of days without our children. We were approached by someone from the company giving tours and offering free show tickets. We thought "why not?" We gave them $40 ($20 per person) and were told that we would get it back once went on the tour. The next morning (the day of our tour), we received a phone call in our hotel room that the tour had been cancelled and we would get a refund by going down to the booth in our hotel lobby and someone would be there. We did just that and found no one at their booth and a sign that directed us to another hotel and a different company office. We followed the directions and when arrived were told they couldn't help us. Thankfully the employee that originally took the money from us had written his phone number on our ticket. We called and he apologized and gave us the number to the General Manager. I called her and in my 29 years have never been spoken to in such a rude way by anyone. She was not willing to help me and told me to go to now a 3rd hotel on the other end of the strip to get our refund. At this point it was just matter of principal so we went and waited for 45 minutes. There were other couples waiting there too and the guy that was "promised" to be there never showed. Upon calling back to their "field office,” we were all told that if we wanted our refund that we would have to go to the Tahiti Village Resort and get it there. By this time we were fed up and just left to go back to AZ, but I would recommend not even wasting your time. There are many more things to do in Vegas than wasting you time dealing with Tahiti Village.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 25th Wedding Anniversary with Tahiti Village”
Reviews.Author: pinnacle07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our getaway after listening to the radio commericials. We were skeptics, but figured we'd give it a shot. GLAD WE DID!!! We had the time of our lives for our 25th wedding anniversary. We booked our stay at the Stratosphere. Very fun casino. The Top of the World Restaurant is a must do! It revolves at 108 stories up. Also, adventure thrill rides are on the 109th floor...amazing. Just a really fun casino...great bars, entertainment, restaurants, We toured Tahiti Village during our stay, and was surprisingly very pleased by the scenery. We loved the contrast it has with the strip. For nightlife, go to the strip, for serenity and tropical feel, go back to Tahiti Village. Plus the mall is right down the street. Had been to numerous timeshares just for the freebies. The suites at Tahiti Village are fabulous! On-site spa looked inviting. ANd even the older suites were well kept. Actually a little nicer than the new ones. (Yes, we did ask to see one of the older suites.) We plan on going back next year and possibly making a purchase. We want our timeshare paid off before we retire, so that we can vacation every year, without having to pay out lots of money when we no longer have income from jobs. Plus so many other perks go with the program. Don't trust me, go check it out for yourself. And we did receive our deposit back within 3 days. So it's risk free. P.S. We are actual customers, we have no connection to Tahiti Village, just want others to know our experience...D. and L. Reed

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed this time.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravel6
Reviews.Content: Wow! Tahiti Village is done! The lazy river is in and was the highlight for our kids on this trip! It is nice to have the lazy river close in proximity to Tower 5, which is part of the finished Phase II development. The sandy beach entry in the main pool was still a favorite and my kids made many friends there while building sandcastles. The whole resort is clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and well equipped. I especially enjoyed the washer and dryer in the new Phase II rooms. They seem much more efficient that the original rooms. It would be nice if the balcony could be extended over to the main master bedroom, but we enjoyed it anyway, just couldn't when the kids were sleeping. The hot tub was nice to enjoy at night and I appreciated the fact that they made that part accessible for adults 24-hours a day. Tahiti Village has also extended their shuttle service with 4 shuttles and now stops at Tropicana, Circus Circus, New York, New York, Treasure Island, Outlet Malls, Stratosphere, and The Orleans. Wiki Wiki is the convenience store located on the property. Prices are fairly good...considering its convenience. Only $3.95 for a 1/2 gallon of milk. Tahiti Village added a spa this year called Manaha. While we did not have any treatments, prices seemed competitive and the spa itself looked gorgeous. One suggestion I have is to either add more tables to the pool area or add more chairs to the barbeque area. It seems that when we were there, a lot of larger families like ours were utilizing this great feature, creating a chair shortage. Only 6 tables were available in the immediate barbeque area with only 4 chairs allotted to each table. No extras were stacked or available, which created tables with no chairs. We tried to eat in the pool area when the barbeque area was full, but there were very few tables in the pool area. One other drawback was we couldn't check out any barbequing tools from the front desk since they were all checked out. It's funny that we barbequed two days in a row and no one we saw there had utensils either. I wonder who had them! Our room overlooked the lazy river and part of the Vegas strip...ahhhh! We can't wait for another week to come next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Trying to come back but seems to always be booked :(”
Reviews.Author: caliLv2trvl
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! My friends were worried at first after reading horrible reviews but the hotel was very very nice, clean, and new. A bit far from the strip but was no problem because they have a complimentary shuttle that comes every half hour and drops you off infront of MGM. fantastic pool and 24hr hot tub. Only negative is no internet and no room service so if you spend a lot of time in the room your trash might pile up.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Jenny019
Reviews.Content: For my daughters birthday, we flew to Las Vegas and stayed at Tahiti Village. It was an awsome experience. The room was immaculate and the service was great. I am recommending this hotel to my son for his wedding in Los Vegas. Shuttle service took us to our destination and picked us up every time we dared to venture outside. I give you an A Tahiti Village and I look forward to returning again soon. Virginia Cupps Springdale Arkansas

Reviews.Title: “Great concierge service!”
Reviews.Author: Steffiethepilot
Reviews.Content: We are in the second day of our trip and it has been made exponetially better by the concierge service in building 5. Nicole Percy and Robert Craig. They went out of their way to advise and book plans for our night out. The service in the main building was completely under-par. The ladies in the main building were slightly snotty and condescending, however the bell hop was very nice. If you are looking for direction and service, go talk to Nicole and Robert!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a super get away - we really enjoyed our time”
Reviews.Author: Khender
Reviews.Content: Loved the place! Here is the pros * Very Clean * Very Spacious * Comfortable beds and sleeper sofas * Great Steam Shower and Jetted Tub * Loved the washer/dryer - very convenient * LOVED THE LAZY RIVER - How relaxing to raft around with a drink in hand. VERY COOL. * The staff was always very nice and accomodating -always greeted us as we walked past or opened doors, etc. All around great place to stay. With the craziness of downtown, it was nice to be very close, but then at a relaxing place. The BBQ's were a great touch, we just didn't get a chance to use them, but it was nice to see alot of people were using them. It also encouraged me to see Vegas busy again, the last time I was downtown it was dead - not this past weekend. It was really great to see people getting out again with friends and family in these times.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but an internet "dinosaur", limited internet connection”
Reviews.Author: ChristimarieSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Tahiti Village and we were shocked at the limited internet availability. We were at first put in the newest phase and there was no internet available at all! They then transferred us to phase 1 and we had to go through a TV connection cable and even then we couldn't email out. I can't believe a resort of this caliber would be such an internet dinosaur. The rooms and amenities are beautiful, but if you need internet, do not stay here. We had to go down to the "business" area to log on the the Denny's restaurant WiFi which was next door!!!! The first time, this area was so filled up with people waiting for resort sales tours,k that we had to search for a tiny place to sit down! This resort may be new, but it needs to join the twenty-first century!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - super clean, great design, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: benrichard16
Reviews.Content: We stayted for a long weekend in mid-May 2009, and found the place to be just fantastic. We had our 9-year-old with us, and the pools were on par the best we've ever had... anywhere... and we've stayed at some really nice places over the years. If you go, know that this is more of a 'condo' experience rather than a 'full service hotel experience'. For the price, we are more than happy to sleep in the same bed linens for a week and hang up our own towels. The kitchen in the larger Bora Bora rooms is just like home, and it's equipped with everything you need to cook for a small group. The free BBQ pit area just outside the building was a nice touch. Don't plan on walking to the Strip, but if you've been to Vegas, you'll know that can be a bit of a walk once you are there anyway. The shuttle service is frequent and different shuttles land you at any of 6 stops... every 15-30 minutes! Last run just before 2am, I think. Again... free. Plan ahead - no worries. Activities? Ask for Mike at the Concierge desk. He was just great! He advised us to spend $2 per person for the Red Rock Canyon tour, and he was right... the best $2 we spent in Vegas! The wildflowers were in bloom, and it was about 10 degrees cooler than in town. As for the reports of stalker sales-people, they will only work you if you want something - if you bite on a promotion (low rate or free tickets), expect to spend up to 2 hours with them. This is what they deserve for giving you any deal you might want. We asked for nothing and weren't pestered even once. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time And Still Great”
Reviews.Author: MOC_Jamz
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay 2 week stay at Tahiti Village marked our 3rd year in staying at this resort, and each year, it gets better as it grows. In 2008, Phase II was just about complete and opened later that year. Our room was actually located in the new phase, and it was nice to see that several things that were a little aggravating in the older phase had been addressed in the new phase. One of those things is the washer/dryer. In the old phase, it's a combined washer/dryer...one unit...you put the clothes in, they get washed and dryed in the same machine. The dryer worked horrendously...the clothes always stayed damp and wrinked terrible. In the new phase, it's a separate washer and dryer, and they work very well. Since we stayed so long, it was of great help. Also, the a/c was set up better. In the old phase, in the Bora Bora unit, in the master bedroom, the a/c blows right on your face as you sleep, and it blows hard. We always turned it off and kept the a/c on in the living room, and the entire unit stayed cool. In the new phase, the a/c grilles are located better and air circulates better. In the bathroom, the air exhaust works better, too. As far as the property goes, for the first time, we were not hassled with sales reps, or "owner update" phone calls. No one called and we were glad! The Lazy River is now open, and boy oh boy, it's the nicest one I've ever been in...better than Wet N Wild and better than Atlantis. There are 5 water features, designed to drench or splash you, but only if you choose. To fully enjoy the river, don't waste the time renting a float. They charge $3.00 a day for the float, but they are bulky, and keep you out of the water. I hate floats in the lazy rivers, and it was so nice to just swim around, every day, and I did. One thing, some of the water falls are really strong, especially the main one, so cover your ears...you don't want water rushing up your ears. Can't say enough about how lovely the "river" is. So nice, I never even swam in the main pool. Don't know why, but the main pool water was murky for the entire 2nd week...looked very uninviting. The river was much better. Evidently, Phase III and Phase IV are planned. Land has been cleared, and with the endless tour groups on the property (they are not allowed in the pool areas, though, fortunately), I overheard that 2 more restaurants will be added, in addition to the Denny's and Tahiti Joes, both of which are pretty good. I also saw the full site plan, and there are more pools and water features to be added along with the new phases. We actually requested a few things be in our room when we arrived, like extra hangars and such, and they have a website where you e-mail them and tell them this, but of course, none of that happened. And trying to request a room in a certain area of the property is also a big pain. I now understood what people were talking about when they said there is no elevator at the end of Phase II building, because we stayed in the very end unit at the end of any INCREDIBLY long corridor. We truly got good walking exercise! But the check in process with luggage and some groceries was a huge pain. Parking is tough on the property, but the parking garage was never even remotely full. However, when they add Phase III and Phase IV, parking is going to be ridiculous, so it seems. One note to Tahiti: get rid of that stupid curb in front of Phase II, behing Manor Suites, and put down parking stripes so people can park! As it is, they all jump up the curb and park anyway! Parking is rough on this property with the addition of the new phase, because the parking garage is on one end of the property, and the entrance to Phase II is incredibly far from the garage and other phases. Overall, we still love Tahiti and will return next year. If you plan to stay here, trust me, do NOT get a room on the first floor of Phase II. All the tours walk down the hallway, and it's a mess of people. On the weekends, the pool and pool areas get pretty crowded, too. Not crazy, but crowded enough. And because the gated system to enter the propery and pools requires a key and you open the door to enter, the door then slams shut, so don't get a room near a pool if you don't want to hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Tahiti Village!”
Reviews.Author: californiadeb
Reviews.Content: We did an exchange through Interval International and were extremely pleased with our stay. We had the 2 bedroom unit and had a wonderful view of the pool. Although the pool area can get noisy, once you close your sliding door you don't hear anything. When we checked in at 2:00 our room was actually ready for us and when we went to the concierge desk we just told them nicely that we did not want to be bothered with requests to do the tour and he very nicely put us in the computer as a do-not-disturb for the week. We were never once asked by anyone on the property to do the tour, so we were pleasantly surprised as so many have complained about this. All our experiences with staff there were very pleasant and we have no complaints at all. Our room was in great shape, nothing was worn out and it was spotless. There is a weird smell in the master bathroom but we got rid of it by pouring a pitcher of water down the closet drain. Very strange but that is what engineering said to do and it worked! That was the only negative about the room at all. The bed was comfy and we had plenty of pillows. The pools are great and we never had a problem getting chairs before 11:00 am. The lazy river pool is not heated so it was too cool for us but I am sure when the temps get up there soon, it will be refreshing. The main pool is heated and very comfortable. The weather was perfect all week, in the mid-80's to low 90's. We had a rental car and were glad we did as we do not like wasting our time waiting on shuttles. We spent part of the time on the strip and actually really enjoyed 2 casinos that are just south of the resort, the Silverton and SouthPoint. Both are very clean and nice and if you like video poker you will be in heaven! Parking, as mentioned, is very full but we were just really lucky.....we always got a spot really close to our room. Good parking karma! We had a great vacation and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: sunloverBroulee
Reviews.Content: Resort was unbelievable, had a suite for my family of 7. Rooms were of a very high standard, loved the spa, steam room, large plasma in bedroom etc etc. Don't know if we were biased coming straight from a stay at a dusty working cattle ranch & a trip to the grand canyon but we loved the spa & pool. Staying away from the strip was a good idea with 5 children & the shuttle bus was handy just be early, I think the drivers watches need resetting. Hated Vegas for a family trip but just one of those things you have to see & would regret if you didn't do it. Cheap internet rates in your room with 3 computers so teenagers were very happy after being out of reach for a while. OOHH! & I forgot to mention the great shopping just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice As Long As No Interaction With Staff!”
Reviews.Author: woohoo1234
Reviews.Content: My parent's are owners with Interval International, the timeshare company. My husband and I get to use some of their time all over the place and have always had a fabulous time wherever we stay. We arrived April 26th around noon to check in. Check in is at 4pm and we understood we were early. They pre-registered us and told us they would call us if anything opened, otherwise just come back at 4pm. We came back at 4pm and had to stand in the same long a$$ line. What was pre-registering for?? They told us to go see the Welcome Center Concierge for our welcome packet. So one lady stopped us and told us to go speak with one gentleman. He was nice and started to give us some coupons and such...Then he said he didn't have everything and that we'd need to go see Darcy for the rest of it. Darcy was nice. She said that as owner's guests we could go take a tour of the facility and in exchange get some tickets to a show. We asked her what show and she offered ICE which she said was supposed to be really good. So we said sure, since we've been on many owner tours of resorts we've stayed at within Interval. She took a $40 deposit for our appointment and said that as soon as we were done with our tour the money would be given back, that it's just a way to make people want to show up. The following day we showed up for our appointment. It was a total cattle call. Our "tour guide/salesman" asked us where we were staying, which was weird, we had never been asked that before. We told him at Tahiti Village. He looked at us strange. He took us into a large room where they give presentations. We finally told him that we think we're in the wrong place, that we are supposed to be on an owner's tour, not in the hard sale area. He walked us back down and we were shuffled around from person to person. We finally just said we want our $40 back and walk away. Then they told us that our money would be given back in 3 days. Not cool, that's not what we were told. So one lady said would you like to still get the ICE tickets and we agreed. She said she was going to get a form and came back with Mike. He pretty much said he didn't know what kind of places we've been to before but that's how they operate here. Everyone goes through the presentation. He said in no way would we be getting the tickets and pretty much that we were [--] out of luck for getting our money back any sooner. We told him the kind of review we'd leave for him. Just because of how lousy the staff is there, I really, really wanted to hate this place! I wanted to come on here and completely bash it, but honestly, the facility is so nice it's hard to. The good: Its a new building so you can't hear other guests banging or jumping around as you normally would in other places, the kitchen is very nice, stainless steel appliances, granite counters, large living areas, large tvs in living and bed rooms, lots of lounging chairs at pool and river, the pool and river are nice. The bad: Our view was of a dirt lot overlooking a car rental facility. The only nice part of the view was sunrise in the morning (yes, we were up that early most days). The elevators are in the middle of the building so if you are at the end, it's quite a trek to get to the elevators. Parking was chaotic! Luckily they have the parking garage but if your room is not near it, it's quite a trek too! I really enjoyed that fact that it wasn't in the midst of the "strip". It's nice to come back to a quiet, calm place where the bells and dinging of slot machines is no where to be found! We didn't use the shuttle because we rented a car and are glad we did! Most days and nights the Douce (double decker bus) was packed. It was just easier to pick the Block we wanted to hang out around and park at one of the casinos for free and walk place to place. There is an outlet mall right across the street...we never went there. We never went to Joe's or Denny's (on sight). There are so many better places to eat than there, in my opinion. The Palms has a fabulous buffet Bistro Buffet that is $9.95 pp for lunch that is actually super delicious with a great dessert area! All in all, this resort is really nice if you're looking for the condo type place. It's not a party atmosphere with hot hard bodies all around. As far as the timeshare portion of it, OWNER OR NOT-JUST SAY NO TO THE PRESENTATION, NO MATTER WHAT THEY OFFER!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, clean rooms, but many other little problems.”
Reviews.Author: ElaineLouisiana
Reviews.Content: I own; there for my first time. Disappointed the service was not the quality I expected. Received no room freshing half way through our stay. Key card stopped; got locked out with food we had grilled. Had to ask to find things. Other resorts have information in units. Small unit's kitchen was lacking of pitchers and microwave bowls. Grill area dirty with the same sauce spills all week even after it was brought to someone attention. Not enough buses for the owners to go to Red Rock State Park? Why isn't there a waiting list; other added as needed? Hassled by the sales manager and lied to by the lady who brought us our packet. When I saw people touring the resort, I wanted to tell them not to buy here.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay @ the Tahiti Village”
Reviews.Author: Easy M
Reviews.Content: We did a roadtrip from Alberta to L.V. at the last week of August 2008. We exchanged our time through Interval. When we arrived at Tahiti Village, we are so glad of how friendly and courteous the staff were. Check-in was fast and easy (and so was check-out by the way). We enjoyed our 1 week stay at Tahiti Village and no doubt in our minds that when we decide to go back to L.V. we shall stay at the same resort. People were very friendly, excellent customer service, the resort is well maintained, housekeeping was awesome and we loved our room. We had a pool view and it was not noisy at all. The sand pool and hot pool was awesome, always busy though. We did have a chance to use it a couple of times. The hot pool is open up to the early morning. The sand pool is close by 10pm. Tahiti Joe is one of the restaurant at Tahiti Village (we went there once as we spent most of our time at the L.V. strip). There is a Denny's restuaurant on site. Every day at Tahiti Village their was always fun activities. We went to the Red Rock Canyon for $2. It was worth the trip and can hardly beat that price. In addition, during the trip, bottle of water was provided. We would go to the strip late in the afternoons and we would take the free Tahiti shuttle servic to go there and get off by Treasure Island, bottle of water was also free! It was easy to go to and fro the strip because of the free shuttle service and there was three drop off/pickup areas at the strip. Make sure to inquire shuttle operator/concierge where they are located at or asked for the shuttle service schedule! At night, We would take the taxi back to Tahiti Village when we lost track of time. As mentioned, there is a concierge available and they do a wonderful job in booking activities. One thing to watch out for is the Timeshare sales people. We were asked twice but declined nicely. We did not have a hard time looking for parking at the Tahiti Village because we mostly took the Tahiti shuttle bus, and when we did we go for a drive, we were lucky enough to always find an empty spot :). An outlet mall is walking distance from resort. We also liked how Tahiti Village is some distance away from all the lights and noise. Cons: No free internet (very expensive to use at Tahiti Village), and as some reported finding a parking spot can be an issue. For info on Tahiti Village: [--]

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: GrandTimberAlabama
Reviews.Content: Very impressed. Read a lot of negative but didn't see anything to worry about. Stayed in Bldg 5 two bedroom. Stayed in lock out portion. Travel regularly with other couple. Very modern and clean. great space. No issue with staff. Did not take the tour and was never bothered. Denny's next door was a bonus. Great place for breakfast. Clean and excellent service.Eastyaccess to the strip hotels and shows. Easier to drive, plenty of parking at the hotels. Pool and lazy river were nice. Would stay again but have a long list of other places to go

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly "PHENOMENAL" Experience”
Reviews.Author: worldseeker2010
Reviews.Content: After all the negative reports of Tahiti Village - I was worried about my stay. However, let me be one of the few to tell you - this resort is beyond beautiful and do not believe the negative reports. I arrived at 1pm (knowing check in was not until 4pm). I was greeted by great service from workers in the lobby. The woman who checked me in went out of her way to ensure I got the perfect room. She asked what building (new or older) and view (strip, standard, pool, or mountain). I chose Building 5 (NEW) pool view. To my surprise our room was ready!! The woman who checked us in was very personable and knowledgeable. After check in - we went to Tahiti Joes for lunch. I had rented a car but did not know where anything was at and was too hungry to look. The greeter at Tahiti Joes was very nice and took our order with ease. We got 2 burgers and fries meals. Here is a complaint: We waited an hour (no lie) for our food to come (we got take out). Furthermore, Tahiti Joes was empty so I could not understand the serious delay. The staff was nice (I won $20 at their slot machine) but that was it. The food was over priced and only average. For those who rent a car, there are many options (the outlet mall which is right across the street [food court], McDonalds and other fast food joints (all within walking distance (bus ride) and driving. Another complaint (though did not bother me) was the groups of visitors whom were doing tours who were being begged to sign their name on the dotted line to purchase a timeshare - the Tahiti Village team would take them to Tahiti Joes and buy them a drink to get them liquored up and sign their name. Avoid this at all costs if you are doing a tour. The room: I got a studio and let me tell you, IT WAS STUNNING!! This is my 4th timeshare room and this one ranks number 1. The studio is the size of a 1 bedroom (really) - it was huge. I had a view of the strip and pool and could see the sun rise every morning. It was great. The bed was super comfortable and the 2 flatscreen tvs were added bonuses. This room is nice for 2 people (a couple), it is cozy and immaculate filled with tropical illustrations. It does not feel like your in the middle of the desert. Be careful though, the standard rooms overlook a dirt field (I think they call that mountain view) - request a pool or strip view. Another complaint is about Building 5 (though this may be consistent in the other buildings as well). If you have a car, you have to park in the garage which is on property but it takes about 10 minutes to get from the garage to your room. Also, there is a LONG (no lie) hallway from outside to the elevators, it goes on forever. When checking in, be ready to carry your bags, groceries a long way. This is only a minor complaint but for those with mobility issues - it may be problematic. Rent a car or not? YES! For me, the convenience of having a car made my vacation even better. However, I can honestly say, the shuttle service (though I did not take it), was seen on property and seems worthwhile. Driving on the strip in April was GREAT!! I have heard the horror stories but it was not bad in anyway. Yes there is traffic, but if you live in any metropolitan city, you can handle the strip. However, if you are going to an event, you should leave 2 hours early (to drive the strip, park the car and get to your location). Speaking of parking, the parking garages at hotels along the strip are FREE - however, they are just as big as the hotels themselves. I found valet to be best (also free) just tip $1 or $2. The only things in walking distance is the outlet mall across the street and gas stations. It is in no way in walking distance to the strip. However, both the airport and rental car facility are next door. Back to Tahiti Village - the sand pool and wave pool are BEAUTIFUL. I did not get to experience it - the weather was cold during most of my stay but I did get to sit at the pool. The chairs are relaxing and areas well kept. Lifeguards were on duty daily and were nice as well. Get ready to be starred at and get photo ops from tours, they are taken to the top of building 5 for an ariel view of property. Housekeeping: Phenomenal, everything I ran out of was replaced within minutes. I did not get to experience any of the activities offered but many were offered. I tried to do the Red Rock Canyon tour through Tahiti Village but was told it was booked solid for 3 weeks. If you know you want to do any tours offered by the resort, book them as early as you can. The concierge were nice (not the greatest). Watch out: Walking around the property (you will get stopped) to take a tour/presentation. Decline nicely and be on your way. Also, on your 2nd day, you will get a call about a "Welcome Package", DO NOT pick it up. It is a trap for a tour/presentation. Also, for those reports about no maid service, this is a timeshare - that is expected. Also, be on the lookout on the strip from other timeshare presentation people, they will stop you in general conversation and try to get you to attend one, just decline and walk away. In the room - there is no channel line up. The weather channel is not very helpful (it is not local). No internet (very expensive); the channels are good (basic cable). Overall, EXCELLENT experience and already booked a return trip for August. Check out was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, few issues - good time”
Reviews.Author: sav55
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Tahiti Village 4/20/09. We did a timeshare exchange through Interval International. This is a nice resort if you need to get away from the vegas strip for a while. We stayed in the Royal Tanishan room (2Bdrm lockoff unit) and it was nice but the furniture was beatup a bit and not to comfortable but it had a kitchen and thats what we needed. The lazy river was fun and the pool also but no wait staff and there is construction going on. Be sure to stay away from the gates, they slam everytime people enter and leave the area. We had a few issues with Tahiti Joes - once at night and once at lunch. Both times we got the meals for free because of long wait times plus I heard other complaining too. The bar area does have video poker and slots with drink specials but we only did that for a night. Wouldn't recommend it but Denny's was good! The room had a washer/dryer combo and it didn't work that well so dont count on it and there is not much storage space for clothing in the bedrooms. Shuttle service was great, saved alot on taxi service! They will try to sell you a timeshare but we skipped the "free welcome package". Allday long they have people coming and going to view this place so book your shows early in the week when the desk is not busy. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great time with the kids.”
Reviews.Author: trave1mom
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a convention that my husband had to attend. My 3 kids came along for the ride as well. We enjoyed the lazy river and pool. The rooms were immaculate and had nice flat-screen tvs and a spacious kitchen to prepare meals. The shopping outlet is located across the street which was nice to walk around if you didn't want to take the shuttle to the strip. There is a general store which came in handy when we needed to by breakfast items and toiletries. Tahiti Joe's is a great family oriented restaurant located onsite. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation - R&R and lots or nothing to do....my choice”
Reviews.Author: artises
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd year staying here. We are owners in Consolidated Resorts. I have a 4 year old son and he loves the huge pool with the beach entry. This year the lazy river was open and it was great. Love the Tahitian theme....we live in California and Las vegas is only a 3 1/2 hour drive but the way the resort is designed it makes you feel like you are really AWAY! You can choose to do nothing...lay out at the pool, lazy river, stay in your room.....or take advantage of activities that the resort has. Their conceriege desk is very helpful. As an owner you can buy various show tickets at a GREAT price!!! The rooms are very nice and comfortable. We stayed in a Bora Bora (1 bedroom with a full kitchen). We love this resort and can't wait to go back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Place 2 Escape”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaChelle
Reviews.Content: My parents are owners here. I have been to Vegas many times and enjoy the entire scene. What I loved most about Tahiti Village was after all the "noise" of the Vegas Strip it was nice to relax in a non Casino like enviroment. Their pools are refreshing and inviting and if you don't feel like eating out again you can have a bbq by the pools! In my eperience out rooms have always been clean. I even ask them to change my bedding when I get there. Their team are always respectful any hour of the day. The only downfall to Tahiti Village is that the shuttles only run unitll 11pm. Not ideal for the younger crownd looking to go out.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: catwoman60
Reviews.Content: As one addicted to trip advisor reviews i did have concerns before our trip due to the amount of negative comments on trip advisor. We stayed for 10 nights, found all staff to be personable and polite, no pressure to take timeshare tours, no problems with parking, shuttles ran on time and were efficient, location at the south end of the strip was perfect for us. As brits we have no problem with walking for 2 mins from the car park, our room was at the end of the corridor from the elevator but took only a minute to walk down. the Bora Bora was clean and comfortable, although sparsely equipped we had no concerns as we did not cook in the apartment, no kettle which is always a problem for a big tea drinker. Steam shower and Large jacuzzi bath were wonderful,plenty of towels provided. We were an end apartment and had no problem with noise from other apartments, despite being spring break. 10 mins walk to las vegas outlet mall and town square mall, with cinema complex which was lovely in the evening, where the locals seemed to go, better than the strip in my opinion. Would defineately stay again if in the area, but would encourage people to get out of vegas and explore the stunning landscapes that surround the valley, driving very straightforward.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: BigCityTraveler51
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here and would recommend it highly. We're experienced travelers and not that easy to please. Had two teenagers with us, family of 4 in the Bora Bora, perfect! Shuttles are great, extremely timely and it's so nice to not have to drive the strip, park, valet etc. Did the Red Rock Tour for $2 p.p. very nice, about 1 hour too long, but worth it. The pool is great, easy to get big beach towels, as many as you want. Lazy River was terrific. Front desk did a great job. We did not do the tour, we were not interested in a time share purchase. We did buy 1/2 price tkts to Cirque du Soleil - very convenient and the show was great. I would rate this a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Stay! Relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: kehoe312
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and loved it. Very laid back. The place is very new and clean looking. We stayed in the Bora Bora Suite and thought it was very comfortable. We liked the relaxed atmosphere compared to the hotels directly on the strip. You can drive to the strip in minutes driving your car, not too bad. The shuttles are kind of a pain, getting back to Tahiti Village took a while (getting on the right shuttle at the Tropicana is confusing). They are also pretty crowded, but so is everything in Vegas. Parking wasn't bad either as some reviews have said. Alot closer than parking at Excaliber or Circus Circus. Pool and Lazy River are awesome, couldn't keep the kids out of them! We never were approached by a salesman, they we giving tours all the time but never bothered us. Staff was very friendly and anything we needed from housekeeping (towels, trash bags, t.p.) were brought up within ten minutes, very good service. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and homey”
Reviews.Author: ianbob
Reviews.Content: Very clean, bright and "homey," which I know sounds odd for a hotel in Vegas. My wife and I just returned from a weekend with the family and had a wonderful experience at Tahiti Village.
