We were skeptical when we booked our two bedroom, two bathroom, full kitchen suite, but were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The room had all brand new appliances, comfy mattresses and huge flatscreen HDTVs in four rooms. The master bedroom also had a giant jacuzzi tub. The hotel is great for kids if you're traveling with family. The hotel boasts a huge (I mean huge!) swimming pool with a "sandy beach," a large hot tub, and best of all a lazy river. Also, the hotel is far enough off the Strip that kids won't be inundated with racy images as soon as they step foot out the front door. That is a plus if you are a parent, but perhaps not so much if you are not. The hotel does offer a free shuttle from the lobby to multiple drop-offs along the Strip. It's about a 10-minute ride from Tahiti Village to the Tropicana. The room was only $160/night, and we expected to receive a high-pressure sales pitch to buy into the timeshare program, but we were once again pleasantly surprised. We were never given a sales pitch and never asked to take a tour with a sales agent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable all around”
Reviews.Author: FightingIllini10
Reviews.Content: Completely dissapointed. Staff was very unfriendly and even rude within the resort. There was no daily cleaning service. Would have to wait for hours to get new towels, pillows or blankets brought to the room. The fitness room left a lot to be desired. Huge hassel trying to get to and from the strip using the shuttle that stops after 11pm. Did not enjoy being hit on by staff, very unprofessional. Would not recommend for the younger crowd. The restruant Tahiti Joes had even worse service even when it was empty. Ordered room service pizza from there and made everyone sick. Advertised a lazy river...which isn't completed yet. Miserable experience - should have stayed at a shady motel and recieved better service.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place, poor service, wouldn't go again, certainly wouldn't buy”
Reviews.Author: travel0bug5
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that the place is not that bad - comfortable, spacious rooms (stayed in Bora Bora suite) and kitchen was very nice. The place was, overall, quite clean. The service, however, was poor (at best!). The front desk was uninformed/uneducated about the resort (i.e. could not answer simple questions about internet access, shuttle times, etc.) and they were also not at all accommodating (i.e. when we asked for a half hour extension on check-out, they refused -- even though no one came to clean the room or touched it for a full hour after 10am check out!). The service is borderline rude in that they don't seem to care much since the entire place is more focused on selling the timeshares. I wouldn't buy a timeshare - there are much better deals out there! Also, the shuttle service is slow and unreliable -- and the resort is quite a distance from the strip and all the action (but at least close to the airport). The pool is nice, the rooms are big, and the food in the area is decent (and convenient). Not going back.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel, but DON'T BUY OWNERSHIP”
Reviews.Author: wandernblonde
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is absolutely gorgeous, the pool is AMAZING! DOn't get suckered into buying at a timeshare meeting, we bought our unit at Tahiti village, the royal Tahitian every other year for $1400 total on EBAY, they were going to charge over $20,000 at the meeting. That's right over 90% off by buying online, this works with pretty much every timeshare out there if you keep your eyes open, there are so many foreclosed timeshares that they basically give the foreclosed ones away so someone will pay the maintenance fees. Before you go to a timeshare meeting go with a list of listings from the internet showing how cheap they sell for and the salespeople won't press to hard since the downpayment they require is usaully more than the full proce if you online!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms nice quite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: deerMaine
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative feeback from the different sites, I was a little worried about my stay at the village. I stayed with my husband, brother in law, and my parents, we had a two bedroom suite. It was huge, plenty of room for the five of us, and so nice and updated. The shuttle ran right on time, we never had to wait, they picked us up at the condo and dropped us off at several spots on the strip. We never used a taxi and we didn't rent a car and we went from one end of the strip to other end, with no issues at all! If you want to be right on the strip and walk from hotel to hotel I would not suggest this place, however, if you are looking to save some many and don't mind riding on shuttles, this a a great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't the strip and it ain't Tahiti”
Reviews.Author: InkdSpEdTchr
Reviews.Content: Don't bother, there is nothing redeeming about this entire place. You're much better off staying anywhere else, plus the ridiculous sales pressure is totally a downer. I will never ever come back to this place- it's not worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort...great pool”
Reviews.Author: triestep
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here, our only complaint was about the weather. The rooms were large and very nice. We would have loved to visit the pool if it had been warmer. It looks like a great place to take kids...so we've already booked a return trip soon! There is a lazy river that you can float on with tubes and a sandy beach area for the kids to play in the sand. The shuttle service they provide to the strip and back is excellent, we flew and didn't need a rental car at all. We dined at Tahiti Joe's (the onsite restaurant) and it was really good and it was 2 for 1 during the food happy hour. A great deal for a great resort...we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “would not step foot at this place ever again”
Reviews.Author: jayg052
Reviews.Content: its too bad nobody mentions 48000.00 to buy into this hype oh yeah and a thousand a year forever.okay people lets do the math 48000.00 time 52 for one place. wow now thats a scam

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I anticipated”
Reviews.Author: PeeAnne
Reviews.Content: So I was a bit leary after reading some of the reviews about Tahiti Village. We had booked a trip for four (my husband, myself, and our two children, 6 & 12). We stayed in the Junior Suite with Kitchenette and I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised. We hadn't been to Vegas for over 13 years and had no idea what to expect. I have read some complaints about the location and I will say it is not in the heart of the action on the strip but we both agreed that for a family, it was perfect. Most of the hotels on the strip offer parking so rather than march my two young children through the smut peddlers in order to tour the strip on foot, we would simply drive from one attraction to the next. We had driven in our own vehicle to Vegas so we didn't have to worry about a rental or using their shuttles. The room was very nice. There was a sofa that made into a queen bed which sat in a small living room area. The kitchenette had a microwave, fridge and sink and the cupboards were stocked with dishes and silverware for four people. There was a large pantry/coat closet area for storage and a bar with a few bar stools for sitting. The bathroom had two entrances, one from the living room and one from the bedroom. The bathroom was nice and large and you didn't feel at all crowded if someone was bathing or shower and someone was using the sink. The bedroom had a King bed which was one of the better hotel beds I have slept on. Both the living room and bedroom had a flat screen TV. One of the remotes didn't work properly and we had a new one delivered quickly upon request. My husband did notice the airplane noise more than I did. It is in the landing path of McCarran airport but I didn't find it at all disruptive. The property and the pools are gorgeous! There are outside BBQ grills and sinks if you want to BBQ and dine outside. The pools are lovely even though it was quite chilly when we were there. We didn't eat at the onsite restaurant or try the free breakfast but if you go south of the hotel, further down the strip, there was a number of restaurants and good shopping. We did eat at the garden buffet at the SouthPointe Casino one night. It was a couple of miles further south on the boulevard. It was reasonably priced, clean, and worth the money for our family. We were asked twice if we would be interested in a 'tour' of the facility or if we had received the promotional 'gift' to which we simply answered no thanks. Easy as that. I didn't feel any extreme pressure to take any timeshare presentations. There were people touring the facility with hotel employees but it wasn't at all distracting or weird. As a family or just as a couple, we will definitely keep this place in mind. I actually appreciated being off of the craziness of the 'Strip' and I liked not having to walk through a smoky casino to get to my hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - Comfortable, Well-kept, but Rent a Vehicle”
Reviews.Author: GlobalEyes
Reviews.Content: I certainly plan to stay here again because the property is very new (completed in August 2008), it's clean, comfortable, well-appointed and reasonably priced. Because we were a group of six, we stayed in the Royal Tahitian suite (combination of the Bora Bora and Moorea suites). The Bora Bora had a full kitchen and steam shower while the Moorea had a half-kitchen and a much smaller bathroom. Both types of suites will sleep four (both come with pull-out sofas), but I would opt for the Bora Bora because the larger space and extra amenities (including a deck) are worth it. If your traveling just as a pair and you don't plan to spend much time in your suite, the Moorea is just fine. Both suites come with two large screen LCD TVs and a DVD player. The only drawback and the reason this property is not a 5/excellent - the location. This is Las Vegas and it's always great to be able to walk out and be a few steps from the action. Tahiti Village is technically on the Strip, but it's definitely not walking distance to the major casinos (not even Mandalay Bay). On the plus side though, it is fairly near a new and very large shopping complex called Town Square. I think a rental car is a necessity (despite the lack of parking spaces), but Tahiti Village offers free shuttles every two hours to the heart of the Strip. Overall, it's a great property. If only it was closer to the other major Las Vegas properties/attractions....

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: richie5817
Reviews.Content: we booked the resort with flights for a good price..after reading alot of negative things about this place myself and my family were really taken with the place..the sales staff only came up to us once.(its good having a british accent) we just said no thank -you..maybe if we were american or canadian the boot would have been on the other foot...the suite we had was large,very clean,the steamer in the shower was a god send... as other reviews have said some of the staff need a kick up the backside.the so called breakfast was a joke,cake and coffee the pool and hottub were clean ,the resort bar had very good happy hour times..4-6 pm and also 11pm-2am..all in all very good resort but the staff could try harder

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Resort, But Staff VERY rude!”
Reviews.Author: Sugarbare
Reviews.Content: Our family checked in Jan 19th, 09 & didn't get room requested. They refused to change it, saying "There just isn't anything left" Even though while looking in the room windows at night, clearly 95% no lights on. 5 people 1 bedroom & 1 pull out bed. It was not so much fun. It's a good thing this was our first trip to Vegas & we spent most of our time away. Hot tub outside was nice, but always had 5-10 wet towels laying around the tub & smoke butts on the ground. Staff at Tahiti Joes was always rude when we ordered room service & if delivered to your room, they charge 18% Gratuity. Gift shop charges 3$ for a small pop & almost 3$ for coffee & don't mention you think that's expensive, because they will bite your head off. Check out day we asked for them to call us a cab to the airport & they said it would be 5 min. 30 min later & growing concerned we'd be late for our flight, my husband went to ask if they called. Female at front desk said "Oh isn't there cabs already outside?" then said "A cab for 5, could be up to 2 hours before one arrives" Well thanks so much for telling us that 30 minutes ago & thanks so much for calling one when we asked. Eventually we had no choice but to call 2 separate cabs or we would have missed our flight. $15.00 a piece. The resort is beautiful I'll give it that. The shuttle bus runs every 30 min to & from Strip & is really nice, but it only runs until 11:45pm (last shuttle from Tropicana) making it difficult to enjoy nightlife, unless you're willing to spend $50 on a cab (shuttle driver's words) Would I ever consider returning? Maybe, but only for the hot tub & the outside view!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: WorldTrekker7
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable. Restaurant was just OK but there is Denny's across the street (literally speaking) and a bunch of other alternatives within walking distance. The shuttle service to the Strip was a little confusing at times and the front desk personnel did not seem to know the schedule. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Stay”
Reviews.Author: lavender_rabbit
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights over New Years in a Royal Tahitian suite in the big tower (Bld 6 I think). Wife’s parents are owners. After reading all the negative reviews we were very tentative about our trip and checked in expecting the worst. I am pleased to say our stay was pleasant in most aspects and we look forward to future visits. Service staff were polite and helpful. Rooms were clean, spacious, and well maintained. Large flat screen TV’s in each room and the master bath had a great spa bathtub and steam shower. House keeping does not come in every day, but this amenity was not necessary as we have no problem making our own beds, and besides, they promptly attended to any need we had – new towels, kitchen supplies, coffee, etc… they even came immediately to the room when we called about a spill. Our room was on the 8th floor and faced west. It was a busy weekend for airline traffic yet we could not hear any plane noise at all despite being able to see them come in on approach. We were not bothered by any harassing sales calls or sales people. Although I admit they hung around in packs and their were constant tours going on. But again, we hardly noticed, and experienced none of the hassles others have complained about. Now some downers: Although Tahiti Joes is a decent enough restaurant, don’t order any of the “spicy” foods unless you really like HOT. A wired idiosyncrasy is that you have to order cocktails from a separate server and pay a separate bar bill – that seems strange to us. We brought along the Wii for the kids, but the flat screens are mounted so flush to the walls you can’t slip a hand in to access input terminals. In the end I went to Radio Shack and bought RCA adaptors and then used the jacks from the DVD player on the main TV. The real downer of the place was that the big tower has ZERO internet service. I talked to someone about it and they say their tech company had a problem during construction and they were not expecting Wi-Fi for a while. Denny’s is the only free internet access available. If anyone in your party has trouble walking make sure you get a room close to the elevators, the big tower hallways are football fields long. Being a holiday weekend not much work was happening, but major construction is and will continue to be going on for some time. If you look at the resort map, phase III has only just broken ground on the entire eastern side of the resort. I can certainly see how this will be irritating especially with an east facing room.

Reviews.Title: “OK Room - not very great staff or breakfast”
Reviews.Author: christians3
Reviews.Content: We were staying there overnight with 2 kids (3 & 8) to land at 11:00 pm and depart the next day at 11:00 am. FIlight was delayed and we landed at 1:00 am. I asked for a later checkout as the kids and I were exhausted. Front desk night manager said it was policy that we had to be out at 10:00 am. or we would be charged an extra day, call back at 8:00 am to ask for late checkout. We went round and round on this with no sympathy on her part. Morning continental breakfast was a joke served from 9:00 to 10:00 only - it was packed in there. They only served coffee, muffins and juice. Super long line to even get a muffin. We ducked out to the dennys downstairs. Rooms are decent and pretty large, just not a staff that really wants you there.

Reviews.Title: “Scam artists!!!”
Reviews.Author: dirtluvingirl
Reviews.Content: I never even got the opportunity to visit this establishment due to the fact that my Father fell gravely ill and subsiquently passed away. I won the trip on the radio and had to pay $100 up front for a reservation and that was to be refunded after we listened to their sales pitch....Apparently the 6 months that I was caring for my ill Father had run up, and I was left with no trip and they also refuse to refund the $100 deposit I had to pay when I first won the trip. They give you 6 months to redeem it apparently - this I was not aware of when I first won. There response to my email asking for my deposit back and explaining my Father's death was this: Your package was only valid for 6 months from the date of purchase which was 11/30/2006. At this moment a refund will not be issued since the package has expired. Thank You. [--] Customer Service Associate I think they run a despectible business and I hope they go bankrupt!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms & Pool great, but everything else sub-par”
Reviews.Author: sjapollo
Reviews.Content: OK, so this was our family's first experience with exchanging a timeshare. We own a week in Rangely, ME, but since we have family in LV, we decided to trade out for this year, and spend the holidays at Tahiti Village. First, I never proactively received a confirmation of our reservation from either TV or Interval. I had to call both of them several times to make sure our reservation was safe. After our arrival with no glitches, I was looking forward to a nice week. We had the Royal Tahitian, which is two separate rooms with a common living room and kitchen. Beautiful suite. The living and sleeping areas were great. We had a bit of trouble with the jacuzzi tub, but maintenance came by and fixed it within a half hour. Pros: - Great rooms (stayed in Tower 2) - Wonderful pool and hot tub area - we swam for 5 out of 7 days during thanksgiving week. - Relatively good and timely service Cons: - PARKING is horrible!!! There is not enough parking for all the guests. This was mostly true on the weekend. During the week it was less crowded. - In-suite Washer/Dryer can handle about 3 things at a time. Even a small load takes 2 hours to dry. - CONSTANT flow of sales people and prospects, even on thanksgiving. - We missed the mid-week housekeeping. Getting our room back on schedule took 3 calls to the front office and housekeeping. Finally, 2 days later, they came to clean the room. - Pizza place flyers under the door almost every day. - Automated phone messages left on voicemail at about 7AM. This left a blinking light on the phone that would wake us up. Overall, I think the management at Tahiti Village does not care excessively about customer service or satisfaction. They are going for quantity of owners over quality. They try to shove as many people through the sales pitch as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort!”
Reviews.Author: nynana614
Reviews.Content: We are owners at their sister property, Tahiti, on Tropicana Blvd. When I made reservations for a 2BR there, I was told they had none available for the dates we wanted (Thanksgiving week). As a curtesy, they booked us at TV (the 2nd time we'd stayed there). Our checkin was flawless - I had asked for a room overlooking the Strip in Bldg #1 and they easily accomodated us - 4th floor. We enjoy watching the lights and seeing the planes land at the airport - and even though it seems like we are only a stones throw from the airport - I never heard a plane landing while there - even when we had the balcony door open. The soundproofing in both the door and windows are great. Our guests staying in the lock off unit did, however, say they heard a baby crying in the room next to them one night - but not again. We COULD hear 'muffled' voices through the our bedroom wall - and the sound of anyone running their shower or whirlpool tub - but not enough to disturb our sleep. We rented a car for this trip and never did use the shuttle - although they just started a new schedule. Rather than the TV shuttle taking you to the Town Center Shops - Tropicana - Treasure Island - the new schedule has it taking you ONLY to the Tropicana (every 30 min), then you have to take a 2nd shuttle up the Strip to T.I. and Stratosphere or you can take another shuttle headed to NYNY, The Orleans and then to the Tahiti and Club Soleil properties. So if you use the shuttle - be prepared to make 'connections. Oh, and now you need a shuttle 'pass' that you get from the 'consierge'. While they tell you to come pick up your "welcome package' that includes this pass - it is just a ploy to get you to agree to another 'owner update'. My husband just went down late in the evening and just asked for the passes (although we never used them). Our room was very clean - there were PLENTY of towels, TP and kleenex for us to use (we were there 4 nights - so we didn't have our room serviced), but anytime we asked for something (like extra coffe paks), we were accomodated with a smile! We didn't use the pool - although it is heated to 82 degrees, we didn't have time - but there were several people in there every day. They were fililng the lazy river, and I see from the live webcam that is is still filled, but doesn't seem to be open. Didn't partake in the 'free' continental breakfast available from 9 to 10 am over at Tahiti Joes - seems like that is where the sales people now bring all their 'prospects'. Check out was no problem - you leave a $100 deposit on your credit card when you check in - internet service is $9.99 daily (a little pricey) No wifi in the older buildings - but you can borrow a network cable while you're there if you have your own laptop. One of the best features is their proximity to the Rental Car Center - literally around the block! Comeout of the Rental Car garage, make 2 rights and you're there! Overall - we enjoyed our time there - wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Time”
Reviews.Author: unhappytraveler01
Reviews.Content: Our initial stay at Tahiti Village was in August and we decided to split our week and finish our time on Thanksgiving of this year, the first thing about them is their sales staff are very rude and pushy, they push their way through wherever they are taking their "guests", we have been crowded off elevators and ran off sidewalks by these sales people, one even woke me up taking people down the hall at 8 AM, keep in mind, I was on the sixth floor, we figured that maybe it is just their big Grand Opening on their new Phase, we were also told that all guests are owners, but for some reason I have found several sites online a can rent a room,? Also one pool and one hot tub with the mysterious foam floating on top, you'd think they could at least put in one hot tub per phase, we have been promised the Lazy River would be done by Summer, then it was by August, then it was November 26th, not even close! But I was told by the staff that "they are just checking for leaks" come on people, they can do better than that, the parking is rediculous, but they have added the all new parking garage! On the other hand, they told us when we were checking out that there was a free valet service because of the parking issues, Be very careful, if you pull out and try to load your car by the gate security will come and tell you to move because the limos need the space for the "new owners" I would like to know why they are taking the new owners down to the parking garage instead of the front door. Gee I thought that we were the new owners they already got our money. The walls are paper thin, we could hear the conversation the people next door was having at 3 AM, then their kids decided to jump on the bed, the water running somewhere upstairs from us, I was very dissappointed in the place as a whole. We were never told the small unit does not have an oven or stove, a kitchenette is nice but if you plan on cooking it is going to be microwave food. We have had better stays down the street in a $39 a night room. Please beware, if you buy into this it is not the end and they dont go away, they will call you at home with upgrade deals, and when you make a reservation they will call wanting you to do their "Owner Update" and yes,they will call your cell phone!

Reviews.Title: “A great bday weekend”
Reviews.Author: lnj4boogie
Reviews.Content: We originally booked another timeshare hotel about 6 weeks before our arrival. The week of our stay, we get a call that that resort was still under construction and that we were to be moved to Tahiti village. I arrive in the early afternoon, where I am greeted by a friendly reception staff (on the right). I am a timeshare owner who swapped out from another location to visit LV. After checking in a woman with plastic lai beads and a hawaiian shirt approaches me and starts asking me rapid fire questions, am I an owner am I the only owner, how long am I staying etc.? This was all in an attempt to get me to tour the current property.Now after being on a plan for 6 hours I'm was a little disconbomlated (sp?) and could have done without that, she stops after I show some disinterest and I press on to my rooom. Our rooms (i had two of the smallest units) were in building 5. I had to walk out of the main part, around the pool and to the back of then property past the outdoor grills. Building 5 has a concerige desk in it (I'm assuming all the buliding do). Becareful these people are here to assist but to also get you to take a tour. You can tell this place is brand new, its beautiful. Got to the room, it was clean, had flat screens in both the living room and bedrooms, and a radio (that is hidden) in the living room. In the small unt there is no stove, but there was a microwave, toaster, sink, mini fridge, silverware and dishwashing liquid. We fit 3 girls (ages 26-35) in each room quite comfortably. They only clean once a week but will happily give you more towels, soap and remove any trash you've accumlated. We didn't care too much for a view, as we mainly slept most of the time we were in the room. The hotel doesn't have wifi (seriously) but Denny's does and i was able to pick up Denny's wifi from our room on the 4th floor of tower 5. There is a shuttle that takes you to then strip, and for the most part it was timely. Something to note, you have to the desk to get a shuttle pass which is good for everyone one in your party. If you plan to split up then get a shuttle pass for everyone. The resort is across the street from what I like to call "a paired down" outlet mall. Its a good place to go if you need something quick and dirty or want a cheap meal at the food court, but it wasn't the outlet mall I was expecting. Stores included, Coach, Ann Taylor, Calvin Klein, Sean John, a bunch of shoe stores. There is a sprint store, and a bunch of fast food places in this area. I took a cab (about $10 with traffic one way, $3.30 base then what a .25 every 1/8 miile) to the Food for Less grocery store. This grocery store is a combination costco (bj's, sams club)/regular grocery store/liquor store. There is also a CVS located here. All in all good experience, lovely place I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: SL04
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at this resort for the second year in a row and had a great experience. We have gone to Las Vegas for three years in a row now because my husband attends the Sema show for business. The second year out in Las Vegas we bought a timeshare at Tahiti. We chose to stay at Tahiti Village just because it is newer and located on the main strip just past the "big hotels" a little further down. I have no complaints with our stay. The rooms are very spacious, the bathroom in the one bedroom is very nice with a whirlpool tub, the kitchens are very up to date and the whole unit was very clean. As far as the service the housekeeping staff was extremely prompt in all our requests including requesting more towels, towel pick up, trash removal, bringing more saundries when requested and so on. I have no compaints very friendly staff and love the fact that if you are not there to gamle and smell smoke every minute this resort gives a definite feel of a more tropical setting. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay - Great Customer Service- Ready to go again”
Reviews.Author: LadySalt
Reviews.Content: We are owners of a timeshare, and have never used it until Oct. 30, 2008. It was more than we expected, and can't wait to go again. Checkin was easy and agent courteous. We are glad we bought it now. And advise otheres to check it out. Not a noisy casino type facility. You actually don't feel like you are in Las Vegas. They have shuttles that make 4 stops along the strip that run regularly. A resturant/bar right next door. The courtesy bus makes a grocery store run. You could possibly not have to rent a car when you stay there. Location 3 minutes from the airport. Right next to outlet mall and resturants. Contact us for a referral and free 3night 4 day stay there. thomasj_ut@yahoo.com After being there I'd invite anyone to visit Tahiti Village.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - Not on Strip - Sales staff hound you - Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WorkingStiffGA
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the worst places I stayed at Vegas. 1. It is on the strip but it is not anywhere near any of the other Main hotels. 2. The sales staff hounded us every time we walked through the lobby or was out by the pool. After the 3rd day I was ready to find a new place to stay. 3. The rooms were new but the sheets were dirty, the showers had mold and had bugs. The one good thing I can say - Is that I DO NOT OWN in this timeshare. If I was a owner, I would feel that I got scammed. Do not go to this resort.. Spend a little extra and get a nice place on the strip....

Reviews.Title: “loved the view of the strip”
Reviews.Author: travis_c
Reviews.Content: oct.25 2008,just came back from a week stay at the village and it was the best,freindly fast service,really nice pool,hot tub ,steam showers,big screen tv,spacious rooms,excellant view of strip,free bus shuttle which the drivers were great and full of info, always on time, the weather was excellant,people were kind and freindly,wife and i just had a blast and are wanting to plan another trip next year. truly was awsome time

Reviews.Title: “Kids love the pool!”
Reviews.Author: AGorthy
Reviews.Content: I loved,loved, loved the pool, there is a sand beach with toys for kids. Web pictures don't do justice to how pretty the pool area is. There are waterfalls at both ends of the pool (but not in the pool), a whirlpool that is actually hot with great jets. This pool is also great for kids because of the zero depth entry, an area that is 2 ft deep, and areas of the pool that shallow for very small children. The lazy river had not opened yet and we were told it would be ready in three more weeks. There was a tiki bar at the pool but no servers. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated. We had the smallest unit and had plenty of room for three of us. My two complaints about the room are, there was no balcony and the windows did not open so we couldn't listen to the poolside waterfalls. TIP: Try to ask for a pool view room, some units overlook the parking lot and have no view at all. There is also no daily maid service, but this is typical in timeshare resorts. We didn't have any problems with service, but heard others had problems with the shuttle and the staff not being very informed about the area. The resort is very close to the airport, but we could not hear planes from inside our fourth floor unit, you do however hear them loud and clear while at the pool. My two biggest complaints overall: No wi-fi, you could go to the lobby and sign into Denny's signal but that was quite inconvenient. My second major complaint is that every time we walked out any door, we had to walk through a cloud of cigarette smoke from the sales staff. gross. This was a great place for us with our small son because of the pool and the family atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Consolidated Timeshare resort affliated with Interval International (II)”
Reviews.Author: DulcineaWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Tahiti Village is a lovely 3-star resort located on Las Vegas Blvd just about 1 mile south of Mandalay Bay and 2 miles from the airport by taxi. For all practical purposes, its location is “off strip” but the resort provides an excellent shuttle service on comfortable buses to 4 strip locations: Tropicana, Treasure Island, Stratosphere and the Premium Outlets. The shuttle runs fairly frequently and is pretty reliable. Room accomodations: We stayed in a 1-bedroom premium (Bora Bora) located in the newer building. The facility is quite nice with an optimal layout scheme. There is a concierge service on the entry floor (usually manned) and ice service with vending areas on each floor. The Bora Bora rooms are fully equipped and sleep a total of 4 in a king master and queen sofabed. They also have balconies with table and chairs. The thick glass balcony doors do a good job of keeping out construction noise, but note that there is also ongoing indoor construction which is quite loud at times. The bathroom impressed me most with its convenient floor plan, oversized whirlpool jacuzzi and seated shower. The toilet area is recessed providing some additional privacy. The shower also serves as a sauna with a very easily utilized steam function. The water pressure both there and throughout the entire condo is strong and the “instant on” hot water system is commendable. There’s no waiting for the tub to fill for a relaxing jacuzzi, and the on/off switch is built right into the side of the tub. Just press a button to turn on or off—no timer switches. The double sinks are separated by a lower counter area for the guest to sit for makeup applications, etc. The only additional item I would receommend is a lighted magnification makeup mirror. Other than that this is the most functional bathroom facility I’ve experienced so far in any hotel or timeshare resort. The kitchen is quite convenient and reasonably well-supplied. The usual utensils are there along with a few extras. The resort provides dishwashing liquid and 2 dishwasher tablets. The double sink also has a garbage disposal. The washer/dryer is small but perfect for this condo. Two little boxes of laundry detergent are provided. There is also a food delivery service for a fee if you wish to have your fridge stocked in advance of your arrival. I wouldn’t bother with this if you arrive on a Sunday or Wednesday because at 8 am on Mondays and Thursdays a shuttle will take you to a well-supplied grocery store just down the road. It’s very convenient and the driver will happily give you a hand with heavy groceries. You have about 50 minutes or so to shop and that’s plenty of time as long as you go with a list. For many perhaps the nicest inclusion are the large flat screen TVs in both the living room and bedroom. Along with comes a music center with DVD and VCR. Onsite amenities: A single pool equipped with comfortable lounges and tiki umbrellas provides fun and relaxation on nice days. A “Lazy River” is currently under construction and looks to be a lovely area when completed. There is also a nice convenience store with a variety of provisions one might need immediately, an ATM, an exercise room and 2 restaurants (Tahiti Joe’s and Denny’s). There’s free Wifi at Denny’s so go there if you just need to log on occasionally during your stay. The resort has only scattered service for which you must pay a fee. Printing is available in the tiny business center (2 PCs) but the minimum to log on is $5.00. The barbecue area, equipped with 5 large gas grills (cleaned daily), has lots of cooking space and shaded sitting areas. This amenity seemed to be highly popular with the guests. Problems: -There are many lifeguards for the single medium-sized pool but I didn’t see them do anything but hand out towels the entire week we stayed. People were permitted to enter the pool with food, beverage, etc., but the worst infraction was that diapered babies were allowed in as well. I found that to be a huge turnoff. -While most shuttle bus drivers were well-mannered and demanded to see everyone’s bus pass, at least one or two failed to make the grade. -A great deal of smoking goes on at this resort even though the advertised guidelines indicate that smoking is permitted in only a few designated areas. Even salespeople could be found smoking with their clients while walking around the resort. Our room appeared to be smoke-free but that may be attributed to its newness. The smoking issue is something I would watch for the future. Generally speaking, resorts which accommodate smokers as much as this one seems to end up much dirtier and more difficult to maintain in the long run; something to consider if you’re buying a timeshare and are interested in lower maintenance fees. -WiFi should always be a free service in mid-level resorts such as Tahiti Village. The attached fee was a huge disappointment. -Be forewarned; there is a great deal of construction noise at this resort both inside and out. It also sits very close to McCarran Airport where flights take off in the direction of Tahiti Village approximately every 20 minutes or so. If this kind of noise breaks your relaxation cycle you would do better elsewhere. Otherwise, I recommend you go. The price is right and the fun is just up the road!

Reviews.Title: “nice and new and under construction”
Reviews.Author: Mike V
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare to stay at Tahiti Village. It's nice and new and under construction. We rented a car and were able to get to Mandalay Bay and the other big casinos in just a couple of minutes--the location is very good, the parking was not so good if you stayed out late. We mostly just slept there and spent our waking hours in town. We did not use the facility (pool, bar, etc.) at all, but we saw lots of people having fun in and around the pool from our balcony view. The pillows were flimsy and the wifi was too expensive. I used Denny's for free, but I got loaded with unwanted e-blasts and pop ups from using this hot spot. The big flat screens in the rooms were nice, but I think they were not receiving a high def signal as the picture wasn't very good on any of the channels. There was no lighting above the mirror in the bathroom--just to the side--which caused shadows on one side of my face and made it hard to see well enough to properly shave and groom my whiskers. I loved the space, the kitchen, the laundry, the balcony, and the steam shower. I'm sure that time will fix things like the parking and the cable signal. I hope they take my suggestion and get better pillows and put lights above or on both sides of the bathroom mirrors. All in all, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool-Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Prairiebear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas for 2 weeks this summer and stayed at Tahiti Village for the second week. We were in the Bora Bora suite as they called it. That is the big side of the 2 bedroom lock-off. It was beautiful and very large. Granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, etc. There was a jacuzzi tub and a steam unit in the shower. The pool was terrific, if not a little too warm. There are not enough loungers and all the unbrellas were taken by 9am so you had to be at the pool very early to get a good location. They offer a shuttle service to the strip since they are just south of the airport. The shuttle system is very poorly run. Even though they are supposed to be on a half hour schedule, it was not unusual to have to wait 90 minuted for a shuttle to show up. By the end of the night, the shuttles were so behind, it was ridiculous. We had a horrible experience on the shuttle one night as the driver dramatically overloaded the bus then hit the highway on the way back to the resort. He was not able to travel the speed limit and it was hazardous. When we reached the resort and complained to the night maager, her response was incredible. She told us we didn't have to take the shuttle and that we could have gotten off. If I were in charge of her, I would have fired her after that night, Instead of handling the situation, she actually escalated the emotions of the passengers. I may consider staying there again, but I would never take the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Bad manners”
Reviews.Author: cabkab00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just were vacationing in Las Vegas. I have to say that the employees that were trying to sell this facility are horribly rude. They were canvassing the streets to try and get you to listen to their pitch. That is all fine and good, but it gets tiring after saying NO to 5 people. Then we have a representative get nasty with us because we said No and then proceeded to walk away and ignore her. She makes a statement "you keep paying my taxes." I haven't ever stayed in this facility but if it starts out with rudeness like this, why would I ever go there.

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti Village - Nice”
Reviews.Author: Angie0531
Reviews.Content: Well we just returned from spending a week at Tahiti Village. After reading all the previous reports, I was really worried that we had made a big mistake booking this timeshare (through a friend). We (my boyfriend and I) were pleasantly surprised and would definitely return. This was my first trip to Vegas so I was very excited. We took a cab to the resort (which cost around $30.00 w/tip) would be great if they offered a shuttle service (the cab ride back to airport was around 25.00). Arrived around noon and our room was not ready. We asked for a pool view and they told us to come back at 3:00 and they would have one for us. We dropped off our luggage and went to explore the resort. The grounds are just beautiful and the pool is amazing. We quickly changed into our suits and pool bound we were. There were so many different parts of the pool even though it was all 1 large pool. There was a shallow part with sand which was great for small children, there are 2 other shallow parts (perfect for putting your lounge chair in), there was a volleyball net & basketball net in the pool…just a great pool that offers something for everyone. There is a store on site (wiki wiki post) that sells extra floats. At the pool area, they will give you towels and if you get there early enough, they do have a few extra floats, noodles and inflatable balls. You can also order food from Tahiti Joe’s and have it delivered, there are menus on the chairs (see photo) The resort also offers a free shuttle service to a few points along the strip (Tropicana, Treasure Island, Stratosphere and a few stops to the Premium Outlet Mall). The Deuce bus is also convenient. For 5.00, you can ride all day. There is a stop close to the resort whether coming or going. If you are coming back at night, it stops over near the outlet mall. When you are heading towards the strip, you can catch the bus by the outlet mall as well but it will take you to the bus depot first (strange but it’s not bad). The Deuce will stop a lot so if you have to be somewhere in a certain time, I would not recommend it. The Deuce also goes straight down the strip and all the way to Fremont Street (which took over an hour from Tahiti Village). The shuttles also have coolers on them with small bottles of water – free of charge. The parking garage – I’ve seen soooo many complaints from people here and I don’t get it. From reading other posts, I thought the parking garage was across the street or something, it’s right next to the complex. There are parking spaces closer to the buildings but if you aren’t lucky enough to get one, the parking garage isn’t that far. When you first arrive, you can drop your bags off and have a bellboy take them to your room so no need to lug them from the parking garage. Tiki Joe’s & Denny’s – both were great places to eat. We only ate at Denny’s twice, got the wi-fi to work the first time but not the second time. Tiki Joe’s has amazing nachos and they are HUGE. Hit the bar there for happy hour before our flight home – great beer specials. Welcome Package – this is where the timeshare comes into play. We knew from reading other posts that this is the “welcome to the timeshare” package and we weren’t interested. We were asked when we got there if we wanted it then and we said “no, we’d pick it up later after we checked in fully”. No issues there. We got a few messages on the phone with daily activities and reminders that if we didn’t pick up our “welcome package” yet to do so but there was never any more pressure. The place does bring people in almost non-stop. It’s amazing how many people come and listen, not sure exactly what they are getting in return. There is a concierge desk that will help get you discounted show tickets if you are interested. There are also a few really nice gas grills & mini frigs towards the south end of the resort. I’m not sure if they are there for anyone to use or if you have to reserve them, but they are nice. The rooms were really nice. We were in a moorea room, 1 bedroom suite with no balcony. The room had a mini frig, microwave and toaster…no oven. Housekeeping will come in the middle of the week to clean, but we never needed it (we just took towels & soap off the cart). Check in is at 4:00 and Check Out is at 10:00. We asked for alittle later check out and they said 10:30 or 11:00. We ended up checking out at 10:15 but it was nice to not feel as rushed. Overall, We can’t wait to go back and will definitely consider visiting Tahiti Village again. If you have any questions, please feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back && loved it!”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel99
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at our Bora Bora time share & we loved every minute of it! The pool water is warm but it still cools you off. Had a great time playing volley ball in the pool & met a lot of great people that way. The lazy river was suppose to be done before we got there but its way behind schedule which was our only disappointment. No problem with check in/out. Fast friendly service always.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype...”
Reviews.Author: The_Landgrens
Reviews.Content: I was first a little nervous about Thahiti Village and not sure if I made a good buy so I read the reviews and was lead to question my decision even more. But now at the end of my first week here I am glad i didn't beleive the hype of a few unhappy visitors. Our first night here we tried to upgrade to the Bora Bora, the larger condo, and they originally they said they could not accomidate us because they were overbooked. We asked to speak to the management, explained this was our honey moon and recieved not only the upgrade but also a REALLY nice gift basket. SHUTTLES - they have shuttles that run to the strip the top of everyhour. Suggestion: take the shuttle to the strip and spend the $15 on the cab to come back so you don't have to worry about pick up times. POOL - AWESOME, to the person who complained about the tempature of the water please remember it's Vegas...it's hot...the pool can't be kept too cold or people would not stay in that long. The water volleyball was awesome and the food was reasonably priced. They don't advocate outside food and drink but don't inforce that either as long as you aren't a drunk idiot. ROOMS- Bora Bora was great, nice plasma in the bedroom, wish it were in the living room. I've never seen a washer and dryer literally in one...not stacked...actually one mashine that will wash and dry your clothes. MAID service - yes, they only come once a week but if you leave your garbage outside they will pick it up. We personally appreciated not having someone in our room everyday interupting our plans but if you don't know how to clean up after yourself you can get the service for between 35-85 dollars depending on the room size. Convenience STORE - was very suprised they did not over charge just because they could. AIRPORT service - just get a taxi, even if they did try to offer the service at the 10am checkout every one has different flight times and you would be sitting in yet another line to get home...not worth it. Parking - we were in room 1612 and the parking was never an issue for the 4 days we had a car. Suggestion: get the rental for the week it's free to park at 95% of the casinos. Even if you don't need it the whole week it's usually A LOT cheaper to get the week rental and just return it early. We had a GREAT time, everyone was friendly and we took the advice not to get our 'welcome package' so we not 'pitched' at all. Can't wait until our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Wait To Go Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: madmax026
Reviews.Content: We read the mixed reviews so we weren't too sure as to what to expect. We checked in late and were given clear directions to our room, a one bedroom with full kitchen. The room was absolutely beautiful. We asked for one with a view of the pool, but they were all taken as it was a long weekend. It didn't matter. What we have was very nice. In fact, speaking with other guests, they all loved their new clean living spaces. Travelling with children made it very nice to walk to the refrigerator to get a snack, and throw whatever dirty laundry in the in-suite laundry. If you didn't feel like cooking, Tahiti Joes and Denny's was a 1 minute walk away. Also lots of other restaurants around and a large Outlet Mall within a few minutes walk. The pool was very clean. In fact the entire property was spotless. Staff was working endlessly keeping the resort immaculate. The staff was also very friendly and willing to assist with whatever need arose. The one downfall was that we were put in the new tower. It was so new that there was no internet connection. Apparently it is coming in, so in the mean time I had to set up my laptop at Tahiti Joes to pick up the signal from Denny's restaurant downstairs. Overall, the place is awesome! Yes it is a Timeshare and there are salespeople doing the tours in the morning and afternoon. They keep to themselves and are not intrusive at all.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: duck10
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the tahiti resort in vegas so i thought i needed to write a review to give the resort a fair shake. After reading so many reviews that were bad we thought maybe we should not go. The day we arrived at the resort we were in line behind a couple that didn't look to happy. They told me don't take the welcome package because if you do they won't leave you alone. So when i go to check in a young lady told me to go to the desk across the room to get my welcome package and i told her no thank you. After that the whole week there i had no problem. The resot is in a great location not to far away but not to close .IT has a beauitiful pool and the resort was very clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I was a little worried...”
Reviews.Author: goldduster
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay here 8/31-9/6. First off I was a bit worried after reading all of the reviews here. So to say the least I was a little skeptical that things would be ok. We arrived about 7pm on a Saturday evening which turned out to be an excellent time to arrive. The front desk had no line and we had our room keys within 3 minutes. We were put on the second floor of building 5 which has just opened. The room was as advertised and very nice. There was almost no evidence of anyone staying in the room previously. I think we were only the second occupants. One pan had a couple of scratches in it and everything else looked brand new. We had been through the murderous presentation about 3 years ago and knew it was not going to happen again so we were constantly on guard for the lead-ins to it. Every time we talked to a concierge we were asked if we wanted to do it to get free show tickets or a Grand Canyon tour but we were not pestered after saying no. In the casinos I found it effective to show the room key to the people trying to hook victims for the presentation and say "Already staying there." They quickly moved to the next potential victim. The good... The staff was friendly, helpful and available when needed and unobtrusive when not. The room was clean and comfortable. The location is convenient but away from the strip. The steam shower was awesome. Housekeeping picked up towels and garbage left in the hall very quickly. The bad... Coffee. The weak stuff they pass off as coffee in the room is not fit to drink so plan on bringing your own or grabbing some locally before morning. The coffee maker used #2 Melitta type filters which we had to buy at the grocery store. The Pool. The pool is shallow and not shaded at all making it very warm. Too warm to be refreshing. The lazy river is still under construction and should be shaded from the afternoon sun by building 5. They also do not appear to be enforcing the rules of no glass in the pool area. We saw many people with beer bottles in and around the pool. Parking. As mentioned in other reviews the parking at this place sucks. Fortunately we were close to the south end of building 5 which is only a few steps from the new parking garage. If we were in any of the other buildings this would have really been an issue. Stairways. Being on the second floor and fairly fit we tend to use stairs instead of elevators. Unfortunately there is no access to the stairways from the first floor of the building. This forced us to walk almost 300 feet to the elevators and then back almost the entire length of the hall to our room. Not a huge deal but packing a weeks worth of groceries that far was no fun. Wi-Fi. Specifically the lack of it. Wi-Fi Internet service is not available in building 5. For a "Nominal Fee" of $11 a day you can get it on your TV in the room but I don't think I am alone in thinking $11 is not nominal. There were two workstations with excessive fees available in the "business center" (I would call it a closet) in the main lobby. There is no excuse for not having wi-fi in a brand new building. Free Wi-Fi is available in the Denny's restaurant next door to Tahiti Joe's. Fire Alarm. There is still construction going on in building 5 and Thursday morning about 8 am the fire alarm was set off forcing us to evacuate the building. We had to stand outside for about 10 minutes while they sorted it out. When we could get back in we had to wait around in the building lobby for a few minutes while they figured out how to unlock the elevators which were secured by the alarm. See the note about no first floor stairway access above. Housekeeping. Our room was toweled mid week and they did a fine job except they forgot to empty the garbage. This was not a big deal for us and I only mention it as some people would be put off by it. If you want housekeeping service more than just the one time during the week there is a $35 charge. Transportation. If you are going to stay here you really need a car if you want any flexibility. We had one so we did not use the shuttle but we saw people waiting for it almost all of the time. It appeared they only had 2 or 3 shuttles running. But they had about 20 shuttles available to ferry the presentation victims back and forth from their hotels on the strip. The Deuce strip bus can be caught across the street (Warm Springs) at the outlet mall. There was often a taxi waiting for a fare near the front entrance but I never saw more than one sitting there. There was a taxi queue across the street in front of the outlet mall. General stuff... For groceries there is a Food 4 Less store about 2 miles south on Las Vegas Blvd. Excellent prices and a good selection. We were pleased with our deli purchases there as well. There is also an Albertson's store about 3 miles east on Warm Springs at Eastern if you want a regular full service super market. For liquor Lee's Discount Liquor has about the best prices and selection I have seen around Vegas. They are located about 3 miles south on Las Vegas Blvd. For gas the Rebel station on the corner of Las Vegas and Warm Springs has about the best gas prices around and they also have E85 available. Parking on the strip is free in most of the casino parking garages. Just look for the self park signs. We used New York's garage for the south strip and Paris for the central strip. Downtown on Fremont use the Golden Nugget garage or the city garage just east of Fitzgeralds. Just make sure you get the ticket validated. Validation is only good for 3 hours so you need to go move the car if you are staying longer and don't want to pay. Do not use the Necropolis garage north of Fremont as Fitzgeralds will not validate it. In summary... I would never buy into this place nor would I subject myself to one of their sales presentations again. They will tell you it is only 2 hours but you will be lucky to get out of there with your wallet intact in less than 4 hours. The secondary market for Tahiti Village is alive and well. They will be happy to sell you a unit for 40-50k and make you think you got a good deal but you can find them in several places online for 10-25k. Three years ago in our presentation they started us at $37500 and as we were walking out the door they were trying for $7500 for the same deal. It is obvious they only have one objective in mind that being to get you to a presentation. They don't care if you already own since they want to "upgrade" you. I would definitely stay at Tahiti Village again. The rental rate is a bit excessive in my opinion at $200 plus a night but fortunately there are secondary rental opportunities available as well if you take a little time to look for them.

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti Village Timeshare Trip Review”
Reviews.Author: juliadanielle
Reviews.Content: I saw the ad on TV for Tahiti Village for a free 3 night stay in Las Vegas, and thought, "no way, if it's too good to be true it probably is." I called anyways to see what it was all about. The operator told me that I could stay at Tahiti Village and they would give me a $100 dollar gas card to come out, the only catch was that I needed to go to thier two hour time share presentation, and put down a $98 dollar deposit. I was still sceptical but I decided to give it a try. Before I went I looked online for some reviews on how other people's experiences where with Tahiti village timeshare presentation was. I couldn't find much, (which is why I am writting this). When my boyfriend and I got to Vegas I reset our odemeter to zero so we could see if it really was only 3/4 of a mile from the Mandelay Bay Casino (which is what they told me on the phone), and it wasn't. Tahiti Village is actually about 3 1/2 miles from the MB. When we checked in we had a little trouble showing that we lived together (even though our id's show the same address, my city was miscorrectly spelled on my id, so they made us print out something from the internet showing that we actually did live together (an amazon.com reciept.). After we got that cleared up we went to our room. The room was amazing, very spacious, clean, and definatly nice. Our presentation was scheduled for the next morning at 10 am. We had had so much fun the previous night that we only got two hours of sleep. Anyways, we were introduced to our guide, and we sat down and talked for a while. He was trying to explain to us how he had bought one of their timeshares and actually sells the room for one week a year, and makes money. I didn't really believe that you could make that much money on one of their rooms being that you can stay in a room in the middle of the strip for the same amount of money. They also had a deal where if you bought one of thier timeshares you could get discounted trips to all over the world (six times a year for 7 days) for between $299-$700 (that actually did sound like a good deal.) We explained to our guide that we wanted to purchase a house first, and that it was not a good investment for us to buy one of their timeshares because we needed to save our money to put more down on a house that we could stay in 52 weeks out of the year. At the end of the presentation the closer came over and told us that the price of the larger suite (the one that we stayed in for free) for $48,000 dollars, or we could purchase the smaller room for $13,000 dollars. He tried to make thier 17.9% interest rate sound small, but we again told them no and explained how expensive a mortgage is in California, and they let us go. We went to the window to recieve our refund, and gas cards. We had no problem at all. The presentation really did only go 2 hours, but we were lucky because other (staying at other hotels had to wait for everyone to get out to ride the shuttle back) .When we checked out they asked why we were checking out at 10 instead of 11? I showed them the paper they sent me in the mail stating that check out was at 11am. They said okay and charged me nothing at all. All in all I would say that this is a very good deal. I read some reviews that people were upset that they had to sit through a two hour presentation, but they didn't appreciate the fact that if they had booked a trip to Las Vegas and paid, they would have ended up spending upwards of 1,000 dollars to stay in a room the size of thier room, and all the other "gifts" they give you to go out there. I would definatly take advantage of this again if I could. I only ended up spending $180 dollars total on this trip, including food, gas, gambling, going to the top of the stratusphere, ect. Hope this is helpful. Do go for the free nights, and free gifts....But do not buy it is an extreme rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: belle-bear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I own a timeshare. We exchanged a week for me to go to a seminar. I took my mother-in-law. First of all, with our timeshare, we are supposed to have a full kitchen with a balcony. We had neither. When I spoke to the people at the front desk, they looked at me like I had a third eye. The next day, they called the room and said that there were two complimentary show tickets waiting for us at the consierge desk along with our welcome pack. We go down to get them, and then are told that they don't do that unless we go through their tour...not as stated on the phone message. Anyway, I proceeded to tell the people at the consierge desk the problem with the room. Once again, to no avail. Still stuck in the little room with no balcony and no kitchen (so much for saving a little money while out there). Finally, on the last day, I go to the front desk to ask if I can mail a post card before we leave. Once again, the lady looks at me like I have a third eye and says that they don't mail things for guests. Very upset by this time, I wait for the consierge desk to open. I tell the lady at that desk what had just happened...and low and behold...I FINALLY talk to somebody who I think actually knows her head from a hole in the ground. It was my only positive experience dealing with the staff the whole time I am there. She couldn't believe that the lady at the front desk had said what she had. There IS a mail drop box at the front desk for guests!!!! Imagine that! This lady was very courteous and sincere. I then asked for a comment card. She tells me that they have them at the front desk. Once again, I get the third eye look, then am told that they are out of the comment cards. Honestly, this was the first and will be the last time that I stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TaisyNewYork
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at Tahiti Village (Las Vegas Blvd. location). It was fantastic. We had 6 people so they gave us two adjoining rooms. We had more than enough room, no one was stepping over anyone. I had to request fresh bath towels and TP and it was brought up to our room almost immediately. The immenities they offer are numerous. I would definitely stay there again! The pool is also fantastic! I can't say enough about Tahiti Village.

Reviews.Title: “under staffed/poor security”
Reviews.Author: egehrken
Reviews.Content: my wife and I own a timeshare on the eastcoast and decided to trade and go to vegas so we picked the T.V. It is on the strip (about 3 miles away from the action and directly in the flight line of the airport. We were put in the new building #5. We had the Bora Bora. It was well appointed and very clean. There is a seperate service desk in the lobby but it was only staffed during the day and nobody around at night.The doors from the outside had card readers so guest are supposed to use their room key to gain access. those were not needed the doors were open 24hrs. we just walked in at all hours of the day/night along with anybody else, even if they did not belong there. Please keep reading it only gets worse. Our room was on the 7th floor(we requested to be away from all of the sales tours) they have 4 elevators in the building. We were on our way down to the 1st floor with about 12 others when the elevator broke down leaving us stuck at the 2nd floor. after using the alarm to try to get help and being stuck for 45 minutes the fire dept showed up and got the doors open (thank you LVFD) . When we were finally freed from being held captive there was nobody from Tahitti village there (management) , not even to offer an apology.On about 4 more occasions within the following days the elevators broke again, having the fire dept come out again. Luckily we refused to use the elevatorsand took the stairs so we would not fall victims again. I wonder how many sales were lost due to the elevators? So what happens next time when it is after hours ,nobody is at the service desk in building 5 and the elevators get stuck or even worse some riff raff decides to come into the building thru the unlocked security doors. Customer service is their business or is it ?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Timeshare”
Reviews.Content: My mom called to reserve her timeshare in Las Vegas and when it was not available for the dates we wanted, she was given availability at Tahiti Village. I was a little nervous after reading the reviews but it wasn't too bad. I loved the rooms. We stayed in 2409/2409A (sleeps 8). There was plenty of room and nice decor. It was also quiet. My mom was worried being so close to the airport and the noise from the pool but once you were inside the room you couldn't hear anything. The lanai was wonderful. It's really big and looked over the pool. We had breakfast out there every morning. There was some hair on towels and food in the track of the sliding glass door. They really don't pay attention to detail, maybe because they have so many units to clean. Overall, we were happy. The parking is horrible. It's not bad if you can get one of the few places up front but if you have to park in the garage, it's very far away. I utilized valet parking when I couldn't find a close spot but valet takes forever! A minimum of 15 minutes to get your car. Ridiculous. There are plenty of hotels on the strip the same size or larger and they get your car to you in less than 5 minutes so I'm not sure what the problem is with valet parking at Tahiti Village. The continental breakfast they offer is a joke. Three juices, pound cake, muffins and coffee. That's it. Nothing nutritional. Denny's was good for breakfast. Tahiti Joes was awful. Not recommended. The entertainment was just as bad. For those of you want the Las Vegas Resort ammenities (casinos, entertainment, restaurants, etc) this is not the place for you. This is a timeshare, so yes, it's going to be more like an apartment complex. The pool is awesome and a great place to cool off. I would recommend this hotel but personally, if I had to pay for it...I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: aneshca
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience at Tahitti village and would recommend it to anyone. I visited Tahitti village whilst on holiday with my mum and was so impressed we both decided to upgrade our time share, the only problem i have is that i live in england and cant get over as often as i would like.

Reviews.Title: “Anti-Gay won't honor their special offer for same sex couple”
Reviews.Author: Abacus7
Reviews.Content: Well, I couldn't even get to book a stay, but the incident occurred Aug 4th '08. They have a promo 3 days-2 nights which on television is advertised as a honeymoon special. However- Online it makes NO mention of having to be a "married" couple (which in a few months- if I am still blessed, I will be) so, when inquiring- and giving info- the operator asked questions, realised that Gina and Jennifer are two women and said the offer does not apply. Are you serious- in VEGAS for goodness sake! My question is- do man-women couples have to present a marriage license at check in? What a joke. We can provide proof of our relationship- life insurance plans- right down to mail at same address with both names etc if they REALLY want to get into our biz. So, my gay and gay friendly brothers and sisters, stay away from this "resort" and any others owned by Consolidated something or other. Bleh. How gross they are. Why does heterosexuality always have to be waved in our faces?

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: zvegas01
Reviews.Content: Just got back on Monday. We travel to Vegas frequently and I guess are used to more. The grounds are pleasant enough but besides swimming, there is nothing to do. Most people come to Vegas to gamble, eat and party a little. This place has no casino (I new this going in), no active bar scene, and no real restaurants. Tahiti Joes is OK, but there is only a Dennys for breakfast. I don't know about you, but I don't go to Vegas to eat at Dennys. All this wouldn't be so bad if they had a decent transportation system. People fly into Vegas, and most don't rent cars. This place is miles from the strip and just about everything else. Their shuttles leave on the half our but only stop at 3 places. There is almost no taxi service to speak of. If you miss the shuttle or want to go anywhere other than the strip, you have two choices, wait a half hour (if your going to the strip), or call a taxi which taskes at least 20-30 minutes to get there. We almost got into a fight when our cab got there and 2 other parties ran out claiming it, saying, "we called 30 minutes ago" If your used to resort style transportation, cabs in a line waiting, forget it. I don't come to Vegas to get in line to wait that kind of time. This place feels more like an apartment complex, with proximity to the strip but you need a car to get around. I agree with the other review in that the staff is not knoledgeable or overly friendly. At least not like you'd find at a real resort. Again, more like an apartment complex staff. If you want the feel of staying at your friends apartment when in Vegas, this place fits. If your looking for that "resort/vacation" feel, then look elsewhere. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Tahiti Village SCAM - Las Vegas Time Share Scam”
Reviews.Author: trip3214
Reviews.Content: We bought into the huge overwhelming hype while visiting Las Vegas for our first time. At the time, my husband had lost his job and the salesperson fudged the paperwork saying he still worked there saying it was just a technicality (he had been out of that job a good 2 months). I thought he was being helpful...now I know he didn't give a rat's ass about whether we could afford this, he had a sales quota to meet. Anyhow, this was in we have been paying the huge maintenance fees and monthly payments . Finally last month I wrote them and said we could no longer afford this luxury and we were willing to forfeit our financial stake $5,000 invested so far if they would just take it back. We have tried selling it, giving it away, have someone take over payments all to no avail...I just got a threatening phone call from "the collections department" stating that if I didn't pay they would garnish my wages...I said I have no job so she said they would put a lien against our property, They was adamant that I understand they would take every necessary legal action to make us pay. Automatic phone calls every single day including weekends; a weekly phone call from a real person, too, including letters in the mail. I so bought into their game...I'm just a small town lady and had never known such excitement and everyone was so friendly and they offered us free trips, a free limo ride etc.....now I wish I had never been to Vegas I have such a bitter taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “The good and just be aware of potential challenges..”
Reviews.Author: MisterPatel
Reviews.Content: It was very hot from June 30 thru July 5th, almost 110 degrees daily, that is not a misprint. However it was tolerable instead of unbearable since it wasn't humid. Premises are nice as advertised. Good water pressure. Steam shower is unique. Steam shower is interesting as it works like a sauna if you are into that kind of stuff. But the shower door opening and closing isn’t smooth, you have to use some force to open and close. Pool area is nice and large. They need to fix the pool basketball rim, they have a volleyball net in the pool area as well. Dennys and Tahiti Joes which is an eating establishment is right next door. Washer/Dryer in the room is a nice convenience. Plates, glasses, utensils all provided. Nice room layout. A very very basic complimentary continental breakfast is provided in Tahiti Joe, Muffins/Pound cake and Juice/Tea/Coffee. The room safe is very very small, cannot fit a laptop. Tahiti Joe hosts some activities like sundae and cookie building for 2 bux. Plenty of pool related activities. Shuttle for groceries twice a week early in the morning. Town Centre is nearby, ½ mile. Access to shops, restaurants, and brand new digital movie theater. Rent a car if you want flexibility otherwise you will be bound to the shuttles and bus system. Local roads and local highways are very very easy to navigate and figure out. No need to be intimidated by the Las Vegas Blvd Traffic. Be warned Red Lights at the intersections seem to take forever to turn green. Literally a two minute drive from the airport car rental place. Might be 10 mins from the Airport itself. Real issue is that as a timeshare place the staff isn’t trained in proper hotel management etiquette. For example the front desk didn't know the difference between Tower 2 and Tower 3, basically they didn't know how to read their own map. Or issues with the Tahiti Village printed directions to attractions to Grand Canyon, Hoover Dam, etc... The Hoover Dam directions are completely wrong. Thank goodness I had enough of my own common sense to figure it out before blindly following them and getting completely lost and wasting time. Another example of confusing situation is the whole shuttle system. Confusion on which bus is designated for owners/visitors and which bus is for the people they want to sell timeshares to. Lastly, I'm an owner, don’t make me go thru an owner update, I just want information and details. So if you want discounts arranged by Tahiti go to the 3rd floor of main building and find the Gifting window to find discounted tickets to shows and stuff. I wish I knew about it earlier, it took them 3 days to finally tell me about it. They also have a ½ price booth in the main lobby but it’s a third party, Tahiti is not affiliated with them. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: red12281
Reviews.Content: we started our stay by arriving at 1 am. upon arriving we were given keys to a room that had yet to be cleaned. there were dirty dishes in the sink, food that had been half eaten on the counter, and moldy food in the refridgerator, as well as towels every where. we called down to the front desk and they sent us to a different room, which was clean but we didnt even get an appology or any upgrades. the room that we were moved too though was right next to poeple who were extremly loud in the morning. not to mention tours that happened every morning up and down the hallways. ugh so annoying. then we called down to ask for some extra hangers, pillows and blanket, we were rudely told that they didnt have anymore to give out. needless to say...i will not be going back to this timeshare ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon from Hell!”
Reviews.Author: brandymhull
Reviews.Content: My parents sent us to Tahitti Village for our honeymoon. Our terrible experience began the very first night. We had a late flight and checked into the hotel at 12:30am. We were informed that our room needed maintance and would not be ready until the following morning. We were put into a smaller room. We later found out that they overbooked our room. We finally got our room situation taken care of the following morning. We left the resort and came back only to find that our hotel keys had been deactivated. Our air conditioning and toaster broke while we were there. While at the resort we found their customer service to be horrific. We called the front desk several times and no one would answer. When we asked for directions (several different times) we were lead into a sales pitch for the resort each time. There are 150 sales people at any given time at the resort and only 2 people covering the front desk. Our room was on the 2nd floor. Every morning all 150 salespeople were congregate outside the main entrances to talk, scream, laugh and smoke. Not what you want to see, hear, or smell as you sit on your balcony trying to enjoy your morning. This was every morning. To get anywhere at the resort you had to weed through the massive mobs of salesman and visitors. To me, if you already bought or were staying there, they didnt care about you. But, if you were a visitor and was taking the tour, all attention was on your. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: pedinurse44
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Tahiti Village and I have to say it was a very, very nice property. It was very clean and the staff were very pleasant. I exchanged my unit for this one and was not harrassed by any of the timeshare salespeople at all. Our unit was clean and very comfortable. I did have a few issue with the layout of the unit itself but overall none of them were deal breakers. The property is very close to the airport but I never heard any planes.
